reviews: Have now had this car for 6 months. Have had plenty of long trips and short ones. My overall verdict is that this is a great car. In 2020 they added apple carplay and android auto. Carplay definitely refreshes the car and makes it very enjoyable. Furthermore, mine is a Silver Sport. Adds 16 speaker bose, and akebono brakes. The speakers sound amazing! The engine is fun and the drive is typically smooth. I personally  think this is great for long trips. However, much like  any other vehicle this one is not perfect. I find that the steering is a bit too light for  my taste. Additionally I wish  that they could add  more spaces to place your  phone and keys as the only places are the  sides of your   doors, the  center console, and the cupholders. Space is fine otherwise however. This changed for 2021 but for customers looking for an older model, Infiniti does not give BOSE standard to the lower trim models. You are left with a standard 6 speaker. I think  that should be considered a crime. For customers looking for a platform to modify, this vehicle has a LOT of potential. I have not yet but might consider later down the line. One major important thing to note is that currently there have been no issues or anything breaking down. At this time I am only at 40k mi. I love this car
Comparing the bells n whistles this car falls short. Comparing pure aesthetics and joy of driving this car is a winner.

I test drove many cars before arriving at the Q50S AWD. I liked some of the tech features of the Audi (the full digital dash is cool) but the turbo 4 cylinder didn't give you the same excitement...frankly it was boring. The C class was pretty, had a nice interior and I loved all the lighting and unnecessary bells and whistles but drivability and cost of ownership made it any easy pass. The Lexus was harder. Their certified used program is the best, the cars are excellent quality but frankly, they look old. The equivalent Lexus is a optioned out Camry. I had a Camry and they are great, but I wouldn't say it looks young or fun. BMW in the same price range was older and more miles so I didn't even consider them. After all my searching the Q was the one I wanted and after a year owning, my only complaint is the intouch system and how in explicated does not work on the Infiniti flagship car. Which means I can't remotely start my car with my phone or track my maintenance. This is annoying but wasn't a deal breaker. I love the auto heated seats and steering wheel, the rain sensing wipers, the performance and sound. The trunk is surprisingly large and the back seat is much more spacious than expected. The color is great and I get many comments and looks when she is all cleaned up. I love this car and would recommend the car and brand to anyone
Excellent vehicle drives really well has lots of power something you can rely on because it’s built in Japan looking good and all around excellent car
Good car I’ve owned it for 3 years has been great overall turbos seem to be going out at 100000 miles which really sucks a bmw would last longer than that

It  was really hard  for me to transition to the Q from the G after reading multiple reviews. However, My hand was forced and now here  we  are. While I wish it  could've happened later, I am so glad  I went with this option. Sure, it does not have the most advanced cabin when you compare it to a 3 Series or a lexus. But it still look really nice of personally I am fond of its styling. I hate  the lack of space but thats the G and Q series for you. Apple carplay really helps this car but it has a plethora of safety and convenience. I went for a Silver Sport so I have more bells  and whistles. Not to mention it is used. These vehicles are great used cars. the base sound system should be a crime by infiniti. But the 16 speaker (Inc on Sensory and above for 2020) sounds amazing and is well worth it. It is  very comfortable overall and the engine feels nice. A lot of people hate  on the handling, it is certainly not a porsche but you will have a lot of fun. So far i have  not had any issues mechanically.
quick and slick says it all - I have to hide my keys as my wife always takes MY car...not hers

I had the 2.0t had problems with it. Once it almost blew up and I had a 5k mechanical problem and a 6k mechanical problem 
The battery was $900 
I prefer a regular American car

I have a 2019 Q60 Luxe AWD. I am one of the few that actually modify these cars but even before I did, the power was good, quick but not fast. In regular traffic you'd defiantly beat the punch off the line especially comparing to a RC350 or something in similar price. I bought mine used in 22' with 21k miles. A few things needed to be taken care of by the dealer but I was still in warranty so no issues on my part. If you have a $30k-40k budget I would highly recommend this car! Also if you are a tuner, these cars can be woken up with just an exhaust, intakes and tune. Defiantly one of the more fun and best looking cars I've owned. Comparing to other Sport Luxury Coupes like the RC350, Z4, and TT this is defiantly the best value for the money especially in the used car department. Only downside I've really seen is the drop in value, the are not maintaining value very well at all, and the infotainment system is outdated but can easily be fixed with aftermarket options.

Exelent car for the price. Very reliable. This is a twin turbo car, if gas pedal is presed hard, expect sudden unexpected acceleration when the turbos hit. Keep monitoring coolant level because turbos use same colant and has the tendency of consume more than usal. Combine city and highway driving is 23.4 mpg. Android auto wired connection and wireless Apple car. 360° view camera. Lane departure not so good and oper monitor resolution could be improved.

This Infiniti model is a high performance, street legal rocket. With 400 horsepower and adjustments to get the right ride, large brakes and the look, you wonder why you can get so much performance for the price. I do not take it to the track, but I do appreciate the gusto of the engine when I need it. Plus, it has a good look whether I'm at a casual or formal event. Another perk is that the Infiniti dealership treats you like a VIP.  The only downside to this car is not specifically with this car, but lower profile cars in general. With high performance tires and lower to the ground, you have to be careful about sidewalks and potholes.

This car is underrated. Drove both the standard and bought the Red-Sport. Both were great. The RS is definitely pricey, but it’s a great car. There is a beauty in a car that isn’t common to see. It’s aggressively fast and fun to drive. The steering is luxurious yet sporty. Being able to change the response and tightness is a great feature. The adaptive suspension makes for a comfy ride, and also a hard sporty ride based on the setting. I the car effortlessly cruises at 90mph, and too easily gets to 140’s. Can be a fun track day car. Infotainment is a little dated but nothing wrong with it very much like the 2 screens. Seats are comfy and sporty.  Interior is very nice, not cheaply made. Is a lack of storage, but that’s expected in a sports car. Very low back seat head room.  This car is very luxurious yet still gives you the sporty butterflies when you want.
Great car, lots of power, great acceleration, good ride quality.  I have a luxe AWD. Fuel economy is better than expected so far…not thrilled to buy premium fuel though….
Affordable sport car beautiful look and preform really good I recommend this car for someone likes sport fast cars
You can have fun in a straight line or on windy roads. The seats hold you nice and snug while you push it through the curves.
This high performance Infiniti is a joy to drive—screaming fast yet quiet and comfortable.   It’s stunning to boot!

Brought this vehicle in 2017 as a certified preowned vehicle, no major issues. Up until 12/4/23, I only had to get oil changes and buy tires. On 12/4/23, I had an oil change, rotors resurfaced, two belts replaced and spark plugs replaced because the plugs had been in the vehicle for 7yrs. The Q70L-V8 has been a GREAT Vehicle. The dealership also give me an offer, but they have no vehicle that I will replace it with and they didn't make many Q70L-V8s (5.6). I trade it for an EV sedan if they come out with one on the level of the Q70L-V8.

10.5 years and 117,000 miles in and the only repair costs that were not scheduled maintenance have been brakes, tires, and a fog light that got shattered by a stone.

I am a big guy and the car fits me better than 90%+ of the vehicles out there.  Beauty is in the eye of the beholder but I find both the interior and exterior to be top of the class.

The standard car suspension is the way I like it.  A bit firm for a sporty feel.  The sport model with the optional low profile tires, stiffer springs and dual shocks rides REAL hard.

One other note, I just had my car detailed and both the interior and exterior look close to brand new.  This despite the fact that it has always been parked outside in my driveway and it has been relatively neglected from a cleaning and waxing standpoint.  This tells me Infiniti's paint work and interior materials were top notch.
I bought this Q70L as my retirement from the military 6 years ago.  I have not had one problem out of it.  It's roomy, looks luxurious, and has pretty good gas mileage!
Best car I have ever driven or owned. Had it for a year now and only have had to replace the battery.

Owner since 2016, in general is very good. Only had 3 issues during my ownership. One is related to the suspension, but a minor part, cost 200. Then the right hand side heating stopped working, but cost over 1000 to diagnose according to the service bulletin, which is pretty expensive because this is only for them to start the job, not fixing the problem. Then my Y pipe is very rusted because of the Canadian winter, i had to replace it. Overall it has been very reliable, sporty, luxury interior design. I like the interior design very much. One thing I don't like this car is that the suspension tuning is between sporty and comfortable, which is kind bothering me, because the oem tire yokohama tire is too firm, very bumpy. But I use my winter tires, it is much more comfortable. I really like the car.

I love my car, when I got a flat tire after I hit an object on the freeway,
the safety feature came on and I immediately pulled over to safety.

Great Job :-)

2013 is the last year of the M series design 2011 - 2013.  So it seems all the bugs (if any) were worked out in previous years.  In 62,000 miles I have replaced 1 set of tires, all brakes pads/not the rotors,  one battery (under the 4 year warranty) and normal oil change / air filter.   Absolutely nothing has broken or failed since I bought it at 6,000 miles.  Most reliable car I have owned.
Car is still tight, no squeaks, rattles or bangs.  Car has good power for a 6 cylinder.  M56 with the V8 would have been more fun but at the time was quite a bit more expensive.  Highly recommend.
Power, suspension, Interior/exterior styling, reliability, no other "comparable" sport sedan comes even close, period.
leeps ahead of American safety, lots of power Handel's snow perfect.sporty stylish. panoramic moonroof, mod camera ,parks min assit
My 6th vehicle

Have had zero problems original tires did wear . Fun to drive get a lot of head turns. Seats are very comfortable good lumbar  support.  Zero problems. Quiet  ride. Love the moon roof. Gas mileage fair. Has alot over pep and get in and out of traffic without any problems.

This car has had countless problems and already $8,500 in repairs. Took it to dealership after finally getting Covid vaccine to find out it needed over $6,000 worth of repairs and the warranty ran out 4 weeks previously.  Did not matter.  Now, the engine fans stopped working and it is an additional $2,300.

This car is an admitted lemon by Infiniti service departments. There are a multitude of malfunctioning components, with no resolution. The shell is Infiniti but the engine and electronics are Mercedes which is foreign to Infiniti master technicians and service departments. The car looks great but the glitchy issues are a nonstop nuisance. The dashboard notifications are endless and impossible to resolve, the back up camera stays on when in drive intermittently. Currently I am on month 4 of the check engine light being on, on my second dealership, my countless "master" tech who feels it necessary to explain AGAIN that the engine and electronics are Mercedes and that's why they can't figure out the issue. THEY REFER TO IT AS A LEMON! My car is still under the manufacturer warranty, in the last 3 months I've spent all but one week in a loaner while my car sits at the dealership for the check engine light. I don't even blame the service department, (this actually my second service department) they have no clue how to fix the car. The explanations from Infiniti have been consistent. The collaboration between Infiniti and Mercedes was a  complete failure. 

DO YOUR RESEARCH....the Infiniti forums are full of identical issues and complaints that Infiniti ignores! They have stopped production of the QX30 but those of us who own the car are just out of luck. You will be treated like a a burden when you have your car serviced. Two separate Inifiniti service departments have given me the exact same explanation of why the issues cannot be resolved, almost verbatim. Today I got my car back...15 minutes into the drive home...the check engine light came on. I GAVE UP!

I have had this car for 3 years. Nothing majorly has gone wrong with it. The only repairs I had to make were a faulty tire pressure sensor and a malfunctioning antifreeze/washer fluid chip. The back is pretty stiff so it isn’t great for long trips. It is very good on gas. I average between 26-28 in the city and about 35-38 on the highway.

This SUV is so underrated, INFINITI made a mistake not continuing this in their lineup, hopefully they bring it back. It's quick, fast and a joy to drive! I bought the black SPORT, best looking car on the road.  Yes its a bit over styled but it is as close to perfection as possible.. Its a "Racecar" in sheep's clothing, faster than my MINI COOPER S.  IF you can find the SPORT model jump on it, you will regret it, it was made for commuting and occasional family use, I am never selling this car EVER!  HINT: Drop in an aftermarket K/N or Amazon air filter and the TURBO becomes a BEAST!!!
black with premium white leather interior. tech pkg plus bose sound system..  senior non-smoker .. clean car-fax

Looking to trade my lease in vs.  give back to dealership at end of lease. Just wanted to know the value for trade in ! I got my answer in a matter of minutes with options ! KBB is exceptional in presenting the most fair valve for informed decision . Love it!
Outstanding Vehicle 10 out of 10 just as good or better than my Mercedes Benz. Great Customer Service.

We were thinking about leasing the QX55 but me and my wife decided on the QX50 mainly due the lack of space in the rear seats. The slated roof design cause this issue. We actually have know issues with the QX50. Its only been 6 days and we love it.

I really have enjoyed this car for the most part.  I drive to and from work 3-hours per day - mostly highway & inner city driving.  I use this car for everything. It's a LOADED model. I have everything except the quilted seats (though I do have the leather package.)  It's really comfortable.  Heated seats are nice but I love the COOLING SEATS!!!  I haven't found many cars with that feature. I love that the speed is displayed in the windshield & I never take my eyes off the road. I love the Bose speakers/system. It's a comfy car. HERE ARE THE CONS: #1 are the RUN FLAT TIRES!!  Ugh! Car has no room for a spare.  On average, the lousy run flats last 20,000 miles but perhaps less. If you don't blow them out, you'll know it's time to change them when the tires start losing air regularly (my car tells me when).  These tires are expensive & are hard to find outside of the dealer. I might switch to regular tires soon. Run flats do what they say - you can drive off the highway with a flat BUT it will cost you about $400+ to replace one tire (and you WILL replace them). #2, Every once in awhile, the radio screen freezes. You can't turn it on or off.  I already had that replaced once when I got the car. It's finicky.  When that happens, I sometimes pull over, turn off the car & let the "computer" reset itself. Sometimes that works. Other times no. It sucks to drive over an hour without a radio. That does happen. #3, sometimes the "protective" features won't let you park a car or pull into a tight parking spot.  If you have the parking assist "on", the car will stop you from getting too near another vehicle or something else.  You have to turn off the parking assist in settings so that you can use your experience to park or get out of a tight spot.  The car just won't let you do it sometimes.  Other than those issues, I love the car.  I HATE the run flat tires.  Don't ever get a car with run flats!!!!!  They're terrible.

I test drove about 6/7 SUV crossovers in this class before purchasing the QX50.  So far the vehicle has a slight edge over the competition.  

Rated Top to Bottom 

1.  This Vehicle is 10 times more comfortable than any other SUV I sat in.  (Yes 10 times more) 

2.  Plenty of horsepower, you will never need more.  

3.  Interior Trim and Design is extremely thought out compared to other SUV’s in its class.  

4.  Better leasing options than competition in Feb 2022

5. Blue tooth Apple Car Play is both convenient and easy to use on the double display of the Infinti.   

6.  Upgraded Tire and Rims package are much much better in Infiniti than other vendors.  

7.    Exterior design, is sleek and unique 

8.  ECO driving option on the freeway allows for close to 30 mpg on flat driving freeways.  

Overall 8.8 / 10

llena con las expectativas de la familiar y cumple con sus objetivos
es el uso diario de esposa y cumple con sus exigencias.

I use this vehicle in my real estate business. It is comfortable for 4 adults, surprisingly roomy. However, tall folks may not be as comfortable (6 ft or better). Average 36 mpg, great hatch/trunk, good sound system. Sporty drive for the 4 cylinder front wheel drive. Handles well on curvy roads, some luxury feeling. Mine is not equipped with remote start or the navigation app - wish it had it. 

I’d buy it again if I needed a vehicle.

One of my whipper washers keeps stopping up….. only problem I’ve had…

Drive this car multiple time and found this to be such an excellent fast performance luxury turbo charged vehicle.  It’s fast off the start, super quick pick up and quiet smooth luxurious ride.  Super tight turning radius which confirms the excellent handling.  Unique sporty looking SUV front to back.  Side view is cool cause you can definitely tell it’s an Infiniti, and not one like all the other small SUV out there.   I want to get this car when I can afford it.

Only negatives are the steering is not as precise as our previous Infiniti QX50, and the CVT requires getting used to.
Overall quality is excellent, fit and finishes very well done, great syling outside and inside, super ground clearance, sweet 20" wheels, smooth ride even with run flat tires, great highway cruiser. We have see gas mileage better than factory ratings, as much as 34mpg highway with premium fuel.
Appearance exudes quality and a rich feel. Infotainment systeme is good, not great, but more than sufficient for anyone's needs without going super tech. Cooled seats are nice surprise. Quite roomy and very comfortable seating.
I have the loaded Sensory model, its such a joy to drive every single time and very comfortable.  My only issue is the infotainment system, kind of dated but works well.

Design of this vehicle is terrible.
It’s a beautiful car, but can’t see anything when backing up at night.
The headlights are too low to the ground which makes it very dangerous while driving , and if it’s raining visibility is dangerous.
Mirrors are too small and there’s reflection of the interior when driving.
Tinted windows should only be on back windows .
I feel certain there will be a recall of this 2022 Infiniti.
We owned a an Infiniti 2000 FX previously and it was perfect.

I read a lot of disappointment with the CVT. But that underestimates the tech that Infiniti uniquely introduced (VC). I find my car super responsive, and overtaking is no issue. Plus, I love that my QX55 is typically the only one in any parking lot in a sea of same. It feels like it was made only for me, and I love it. Doesn't hurt that it's very easy on the eyes.

My QX55 is really warming up to me. It is a very comfortable ride with wonderful exterior and interior looks. CarPlay is a big upgrade. As a former GLC and X3 owner I have had great comparisons. While the two German SUVs are better from a performance perspective I didn’t go wrong by going with the QX55 sensory package. This package on the German counterparts would be very expensive. This is a buy I would do again.

This will be my last car I purchase from Infiniti. Customers service has below average regarding my issues with mirror reflection. No one seems to know how to resolve the problem. I have dropped off my car multiple times with nothing resolved.

Fantastic exterior look. Interior top shelf.  Easy accessibility to its features. Plenty of space for my 6`3” frame. Got the sensory trim. At least $30,000 less then the German products. So far extremely happy.

Overall;
Build quality is average, can’t be of luxury class. Far behind compared to Lexus and others. 

Interior design: outstanding, top class. 
Exterior design: Too good. 
Driving experience: really good. 

Mirrors- looks like design problems. Very shaky on the road. Specially driver side and inside rear view. Passanger side mirror is good and stable. 

I asked the dealer to fix this, they checked other QX60, all having same problems. I showed them this issue, they acknowledged, but they can’t fix it as its a design problem. 

While on the road, you can’t expect mirrors of a luxury class car irritating your entire trip.

First of all, as soon as I got in the vehicle, I was amazed with the premium quality.  Seems like they really paid attention to all the details.  Exterior and Interior suits me the best.  I almost bought Range Rover Sports, but QX60 has way more features as such as AC seats, third row seating, wireless Apple Car Play, one touch access to 3rd row access.  I love the saddle brown interior. I got the Autograph version because I like captain chairs in the middle row.  I was honestly happy with Luxe edition as well.  Ride quality is great, you don't hear outside world.  I just enjoy the drive with awesome Bose sound system.  With two little ones, I'll just have to try to keep it clean.

Infiniti has always delivered in the exterior design department  for their models, with the QX60 in dire need of a redesign and the concept Monograph QX60, I knew the vehicle would look great for the exterior. But where they really “WOW’d” me was the overall package of the vehicle. New for the QX60 is a 9speed auto, and a departure from the dual screen layout for the entertainment system. In addition we get a fully digital 12” instrument cluster, 10.8” HUD, a rear view monitor, and of course the 12.3” infotainment system. Really bringing the QX60 up to where Infinitis standards should had been. Also adding to the small but valued features, we now get messaging seats and memory seating for the passenger, something you typically find in six figure vehicles. All these new additions to the great build quality and high end materials finished throughout the vehicle, it’s certainly now a car I’d love to sit behind the wheel of. Talking about that, the 9 speed auto is such a huge improvement over the CVT, those shifts through the gears makes the QX60 feel like it’s not running out of breathe compared to the previous QX60s CVT droning. If I had to complain at all, I wish there was a performance variant, hoping they’d consider putting their twin turbo V6 underneath the hood, then the GV80 and MDX Type S would have a run for their money. To wrap the 48hr experience with the car, Infiniti really wants to take back its crown for the best selling luxury SUV, although it’s got tougher competition, it will only make Infiniti one step better than it was before.
The sunroof leaked. The windshield wipers will randomly stop working especially when it's down pouring. The heater doesn't work during the winter. The ac doesn't work in the summer.

I have been driving a 2015 QX 60 for five years and can’t wait to get rid of it. First of all, it takes premium gas, which has already been less than ideal in the recent economy. But add to that the fact that it gets the worst gas, mileage of any car I’ve owned in my 50 years and it’s a real money pit. 

In addition, the battery lasts about 1 to 1 1/2 years. Fortunately, it’s under warranty at our dealership for two years so I don’t have to keep paying for replacement batteries, but it sure is inconvenient when it decides to go out. According to the dealership, the batteries in this model were put in a bad spot where they tend to get too hot, which damages the battery, and accelerates erosion. 

The third row is almost unusable unless you have kids who are just big enough to get out of car seats, but haven’t hit their growth spurt yet.

Overall, it’s been a disappointing experience and I can’t wait to get rid of it.

Drives like a dream. We bought this car brand new.  It’s pearl white and it’s receives a lot of glances.  The only negative thing I can say is that it doesn’t have Apple Car play, other than that this is a very nice vehicle. Good cargo space with the 3rd row down.  We bought this car after comparing to many other vehicles including Acuras, Volkswagens, and Hyundais.  A good choice!

I like this car.Big salon,easy drive …
Infinity qx60 I recommend for all people 
reliable, but gas consumption is sufficient

Very nice car. If you are looking for an SUV with plenty of storage space then this would be a great option. The second row seats go all the way up to butt up against the back of the front row seat which exposes a large well behind the second row to store boxes etc. I put boxes in that well and push the luggage all the way into to the back of the second row seat. Really nice storage design. Overall, a very nice riding car and quiet. A great car for long trips. We like the style and the car has a very intuitive dash. I have 22K miles on it and so far have not had mechanical problems. PROBLEMS, 1) I have paint peeling all around the car. This began after having the car for about a year. The dealer will take care of it. The problem is, after the warranty expires what can I expect 5-6-7 years down the road? 2) EVERYTIME I start the car in the morning and back the car out of the garage the brakes squeal. The dealer said there is nothing wrong with the brakes and suggested I live with this little annoyance. I had an Acura MDX for 10 years before I got this car and never once did I hear the breaks squeal.

We purchased this 2013 JX35 used, and so far we couldn't be happier. In comparison with the similar GMC Acadia, the JX35 wins in every category. The one concern is the CVT (Constant Velocity Transmission) that can appear a little weak in traveling mountainous regions in the USA. Fuel economy may be a little better is competitive brands, but this is a heavy AWD vehicle, so fuel economy is going to suffer a bit. All in all, it has plenty of (easily accessible) seating and storage. Folding and stowage of the rear seats is much easier that the other competitors we checked out. 
I would definitely purchase another Infinity in the future.

First, really strange for a luxury brand like Infinit not to have iPhone connect esp at this year. That’s really a bummer. However I have to many issues with my phone connecting to the car and the iPod mode connecting. This is becoming such a big issue I may sell the car and buy another brand that that has iPhone
 connect. It just makes live easier.
This car is great value for what you're getting. Its low on teck and safety things and it has cheap  parts from other Nissen products. but it is great for the price
I've owned 2 in my time and with 5 children traveling with this SUV is a pleasure!! I love this QX !!
This is my dream car it's grey big inside look very new tires in good shape inside clean I just think that the miles is high but the company is very nice and the people is so helpful

OVERALL - Its a great vehicle, smooth ride, lots of power too, esp for the size. The interior is very nice if you buy the upgraded interior packages, not on the same level as a high-end model Mercedes, but very nice and very durable for real world use (esp if you have kids, it can handle the abuse and easy to clean)...

GAS MILEAGE - Yes, the gas mileage isn't great, probably could get better mileage if I wasn't always peddle to the floor, but its got 400 naturally aspirated horsepower which are too much fun! No joke I have done 138mph on the highway with mine and for an SUV this size that is insane (and it is actually very stable at that speed).

Also, if you are worried about the gas on this car though you probably shouldn't be buying it. Save your money and invest before buying a luxury car, if you don't then you will be worrying about gas forever because you will always be poor.

CONCLUSION - Anyways, if its in your budget I think its the best value in its class and some of the best performance for an SUV this size... yes, an Escalade might be a little better in some aspects and overall I would think has an edge on this car, but I would rather spend $90,000 vs $130,000 and do something else with the $40k I save... because I got some money, but guess not enough to not care about an extra $40k ;)
Awesome vehicle drinks gas but had this car 9 months drives like a dream. Has been very reliable, smooth ride, lots of power. The vehicle features are amazing I'm very pleased with my purchase

A $40 thousand on up new for these are down to $30 if that? Most auto sales are not going to pay near trade in value. Take this advice and get rid of this thing. Income to dept in a vehicle loan, is no popcorn and soda at the movies. It's meaning is your buried in to deep and can't get out.
This care is a beast and will certainly keep your family safe while loving the ride, comfort, and convenience!  Towing boats or packing in riders...this truck is awesome.

First, not economical  gas
Second, I bought 2021 QX80 a brand new and not a year, the FBrake has problems and customers service told that it is not under factory warranty, and will have anything care about it. The vehicle service department told me that it may happy again. I will so worry about the safe and I have 2 babies with me all time inside the car. I so regret to buy it. So, be careful to have it.
Phenomenal service, Shane Wellman is a great salesperson, will definitely recommend them to friends and family

I love my 2020 4-Runner! It has 87,000 miles on it and has never given any problems. Only regular maintenance done. Very dependable vehicle! 
The cons include 19 mpg fuel economy and it rides good but not smooth like in a car.
I highly recommend the Toyota 4Runner if you’re willing to pay the price for the gas mileage!
This car is in excellent condition inside and out with extremely low mileage. Not much over road mileage. No recalls. The only time it has gone in for a problem was a clip popping off of the gas cap.
Make sure the frame has been treated for salt treatments of the road, it's only got 53,000 miles on it

Replaced air filter, there were sunflower husk in the filter chamber. Cleaning dash, noticed bird seed in air conditioner vent. Looked into vent found mouse nest and a winters worth of bird seed. Don't know how they got into car. Believe they chewed wires going from 4runner to trailer. Push brake petal and trailer running lights come on. If vermin chew wires while car cruising highway could cause accident. Toyota needs to plug holes that vermin use to enter vehicle.

I absolutely love my truck. I’ve had it for about 6 months now and not a single complaint. It’s a 2020 sr5 premium with the 3rd row seat option and pretty much all the bells and whistles offered as far as interior. Everything else is factory except for wheels. I purchased the black trd wheels and blackout emblem kits. The roof rails I removed and painted a nice matte black and matte clear coat to match all emblems and wheels and they look great compared to the chrome. I plan on putting on a lift and level kit and maybe suspension here this spring but in all honesty it isn’t needed by any means. I just like they way they look lifted and can put on some bigger tires then and definitely like the look of the rear end leveled out with the front. But as far as stock ground clearance and suspension goes I’ve put it to the test and it performs as you’d expect from one of these rigs. It’s a beast and has yet to even get close to stuck or even slowed down through some serious mud and hill/rock climbs. I’ve been in my fair share of 4x4s and my 4Runner easily outperforms anything else that has been stock but honestly most trucks that spent thousands of extra dollars to complete their build. Mpg is pretty much what they claim give or take. Most times I’ve been getting better than advertised unless I’m a little more heavy footed on the gas. Brakes are great I do know though a handful of people that added weight with over landing equipment aftermarket bumpers and tailgates and they all claimed that they felt they needed to upgrade their brakes after just a couple of this additions. Downhill descent works amazingly and has really come in handy in a couple different scenarios. Mines the 6cyl not 8 and it’s by no means sluggish but obviously not a sports car. It’s meant for a different purpose and it without a doubt blows the competition out of the water in the areas it was intended for. By all means if you have the funds and your debating on pulling the trigger stop you will not regret the purchase I promise you.

Bought new in 2018 and paid for.  Scheduled maintenance service including oil and oil filter, air filter and tire rotation has been performed.  No repairs have been made.  We also own a 2006 4runner V6 sport edition which had a minor repair to front end CV due to leaking seal in 2022.  Best vehicles I have ever owned overall.
If you can, act like you hate it is but that's hard to do to lower price.  Never get stuck in snow.  Buy.

Top not service 100% reliable is the most comfortable car I have ever driven for the age of it now and plan on keeping it for another 10 years you will definitely not be dissatisfied but this Toyota 4Runner sport utility.

Definitely a blast on the track and decent on the highway in my TRD 86. I've got so much more driving to do in this I might change my mind later, but so far I have zero complaints and really enjoy the authentic/old-school style of the interior with its physical buttons and minimal functions tied to a distracting touch screen. The vehicle itself sounds decent for a 4cl twin exhaust, and surprisingly I'm not feeling the urge to turbo or supercharge it as I feel it could ruin the balance behind the nature of the car. We'll see what the future holds!

Like some people say, most of the things noticeable are the handling which is great, and the engine which is weak by design, and the backseat which is not large (I fit most everyone in tho).  Also can put the back seat down for more trunk space.  Only other thing I would say is some dudes have great review series online by a guy that owned one of these from years past for many years and made a lot of vids.

Body style is sharp looking, but no power from this small engine. It's just basically for looks, and basically gas mileage. This car is not that fun to drive. To small, no turbo, cheap quality. Wheels are 17 inch and they look small. Back seat is useless.
Great car good features except no cd player. Seats are comfortable throughout and good legroom throughout.

Great value for the money
Comfortable rides very smooth
Compare to airplane flying quiet 

Very reliable

Would highly recommend 

Toyota makes a great vehicle 

My last Avalon ran over 200 k miles

Never had a car with over 200k
Simply, Lexus fit & finish.  The identical state of the art 3.5l  engine, inter. exter. style as a ES 350. For $5000 less...
Excellent vehicle. Best full size vehicle of the last 25 yrs. Lexus-like looks,  fit & finish. At $5k less.

Decades long standard for a modern full size vehicle.   Essentially a Lexus 350 for $5000 less.   Mechanically, the well proven 3.5l. powerplant.   Mpg rating  22- 32. Im getting 27 town/ 33 highway.  My old 2.5 l. 4 cyl. , at best got us 26, 27 mpg.   Nice 3750 # car w/ that gas consumption.  Great merge acceleration.    Inside, even the XLE exudes upscale fit & finish.  Very comfy seats front  & rear.  Minor,  bit smallish glove compartment.  Amazing myriad of tech features.  Im not a wonk so wont use alot of them. Nice settings gives owner power to customize.  Exterior styling, real clean cut, modern.  Noted Toyota ( post 2022) replaced w/ more pricey,  Crown.
very smooth and quiet ride. great sound system space is great in the rear seating . and car play is great

Wouldn't buy again-- in fact this is my last Toyota. Still noisy (like the Camry) at highway speeds. Battery went sour and, unlike my wife's 2005 Honda CRV with 142,500 miles, no battery light went on. Just blinking lights, weird sounds, and every light on the dash blinking. It was the engine..no the electrical system...no the (you name it). Took the mechanic some time to see that it was the battery (battery then replaced at about 21,000 miles). Apparently, unlike older cars, you have to guess at what is wrong. Most of the technology is wasted on someone  like me that just wants a heavy, stable, car that is dependable. Don't want a sunroof, adaptive cruise control, and other gadgets that cost Toyota 100 dollars to make and install and for which they can charge $200 to customers who never use them. Also, the "technology" that tells you what song is playing works sometimes and sometimes just locks on the first song that is played and stays there. The driver's seat leans to the right and is hard on the back during long trips. The infoscreen is basically useless.

LONG BANANA SIZE CAR.. It's almost a short version of a limousine car. It's a ridiculous looking car that I have ever seen. This thing is pointless as well. Resale value drop instantly. Engine transmission is just cheaply made for these cars. They stopped producing these cars because of problems accruing. Recalls of glory are pathetic.

One owner. 33212 miles 
4dr limited.
Excelllent condition. Internal is blck leather always kept in a garage. Very little winter  driving.
One owner elderly couple mostly driven by wife. Hardly driven at all the last two years because of wife’s dementia

Purchased new in March 2013.  Always garaged, always properly maintained by Toyota dealer, never smoked in, never damaged, always driven at modest speeds and by just one driver ( a long retired former trucker), tires have less than 10K miles, maintenance records available to verify current mileage and dates of service.  Will most probably be sold due to present original owner having become handicapped and not able to renew driver's license when it expires.

This is a great car by all means, one exception is the low profile wheel/tire. Low profile tires are meant to improve look, handling, and cornering, but they are bad with bumps, and they blow out easily, I have two of my tires blown out after stepping into a relatively small path whole in the middle of the night, with only one spare tire that was a nightmare. Low profile wheel is a joke, I am not on formula one race to require better cornering, I just need to feel good on bumps and not have my tires blow out, So if you choose this car opt for the XLE and avoid the limited. Will eventually sell the car I love because of the wheels situation. Never thought that low profile wheels are going to be that problematic.

I bought this car a year ago with 76,000 miles on it. Now it has 83,000 flawless miles. It had a little wear on some interior pieces that repaired myself but otherwise has been a wonderful car. The suspension provides a smooth ride that handles well considering the size.
Haven’t had any issues and the car is super spacious. I’m a big guy but can fit easily in the front or in the back seat.

Purchased used 3 years ago with 50k miles on it. Now I am at 70k miles. The car is mechanically sound. I have never ever had a problem with this beautiful car. 
I service at regular intervals at our local Toyota dealer, who are extremely capable. 
On the interstate I can cruise at over the limit and still could go faster. 
Be decision I ever made on a used car.

Terrific highway ride (but a bit boaty handling on country roads), Toyota reliability with absolutely no repairs, extremely extremely reliable, purchased with 30k miles & now 4 years later 90k miles, roomy comfortable interior, V6 engine with excellent power, excellent gas mileage @ 34 mpg highway, regular gas!! FWD adequate in snow. Navigation & backup camera. Base model with leather
This car has exceded all of my expectations. From the mileage which is 46-47 mpg to the comfort and handling.

I purchased this automobile on 6/08/22 at Town&Country Toyota in Charlotte NC, after a year of mostly urban driving plus a road trip to Florida I am most satisfied with this automobile. No warranty issues, none. Seamless operation, 44-45 MPG. Interior fit and finish flawless. The only complaint is the paint which seems less than durable and is susceptible to road debris. Highly recommended for those still interested in one of the last spacious well executed American-built 4-door sedans.

I've had the Avalon for a 1 1/2 years without any problems to date.  The car is comfortable and a good road car.  Mileage is excellent at 40mpg overall.  Workmanship is very good for a car made in the U.S.  The paint is has a great shine, but seems to chip easily and has some noticeable "orange peel" in some areas.
The mechanics are great, but the electronics are in need of some updating compared to other offerings.
I'm quite happy with the purchase and my local Toyota dealer's service and sales departments.

One significant criticism is the OEM tires (short lived and sacrificed feel and performance for low rolling resistance). Now that I have replaced I realize just how mediocre the originals were.  Sacrificed a couple of miles per gallon on fuel efficiency but much better fell and traction (went with Michelin Climate 2 as replacements).  Consistent low-mid 40s in MPG).  Vehicle is comfortable and attractive.

This is my 6th Toyota Avalon, and my 2nd Avalon Hybrid, guess you could call me a lifer.  I love so many things about this model-its quiet cabin, the fit and finish of the interior, and the mileage.  In cold winter months, my average MPG is 46.7 and in the warmer months, I average 50-51 MPG.  My last Avalon Hybrid (2013) was still going strong at 200,000 miles when I sold it and it had zero mechanical issues during my 8 year span of ownership, and I anticipate this will be the same with my 2021 as well.

Three months ago I took my Toyota Hybrid Avalon in for service, the battery was dead, I needed to jump start the vehicle.  I was told that is was due to a defective positive battery terminal.  On Friday, 6/17, 2022 the same thing happened again, the car would not start. I returned to my dealer and after a day's investigation they suggest that someone have changed the original battery and installed an incorrect replacement.  It turns out that in 2020 I had the same issue and it was this dealer that installed the batter that just failed.  They have since replaced the one they installed after destructive testing, leaking the acid over the battery and batter compartment.  I submitted the service reports and my previous to Toyota Customer Experience Center, Case 220810000830.I am certain that the battery itself was defective because it was confirmed by the dealership. In any case I requested reimbursement of the paid amount, $160.79, based on the vehicle warranty.  I have spoken the service manager, Rob Hayes. He suggested I write directly to Toyota based on the above analysis and Toyota would reimburse me.

Flawless prformance and  and performance, 45 mpg plus, comfortable, great safety features, great value with all the comfort and convenience of more expensive cars.  NO warranty or quality issues  since new.    GREAT vehicle, recommend these to anyone looking for reliability, performance, safety and MPG.

The GPS in this vehicle is a nightmare. We took it to two different dealers and found that even the technicians can’t operate the system. It is so confusing. Certainly Toyota could come up with a system that is user friendly. Very disappointed in this model. Loved our 2013 Limited.

I have had this car a little over 2 years and couldn’t be more pleased.  I do a lot of mountain driving on slow, winding roads (worst kind for milage) and average about 39 mpg. I have driven from Reno to Sacramento or San Francisco several times, and the car is smooth as silk on cruise control at 70mph all the way. I am 6’2” and the leg room is fantastic for my 6’4” son in the back seat as well as for me. I have been very pleased with the JBL sound system and the cordless Bluetooth reception from my iPhone while it charges wirelessly. Plenty of trunk room as well.

Great gas mileage 
Comfortable 
Handles well 
What’s not to like?

there are a lot of pros and cons as well.
pros Nice and comfey car. drive smooth.

cons: the change lane assis can be very confusing! dont recommand you to buy a car any car with that feautre!
 
cons: EXTREAMLY EXPINSIVE PARTS!
My windshield get cracked by a rock and it cost me 925 miss my old Avalon 220 for front windshield!

This car actually gets a little better mileage than listed. With proper driving habits we an get 41+ mpg plus it has the power to pass if needed. Not as fast as previous Avalon but considering mileage I can live with it. Great car
EXCELLENT !!! ,ULTRA  Reliable, awesome 32 mpg all the time, even higher if all highway. They make the best Sedans in the World ,,,,,Period.

Toyota hates sight lines. Seeing out of them is physical exercise.  But you want to look around frequently to see where the noise is coming from when they idle, excellerate up even a gentle slope or when there is a passenger up front who weighs more tham 100 lbs. The suspension sounds tortured. 

The mileage is so so. My '05 Honda Civic hybrid was getting better mileage. I really miss that car.

The 2024 Camry is death from 1,000 cuts. So many details tweaked beyond stupidity and uselessness straight on to malice aforethought. The rear head rests block blind spots further. Aggravatingly they are not removable but sewn in place. They also prevent the rear seat from folding down because they hit the backs of the front seats if the front seats are positioned to allow sufficient leg room.

When it's raining opening the door allows the roof to drain onto the front seats. Driving with wet seats is gross.

The rear doors open only about 60°. Loading anything into the back seat (groceries, children, a newspaper) becomes a struggle as the door port is reduced in size by the door not opening far enough.

Lifting the drivers' side wiper isn't possible because it's blocked by the hood. The manual suggests putting the wiper in "mist" for two seconds and stopping the wiper in the Up position. This requires a second person to stand by and grab the wiper.  Or a second person to sit in the car fiddling with the wiper control while you try to catch the wiper yourself.

So many design "improvements" make me regret spending more than $5 on this piece of complete garbage. I hate this car.

This car has never let me down. Amazing on gas ! Low maintenance car! Eextremely comfortable and affordable also reliable ! I have no regrets on purchasing this car ! Very efficient and safe! Also it’s a sexy car !
LE model 95000 miles silver, black interior no  damage  interior excelant, all seats covered with custom covers, 30,000 miles left on michlein all season tires

I have owned my Camry since May of 2019, over the past 97,500 miles, I have never been let down by this car. Through snowstorms, thunderstorms, high winds, and a sandstorm (northern Arizona on a roadtrip, quite interesting), and countless other road hazards, this car has stood strong. Yes, it has its shortcomings- mainly that it seems to wait 1-3 business days to shift while going up any type of incline and sometimes it gets confused like an old dog when deciding what gear it wants to go to, it outpaced (and outsold!) the competition it was up against. The entire package compared against the cars it was being sold with at the time (Accord, Altima, Sonata, Optima, Fusion, Mazda6, Passat, Legacy, Malibu) all were solid options, but the Camry stuck out for a few reasons, and still does so today. 
1. Resale value: If you take care of this car, it will take care of you and repay you for good ownership when you decide to go get something new. 
2. Reliability: In just under 100,000 miles I can tell you everything that has been worked on this car- 
2 sets of tires 50k and 93k miles (when replacing tires, do not go with the ones that came with the car)
One brake job completed at 93,000 miles
Two windshields (Truck driver threw rocks when he ran off the road, and a fraternity brother hit a foul ball while playing inter murals)
Two bumpers (a poor unfortunate soul who purchased a jeep gladiator and did not understand that you have to put the emergency brake on while you park a manual vehicle, and an idiot in a Nissan Cube who didn't look when backing out of a spot at Walmart)
Fuel Pump recall
Brake Control Module (extra warranty covered this one)
Transmission Flush
21 Oil Changes
4 or 5 windshield wipers
That's it. The car is still on the original battery and has always started. 

There are many cars that you could compare it to/pit it against, and it does have its quirks. The Adaptive cruise control is like a mom of a 16 year old driving, sometimes the CarPlay decides it doesn't want to play my Depeche Mode playlist (that's fair on its part), Lane Centering is very hands-off, to the point its like a dad videoing his kid about to fall down- supportive, but from a distance. In contrast to everything it might seem to have "wrong" with it, you could look at every car in its class and make similar conclusions. I know this review will probably get lost in the many, many others, but I can guarantee you this: Buy a new Camry for your High School graduate (or co-sign a loan and make them make the payments like my parents did) and I can guarantee that the car has a solid chance of making it to their retirement party 42 years later. If you take care of this car, it will take care of you. Regular maintenance, calm driving, and good gas will take you well over the 300,000 mile mark. 
Soon, I will parting with my Camry, who has gained the name Cher, and selling her to my younger brother who just recently turned 16. It is the only car he is comfortable driving in our family (F-150, Highlander, and Grand Cherokee) as it is the "perfect size for him" and he doesn't have to worry about "hurting" it. As a parting word, I'll sum up owning a Camry to a few words: you can always find flashier, faster, fancier things, but nothing welcomes you back quite like a Camry. It is reliable, comfortable, economical, and affordable. You might love champagne and caviar, but nothing fills you quite like Grandma's Chicken soup.

I bought a 2024 XSE V6, the V6 engine soon will be discontinued so hurry to get yours, all the 2025 trim levels have a 4 cylinders engine ! Toyota are known for their reliability and it will last 300-400 thousand miles, I have friends who have some Camrys with that mileage. All the 2024 Camry gas engine come with a15.8 gallon fuel tank, and that is kind a small for a V6 engine, expect to visit the gas station more often. The heated seat takes a longer time to warm the seat, unlike the cool seat it’s great and cooled the seat instantly. The infotainment screen is not a user friendly, if you are using the apple car play while listening to the radio and you receive a phone call or a message the tone is very loud, the navigation layout is not an eye friendly like apple map or Google map, and for some reason it gives me either longer route, or thru heavy traffic, there is something wrong! Engine remote start, come on TOYOTA I don’t have to be too close to the car to remote start engine I had a wrangler , Volkswagen Tiguan and Chevrolet truck I could remote start from a distance of more than 100 yards even more! But I believe TOYOTA intentionally did it so you pay $80 a year for the phone application!! When you open the door the engine stops ( really TOYOTA ) I have my daughter 2024 TOYOTA Corolla the engine will not stop when you open the door after a remote start. The sound system JBL is good but definitely not a WOW, I am 55 years old so far I am ok, the reason I said that because the car sits low ( sporty ) it will be little hard to older people to go IN and OUT I miss my 2000 year model Camry it was more of a sedan than a sporty looking car. 19 inch rims (wheels) looks very nice but does not provide a softer ride, again I miss the 17 inch with more tire rubber. Road noise is acceptable unless you are driving on a rough highway road then it’s loud. Other than that it’s a beautiful reliable car and definitely I will buy it again and again. Please DO NOT follow the maintenance manual of changing the oil every 10,000 mile or 12 month, do it at 5000/6 month, Change the transmission oil every 50,000/5 years, Change the spark plugs every 60,000 mile, the Coolant every 50,000/5 years, and the brake fluid every 3 years. Do it and your car will definitely last for 15 years.
Things that I love about my Camry are ,#1 is reliability it is a Toyota, comfortable seat, driving dynamics, powerful V6 engine, excellent air condition, great cooled front seat, inexpensive maintenance, well built, clear head lights, adaptive cruise control, all the safety features I wish if they added an aural warning for the blind spot.

I got this car as a last resort I needed a car because all my other vehicles were close to not being drivable an this was the only thing that could fit my budget and I absolutely fell in love with this car it handles the snowy roads better then any other vehicle I owned and the little 4 cylinder might just have a little more power then the supercharged 3800 engine and I’m really impressed with all sensors in the abs or lane assist this is my first Toyota and definitely won’t be my last

Car looks great.  Handles well.  With the small engine, not much get up and go but enough to pass when needed.  Have had 0 problems with anything.

My 2018 Toyota c-hr, I bought this car about two years ago around February. I've done everything right normal oil changes and what not, But now at 77,000 miles the transmission already needs to be replaced. Unfortunately I'm not the only one to experience this issue, Many others have at even lower miles then myself. they need to do a recall or something. Fortunately mine is still covered under warranty. But if it was not id be In forever dept. The humming sound was noticed in the transmission shorty after buying it and every shop I took it to said it was nothing Until said noise got louder about 2 weeks ago. I replaced the wheel bearings on it, Hoping that was it. Nope then I finally caved and took it in to the dealership because it was keeping me up at night. I new what they were going to say as I waited patiently in their waiting room. Low and behold "Ms. Perk" the nice gentleman said, "I'm sorry but we have to replace your transmission where did you say your warranty paper work was?"(My heart sunk in my chest) And on top of that the Warranty company is giving the dealership a hard time. This is all just very stressful, I've only owed this car for two years!
Guys I know this car looks nice and might drive nice, it was extremely tempting to me as well but please for the sake of your future self's sanity do not buy this car! Just get the Rav4 instead. You know you want that as well! I keep telling myself I should have just got the rav4 :/
Cute sporty awesome car great gas mileage comfortable to drive get lots of compliments on my car would definitely buy again love this car
Great condition. Fun to drive. I feel very safe with my grand kids in the car with me while I’m taking them to school. I get lots of compliments.

I'm nearing the end of my 3-year lease on the 2020 C-HR LE. I have to say that I feel pretty 'meh' about the car.

It does have some good qualities to it. The gas mileage is pretty good (especially for me being a thruway driver), it's comfortable to drive long distances (10hr round trip to Detroit in a day), and it looks pretty good on the road. That last one may not be shared by everyone but it's unique to say the least. The standard safety features are a plus, especially on a base trim level. It's easy to get into and out of so running errands feels quick and easy enough. 

The car does come with some downsides. One of those is its underpowered engine. It is consistently sluggish on the thruway to get up to speed. If you plan to overtake someone in the left lane of the thruway, be sure to give yourself some distance and time to make it happen. It also can get really noisy on the thruway so my music is always up at a higher level to equal out the increased road noise. KBB's review hits the sightlines perfectly. I'm constantly moving up in my seat to check my blind spot. Having blindspot monitoring would be really nice and an added bonus. Also, the cargo space is severely lacking. Anything outside of some normal grocery shopping requires me to fold down the rear seats. Like putting my golf clubs in the car is an adventure on its own. I know most cars in this class would require dropping seats for golf clubs but it'd be nice to feel like I could fit more than just the clubs and a few bags of groceries and not feel like all my storage room is taken up. Also, the rear seats are definitely a bit cramped for anyone who's above a standard 5'10" height. You could view the back seat experience as lux because you're enclosed in a smaller space and the rear doors hide your face from the public eye. Or you could view it like my wife and I do as a claustrophobic experience for yourself or your passengers. Either way, the rear seats aren't the best for hauling family or friends. 

Main Summary/Thoughts: 
All this to say, it's a pleasant A to B car that'll get the job done for certain people. It has nice (unique?) styling, good standard safety features, and decent gas mileage. It's easy to get in and out of, sits like an SUV but without the driving height of one, and is solid for longer drives. However, if you're looking for a more engaging driving experience, a quieter cabin on the thruway, better cargo room, safer sight lines for your blindspot, and space to bring people out shopping/tripping with you I'd advise you to look elsewhere. But, if all you need is a comfortable commuter car with a stylized edge to it, this could be the one for you.

I had high hopes when purchasing a used 2019 CHR in 2020.  I expected the former Toyota quality inside and out.  Well..the exterior is made of cheap plastic that dents easily.  The interior has even cheaper plastic parts and even the seat adjusters have had issues.  Already the windshield wiper nozzle and motor have needed replacing.  I will go back to Honda when I get ready to turn this in one day.  Also this has the slowest pickup ever.  It's the "little car that couldn't."

Most new cars and suv look like eggs in an egg case, same style diffrent color, no personnality in todays cars.
C-HR as a personnality just like cars use to have in 50s and 60s.
i love my car for me and the wife it is the ideal stand out remarkable auto for the 22s and 23s years.

unit style for 2021 2022, safe and sound for a couple or a single person.
very good on gas and not to many electronic gizzmo.
easy to service and understand espacialy for seniors.

excellent

I purchased my Corolla SE on March 2022.
So far I driven 33k miles and this little mule has never failed me. Fabulous MPG, great looks for the value, the screen is a bit small but works great, the seats cant be any better. I must note my vehicle was assembled in Japan, IDK if it made a difference but this vehicle is great. 
I highly recommended to anyone.
Updated at 1,700 miles.  Gauge reads 59.7 vs 58.3 actual = fantastic.  90% LA freeway driving with stop & go traffic mixed in.  Still very comfortable and enough power for my needs.

The 2020 Corolla is a great little car. Coming from a much older Corolla, and being proud Lexus owners for years (all-Toyota family), this is a big upgrade and nice car. The styling is much improved from older models - the front headlights are full LED and look great with the imposing grille. The rear end is sporty and streamlined, and the whole car looks pretty good. The engine is perfect for the car - it may seem slow, but the little 4-banger does the job well (remember, the price). The cabin seats are very comfortable, and the cloth and other trim is great. The little floating 8" touchscreen and climate controls in the middle of the dash are good as well. The safety features plentiful too, and very useful at that. Overall, great little reliable city commuter. Would highly recommend buying.
Love the car looks are amazing plenty of power only downside is the interior is kinda cheap it makes a lot of noise and scratches up really easy and Iv only put 15,000 on it!

Pros: Great ride and decent handling (SE), fuel economy, comfy interior, nice styling and I get compliments on it's looks (SE)

Cons: Inconsistent and clunky transmission, lumpy idle and very light steering.

This is a really good car that gets let down by some quirks.  The transmission is rough when shifting out of launch gear to the CVT.  One day it's smooth and you never notice it.  The next day it shifts hard and quivers.  And why must the CVT mimic shifts?  After the engine warms up and you stop, the idle becomes lumpy and shakes the car.  Other than that the engine is smooth if not a little loud.  The ride is excellent despite having 18" wheels.  The handling is also quite good, especially for a Corolla.  It's not sporty but it gives confidence when going around a corner.  Considering how good the ride is, the handling is very good.  And again for a Corolla, it looks really nice in person and I get compliments on it often.  Most don't realize it's a Corolla initially.  And that's the theme for this 12th Gen Corolla.  For a Corolla, it's an awesome Corolla.  For a car, it's mere average.

My average mpg is actually around 80.4 I don’t have a heavy foot so I’m constantly in charge mode. I usually fill up once sometimes twice a month. Excellent car Great Looks not much on the horsepower but it’s sufficient for me!

I love my Apex very much this corolla is a ton of fun, can’t believe this is my first brand new car after owning 19 other vehicles. I would say this is by far one of my favorite but I also enjoyed my 2019 mustang gt it was fast and this one has some power too.

We are so happy with our 2015 Toyota Corolla. I am lucky to have this as my first vehicle. My husband feels lucky as well, and said he has never had a more reliable vehicle before. We love being able to see what's behind us backing up. The heat and ac works great throughout the vehicle too. The trunk is roomy and the car is easy to control. The only issue we have, is that the volume for music is tricky because when adjusting the volume the numbers can have a mind of its own. lol But we are able to manage, when taking our time with it. :)

I bought this type of car used four years ago. It has been great. Comfortable, dependable, easy to park and drive. Lots of trunk space and room for four. The only drawbacks are poor gas mileage in town (only 20-22 mpg), but on the freeways it gets 35. Also, the white paint is beginning to peel. Of course, it is ten years old now...

I had to replace the battery once, but other than that I haven't had any problems. It's also really easy to drive. It has buttons so it's easy to feel what you're doing if you need to adjust climate or music.

Ivenow ex Ford fiestas,vw rabbits, tercels and siennas this Corolla is attractive, rides well, great gas mileage,  ac compressor went out once and oil changes are the own maintenance I've ever needed.  Will drive this car until it goes no more. And with 28 thousand miles it has a ways to go

This car truly has it all! If I could give it a 10 star I would.
From the comfort, the reliability, good looking car.. Machinically unstoppable.
Truly worth every penny. I still have my Corolla! 8yrs later and it's never let me down, I still love this car just as much as the day I bought it. 
Get one! You truly cannot go wrong with it.
Very reliable comfortable vehicle, economical and stylish. But, the tires and the original battery were of very poor quality.
I love my 2018 Corolla, it drives like a sewing machine.  Best purchase I ever made. I started to purchase another KIA but glad I didn't.  I'm looking to trade up.

This car is amazing!  Just regular maintenance and change the oil every 5,000 miles.  Use 75% of the time for Uber/Lyft rideshare and passengers love it!  Still great style and super reliable.  It’s like part of our family…😂😂😂

I traded a 2021 Camry Hybrid getting 52 MPG. So. I was concerned that the Cross only averaged 42 MPG. After 800 miles I am averaging 48 MPG. Obviously the way the car is driven makes the difference, but this is a nice turn of events. The comfort and ride are an upgrade over the Camry.

I traded in my CH-R b/c it was being discontinued.  wish I was told that when I brought the car...The Corolla has the worse ride ever. There is no power, when you do, you just hear the engine take the back seat before it goes into gear. The interior is poorly made, low quality. I found out that there are a lot subscriptions on the car that's going to expire. The salesman never said anything nor would I ever think of asking for all the cars that I have brought. Now, I have to pay for them. The car has been in the shop five times not counting the recalls. The only nice about the car is the color. Buyer beware!! Very disappointed in Toyota. I will never buy one again, even though I've had them in the past. Now, I have to wait three years, no way.

On highway, one could easily feel that it is so underpower SUV. No drive comfort, CVT makes sluggish noises. It has bad suspensions, one could feel small road cracks. Dash board is also cheap plastic. Not worth the price. This car doesn't deserve $22k+ price. It is a junk. Not worth it.

Gas mileage is nowhere near what I expected.  Use as a daily commuter 50 miles down local highway average 75mph and get max 27mpg due to small engine even with close attention to eco driving.  Cross country road trip with small Thule roof box was max 23mpg.  Small tank also meant many gas-up stops (12 gal). City driving is closer to expected mpg but never hit higher than 30.  Good solid vehicle that handles well in snowy conditions with great safety features and sound system.  Apple CarPlay is a bonus.  Comfortable vehicle overall.  Frustrated I have to pay a monthly subscription fee to use the automatic car starter that I use only 6/12 months of the year.  Generally happy with the vehicle but would have chosen an SUV with a larger engine and done a little more research to find a company that does not charge a subscription fee for using the car starter.  Overall, this vehicle is a bit overpriced for its performance.  I’m paying for safety features and the look of a RAV4 without the performance. KBB value WELL below what I’ve paid for the vehicle…

My 2023 Corolla Cross came in after a few months wait from the factory,  so far it is a great vehicle with all the Toyota reliability and value that I was looking for.  The vehicle is well made, very solid,  my only complaint is that I wish they would have used more sound deadening material in its construction.  It has a lot of road noise compared to the Hyundia Kona I drove for 4 years.  It does come with 2 years of free maint,  always a plus.   Kudos to my local Toyota dealer in Lawrence Ks,  for not adding thousands to the sticker price like some dealers will,  due to limited inventory on new cars.  Overall,  I am looking forward to years of enjoying my new Corolla Cross.
I love this car so far. I bought mine brand new in November and it has been amazing. It's big enough yet small enough and gets great gas mileage. The all-wheel drive is a really nice touch.

Great car that provides you the proper versatility for the price range. I currently own the car and purchase a 2022 LX AWD about 2 months ago. To date, the vehicle has about 800 miles on it. 
PRO: 
-Good Gas Mileage 
-Great AWD traction on dirt roads
-Simple dash functionality 
-Fun to drive around town
-Comfortable fabric seats 
-Has high marks for reliability 
-Children seatbelt alarms are great
-Comes with a printed maintenance manual
CON:
-Road noise is noticeable but not terrible 
-Seat adjustment lever sticks out from below the seat. So when you are using cruse control it can be annoying
-Lock buttons on the door do not aluminate at night
-Car automatically unlocks when you place in park
Drives great if you baby it on the highway tou can get over 40mpg!!! Quit and wonderful in town too!

Bought my bronze-colored SE 6 speed manual new in June 2020.  Made in Japan.  Traded in a 2015 Ford Fiesta that was very nice to drive, but very poorly engineered and a mechanical and electrical nightmare.  Had an issue with the Toyota at 6,000 miles with battery going completely dead after sitting in garage for 3 days.  Found TSB (service bulletin) online, had dealer perform the fix, no more battery issues since.  Also had a downstream AFR sensor throw a check engine light on at about 15,000 miles.  Dealer installed a new one under warranty, no more issues there either.  Stock tires are junk, had to replace all 4 at just under 20,000 miles (tread down to wear bars).  Put Continentals on, little firmer ride, but much more confident handling at speed.  Honestly, my Fiesta had a better ride/handling balance, but with the new tires, the Corolla is pretty close -  more compliant ride, slightly "floatier" in the curves.  I blame the 3000 lb curb weight (!).  I'm an older guy, I'm used to compact cars weighing closer to 2000 lbs than 3000.  But of course, all the safety equipment, rollover standards, and electronics in today's cars add weight.  Speaking of safety, the IIHS rates this car as "good' pretty much across the board, with an updated side-impact rating of "acceptable".

My biggest complaint - I've had an annoying drivability issue pretty much since day 1.  Sometimes when accelerating, I'll get some hesitation or "fish bite" going through the gears.  It's only at very light to moderate acceleration:  if I hammer it, no hesitation at all.  It's worse with the a/c on, and exacerbated when it's hot out.  I usually burn regular gas as per the owner's manual recommendation.  I have noticed that when I fill up with non-ethanol 91 octane premium, the hesitation nearly goes away and is virtually unnoticeable.  I'm curious if anyone else has had this issue.  Dealer can't find anything wrong.

Interior is definitely tight (I'm 6' 1" and 240 pounds), but once you wiggle inside, it's fairly comfortable.  Very little room in the back seats for adults.  Not a ton of room in the hatch either, even with the "spare tire delete" package (which I unwittingly got, another minor annoyance).  Fit and finish in and out is quite good, though I could do without the shiny black plastic inside that shows fingerprints and dust like crazy.  Heat and A/C work excellent.

Despite the occasional drivability hiccup, the car is mostly fun to drive with the 6 speed manual.  Not a barn-burner, but decent acceleration for what it is.  The IMT (automatic rev-matched downshifts) is terrific and one of the best features of the car.  Excellent fuel economy for a non-hybrid.  I routinely get 30 mpg in spirited city driving without using the A/C.  I've gotten well into the 40 mpg range on empty 2 lane roads at a steady 60 to 65 mph.  My lifetime average from new after 3 years and 43,000 miles is 30.4 mpg.

In summary - this is a stylish, fuel-efficient, comfortable-for-two, practical little car.  I do wish I could nail down the hesitation problem, and I just don't feel like this car will go 300,000 miles like some of my older Toyotas did without major issues.  Still, if you're in the market for a relative simple smaller car, the Corolla Hatchback deserves your consideration.

There's really nothing special about these cars.  Too small, road noise is annoying. Hatchback looks weird. Gas mileage is okay, and cheap for upkeep. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend this car. If you get smashed in the back of this car. Good bye!! Terrible rear crash rating on these cars. If you like corolla, buy the sedan size. It's a lot better than these hatchback pile of junker cars.
not fast, kinda quick off the start. Looks nice, the 4 door Is kind of a lie you have backseats but they don't have much room, but overall this car was reliable and never gave me a single worry

I love the driving dynamic of this car.
It is also very comfortable, good on gas, front seat is really comfortable.
Love the suspension tuning, very good handling but also very comfortable.
CVT is still not very nice, 1 to 2 gear is not smooth.
Rear seats are very small, but if the driver is a girl, then second row is not a problem.

I was hesitant to purchase the 2020 Toyota XSE Hatchback as it's such a small car, considering I'm 6'1", but I soon found it's exactly what I wanted and it's perfect for me!
 It has plenty of leg room and it's comfortable for me, It has a 6sp manual transmission and it gets 36mpg on the hyw ( long drives) with a 13.2gl capacity and 488 miles to empty, I fill up every two weeks at most..  With today's fuel prices it's the best TOYOTA I've ever owned.
I've had several CoWorkers asked me to sell it to them and a few people on the street wanting to know more about the car and if it's for sale.. I put some NEW KUMO tires (P225/40R18) and tinted the windows and keep it clean inside and out.

I love this car. 

I got mine in "Galactic Aqua Mica" and it is stunning. The color changes depending on the lighting and is always a pleasure to look at. Its a very stylish car. So many nice curves that make it fun to hand wash.  Interior quality is quite surprising for a corolla. Soft touch materials with white stitching accent the dashboard and looks very clean. I only wish they left out the gloss black materials because they just make me OCD about fingerprints everywhere.  

I decided to get the 6 speed as I've driven 2 manuals before this. The throws are excellent and with the IMT activated, downshifts are a breeze. I only wish that the clutch pedal had a bit of a bite to it. Once you get used to it, however, especially with IMT activated, it makes for very smooth take offs in first. (Should be noted if you live in a city like Chicago you will be shifting ALOT.)

The standard features on this SE model are really blowing me away compared to the other cars I've driven. I don't ever need to take my key out of my pocket. I can lock, unlock, and start the car with no key. Auto climate control means I can just set the temperature and never have to worry about getting too hot or cold again. Automatic high beams gives me more peace of mind during night time driving.  Radar cruise control will keep a certain distance away from the car in front of you, speed up or slow down depending on how fast the car is going, and assist keeping you in your lane. I feel so safe in this car. 

Performance is surprising for a Toyota Corolla. I never knew the Corolla to be a fast car but this one has got a little get up and go to it. Its faster then an ND1 Miata and much more comfortable to drive. Of course if you want a faster Corolla, then wait for the GR Corolla to hit the dealers. 

 Infotainment leaves a bit to be desired. Wireless car-play would have been an excellent touch but instead we are stuck with a USB in an awkward spot. I would like to have been able to upgrade the speakers in this car from the factory but its decent enough. Even still the screen is very nice and responsive. (Type C and standard 12v chargers are located in the middle console.) 

I did a 3 hour drive recently and it did start to get uncomfortable after about 2. So if you take long trips plan more rest stops. I wish the seat was more adjustable but not the worst. I got about 33 mpgs during the trip. 

All in all this is a great car. My 9 year old said verbatim "I love all of the safety features, I love that the color looks so rare, and I give it a 10/10"

My second new Toyota, I have owned used MR2, Camry, ES300 Lexus and a new Toyota Tundra. I love this little hatchback. Bought the 2022 cvt SE, new. I was very happily surprised, at all the standard features, both safety and function. Radio is better than I expected. The acceleration was a big surprise, the 168hp 2.0 has more than adequate acceleration, bordering on sporty. The suspension has the feel of a much more expensive car. It's sportier than the 4 door model. The look I think comes from the Scion division, as it has a youthful appeal. I like the versatility. Yes the back seat leg room is bad, but I don't ride share and have no real need for it. Economy is great and I have been having fun zipping around town in this little sporty hatchback. I don't understand all the reviews that put down the speed... if you google 0-60 times the 168hp car comes in at around 7.3 - to 7.55 seconds. with a 1/4mi at 15.7 seconds. The new si 0-60 times for 2022 are like 7.1. The corolla hatchback has a pretty respectable time considering that they are not promoting it as a hot hatch, and it is naturally aspirated which is a huge consideration when it comes to the longevity of the drive train. It is a great all around driving car. I did see a used one that had some damage to the soft passenger side dash. It was abraded/scuffed. So it may look nice now but could have problems holding up over time vs the hard plastic older style dash. I bought this car to keep, mine is made in Japan which I was very happy to see on the manuf. plate. My Tundra has lasted 21 years and doesn't owe me a thing. I hope to have this one as long as well.

Looked at 2022 corolla SE hatch here at a dealer in northern CA. Car is a base model listed at $22,015. Then there is an MSRP price of 23K. Nice sales person at dealer, but with Dealer markup of of almost $3k. Destination charge 1K, tax 2,500. Registration and fees. 1,500. Car is 30K to buy. Not much of a bargain or value buy anymore.
