Great car but I hate the adaptive speed control and you can’t turn it off. Didn’t like the lane correction either but it can be disabled. The rest of the car is fun and comfortable. Efficient too. Love everything but hate the cruise control and adaptive speed control. The cruise control is cumbersome compared to my Mercedes.
My A5 sportback just looks and performs great. Added sport  and upgraded radio packages and cannot fault the car. Lots of truck space and so many features to keep everyone happy.
A sports care definitely and excellent handling, a lot of power and I love the Quadro, not much more to say , but very safe a well

This is a great car. It is comfortable to drive with the top down even when temperatures are in the 50's. Unless you are in the rear seat, which is totally unprotected from wind and cold. The sound system works exceptionally well even with the top down. Of course, the car is steady on the road, solid and quick.

The touch screen interface is ridiculously complicated and almost impossible to use. I think it is an Audi problem, not specific to this car.

We haven't driven it long enough to rate reliability, check back with me in two years.

2021 Audi A5 Sportback, Prestige, 45 Engine, Navara Blue with Black Ops Package.  Pretty much have every option as an A5 can have and truly impressed with the car to date.  Get's mpg's as advertised and does get up and go when needed.  Reliability score was based on to few miles to really score.   Departed a 2009 Saab 9-5.

I could not be happier with my 2019 Audi A5 Coupe,  Bought out my lease, and when time comes to replace will not even consider a competing model.  Has never failed me, fun to drive, more than enough kick to get into trouble, and the looks are the best out there - subtle, timeless and classy.   Wired connectivity with my android phone sometimes finicky, and front sensor can be a little too sensitive at times, but these are minor points.  A multi-lease MB C300 friend converted to A5 Sportback after driving my car, and she never stops thanking me for the change.  Another friend seriously considering an A5.

Too many upgrades required to keep this car at maximum performance level.  What do I mean exactly?  If you are paying for a performance vehicle the expectation is that when you plug your phone up, turn your vehicle on and GO then all will be well.  This is not the case with this vehicle.  I bought this vehicle brand new and have been back and forth to have upgrade after upgrade just to be able to keep the SOS system working properly which was one of the reasons, I purchased the vehicle to begin with.  I say don't waste your money as I am currently researching a new vehicle away from Audi completely I am past frustated at this point.  Beautiful looking car but what always looks good doesn't always mean good.

Must like them....owned 7 Audi's, 3 of them a5 Coupes, Premium Plus, Sport Pkg. B & O Sound system...sport suspension.  Sound is supreme, handling is awesome  w/19" wheels.  Some are not aware, sport suspension lowers the vehicle compared to w/out it so ride is stiffer for those who like tight responsive handling.  If you like a soft ride, don't get the sport suspension, however, it is super smooth on highways and most roads. If you want a loud, grunter car, this likely is not your cup of tea, if you want great engineering, under-stated styling, sleek design, crisp handling & fun, then is might work, it does it for me. P.S. Sits low so those who don't like getting in & out of a lower vehicle, it might be tiresome, but I don't mind it.  Great safety features. Stay off the turbo to conserve gas, have gotten up to 36 mpg on the freeway if not speeding. Back seats not for long drives, tight fit in back.

A fan...have had 7 Audi's, if you want raw grunt, pass on by.  If you want style, excellent handling, "jack be nimble, Jack be quick' turbo action this might be for you.  Decent gas milage if staying off the turbo.  Sport suspension & sport seats make this an under-stated fun sports car.  Add the B&O system & you'll be smiling.

I bought this car a new in 2019. In the past year, it has had two very serious problems. The generator malfunctioned last fall, causing a cascading series of problems that ultimately required the card to be towed into the dealership for service. Just today a low pressure, fuel valve, malfunctioned, causing the car to go into “limp mode” with RPMs limited to 2500 in the middle of a long road trip. Steer clear, or buy an extended warranty.

The Audi A6 Allroad Prestige is the 4th Audi I’ve owned. Previously, I had a 2018 Q3 and 2019 Q5. I still own my 2009 TT Roadster. I am an absolute fan of all those vehicles, but for sure the A6 Allroad is the most luxurious and refined of the Audi models I’ve owned. There is something special about a wagon. It has all the practicality of an CUV/SUV, but the drivability and handling of a sedan. No one buys wagons, so there is some degree of exclusivity that makes this care unique. I owned two Subaru Outbacks … however, those models sit very high, so it feels more like a CUV/SUV than a wagon.  This model definitely gets attention. It has a great looking exterior and the interior is made from high quality materials. The ambient lighting enhances the appearance of the interior at night. The air suspension makes for an extremely comfortable ride. It soaks up all the imperfections on the roads without any issues . There is hardly any wind noise at high speeds. What I like most about this car is that it has a lower center of gravity, so I don’t feel that top heavy feeling from driving an CUV/SUV. And because the roof is lower, I can easily get my bike and other gear on without difficulty. The B

This is already my second A6, previous one was 2013. Overall, I like Audi more than MB and BMW, no matter in services, style, performance and reliability. For sedan, S8 and A6 are the best. Minor problem on electrical parts is unavoidable but dealer can fix it within a reasonable time. Unlike BM, loaner car always available.

I recently traded in my 2019 A6 due to a gremlin in the ignition system that raised broader concerns about the electronics. In colder weather, the engine occasionally failed to turnover and the brake pedal became unmovable. Took it in for repair, but the problem resurfaced several months later. Overall, the A6 is a great driving car. It is very comfortable and quiet on the road, the interior is exceptional, and it has excellent acceleration. I am not a big fan of the upper and lower displays. They work, but they caused me to look down from the road too long to make adjustments. I also had to replace the computer once when the screens went dark. The other limitation is the overall lack storage space on the center console.

I recently purchased an A6 V6.  The car is very comfortable, drives smooth and has great pickup.  However, when I come to a stop, about 60% of the time there is a loud clunking noise that happens when I stop. Been to the dealer 3X AND I spoke with Audi and they say this is normal for this transmission.  This transmission seems to be on the A7 as well.

Excellent and classic overall Audi style and workmanship. I have had this car for a one year period and can report no tech nor engineering related issues. I have the prestige edition with massaging seats and 20 inch wheels. Ride is insulated from the outside noise of the world and despite large tires, the vehicle delivers extreme comfort as I drive on an interstate that is hobbled by winter bad weather. Routine on my drive down from Lk Tahoe to Reno and then back uphill, I average near 40 miles overall per gallon. Thus, I can get near 600 miles of highway cruising to a tankful. I do not drive like an idiot and cruise at 70 mph letting others pass me. Believe me, though, when I press on the accelerator, this car will go fast as need be.  I love the Apple Car play and ability while driving to use all of the driver safety features and be able to send and receive texts by voice. The Audi Apple Car Play is flawless and I can send a text out verbally to others that is oftentimes a couple of minutes long without any need for correction.  Car is classic in its lines and I get rave reviews and a lot of staring at it when parked.  Of course standard AWD quattro helps and in winter weather and snow, and the car handles extremely well suffice one puts on a dedicated winter tire. This is not a sport sedan and I agree that in twisting roads there are better vehicles to drive. It is also a touch expensive but Audi is oftentimes more competitive than others and offers many loyalty discounts on its vehicles.
This car makes you feel like you are on air. Best car I ever owned. Had a 2016 traded for 2019 big difference in comfort.  Only problem loses value quickly.

The comfort level, the quiet, and the sound system are phenomenal - I have the Prestige trim with the Sport package, the cold weather package, and a few other add-ons.  The fantastic instrumentation takes a little getting used to, but proves to be fairly intuitive over time.  I got a warning light for 'high' oil level, which needed a visit to the dealer to rectify (even though no oil was added by me since purchase).  That explains my rating on reliability being less than perfect.  The adaptive cruise control can be overly aggressive (adjustable, but have not messed with it yet).  Occasionally, there is a slight delay in accelerating from a stop.   I am getting reasonable fuel economy considering the cold weather (about 23 mpg in mixed driving, though mostly in town).  Overall, it is a great car, whether commuting to work, driving on the interstate with the family, or (occasionally) going on a banzai run to clear the cobwebs in my mind!:)
Snow storms or sleet will not hold this car back. The family feels most confident in the Audi for ski weekends in the mountains.

Great running and driving car. 125,000 miles and now it is using oil. too much. a quart every 800 miles is a big problem with the mid teen years especially with the 2.0 4 cylinder. very expensive repair so I may change my allegiance and go to a Toyota - Lexus product. darn shame for such a great vehicle.

I bought this 2015 Premium A6 in 2017 with low miles....I don't remember mileage.  I now have 119k and still drives and looks great.  Oil changes, tire replacements, detailing, new brakes, and rear brake lens.  On the highway with just me as driver I achieved 34 mpg.......smooth, good acceleration, but not a super takeoff from stopped position.  Who needs 300 hp plus?

This is my second A6 and it has served me well.

Dark blue over Nouget Brown interior. Only 47,200 miles.
4cyl turbo with excellent power. Received many compliments.
So why am I giving up?
Sold a few properties and moving up to a Porsche.
Expect a nice ride just keep the maintenance up.. oil change it at 4 thousand miles and it take care of you I love my 2015 Audi six.. 95000.. miles drive like a dream ..

Great car, very strong performance, awesome gas mileage , super handling , new AC , tires, well maintained , all records.
Buying electric for my wife , sad to sell it .

What’s delightful car this is my overall love has increased a lot now. 

Their engineering skills are truly visible in every aspect. 2012 model beauty fro m outside A6 version for luxury with comfort mode even went so smoothly on road once with sticky mud. And every drag at traffic with just mild switch in supper soft gear knob to sport in fractions take you 0-100 easy. Interior music Bose system with every R&B makes you high before party. Leather comfort seating and looks of luxury premium inside . Overall extremely satisfied with my love for Audi A6. 100% worth every penny although it’s was used car bought after it did already 80k run still runs smooth silky.

Very classy, very powerful. This thing feels as if it's glued to the road at all speeds and turns. Makes navigating tricky commuter traffic a breeze and when the roads clear up one has to be careful with speeding, else you'll be well over 100 without even flinching.

For a 2013, this thing has all the advanced features that many 2022 models still wouldn't have. There are cameras everywhere to assist with parking, adaptive cruise control and assistive braking, heated and cooled seats, rear and side window shades, navigation, bluetooth, sunroof, large trunk, etc.

I'm only 29 and so buying a car like this vs. a beat up wrangler/tacoma was really a no brainer. I'm certain my commute time is cut down significanly and I don't arrive to work sweating and tired, but in style.

I bought this car a new in 2019. In the past year, it has had two very serious problems. The generator malfunctioned last fall, causing a cascading series of problems that ultimately required the card to be towed into the dealership for service. Just today a low pressure, fuel valve, malfunctioned, causing the car to go into “limp mode” with RPMs limited to 2500 in the middle of a long road trip. Steer clear, or buy an extended warranty.

The Audi A6 Allroad Prestige is the 4th Audi I’ve owned. Previously, I had a 2018 Q3 and 2019 Q5. I still own my 2009 TT Roadster. I am an absolute fan of all those vehicles, but for sure the A6 Allroad is the most luxurious and refined of the Audi models I’ve owned. There is something special about a wagon. It has all the practicality of an CUV/SUV, but the drivability and handling of a sedan. No one buys wagons, so there is some degree of exclusivity that makes this care unique. I owned two Subaru Outbacks … however, those models sit very high, so it feels more like a CUV/SUV than a wagon.  This model definitely gets attention. It has a great looking exterior and the interior is made from high quality materials. The ambient lighting enhances the appearance of the interior at night. The air suspension makes for an extremely comfortable ride. It soaks up all the imperfections on the roads without any issues . There is hardly any wind noise at high speeds. What I like most about this car is that it has a lower center of gravity, so I don’t feel that top heavy feeling from driving an CUV/SUV. And because the roof is lower, I can easily get my bike and other gear on without difficulty. The B

This is already my second A6, previous one was 2013. Overall, I like Audi more than MB and BMW, no matter in services, style, performance and reliability. For sedan, S8 and A6 are the best. Minor problem on electrical parts is unavoidable but dealer can fix it within a reasonable time. Unlike BM, loaner car always available.

I recently traded in my 2019 A6 due to a gremlin in the ignition system that raised broader concerns about the electronics. In colder weather, the engine occasionally failed to turnover and the brake pedal became unmovable. Took it in for repair, but the problem resurfaced several months later. Overall, the A6 is a great driving car. It is very comfortable and quiet on the road, the interior is exceptional, and it has excellent acceleration. I am not a big fan of the upper and lower displays. They work, but they caused me to look down from the road too long to make adjustments. I also had to replace the computer once when the screens went dark. The other limitation is the overall lack storage space on the center console.

I recently purchased an A6 V6.  The car is very comfortable, drives smooth and has great pickup.  However, when I come to a stop, about 60% of the time there is a loud clunking noise that happens when I stop. Been to the dealer 3X AND I spoke with Audi and they say this is normal for this transmission.  This transmission seems to be on the A7 as well.

Excellent and classic overall Audi style and workmanship. I have had this car for a one year period and can report no tech nor engineering related issues. I have the prestige edition with massaging seats and 20 inch wheels. Ride is insulated from the outside noise of the world and despite large tires, the vehicle delivers extreme comfort as I drive on an interstate that is hobbled by winter bad weather. Routine on my drive down from Lk Tahoe to Reno and then back uphill, I average near 40 miles overall per gallon. Thus, I can get near 600 miles of highway cruising to a tankful. I do not drive like an idiot and cruise at 70 mph letting others pass me. Believe me, though, when I press on the accelerator, this car will go fast as need be.  I love the Apple Car play and ability while driving to use all of the driver safety features and be able to send and receive texts by voice. The Audi Apple Car Play is flawless and I can send a text out verbally to others that is oftentimes a couple of minutes long without any need for correction.  Car is classic in its lines and I get rave reviews and a lot of staring at it when parked.  Of course standard AWD quattro helps and in winter weather and snow, and the car handles extremely well suffice one puts on a dedicated winter tire. This is not a sport sedan and I agree that in twisting roads there are better vehicles to drive. It is also a touch expensive but Audi is oftentimes more competitive than others and offers many loyalty discounts on its vehicles.
This car makes you feel like you are on air. Best car I ever owned. Had a 2016 traded for 2019 big difference in comfort.  Only problem loses value quickly.

The comfort level, the quiet, and the sound system are phenomenal - I have the Prestige trim with the Sport package, the cold weather package, and a few other add-ons.  The fantastic instrumentation takes a little getting used to, but proves to be fairly intuitive over time.  I got a warning light for 'high' oil level, which needed a visit to the dealer to rectify (even though no oil was added by me since purchase).  That explains my rating on reliability being less than perfect.  The adaptive cruise control can be overly aggressive (adjustable, but have not messed with it yet).  Occasionally, there is a slight delay in accelerating from a stop.   I am getting reasonable fuel economy considering the cold weather (about 23 mpg in mixed driving, though mostly in town).  Overall, it is a great car, whether commuting to work, driving on the interstate with the family, or (occasionally) going on a banzai run to clear the cobwebs in my mind!:)

I have owned a 2018 Audi A8L turbo V8, 2012 Audi A6, 2019 Audi A5 cabriolet and also currently own the 2020 Audi Q5 and a 2008 Audi A4 (with 70k miles). I have to say the 2019 Audi A7 Prestige is a real pleasure to drive and own! Mines has the 21" wheel package as well as the sport suspension and drivers assistance package. It gives me about 21mpg city and having aken it on the road I'm getting 29mpg highway. It is comfortable (although not as comfortable as my A8) quick and a really beautifully styled vehicle. I have had the alternator replaced under waranty but besides that, no problems. It is the quintessential Audi and I highly recommend snagging one if you can find a clean example to buy!
Very confused and disappointed. After giving all the car information i still didn’t get an exact amount offer. Too many ads in between leads to confusions.
Most beautiful car in this  class. It is distinctive, dignified and extremely sporty. All systems function well and it's low end torque is a very satisfying feature!

Audi makes it difficult when you have documentation from the dealer to resolve the problem!!!!

Service manager at dealership has been extremely helpful. 
He is equally as frustrated!

Traded (reluctantly) my 2018 Panamera 4s for the new Audi A7, my second A7. Like the Panamera, I love the “utility” value afforded by the hatchback. With the Prestige level trim package, this car is extremely quiet. It is sneaky fast and very smooth, altogether a different experience than the similar Porsche.  Very comfortable seating and high quality interior.  MMI user interface definitely takes time to learn and unfortunately in these COVID times, the dealer is unable to offer much in-car familiarization experience.  Overall, a very nice car.

I’ve been a Lexus owner for 15 years. 3 different cars and lived them all. I’ve switched to Audi and love the A7 prestige. It’s roomy, full of great tech, has amazing performance and is simply a great looking car. They’ve added double pain glass so these are super quiet cars. No rattles. Just a gorgeous car that is loaded with features. Not inexpensive, but a sweet ride!

BRAND NEW 2021 Audi A7e broke down after only 823 miles and less than 3 weeks of ownership.  It had to be towed into a dealership and wait several weeks for a part from Germany.  While the vehicle looks beautiful and drove nicely (when it worked), I have lost all confidence in Audi's Quality Control and Reliability.  This is completely unacceptable.  It would have been a bit more tolerable had Audi authentically cared when I reached out to them, but they just kept quoting their only responsibility was to repair a car for standard period of 4 years or 50k miles, which they did.   They were not concerned in the least nor were they empathetic whatsoever.  It's bad enough that their vehicle failed me, but when Audi treated this situation as coldly and as if it was in the same category of a vehicle that had been first been driven for a reasonable period of time before having such a major problem, they lost me.

I didn't love the styling when it was first introduced in 2012, but it grew on me over time and I slowly became obsessed. Then I kept reading all the great reviews and knew I had to buy one. It took months, but I finally found a pre-owned A7 with pretty much the exact options I was looking for with less than 30k miles on it. I've owned a lot of cars in my life, but everyone that's driven the A7 agrees it's the best driving and looking car I've ever owned. It's so quiet, powerful, smooth, spacious, comfortable, fuel efficient, reliable, practical, and safe. I also love the uniqueness - you don't see a lot of them on the road. I wish more manufacturers would adopt the rear hatch - it's so much more practical than a trunk and saves me from having to own an SUV. It did need some costly repairs shortly after my purchase (more due to its age), but thankfully those were all covered by the extended warranty. I literally look back at it every time I park somewhere and find excuses to drive it - I love this car!

This car is like new. Runs and rides beautifully. It received very minor bumper scratches from a rear-ender at a stoplight. I was stopped and waiting for a red light when the car behind me rolled into my bumper at about 4 or 5 miles per hour. I brought the car to my Audi dealer for like-new bumper repair.
Awesome car! Fast, comfortable, reliable, and looks great. Handles great. Quattro is great in rain & snow especially.

My favorite car of all time. Looks, performance, comfort, practical (show me another car that looks this cool that you can get a 9’ Christmas tree inside!). A pleasure to drive. Like it so much, I have 2!
car performance ;looks and $$$ worth it every single penny; Im driving almost five years and I want to get a new one A7 one more time

This vehicle is exactly what you've been lead to believe it will be.  An extremely confident cruiser at all speeds, comfortable to drive very fast, and very unique styling.  The interior is of the highest quality and everything is ergonomically correct.  Overall, a great used car buy, though a bit pricey for what you get new.  Maintenance is expensive, but you know what you're in for with the Germans.  Of particular note, this ~340hp supercharged V6 is the best engine I've owned in a vehicle.  Driving normally, you spend almost the entire time between 1,000 and 3,000 rpms with zero lag.  Gas mileage benefits from this, and on the highway it's easy to get mid-thirties.  A great automobile.

I purchased this unicorn 2014 Audi A7 3.0 TDI brand new in NOV 13.  This car has been driven on the German Autobahn, the Italian Autostrade, and American highways.  It turns heads everywhere it travels.  

Pros:  
-Excellent fuel mileage (HWY 38 MPG) and range (650 miles) even after the recall 
-Very comfortable
-Timeless styling
-No reliability issues
-I believe the KBB value is understated as these TDI vehicles are in demand
-Incredible acceleration with the 405 lbs of torque
-The AWD system allows for excellent control in any weather
-Large amount of aluminum used in the body deters oxidation/rust
-The expansive cargo area (with seats down) allows for transportation of bikes or other large items
-Won't let you lock your keys in the car

Cons:
-In cold weather the spoiler tends to remain elevated.  This does not happen during the warmer weather.  It finally goes down once the weather warms above freezing
-The navigation system once had Google Earth.  It appears to require an expensive update for that to work again
-Bluetooth phone sound could be better

Best car I have ever owned. Changed the brakes at 80,000.  Changed the tires at 85,000. According to computer I have achieved over 40 mpg on highway. Except for recalls all other parts are original. I would buy another one, but now that I am retired they are a bit above what I want to spend on a car.  By the way my A7 has only been serviced by the Audi dealer.

Bought my 2019 A8 (3.0T) in early Spring 2022 and have been loving it ever since.  Bought with 23k miles and now with 41, I'm happy to report its been care-free... and yes, with all the features, I was a little worried about things going wrong at first, but so far, so good. 
Outstanding travel/road trip car, but it's also excellent in town (the 4-wheel steering option is a game changer!), and it's even impressively agile on windy roads for its size.  The turbocharged V6 is no slouch - this car is NOT underpowered, and it gets better gas mileage than the 2015 A6 I traded in after 110k miles (I'm getting 30-32 MPG highway with three 200-pound adults and their luggage).  City mileage is better too, presumably due to the "mild hybrid" drivetrain.  
But the creme-de-la-creme is the serene and oh-so comfortable interior.  It is uncluttered, classy, and above reproach - a place I love to be every chance I get.  I look forward to every quiet and comfortable moment I can spend in this car, even if it's just parked!  And, I was surprised to find how much I love that I got one that's optioned-up, because I would not have ordered all the extras if building one new - - but I will vouch for the value of all of them if you are considering ordering one.  
The "base" Bose stereo is quite good, and that is one of the few non-upgrades I have.  The upgraded leather, interior lighting, insulated glass, climate options (ionizer and scent are far more appreciated than I would have guessed), and the wonderfully-effective seat ventilation is a must-have.  The seat massage option sounds silly and decadent, but on longer trips when even in this wonderful space I get road fatigue, I can stretch out the miles between stops by activating one of the several "massage" options and reducing back and butt fatigue.  And the one thing I would never have cared about until owning a large car with it:  4-wheel steering.  I now wish we had it on all our family's cars, as it "shrinks" this rather long car down to compact-car size as far as turning radius for super-easy parking and navigating tight spaces like parking garages.  The MMI interface is lightning fast (instant) and, after a short learning period (maybe up to a couple weeks if you're a boomer like me).  Audi did a fantastic job of moving from the remote knob to a "haptic" touch screen (and excellent voice-control options if you prefer that instead).  The two-tier programmable interior lighting is flat-dead gorgeous at night.  The trunk has a huge, flat surface area, and I love the no-touch open and push-button closer (a-la SUV or minivan hatch).  Even the soft-close doors are a nice touch, along with so many other thoughtful features that take away the crudeness of being transported in a machine (wink).  Windshield washers that do not spray bystanders or passengers getting in or out, super-quiet windows and shades, and even door locks that make no noise when opened or closed (fun fact:  People stand and wait for me to unlock the doors, so I just look at them and smile until they try the handle to find its open - lol).  The touch-open door handles inside are great.  Lift your hand from the armrest and put a finger under the latch... One small tug and the door latch releases - kinda pops to part-open.  Pretty much everything about this car is designed to be quite or in some other way put its driver and passengers at ease.  Some auto journalists have even said they almost have a hard time staying awake because the interior is such a serene place to be! 
Lastly, did I mention the A8 is quite an attractive car?  I love its looks and get an incredible number of compliments everywhere I go (it does have the chrome package, which looks amazing on the dark blue body).  One gentleman swooned over the car as I was checking into a hotel.  He  later saw me inside and asked several questions about it.  The conversation ended with him saying, "I know an Audi dealership owner and will be ordering one of these when I get home from vacation".
If I sound biased, I am.  I have been in love with this car since I bought it and hope I can afford to  always have one this nice when it comes time to sell/trade.  Its my fourth consecutive Audi in 23 years, and I am hoping to get the same care-free 100,ooo miles I got from the previous three (one A4 and two A6's).

We purchased a CPO 2019 Audi A8 with 32,000 miles. In the first 16 months of ownership our car has been in the Audi Dealership shop 82 days. Even after 82 days in the shop we have a return visit schedule to address outstanding items. We continue to have brake issues with no resolution from Audi. If you don't want a car with a lot of service issues this is not the car for you. This is also my 4th Audi and far worse than any of my other A6's. 11/4/22 – 12/22/22 48 DAYS 8/18/22 - 8/29/22 13 DAYS 2/25/22 - 3/7/22 10 DAYS 1/14/22 – 1/20/22 6 DAYS 12/29/21 - 1/3/22 5 DAYS = Total 82 Days
Smooth as silk.  Quiet yet powerful. Comfortable and inviting.  Just perfect!  If you want a serene yet exhilarating driving experience, this is the car.

Honest review; the 3.0 transmission stutters often especially when the auto on off is allowed to operate. My solution is to always put it in S mode sports mode so the transmission shifts must better less lag.  Then there’s the annoyances through the interactive computer since you said certain things they don’t stay every time you have to go back in and reset certain settings just annoyances the S class was much more user-friendly without those annoyances.
Fully loaded w/Exec Rear Seats/Tray Tables/B&O sound Sys/Night Vision/Sun Roof/Monsoon Gray Metallic

This is my first Audi and I have been pleasantly surprised overall. For starters, it is a beautiful car that earns me complements where ever I go. The ride and performance have been beyond my expectations with the turbo V8. I have often been surprised to see the speedo at 90+, while continuing to feel securely in control.
The technology of the options are way ahead of any car I have previously owned, and the luxurious look/feel of the interior is amazing.

Luxury comes at a big price but you have to be all in.  3.0 engine absolutely great on gas 30 mpg highway but needs 93 octane.  Aluminum body car only weighs 4450 pounds but looks like 5000.  Gets up and goes, supercharger and fast shifting automatic 0-60 times 5.5 and the tourque ban is good.  No complaints on room L model.  Quality materials and build, no squeeks or rattles.  Still a car, a little harder to get in and out of compared to a SUV.  Maintence is expensive recommend finding a good mechanic that works on foreign cars, not Audi Dealership, that's why it's not for everyone.  Rarity, not to many around, it will be 15-1 Mercedes S Class or 7 BMW's before you spot an A8.  Center Screen disappears into the dash but reappears if backing up or starting up.

Best car in its class, hands down.I have had seven Audis, Mercedes, Porsche, and Jaguar. While each has had some advantages, the overall experience of the Audi A8 is by far the best. One of the powertrain options that is not discussed in the review is the turbo diesel. This is the one that I own, even though Audi had to modify the engine because of the admissions scandal. This engine gets 40 miles per gallon on long drives, and my long term mileage for city and highway is 31.5. When I get service at my Audi dealer, I am always given a loaner which is usually on A6 or Q7. These are not half the car that I have. In the past, I have traded every 3 to 4 years and have had this car for nearly 8 years. I don’t intend to trade it anytime soon unless it is outfitted with an electric engine. For the price, I cannot imagine a better used car. If you can find a diesel, buy it now.

Best car I've ever owned.  Comfortable, excellent gas mileage, reliable.

NO COMPLAINTS!

I switched from a 2008 Lexus Ls 460. Did quite a bit of homework before switching. I was specifically looking for the A8L Sport with the Bang and Olufsen and rear seat comfort  package. I've had my vehicle for three weeks. I'm truly satisfied. 
Great power, comfort and amenities. The Bang and Olufsen stereo was worth waiting on and the comfort of the seats are priceless.

I expected the car to be good, but it wasn’t. It was amazing, almost perfect in fact. As a used car is perfect because of the prices you can get it at, but brand new maybe not because it loses value pretty soon. However, I wouldn’t care because this car is so good I wouldn’t care losing money on it. I have the 4.0t and man is this thing fast. I timed it from 0-60 in 3.8s and I’ve raced many cars and for now remain undefeated in this thing. I even raced a Porsche Cayman GT4 and dusted it. It also have great traction from that Quattro AWD for New Jersey’s snowy days. But the best part of the car is how it combines speed and luxury together, this car is so refined and the interior is so well built that you feel special just sitting in it(specially with the massage function in the seats).The ride is comfortable but not comfortable to the point where it feels soft and uninspiring around a corner. There is barely any body roll and the car just feels comfortable but at the same time sporty everywhere you go. It also has so much space that me sitting with my seat set for my 6 foot frame, my son who is 17 and is a monster at 6’4 and 260lbs can easily fit behind me. Same goes for the trunk where I was able to fit 2 whole carts full of food from a supermarket and with still some extra space left. Another thing I love is that it makes you feel cool and special because your are in 1: An Audi, 2: Audi’s best sedan(well except for the S8) and 3: It’s a sleeper because it actually embarrasses many sports cars and you would never think that based on its big-car looks. Also some people complain about the infotainment system’s speeds, but I have no problem with it and I love the google earth function too. Definitely wow’s my friends and my kids when they see that map. If I had to say one con which it isn’t really a con and it actually helps you fly under the radar even stealthier, it would be that I wish it was louder. The engine sounds great but is a lower pitch sound, I would prefer it was louder but thats just me. Other than that, love this car!

The best luxury sedan on the market for quality and price on the matrix scale.
Audi is very original in it's own way
Everybody need to own at least one audi in their lifetime.
The Audi A8 L's I've owned have been a pleasure to drive & ride.  Lots of room and full of feature & benefits.  They just keep getting better with new model years!!
Awesome sound system.  Very fast and great acceleration.  I blow the doors off all ICE engines and most Tesla’s (lots of me-too, wannabes who don’t know how to drive).  Very comfortable.
The most amazing ride.. for an AWD!  So quiet and comfortable that it is hard to believe you are driving an SUV with chops best in class for sure!

This is a well engineered car with top quality throughout in both parts and build. Range fits into my usage and recharged primarily in my garage with a professionally installed 240volt/50amp circuit which makes all the difference in EV ownership.
This car is a joy to drive and to ride in as well.  The range has been increased to 248 miles.  It is extremely attractive both inside and outside.
Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is goodCar is good Car is good

I traded in my Q8 Prestige for a 2021 eTron Sportback Prestige nearly a year ago.  Performance is similar to the Q8, perhaps a bit quicker but it isn't as fast as the base Taycan I drove at a Porsche event.  

There have been a couple of instances where the MMI system needed a reboot but other than that the car has been trouble free.  It charges from 50% to 90% in about 20 minutes at on an Electrify America DC charger, or in about 6 hours on the 50-amp circuit I added to my garage.  A 90% charge during colder weather shows a range of about 174 miles on the dash. 

I am retired and don't commute to work or drive on long trips, so the range hasn't been an issue for me.  If I wanted to take a long trip, I would consider renting a car rather than worrying about finding a charging station.  If I did a lot of long drives, I would have looked for a plug-in hybrid instead.

The fit and finish of the exterior and interior is up to the quality that I expect form an Audi.  There are no creaks, rattles, or wind noise. The 4000 lb. towing capacity is a plus for me.  I have no regrets about purchasing this vehicle.

I've owned a 2021 Sportsback Prestige for 8 months and really enjoy driving it.  It's the most quiet care I've ever owner. When driving on highways you can barely hear any road noise.  The smooth acceleration and quick response makes it fun to drive.  Interior comfort is second to none, very comfortable seats with massage, heat and cooling.  The stereo system is ok. I think the Meridian System in Land Rover was slightly better, but its still really great  

I did have the AC pressure sensor fail at 2000 miles. Very common problem.  Car was in the shop for 2 weeks waiting for the part.  
Charging is easy and a lot cheaper than gas.

I love this car. Low profile but great engineering and very well made. Driven a Tesla and yes they have longer driving distance if you want to drive 40 in a 65 for your distance. Plenty of charge for me to go 37 miles to work, go to the beach for the day or hit the mountains.
Awesome sound system.  Very fast and great acceleration.  I blow the doors off all ICE engines and most Tesla’s (lots of me-too, wannabes who don’t know how to drive).  Very comfortable.
The most amazing ride.. for an AWD!  So quiet and comfortable that it is hard to believe you are driving an SUV with chops best in class for sure!

This is a well engineered car with top quality throughout in both parts and build. Range fits into my usage and recharged primarily in my garage with a professionally installed 240volt/50amp circuit which makes all the difference in EV ownership.
This car is a joy to drive and to ride in as well.  The range has been increased to 248 miles.  It is extremely attractive both inside and outside.

Charging is easy and a lot cheaper than gas.

I love this car. Low profile but great engineering and very well made. Driven a Tesla and yes they have longer driving distance if you want to drive 40 in a 65 for your distance. Plenty of charge for me to go 37 miles to work, go to the beach for the day or hit the mountains.
Awesome sound system.  Very fast and great acceleration.  I blow the doors off all ICE engines and most Tesla’s (lots of me-too, wannabes who don’t know how to drive).  Very comfortable.
The most amazing ride.. for an AWD!  So quiet and comfortable that it is hard to believe you are driving an SUV with chops best in class for sure!

This is a well engineered car with top quality throughout in both parts and build. Range fits into my usage and recharged primarily in my garage with a professionally installed 240volt/50amp circuit which makes all the difference in EV ownership.
This car is a joy to drive and to ride in as well.  The range has been increased to 248 miles.  It is extremely attractive both inside and outside.
Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is good Car is goodCar is good Car is good

I traded in my Q8 Prestige for a 2021 eTron Sportback Prestige nearly a year ago.  Performance is similar to the Q8, perhaps a bit quicker but it isn't as fast as the base Taycan I drove at a Porsche event.  

There have been a couple of instances where the MMI system needed a reboot but other than that the car has been trouble free.  It charges from 50% to 90% in about 20 minutes at on an Electrify America DC charger, or in about 6 hours on the 50-amp circuit I added to my garage.  A 90% charge during colder weather shows a range of about 174 miles on the dash. 

I am retired and don't commute to work or drive on long trips, so the range hasn't been an issue for me.  If I wanted to take a long trip, I would consider renting a car rather than worrying about finding a charging station.  If I did a lot of long drives, I would have looked for a plug-in hybrid instead.

The fit and finish of the exterior and interior is up to the quality that I expect form an Audi.  There are no creaks, rattles, or wind noise. The 4000 lb. towing capacity is a plus for me.  I have no regrets about purchasing this vehicle.

I've owned a 2021 Sportsback Prestige for 8 months and really enjoy driving it.  It's the most quiet care I've ever owner. When driving on highways you can barely hear any road noise.  The smooth acceleration and quick response makes it fun to drive.  Interior comfort is second to none, very comfortable seats with massage, heat and cooling.  The stereo system is ok. I think the Meridian System in Land Rover was slightly better, but its still really great  

I did have the AC pressure sensor fail at 2000 miles. Very common problem.  Car was in the shop for 2 weeks waiting for the part.  
Charging is easy and a lot cheaper than gas.

I love this car. Low profile but great engineering and very well made. Driven a Tesla and yes they have longer driving distance if you want to drive 40 in a 65 for your distance. Plenty of charge for me to go 37 miles to work, go to the beach for the day or hit the mountains.
It's a good car for the price, however I wish more tech integration was available. Overall, nice and I do recommend it to drivers looking to get a decent car.
No complaints at all. Have had q3 for 6 months and love it. Wish it had a little better gas mileage
I love this car it’s a joy to drive. It’s pretty nice shape. Definitely recommend the blackout package. But don’t do 20 inch rims makes the ride rougher.

2020 Rides horribly, no power at all, no solid driving, all the dashboard lights and gadgets stop and start working on its own. I loved the look, that's what drew me in and lease price. I thank God I didn't buy it everything I drive it. Looks are great, that's it! Go with a sadan VW put this to shame... if 2023 is the new one, wait a year or 2. So sad, I love it! Such a let down.

The Q3 is solid. 

Pros: Tech features, also safety….2 people have hit my car (minor fender benders) & the car is solid… minimal damage to mine, while their cars pretty much crumbled. 

Cons: pick up, transmission, loud AC.

Unsure of reliability because I’ve only had the car a year, but I’m assuming the car would probably have some if the normal Audi issues down the road, which can be very pricey to fix.

The Audi Q3 Sportback is elegant and refined on the road, just like the Audi Q3 SUV. In terms of image and style, it edges ahead for this reviewer with a unique coupé-like look for this segment.

The beauty is that Audi has sacrificed very little practicality for this style. So the Q3 Sportback balances the head and heart with plenty of interior space and a big boot.

Inside, the Sportback has one of the best cabin experiences in the class. Equipment levels are good with plenty of technology coming as standard on the vehicle.

The Audi Q3 Sportback adds even more prestige to the Q3 range in a desirable SUV-coupé format.

In less than 2 years of ownership I have had multiple problems. 2 trans fluid leaks, 3 sunroof leaks and assorted minors issues. I have asked Audi to contact me on service questionnaire and have never gotten a response.

The Audi Q3 is the best near-luxury compact SUV of the pack. The Volvo XC40 is a bit too funky even if the turbo is slightly better. The MB B-class and BMW X3 requires too many add-on packages to match the Audi's features, becoming too expensive -- also have a cheap interior for the price. 

The fact is you're looking at the Q3 because you've also considered the Q5. However, it's about $5-10k more for the same features and doesn't offer much more space or tech to justify the price. If you're looking for a stylish near-luxury compact SUV, you're in the right spot. I did a lot of research over several months and ultimately purchased a full-option '21 Audi Q3 Premium Plus. I noticed reviews from others were either too critical of the Q3 (reviewing it like they expected a Q7) or not critical enough (you love your new car, but honestly it's not perfect). I hope to accurately review the Q3 and point out honest observations while remembering this vehicle is a near-luxury compact SUV, not a luxury or standard vehicle.
A great car.  purchased it two weeks ago and really enjoying it. Low mileage only 30,000 miles. Highly recommended.

This car will be 6 years old at Christmas 2023. Has been in EVERY state east of the Mississippi. Most states several times. Wisconsin and the UP of Michigan. Florida twice yearly at least. 
Excellent gas mileage 32+ mpg on the road. 30 around town. Quiet. Comfortable. (Could also be due to Michelin tires?). 
Anyhow, just terrific. When it is not on the road it is a garage Queen, waiting for the next trip.
This year we go to Mississippi, Louisiana for 2 weeks for Cajun food, zydeco music and tour Laurel, Oxford, Natchez and Vicksburg. St Francisville for history and food and Lafayette for Cajun and crabs.
BTW I am 81, spouse 71. NEVER, EVER use the Interstate system. Just the old Blue Highways for us. Never met an a**hole on any of our travels. Everyone asked has always been a help for food, directions, places to stay or places that are a must see.

Bought the car back in 2019 used with 41000 miles.  Been the best overall car I've ever had. Not a great family car if over four people but otherwise been a great vehicle. Been reliable so far. Have had an issue with the car not always accepting the key when close to the door or inside the car to start . Had to look at the car manual to figure how to always get in and start when it wouldn't accept it. Overall no complaints. Driving it is awesome. Better than the 40 plus other vehicles I've owned

This car is everything I dreamed of.  I went from driving a small sedan and wanted something more suitable for the winter months.  I feel extremely safe when driving in the snow with this car.  It is also very comfortable, so I can't complain when I am stuck in traffic.  The bose speakers are pretty awesome too.  The only issue I have had in the 3 years I've had this car was a broken clock spring which is not super uncommon for this model apparently, but it is a repair covered under warranty if you have it.  There is plenty of trunk space and the back seats are comfy!  My dog loves going for rides in my Q3 - however I do have a seat protector over the back seats.  I am a big Audi enthusiast and will tell everyone how much I love my Q3.  Don't let the idea of owning a luxury car scare you, it's well worth it in my opinion.

Overall, yeah, pretty decent car.  I've been driving it for 2.5 years.  I have the premium with 20" wheels, AWD and some of the extras.  Just underwhelmed with performance.  Unless it's in sport mode, the thing doesn't really wanna respond as I feel it should.

Also the tech.  Yikes.  Frustrating at best.  The business with the doors not unlocking all the time when you are standing three inches from the car, or it locks instead, is extremely annoying.  Small things like this mean a lot when you're paying upwards of 40K for a small suv.  

Pros - comfortable front seats, good handling and the bright blue one I have looks really nice.  Just won't be getting another when turn this one in after the lease is up shortly.  Overpriced for what you get.

I've owned several German made cars and while I truly love most Mercedes products, I am enamored with this little Audi. I had a Q7 about 10 years ago and it was just a pleasure to drive...that's how I feel about this Audi. It's a pleasure to drive and I don't have the high price of a MB....nor the feeling that I'm trying to be something I'm not....lack of pretense. I read a lot of reviews complaining about lack of power and lack of room in the back. I would say I'n not missing any power and the back may be small but I'm not riding back there and it is a small vehicle...so, I'm not expecting it to be the Q5 or Q7. My last 2 vehicles have been BMW and oh, I am sick inside about the trouble and money I spent on them. I wanted them to be awesome and man they just are not. I'll drive this Audi over a BMW any day. The Benz? They are so nice but....for the money...this Audi hits the spot.

Overall, a nice car, and fun to drive.  Roomy for a 6'5" guy, and we've had four adults riding around comfortably.  And it's a nice car for a long trip too.  

My biggest issue, and it's not a huge one, is that the electronics or maybe the car's computer, seems to act up now and again. For example, sometimes the radio locks up, or the car doesn't recognize that I'm standing three inches away from the door and it still doesn't automatically unlock for me.  Or when the door sensors get wet they lock and unlock the car.  Or the bluetooth doesn't automatically activate and I have to go through the whole setup thing again and keep my fingers crossed.  Had higher technical expectations from the Germans.  Never had any problems like these with my Volvo XC70 - which was totaled and why I ended up with the Q3.  

Of course the dealership says there's nothing wrong with it.  Maybe it's just my car/model, I don't know.  

I recommend the car overall, but probably will not be keeping this one past the lease end.

I recently purchased my Audi Q3 (2016) Prestige in December of 2019. Audi has an amazing knack for creating super chic and powerful cars. The exterior and interior of this car are honestly unmatched to its competitors. The handling is also quite a dream, as I do own the Prestige model which offers Dynamic and Comfort modes for steering/transmission. It does have the same engine as the Audi A4, which having owned an A4 before this, does make it seem a bit sluggish but once it gets going it's a BEAST. This machine handles extremely well in all weather conditions... Quattro power in this car is outstanding.

The car is beautiful and i finally get all the technology figured out which is outstanding.   BUT . . .  I agree with the battery review above,  Prepare to lose 1% charge per mile e.g.  10-miles, expect to go from 80% to 70%.  Plus on a regular 120V outlet it will take you 1-Hour to charge 1% e.g.. to get back to 80% from 70% expect to charge 10-hours.  Double that to 20-hours to get back to 80% from 60%.  With the 240V problem and recall, you're stuck between a rock and a hard stone.  BIG concern, beware! Make sure you know what HPC charges are located!!!

Excited to go electric and did my research.  This car was estimated to go 236 miles on a single charge.  It does not charge past 180 and loses 15 miles as soon as you back out of your drive way.  My commute to work and back home is 50 miles. round trip. I can only go 2 days before I have to charge it again.
Absolutely great car! I was deciding between this and the Volvo however the drive and the comfort inside blew me away. Great interior features and the Premium Plus package is honestly the way to go!

The car drives great but the software that runs everything from radio to climate is awful. It is confusing and hard to operate - my wife who has an engineering degree had to have two long appointments just to learn how to work - and still was confused. Have had people at the dealership and a repair place tell me there are always problems with the technology. I also have a Ram truck same year and it is 100 times better in that regard. They should be able to get that right.

I traded in a 2017 Q-5 to lease the 2021 Plug-in and get the California HOV sticker. It was very disappointing that the Hybrid batteries occupy the space under the rear cargo area (where a spare tire would fit) because the area provided space to keep a slew of items such as owner's manual, gloves, spare prescription glasses, tire air compressor, etc.  This is particularly important space since the console between the front two seats is tiny and difficult to access.  The batteries also forced Audi to reduce the size of the gas tank from 18.5 gal. to 14.3.  That costs about 110 miles of ICE range in exchange for only about 20 miles BEV range. You are on fumes at about 375 miles, which is a big deal if your two homes are 390 miles apart.  Because I did not install a 240v charger for a mere 20 miles, I use the standard 3 prong wall socket for charging.  The car will only gain about 1.5 miles per hour of charging.  The dashboard gage will display 31 miles range on electric, but that is an illusion.  You will get 20 miles, plus or minus and will need all night and then some to get a full charge from a totally dead hybrid battery if you just use a standard plug.  
I've been quite negative about these aspects of the Audi, but in fact when my lease ends in 2024 I intend to lease a 2024 Q-5e.  Journalists have reported that the vehicle will receive a new, slick trim and come with 40 BEV mile range, which is critically important for my personal driving habits.

Superb ride and handling. Average mileage 30 mpg on premium. Ventilated sport seats keep me comfortable Year round.

Fantastic service Audi Silver Spring.

Owning it for 2 years.  Some small issues with driving safety system - when pulling back sometimes  it breaks without any reason. I think parking markings could be misidentified by cameras as some distraction.  Handling is great. You “feel” the car on every corner.  Averaging 26 mpg , of mixed driving.  Also I wish the trunk space would be larger.

I have a mint 2008 Audi A4 1.0 Sline and love it 
I just bought my wife 2022 Audi Q5 Quattro Sportback "Ultra Blue" and this thing drives like a BEAST and is so fast, smooth and comfortable... Everything about this car is absolutely amazing 
I don't know if I got a great one but there is not one thing wrong from the cool Ultra Blue 
"BIG BLUE" will silver spoilers and the 20 inch fantastic rims not including a killer interior this is buy far the best Audi you can buy and kills the looks over the BMW & Mercedes in ever area -
Period !!! Plus I was smart and spent an additional 5K so everything - I mean everything on this car is guaranteed until 2028 !!!! 😊👍 - BOOM !!!!
This vehicle has great amenities. Very comfortable ride. I would have liked the screen to be a touch screen. The trunck is just big enough for my family of four.
Love just about everything with this SUV.  Throw it in Sport mode and wow you don't realize you are driving an SUV.  Reliability has been better than I expected and dealership is first class.

I owned the 2018 model which was really nice but didn't have a lot of power and mileage was around 27 average. This one is super powerful, I'm getting 50  a gallon because my garage has free plug-in. if it had twice the battery only range, I would keep it forever
