We've had our car 6 months so far, and it's been in the shop 7 times. This model has an issue out there currently with the brake pedal assembly and that portion of the wiring harness that causes issues with brake pedal position, cruise control, and throwing check engine lights related to this. GM knows about this issue, and has a fix involving a completely new brake pedal design related to a design flaw in the current design, but refuses to issue a TSB for it.
Car is perfect. Enough said   Easy car to drive and has latest technology. Cameras everywhere. Car rides like a sedan and has great pickup.

The fuel injectors had to be replaced at 45000 miles and are not covered by powertrain warranty.  The car is very noisy inside.

Space is good compared to other csuvs.

Gas mileage avg us 25 mph after 45,000 miles.

Buicks warranty is a real consideration to not buy another buick compared to Kia or hyandai.

Also, the Envision is manufactured 100 percent in China. That's a negative for future purchases for us.

I have driven Buicks for years, previously Regals and once they were discontinued Envisions. I have a 2022 Envision with the sport package and it drives so nice! Buicks always drive nice. You feel like you are in a luxury vehicle without buying a luxury vehicle. I recommend these all day!

I purchased a 2021 Satin Steel Buick Envision Avenir AWD in March 2021. It has been a pleasure to drive and the cabin is so quiet. Very impressed the way it absorbs bumps and gives the feeling of driving  much bigger car. It has many safety features that give me security. The cameras are top notch with excellent coverage. I see why Buick sells a high percentage of its vehicles to women. This vehicle is not a sports car or a vehicle that I will take off-roading. Its was purchased for luxury at an affordable price with attractive styling.
This is the Kelly Blue Book and to check on the estimated value of your own vehicle, you have to jump through hoops to get it. This is disgusting.
Nice as an Audi, or Lexus at $15,000 less. Awd, turbo, amazing infotainment system, lane assist and adaptive speed control work great.

Strangely enough, I cross shopped this with a BMW 330 sedan and an X3 suv.  Similar price for a base 330 to Avenir trim. I hated the transmission on the BMW. Every push of the gas is met with hesitation, then thinking about the right gear, then going to it. Annoying! The GM 9 speed is seamless forward motion. Then the seats were uncomfortable on the 330. Buick very comfortable. The infotainment on the Buick is so functional and works every time. The BMW annoying. The tan vinyl seats on the BMW 330 and X3 looked cheap compared to the nice looking and SMELLING leather seats in the Buick. I know my neighbors would be more impressed with either BMW, but I drive 120  miles a day, and my comfort and enjoyment comes first.
This is one of the best cars I have ever owned. It is very comfortable and sporty. It is very well built and is very dependable. Love this car!

Let me start by telling you I change cars every about 2 to 3 times a year yes 2  3 cars per year I am just sick in the head and I can not stick with 1 vehicle for more then 4 5 month I had all kind of brand from Lexus RX350 to Mercedes Toyota to Honda all kind of Toyota such as Highlander Rav 4 Camry Corolla  Prius All Hondas Nissan Murano  Mazda CX9 signature and CX5 GT Ford Edge and many more too name them Lexus RX350 was must comfortable vehicle to drive but infotainment system was totally useless Garbage this Buick does not fall behind Lexus and Mercedes what so ever excellent handling super responsive on 2.0 turbo engine very very quiet full of features in fact many more features then Lexus and Mercedes this was the only vehicle bought it over a year ago and still have it I Love every single mile I drive and every trip I take with this Buick not thinking to sell it any time soon if I sell it definitely is going to be another Envision but newer model.

Very satisfied. Only two issues in 6 years. backseat a/c heat control gate defective. Repaired at no charge. Frayed seat belt. Replaced at no charge.

I really like my 2017 Buick Envision. It took me a while to get used to all the features, and I am still learning after 2 months of driving. It is roomy inside, very comfortable and clean. Mine has the panoramic view which I love. I do have a few issues such as each time I start my vehicle up, the driver's seat adjusts even though I have set the adjustments. One person told me to leave one set of keys out because that's the reason it does that. I tried that, and it did not help. The other small issue is the stop/start feature. I really don't care for that, and there is no way I can turn it off without having to take it to a service shop which I don't want to do because I don't want to start having repairs done this soon. Other than that, it rides good, but uses more gas than my 2008 Chevy Equinox. I guess because the engine is smaller, not sure. I like Buick models and SUV's especially, but I don't like the smaller size, compact vehicles. With all that being said, I would recommend anyone to purchase the Envision.
We love the Envision Essence (2020) that we purchased new. It continues the quality, quietness, and performance that Buick has  long been known for. Would encourage anyone to purchase the Envision!

Bought this vehicle in December 2018 and continue to be delighted with its performance and efficiency.  I typically average 30+ MPG around town and near 40 MPG on the highway. It's fast and the 9-gear automatic transmission is smooth.  Even with four occupants it has good to excellent acceleration.
The Regal Essence is a quiet safe easy riding 4 door sedan. I get 30 MPG in mixed suburban/hwy driving. The car is comfortable and handles well.

Like most people who have had GM products in the past I swore that would never have another one in my driveway.  That being said I saw this car and had to check it out.  When I knew it was imported from  Germany, I gave it a hard second thought.  Boy am I glad I did.  It really has been a wonderful car,  It rides well, Ive had two back surgery's and and use to not be able to ride much more than a couple of hours before I had to stop and walk around. Yesterday I rode almost four hours with out much problem.  The heated seats really make a difference there.  It handles well and I really love the adaptive cruise control. Works really well.  Have just under 22000 miles and I have not one single problem with other than usual maintenance. Do your self a favor and check it out.  As i said its not your run of the mill GM car.

I used KBB to get trade-in as well as used car value for this purchase.  Right on the nose! Car is very impressive over a two-day 300 mile+ trip.  Looking forward to learning all the new technology and personalizing the vehicle.
Cool sports car!!! Fun to drive. Smokes most cars stoplight to stoplight! Good gas mileage for a fast car!

I have owned for 2 1/2 years and it is one of my daily drivers.  It's reliability is outstanding and because of the BMW underneath it, is both reliable and reasonably priced to service.  It has great driving and street presence.  Definitely a soft ride, but fast (I have the V-spec).  In the entire ownership, the only problem it had was a bad cable in the drivers door.  While they fixed it under warranty, it would have only been $600 to fix at RR dealer.  I used to trade in a Mercedes s63 about every 2 years, just to get the newest.  This car is timeless, because I bought it 3 years old, had already taken the depreciation hit.  Therefore, because it is timeless, there is no reason to upgrade to a newer year.  Thus, much less expensive than buying a new s class every 2 years.

This car is an absolutely amazing piece of machinery that is more like art on wheels. I have owned many luxury brands but none make me feel like I do when I drive my Ghost. It is powerful and sophisticated that will delight all your senses.

After two years with our Ghost I am still dazzled by it.,,quiet inside like no other car. Easy to drive. Handles wonderfully. Faster than will ever be needed. AND it still has the Rolls-Royce feel brought up to date. My next car will be a Wraith, but I still have way to many miles to put on our Ghost.

We keep the batteries negative disconnected, but always fully charged, tire pressure check before any short trips, 6 years, two oil changes Zero maintenance, we bought it with 12k miles now we have 17k. 
I invested only $1000 for a full detailing with ceramic coating, car is a limited 2006 black edition, fuel tank is always full, perfect car for special occasions. Never had a single problem.

2006 Rolls Royce Phantom is the epitome of luxury, value and fun.  Always beautiful  with comfort and quiet ride.  Lots of power to accelerate onto the highway.  Reliable and costs of repairs no more than other expensive cars.  Great audio system to enjoy while sitting on premium leather seats.  Paint and finish quality is far above other vehicles as this car is now 15 years old and still looks brand new.  Having other exotic cars including Ferrari, Lamborghini, Porsche, Mercedes etc., can definitely state that the Rolls Royce is more enjoyable to drive and gets more attention than any other car.
Nothing finer on wheels

I've had this car for about 6 months and it is an absolute pleasure to drive. People stop and stare, some take photos as I drive by. Smooth ride, great comfort and acceleration, tremendous sound system, not a bad thing to say about this ride.
What more can I say - this is the ultimate in motoring luxury and comfort.

Most people that have rated this car here have never even sat in a Rolls-Royce. I own a Rolls-Royce. A Rolls-Royce is expensive to purchase and expensive to properly maintain, BUT when the vault-like door shuts after you have settled into your seat you have entered another dimension in motoring - a world apart from all those other folks driving around you. Quiet, soft sounds, a world of everything working correctly. Just shifting into drive is a pleasure as you are merely moving an electric switch while soundlessly a little electric motor actually shifts the gears.
Yup, the Phantom is worth the money if you truly enjoy driving or being driven in true style and absolute comfort
I have a maseratti and a range rover and I do not drive them anymore since buying this amazing piece of luxury machery.

This EV is really impressive.  Our family can sit comfortable in any row, (yes even the 3rd row) on long trips.  I am 5'9" and I sat in the 3rd row for 4 hours with no issues.   The number charging ports, reclining seats, constant software updates, thrill of the drive in sports mode are just some of the reasons this is one of my favorite vehicles of all time.  Is it perfect, not but most vehicles are not.  Any issue we have had Rivian has gone above and beyond to make sure it is corrected.  They even call us after the service to make sure we are happy.   The purchase process was seamless.   Charging at home is super easy.  Charging on the road is easy since it charges really fast.  We have over 7,000 miles and after 5 long road trips, we are still happy. We usually are topped off at 321 miles with our 22" wheels based on conserve mode.  A reason why we chose this over a Tesla Model X is the true range it provides and more space interior for seating and loading the family gear on our trips.  The massive frunk and room in the cargo area above and below (if you opt not to get the spare tire).  For a young company Rivian is just super impressive.  I am speaking from a vantage point of someone who has owned/leased 50+ vehicles if that helps put things in perspective..  I definitely recommend the R1S.

Pre Ordered R1S in Sep 21 and should be receiving it by this Dec.
Test drove it , I can’t  agree  more with the other reviewer wrt pros/cons.
The car looks amazing, way better interior than Model X ( but still doesn’t have the luxury feel of a BMW, Mercedes EVs ), plenty of room, brutal power.
But the poor ride quality, annoying road noise leave a lot to be desired. You feel every bump, pothole  on the road. I asked the dealer guy sitting next to me if I had been driving in the wrong mode and if the mode needs to be changed , he said this is the smoothest mode available. 
I never understood Rivian’s obsession with offroading since the beginning, may be R1T could’ve been designed exclusively to do that. 
R1S could’ve been for daily driving, I need a car to go to work in ATL city conditions. 
70% of drivers would be like me who never really drive in the rocks/sand. 
I had been driving a Model X, test drove BMW  iX , the ride is incredibly smooth in both of them, zero noise, great suspension and ride quality that’d put any gas car to shame .
I’m still excited to get the R1S and hopefully (if any software updates as they say )could fix the bumpy ride, road noise.
If not, will have to sell it .

I ordered my R1S in November 2020 and received it in January 2023. I have been driving it for three weeks and I really do love the vehicle. 

Pros:
- great styling inside and out
- plenty of room for my family of five - it does not feel like an EV
- lots of storage space in the front and back
- surprisingly good electronics for an early edition, homegrown software suite - native Spotify and TuneIn integration and the maps/settings/gear guard are all great
- fantastic sound system
- lots of key types - phone, key card, key fob, wristband

Cons:
- no CarPlay so you can’t see your iMessages on the screen or use your favorite non-Spotify music app easily, like YouTube Music or Amazon Music or Apple Music; maps are also not as good with traffic showing odd backups in places where there are none 
- the ride quality is poor. It feels like an off-road vehicle; you feel every bump in the road and it’s got a surprising amount of road noise. My Volkswagen Atlas that I traded up from had far less noise and a much better ride quality. 
- Driver+ and cruise control feel slightly jerky. I’m assuming that this will be refined in future updates, but they are not smooth now. 

Overall, though, I’m really happy with the vehicle and I’d but it again!

Once you drive one of these, all of your other vehicles will feel outdated

The fact that you can tow anything you want and also go 0-60 in 3 seconds is a combination that is wild. They also send updates about once per month to add features and improvements in the performance. I've owned 3 other EVs and this is the best yet. 

Only annoying item is that the closest service center is 2.5 hours away. Luckily I've only needed to take it there twice, other items that have come up have been handled by a mobile unit. Growing pains of a new company.

Fast, strong, and reliable. enough room for 5 average size people. The mobile service is good. Good on the long trips as well as long as you plan the trip. Remember, when the first gasoline cars just came out, people had to go to a grocery store with a bucket to get gasoline. ...so for those who are still crying about charging networks, don't be a baby and use common sense and your brain. Most of the time you charge it at home, like a cell phone at night. In the morning you got over 300 mile range. At the superchargers, you spend no more than 20-30 min on long trips.
Also, stop complaining that you want to fill up and go. (like you do :) ) Do you need to eat or go to the bathroom? That's enough time to get at least 100 miles of range.
So.. no complaints about this truck. Not to mention, that it is the first vehicle from the brand new company. Tesla is still not anywhere near Rivian on the built quality.

My Rivian R1T was delivered in July 9,2022. 8,300 miles. No problems or mechanical issues besides the paint chip and minor adjustment with the front air suspension uneven when parked which was corrected. Other than that I'm very happy with my R1T.  My R1S is coming soon. I wish I can keep both Rivian's but can't have my 16y/o drive one of them for their 1st car. Awesome Truck.

This is my 5th pickup truck since 1995.  How times have changed.  Great truck from a new company. Faster than almost anything on real roads and better off-road than most other vehicles. Owned for almost 1 year and no complaints except distance to service center if needed. I would definitely buy a Rivian again at this point.

TL:DR It’s an awesome truck if it meets YOUR particular lifestyle needs.

Grew up driving lifted gas and diesel 4x4’s. Became a Toyota family when I met my wife and we owned a 4th gen V8 4Runner and a 3rd gen Tacoma before going electric. Loved them both. We currently have a ‘22 Model Y Performance, ‘11 Sienna and the ‘22 R1T. So based off of my personal vehicle history, the R1T has been my favorite to drive/own. 

It’s an EV so the maintenance really is low compared to a gas/diesel vehicle. I’ve also been very fortunate to have never owned a lemon or a vehicle I couldn’t wait to get rid of. That said, 5 months of R1T ownership is too short to talk about long term reliability by any means.. but so far, so good!

It’s a new product from a new company so there are bound to be issues scattered amongst the tens of thousands of R1s produced. Some have had worse issues than others, but the company does seem to be doing its best to take care of their customers from what I’ve read/heard. We haven’t had any issues with our truck since day one.

Because it’s a newer vehicle employing an abundance of technology, most things get better over time. Over The Air (OTA) updates have already vastly improved the driving experience and ownership with a slight increase in range, more app control, security, comfort, performance, convenience, and safety.

Towing. Yeah, it’s obviously not a 1 ton dually with a reserve fuel tank. It’s a truck that runs on batteries. So don’t expect to tow your toys, boat, or super sweet travel trailer long distances without making way more stops. Will the R1T tow a huge travel trailer across the country? Yes it will! Is it convenient? No it’s not.

The R1T is a great truck for our personal lifestyle and use case. It does everything we ask it to do effortlessly. We still smile pretty much everytime either one of us drives it because it’s just so much fun! We let our neighbor take it for a drive a month ago and he just told me they ordered one last weekend.

I recommend doing your research on the specs and see if it (and EV ownership in general) fits your lifestyle. Our truck has been practically flawless so add that datapoint to your research.

I have owned it for over 4 months, it has been a great vehicle for daily driving and for running errands.  This vehicle exceeded my expectations with its quality build and driving dynamics.  Acceleration is exhilarating, it is very maneuverable, fits in the garage just fine, and hauls most everything I need to.  It has been the perfect vehicle to live with.

I've never driven in a car with such smooth acceleration, be it electric or ICE, sports car or truck. At the same time, it's eerily quiet. I can easily talk on the car's bluetooth system without having to raise my voice and I have had people tell me that they didn't even realize I was driving.
There were some kinks that Rivian needed to work out (the key fob's delayed responsiveness being the most annoying), but it has gotten better with every update. 

For those of you wondering about the range, with the standard 21" tires, if I am driving nonstop (which means no long breaks where the battery has to warm up afterwards), I am seeing a range of about 334 miles in conserve mode and 303 in all-purpose mode. The EPA estimates are quite accurate. The vehicle's real-time range estimates are very accurate too--it seems to take into account your driving history and conditions, whereas Tesla's estimates are always too optimistic and only reflect optimal conditions. 

I've had no mechanical issues, thankfully, and the build quality (delivered in late September) seemed to be excellent without panel gaps or trim issues that perhaps some of the earliest deliveries had. The one time I needed service was when Rivian announced a recall, and they sent out a technician to my home to repair it within days. Amazing! I may never have to take this truck into a shop, at least not for any work that is covered under warranty.

All in all, Rivian has exceeded all my expectations. I am patiently waiting for them to expand their charging network on the east coast, which is far from adequate, but I understand that this can't happen overnight and I am willing to put up with third party charging until then!

Starting with the company.
Their customer service is equivalent to the old LLBean of the auto industry. They are so much better than any dealer as they continue their care for you as a customer long after the sale is made. Their service is unbeatable as they will come right to my home to service the truck unless it needs special attention which requires it to be put on a lift. 
Now the truck itself…
Incredible build quality! Fit and finish, interior finish is exceptional. This truck is POWERFUL with 800+ hp and 900+ foot pounds of torque. The ride experience is varied depending on which mode you select. It can ride like a Corvette giving you a total sports car feel on the road, or like a F-150 which can handle anything I throw at it. Adjustable suspension allows for any situation. 
With the AT 20 wheels, I am getting 300 +/- miles of range with a 100% charge on Ecco mode. 
I now have 15000 mikes on it and the only thing I am not crazy about are the stock tires. They are not wearing well and I will be replacing them after 30,000 mi. 
I

I absolutely love my Bronco Sport. Very comfortable ride and with the lane centering/ adaptive cruise control option, it's incredible on road trips. I've had no problems with the vehicle and constantly get better gas mileage than EPA ratings. Best vehicle I've ever owned.

The best Ford vehicle ever built... in every respect!  Traded in a Wrangler and never looked back.  This thing makes the Jeep look like junk.  They improved and fixed every flaw in the Jeep.  Buy one if you can!!!
Fun to drive, turns heads. Goes almost anywhere a wrangler will go, off road but it’s much more enjoyable to drive on the road than the junky Jeep.

Drives so much better than a jeep Wrangler,  Sorry. I used to rave about Jeeps. Ford has 1 up the norm.
Competition breeds innovative ideas, so,...
Let's see where this goes.. For now driving my Bronco is meditation 🧘‍♂️.

Over all this vehicle exceeded my expectations, it is extremely off road capable and drive smooth on the highway. The technology in the vehicle is very user friendly and the overall experience has been positive for me and my family

Bought a brand new 2022 Bronco roughly two months ago. Love everything about the car except the electronics have not functioned properly since day 1. The problem has been diagnosed by the dealer, but its been 2  months and I still have no idea when parts will be available to fix my new car. This despite new cars arriving at numerous local dealers; fixing mine does not seem like a priority which it absolutely should be.

I reserved when came out ordered the day it was available, waited a long 11 months to get it. changed from hard top to soft in order to receive the first model year. fell in love with everything about it. despite all the negative supposed issues with the engine. 4 months of ownership, come April, I drove it to Anchorage Alaska, (4000 miles). through snow and ice towing a trailer. in the slippery ice and getting wild winds, I put in 4 high on the fly and it was like driving on dry pavement. The ride and the seats were so comfortable, I didn't want to stop driving, was doing 800-1000 miles a day. didn't even notice it. what a trip.
on the way back, in the Middle of BC Canada, I tested out the engine,drive train. I was able to get up to the top governed speed for some time, made it from the top of the BC,Yukon boarder to 150 miles from Kelowna in 11 hours. the rest of the drive, i took my time fully enjoyed the ride.  no issues, no engine issues, no anything issues, the MPG was unbelievable as well.
ONE OF THE FIRST ORDERED 2DR FULL-SIZE BRONCO. DRIVEN SHORT DISTANCE, UNDER 100 MILES AND GARAGED. FEELS LIKE DRIVING BIG FUN TOY!

Not impressed with the way this car handles.  It may look awesome but it does not hold up for a Ford.  Fuel pump went out in this vehicle after 20k miles.  Now the brakes are making a weird noise.   Doesn't get very good gas mileage.  Now the infotainment system is acting up.  Please be aware if you are thinking about getting one of these vehicles.
The only problem that I had was the paint chipping off, and Ford repaired that other than that been great so far

I live in Minnesota and have always had issues with driving in icy conditions. The tires, Continental Pro Contact tx, that came standard on my 2023 Bronco Sport, have been incredible! Not only is the vehicle a dream to drive but the tires make my winter driving stress free and I have less tension after a trip to town. I recommend this little guy to everyone I know, and I've had many strangers ask about gas mileage and performance.

When shopping for a vehicle, I wanted something that would be comfortable and fuel efficient for my 148 mile round trip daily commute. I test drove several vehicles, and landed on the Bronco Sport. The Big Bend has just enough options to make commuting easier. Best of all? I am averaging 33-35mpg on the highway and have seen it as high as 42mpg when cruising at 60mph.

I bought the 2022 FORD Bronco Sport Outer Banks, a bronze colored one, for my wife. It has exceeded my expectations! It is averaging 30.3 mpg. It is adequate in get up and go! It's comfortable, and somewhat sporty, to drive!
I'd recommend buying one! I might fetch a new BADLAND'S version, someday, for myself!
Great car with adequate room for a larger individual. Handles well. Would certainly purchase another.
I have owned this car for 2.5 years and it has been great. Average 47 mpg efficiency. No problems. Now 128400 miles going strong! Fun to drive, looks good, plenty of space and easy to park.
I bought mine used in May and have only nice things to report. Gas mileage averages 40 mpg and does so with comfort and a quality interior. Ford strived for quality with the C-MAX and it shows.

i just bought a c-max ford hybrid electric or gas 2016 I went to go to the store and the engine light came  on i put it in reverse and it was going forward finally i got it so went to the store got  in and it happened again This time the wheel seized finally it got going i was pulling into my parking spot and the line went sideways and scraped the car beside me

Consistently over 41 MPG's, city & highway mixed.  Low maintenance car, super dependable and lots of interior room.  Fold down rear seats, power liftgate is very hand, Sony stereo system with navigation, back up camera, heated seats and easy to drive and see out of.  One of the best cars I've ever owned.  Now I need something bigger, SUV, truck type.  I'm going to miss this car.  Hopefully it finds a happy home.  Has 142K miles, I think it will go many, many more!
I think the Ford C-Max is underrated. I have just recently been getting 48-50mpg. It handles really well, and I thoroughly enjoy it.
This vehicle looks great no dents no scratches ride’s great looks like new it’s a pleasure to drive, average 37 mpg

I LOVE this car! I get approx. 40.5 miles to the gallon.  It rides smooth.  My husband is 6'1" and he fits comfortably.  Its easy to park.  It handles well on the highway.  I am impressed with my Ford vehicle.

I brought a 2020 Ecosport with 93500 miles. The car mostly functions well but engine light occurs after one week. I asked two mechanics they told me they don’t know what one of the error codes is! I was shocked and sold it without hesitate. It doesn’t worth such a price on CARFAX, you have better choice.
I've been to the Ford dealership several times and no one seems to know what's wrong with it.  It tugs and feels like it is constantly shifting.

My 2018 EcoSport only has 42,000 miles on it and is only 3 months out of warranty. Check engine light recently came on and they said the turbo needed changed and would cost $2,500!!! I'm not confident that this is even the problem or will fix it. I keep seeing that Ecosports are having major engine problems right after the warranty expires. Ford needs to have a recall on these vehicles and are doing nothing about it!

I bought my 2019 2.0 AWD Ecosport Titanium 3 years ago and it's been pretty good to me! Zero mechanical issues at all. The AWD rocks, gets me around in the harsh Nebraska winters. The speakers are great, love that it's got a sub. Anyone that gets in my car is always like.. wow this is nice. The leather seats, bigger screen, and black trim in the titanium helps make it feel kinda fancy. The steering is super great in my opinion, not too heavy and very responsive.

Of course there are some cons tho: The spare tire situation sucks. I've had 3 flat tires and each time I have to get the car towed to ford. The acceleration is meh, but that's to be expected of such a little car. The back seat doesn't fit adults comfortably, but again it's basically a hatchback on stilts. 

Overall, I really like the car and will probably drive it till it dies.

Do not buy. Ford knowingly placed and sold self destructing 1.0l engine. Dealer exdented warranty is refusing to replace engine and is changing parts that are only causing failure. Car has been in shop for over a month. The warranty company is continuously having mechanic teardown engine and put back together, even when certified mechanic acknowledges most efficient was to to replace entire engine. These are ticking time bombs. #ecoboom.

PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS CAR, IT'S A LITERAL DEATH TRAP!!

hese cars may look cute and "sporty" but stay far away, even if you think it's a good deal! We bought ours on Halloween of 2022 with 13k miles on it. Now, here we are, less than a year later and the engine fails! Regular maintenance kept. Your wetbelt will disintegrate well before your payments are done being made. Your wetbelt is inside your motor and will give you zero warning before it literally offs itself. After the belt degrades, your gears will grind together, throwing metal shavings throughout your entire engine, completely ruining it. The only warning you get is a "Low Oil Pressure" light almost immediately before your dash starts setting off alarms, your engine begins knocking horribly, and your engine seizes up. Ford is fully aware of this failure and refuse to act on it. They currently have a class action lawsuit against them, filed June of this year. Countless people have sustained injuries because of this catastrophic engine. It has locked up on people going 70 mph on the highway, stiffening up their brakes, making it nearly impossible to stop or control the vehicle. This is not the first time this has happened either. This is a huge news story on BBC right now. If you still don't believe how important this is, take the word of literally thousands of other people. Check out the FB group called Ford EcoBoost Nightmare, read their stories. Please save yourself the heartache, stress, and potential injury/death because Ford continues to send out motors with manufacturer defects. They've had so many lawsuits over this, with several different types of motors. I promise you that cute little car isn't worth it! And Ford is about as helpful as a wetbelt napkin. I grew up in Ford vehicles, so they've always been special to me. But after this? Never again! DO NOT BUY, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!

DO NOT BUY THIS VEHICLE. THERE IS A CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT AGAINST FORD FOR ANY VEHICLE WITH THE 1.0L 3-cylinder engine "eco boost". AT 55k-75K MILES - YOUR OIL PUMP WILL FAIL AND CAUSE CATASTROPHIC DAMAGE TO YOUR ENGINE, REQUIRING A FULL ENGINE REPLACEMENT. DO NOT REPLACE THE ENGINE. CUT YOUR LOSSES AND GET A DIFFERENT VEHICLE, BECAUSE THE SAME ISSUE WILL HAPPEN AGAIN AND AGAIN. THIS CATASTROPHIC ENGINE FAILURE FALLS OUTSIDE OF THE MANUFACTURES WARRANTY. FORD IS AWARE OF THIS ISSUE AND IS STILL SELLING THESE VEHICLES!! STAY AWAY!

Purchased new.  Reviews were terrible - ranked at the bottom of comparable small SUVs.  Why?  #1: no infotainment system  #2: gas mileage  #3: lack of power  #4: "goofy" styling

Results:  #1: I don't need an infotainment system!  It's a local runabout.  #2: In long-term tests, gas mileage is within one or two MPG of it's competitors.  #3:  With 166 horsepower, it has plenty of power.  Merges well at interstate speeds.  #4: Styling form follows function.  I'll admit it is a bit 'goofy'.

The car has been flawless.  With Blizzaks mounted, the 4-wheel drive system (really AWD) works well in snow.  The interior is functional and familiar.  Buttons & knobs are where they are supposed to be (yes, buttons & knobs - no digital displays!).  The gauges have needles!

Yes, made in India; with a US sourced direct-injection 4 cylinder engine.  6-speed transmission is suprisingly good.  In sport mode, shift points are spot-on driving up the Rockies.  Manumatic shifting works best coming down.

The back seat is best for kids & dogs.  For me, it folds down to provide lots of cargo space.  My wife loves it.  Easy to drive, easy to park.  Four thumbs up!

It’s “okay” as in it drives and has fancy features but driving in it for less than a week I hate it and find it difficult to do anything simple like PRND, change the climate settings, the windshield controls where the wipers are useless, the windshield is so reflective during the day it’s hard to see out of, I could see someone EASILY getting into an accident because of this cars features it’s too much distraction from driving
Traded it in after Christmas in 2023 have to write so many characters for this part so disregard the last sentence
Easy on the REGULAR gas.  Auto rain blades. cruise controls and headlights make it easy.  camera is great.

I bought a 2016 Edge SEL with the 3.5 6cyl and AWD. The mileage was 120,000- higher than what I was looking for but it had all of the options I was looking for, no accidents and was bought and maintained at the same dealer I purchased from. So far so good. Very nice ride- still looks and drives like a new car. I can’t say there is anything I dislike about it. I purposely looked for one with the 3.5 as I had heard negative things about the reliability of the EcoBoost 4. My previous 2 Fords both had the 3.5 and were extremely reliable. The gas mileage could be better but it is winter and I have been using the remote start which I realize wastes gas. I currently have a loaner ‘24 Edge (when I purchased mine it needed a part replaced on the AWD system and the part just came in) and I have to say I like my older Edge a lot more. I dislike the larger touchscreen of the new one and I really don’t like the rotary dial for the gear selection. The one I have is an SEL also and it just seems cheaper (no metal trim around the instrument cluster, the seats look live vinyl, no door over the charging compartment on the console). It has the 4cyl which does have good acceleration though. 
Hope my 2016 is as reliable as my previous 4 Fords.

BUYER BEWARE! Coolant will leak into your engine. FORD will not pay to help you. The cost to repair? A NEW ENGINE. Ranging from $7500-10,000 dollars. Happened to our Edge at only 70K miles. Happened to Mother-In-laws edge at only 40K miles. FORD KNOWS ABOUT THIS ISSUE AND IS UNDER LITIGATION, BUT STILL WON'T RECALL OR HELP CUSTOMERS. DO NOT BUY AN EDGE OR A FORD!!!!!

Buyer beware of the Eco boost engine, at 32k miles had a check engine light. Ford dealer said engine coolent leaked into cylinder. Had engine replaced no charge because of under original factory warranty. Dealer also had to work on replacing rear brakes. Dealer misplaced my extended warranty purchased when car was new. Dealer found my purchased extended warranty  after 3 years!. After all of the work done to my 2018  Ford Edge by my Ford Dealer in my zip code 02360, I have a new car now ( it really is my rebuilt 2018 Ford Edge SE with 50k miles ). Hope the Edge will last for another 50k miles without any more car problems. If I had high mileage on my 2018 Ford Edge, the engine replacement would be $7k to $10k. Good luck with a 2018 Ford Edge. Make sure you keep a copy of any additional warranty purchased, it may save you money on any future repairs on my 2018 Ford Edge.
This is one of the most comfortable riding vehicles that I’ve driven in 35+years.  It handles like a dream and has plenty of interior room for 5 full size adults

Terrible experience, terrible gas mileage. Transmission is trash, and so is this v-6. This thing has way to many negatives about them. It would of been better just to get the ford escape vs this big old thing.
As a company car this car has proven to have some issues! HOWEVER I have also had the opportunity to ride as a passenger all day!!! Peeeerrrffeeeccttttt for the passenger princess of your life!!!!
Better power than expected.  I would recommend a quality tire for ride comfort and handling.  Plenty of leg room for bigger sized drivers. I would own another when the time comes.

I purchased a 2024 Ford Escape Plug In Hybrid recently and can’t say enough good things about it.  First, the ride is very comfortable.  I have owned many Fords over the years including two previous early versions of the Escape including the 2008 and 2016 versions along with several of their mini vans, HD Trucks, F150’s and the Explorer of which I still have a 2020 Explorer.  The new 2024 Ford Escape Plug In version gets the best mileage of any vehicle I have owned averaging so far around 42 MPG.  I do use the electric often without the engine at all to run around town.  The seats are more comfortable than any previous Escape I have owned and the ride by far is much superior.  Probably because of the weight of the battery and electric motors.  I have no issues with handling, the brakes feel very good and the interior is roomy for a small SUV.  The infotainment screen is very large and responsive.  Looks of the Ford Escape are very nice.

Have 2021 Ford Escape with 50K milage (purchased new).  Maintained this vehicle to perfection as I use it for work. 8 months ago the rear driver window just dropped, cost to repair was $450…now 2/15/2024 (6 month later) the rear passenger window has now dropped…
Somewhat baffled, never use the rear doors or windows….
Had to go to a repair shop for after market part….the dealership wanted to replace the whole insides at $1300….the kicker was, they couldn’t guarantee when and if they could get the parts….
This is our first and last Ford for the family….

I bought a 2020 brand new Ford escape...the last car I'd ever buy (I'm  70 years old).
Much to my surprise/shock,
Just before the warranty ran out, the car started  having a number of problems. ( dash lights, notifications  etc.)  Everything  fortunately was covered by the warranty.
After 9 weeks I finally have the car back!. 
I now have NO trust or faith in ANYTHING  FORD produces!

En 2021 adquirí el escape hibrida 2020 awd titanium, el mpg excelente, comidas razonable, pero con 20.000 millas ya le reemplazaron la tracción trasera porque falló, las platinas exteriores se despegaron, el sub woffer lo tuve que reparar personalmente porque en los Dealer nunca lo pudieron solucionar un ruido insoportable y por último ahora 23000 millas tiene un ruido en la parte trasera al girar a baja velocidad. 

Me decepcione y lo voy a cambiar.

This is the third escape we’ve purchased. Previous 2 were great (each had 100k miles when traded in) this one had to have driver door replaced (warranty) for window motor and hinge failure. Active grill shutter failed at 60,000 along with several other issues. Total out of pocket repairs was over $4,000 before 70,000 miles and now the transmission is surging at 71,000. All p.m. service done as expected. Will not be purchasing another

My family decided to support American manufacturing and ordered two 2022 Ford Escape Plug-in Hybrid in March 2022. One was picked up in August 2022. But it took 17 months for another one to arrive at the local dealer, however, it cannot be picked up because the hybrid battery does not charge (can you believe it?). The first one had trouble only two weeks after the purchase. The engine alarm popped up when I was driving. It was towed to the dealer. It became drivable again after service, but the dealer did not know why the engine fault occurred. It makes me nervous when driving it after this event. Now, this vehicle has been in the dealer's service department for 65 days for a collision bodywork. The body was fixed, but the technician could not figure out the mechanic's problem; the vehicle could not pass the inspection. The design of the vehicle seems immature which cause headaches for customers and technicians.

Happy owner myself, very good vehicle's. Fuel mileage is efficient and it's reliable. Holds up on there value reputation. Comfortable seats, heated. Cargo area is spacious, including the roof rack. Styling exterior design, and quality interior. Very nice and comfy vehicle to own.

This is fun having a small suv to take off-road, go camping and plenty of space for my items. Pretty cool ride these are, and having good gas mileage. What a terrific vehicle, and low cost maintenance. Styling looks, sharp interior design. Comfy seats, heated and a nice sounding stereo system.

Good vehicle's that are 4wd intelligent suspension. Fuel mileage is efficient, and so is the maintenance up keep. Fun to drive around in this suv. Styling exterior design, comfortable seats both heated. Cargo are has plenty of room. Luggage carrier on top. Tow package hitch. Stereo is really good, plus it has a cd player. Reliable, performance turbo engine. This vehicle holds up on there value reputation really well.

This is a good vehicle to own. Off-road trails , good for camping. Lot's of cargo area room.. Luggage rack, holds some items to. Performance turbo engine, comfortable seats heated. Stereo system is really good. Cd player, navigation plus other things. Fantastic vehicle's, it's affordable and it's reliable.

It's a cool ride, also being 4wd suspension. Fuel mileage is economy friendly. Styling looks, interior design has lot's of quality. Comfy seats, mine are heated. Cargo area is very spacious. Reliable vehicle, holds a good book value.

Dependability is strong. It's getting me around with no problems. Fun to drive, low cost up keep maintenance. Styling compact size suv. Comfortable seats, heated. Rear seating has a recliner position for passengers. Cargo area is spacious. Very nice sounding stereo speakers. Towing capacity is actually good.

Yuppers!! Reliability, quality looks. Fuel mileage is economy friendly. Holds a good value reputation. Comfortable seats, plus rear seats fold down for extra storage space. Stereo system touch screen. Cd player, navigation plus other apps. Really smooth handling ride. "Compact Suv"

Reliable, it's sharp looking design has a sporty character about them. Having 4wd intelligent suspension in the winter season is good. Gas mileage is efficient, and low cost maintenance. Quality interior, comfortable seats heated. Cargo area is spacious, and there's a luggage rack for extra storage.

Overall it's a very nice vehicle with many features I was looking for. It's huge and horribly inefficient, but it hauls my whole family and a giant trailer. Pretty much the only thing out there that can do that. 

I can't say the value is there to begin with, and its depreciation is pretty drastic, but again, I knew what I was getting into.

Nice looking interior and exterior can be deceiving. Interior quality of workmanship and materials is below average. There was 1 interior rattle when new and at 28,000 miles there are at least 3 major rattles that the dealership said they can’t or wouldn’t repair. Mechanically sound vehicle with very poor interior construction.

We bought this used from a ford dealership. It was said to have been blue certified. Within a few days we relished the air didn’t work. We brought it back and fixed the broken line. A few weeks later, two lights came on. It stayed in the shop for three weeks getting transmission and engine repaired. They said they also fixed a wire under the seatbelt. The next week, the navigation system stopped working and wouldn’t charge our phones. Then the button for the window shattered. About a month later another light came on and the seatbelt had to be replaced. Now the power train light came on. It’s been four months with all of these issues. We are trading in and staying away from fords.

Purchased 2019 Expedition new from dealership. Under 20k miles all the shocks were replaced twice because of leaking. At 25k miles the first set of Cam Phasers had to be replaced. Around 36k miles the navigation system had to be replaced (not covered under warranty). At 54k miles the 2nd set of Cam Phasers had to be replaced. Then on the way home from the dealership the oil pump went out. This is by far the WORST vehicle we have ever owned. We would NEVER buy or recommend a Ford product again. Ford is NOT what their slogans state: Built Ford Tough or Built To Last. If you want reliability for your family large SUV, go buy a Toyota Sequoia.

It took approximately 2.3 years, but the central computer is out. The side boards do not communicate consistently with the car and either stay down or up when the opposite is wanted. The car lurches consistently when traveling up hill. Shocks were replaced at 30k miles. This car costs over 70k. I had read very positive reviews and bought this car. I do not think it has lived up to expectations in the least. Is this vehicle reliable? Not in my experience. I thought Ford was better than this. I will have to be very careful when choosing in the future.

Pros: Lots of seating space, great storage, great visibility with few blind spots
PERSONAL INFORMATION OF WHAT THE CAR SELLS FOR AND VALUE OF TRADE.  NEED PICKUP WITH 4 WHEEL DRIVE AND RED COLOR
Good combination of ruggedness and technology or similar feel to the raptor, but in an SUV just wish it had a bigger fuel tank.

We ordered this 2018 Platinum Max 2 wheel drive in the summer of 2018, and was one of the last ones built.  We have been so happy with it.  About 60% of the mileage is towing our 7,000 pound trailer.  Except for the gas mileage, you almost don't notice it is back there.  Gas mileage is OK.  On extended trips, California to Maine and back, driving at 75, mileage was in the range of 21-22.  Towing at 60 the mileage is 8.5 to 9.0.  Around town, depending on percent of freeway driving, it is anywhere from 15-17.  It is very comfortable and quiet.  Gauges are complete, GPS is very solid and clearer than many cars.  Reliability has been outstanding.  Only failure has been the battery at 4 years.  Tires are still original, but replacing before trailering to Canada next year.

Overall it's a very nice vehicle with many features I was looking for. It's huge and horribly inefficient, but it hauls my whole family and a giant trailer. Pretty much the only thing out there that can do that. 

I can't say the value is there to begin with, and its depreciation is pretty drastic, but again, I knew what I was getting into.

Junk suv dont buy. Been to the shop going on 10 times now. The suv has left my wife stranded on the interstate. Its so unreliable that im worried taking my kids anywhere with it. Its our only vehicle that will ruin us financially when the factory warranty runs out. I asked ford to replace it because of all the problems and they told me they wont do anything about it.

Worst car I ever owned. It had nothing but problems. Electrical system failed multiple times, water leaks caused system to short out, heater failed, GPS and audio quit working. It was in the shop about every 3 months. Got rid of it as soon as possible.
Transmission went out at 38k now they are trying not to pay for it DONT BUY they are there best not to pay for it

I was very disappointed with the interior. The front side seats, both passenger and driver got loose where the seat control is at. Very reliable and comfy to ride in.   Only negative in my mind, is the third row is quite small when up. I keep mine down 99% of the time though, to get full use of the extra large trunk space. I had bought a new, when purchased, 2021 Ford F-150 Supercab. It is the STX variety. It has the FX4 addition. It has the 20" tires. It's the 10 speed auto. It's equipped with the trailer towing packages. It is decked out to the XLT level. I am averaging 22.4 mpg.! It has really decent get up and go!!! I have never had a full-sized pickup, until now! I recommend it!

Ford - Always getting better, Always hitting it iut of the ball park.

Super cab gives extended space while having a bed over 6 feet, with power and stability to tow our Horses around safely.
The app allows notifications and starting the truck on those cold an hot days.
Pros - power, great fuel mileage, comfort and the software that will control the truck when I need a little assist has mad me look good at least twice. The tow package, cameras and the truck shutting down engine to save fuel at stops are things Ive come to appreciate. 
Double glove box for more storage. Plenty of cup holders, 
External lights all around the truck, 
Cons - only one eye glass holder, rear doors (super crew) dont open without front doors opening first, the front seat belts are connected to the back mini doors, cause issue each time someone needs out or in after driver is in position.

Price,

Coming from a Tacoma this truck hasn’t disappointed at all. Test drove all similar models and continued coming back to Ford. So far no regrets and absolutely love the MPG, payload, 3.5EB power, and interior. Ford remains #1 for a reason.

So comfortable to drive, great fuel mileage, fun to drive, definitely has some get up and go when needed. At 5'3" and 63 years of age I change the oil myself, it's super easy. Love the red exterior and black interior.
It isn’t perfect, but smooth ride, comfortable, great range.  A solid truck with  minimal payments for maintenance and no gas.

I bought a standard range Lariat F150 lighting one year ago and this has been the best vehicle I’ve ever driven.  It’s fun to drive and costs almost nothing to operate.  It has everything you’d expect from an electric vehicle such as snappy, quiet and very smooth acceleration.  What I like most is the size.  It’s extremely comfortable for all 5 passengers with tons of leg and headroom as you’d expect in a truck.  It has all the features of an ICE F150 plus the huge front trunk.  All other electric vehicles are tiny by comparison.  

I charge at home and mostly use it for short trips around town so the standard range is all I need.  I really would not recommend buying the extended range if you are price conscious.  95% of your use will be short trips around town where it’s very efficient.  I only need to charge 2 or 3 times a week and it’s always at night during low cost off peak electricity rates.  For the few longer road trips I’ve taken, it just requires a bit more time to stop and charge.  This is sometimes inconvenient due to poor infrastructure but has never been a big problem.   I’m looking forward to using Tesla chargers starting next spring as that will eliminate the infrastructure concern when travelling.  I keep reminding myself of the money I’m saving in gas for the extra time it takes to charge on these longer trips.  It’s well worth the trade off.  
The quality of this vehicle has been outstanding.  As a first model year of a new technology I was expecting some recalls and repairs.  I’ve not had a single issue with anything after 14,000 miles and 1 year.  Only rotated tires and added washer fluid for maintenance so far!

This vehicle has been better than I expected.

Pros:  size, performance, quality 
Cons: road trip charging infrastructure availability- (to be fixed in May 2024 thanks Tesla!)

9 months in with 10k miles… super smooth ride, amazing acceleration, awesome in the snow, love cheap charging at home vs lines at gas stations, front trunk is used all the time, so big and convenient!
Had glitched a few times to be expected with so much technology…always fixed itself. Range is a bummer for long rides but I knew that getting in. Don’t do enough road tripping to care about.

Race Red, excellent condition. owned by myself at 66 years old. garaged, serviced,  F150 FX4   5.0 v8 engine,10 speed automatic 3:73 electronic locking diff. Bridgestone Dualer a/t rwl tires. led bed lighting. spot /puddle lights on mirrors. NOT 1 dent or ding

Gas took a hit, 8mpg, normally 14mpg Highway. Super Comfortable and Drives like a dream, an elevated Cadillac Ride as a Tremor, NO issues. This truck is easily worth $65,000. as it sits, all 4 of us in this truck are all over 6'4" and not a problem with room in the back seat with the front seats all the way back. Great rig, though the interior needs some updating. Transmission is good though slips from time to time.

Drives good pulls great. Looks good. new trucks are cool. Tremor package works good off road.

Have always like Ford trucks, and ordered this 10/21 and received 7/22.  Dealer asked if I would cancel the bedliner and 5th wheel prep package to speed up assembly.  I agreed, only to find out I still had to pay for those uninstalled options at time of purchase.  $1100 lost. The antimatter blue color didn't match the online picture, but still looks nice anyways.  After driving for a while I noticed was all of the front bumper bolts were loose.  Had to call dealership to get torque spec to get them right.  Found out navigation is only temporary.  First new car I've ever bought that the manufacture holds a certain feature hostage unless you pay them a fee.  Guess I will be using my phone for nav.  This will probably be my last new Ford truck.

Interior quality of the limited is outstanding. Ride is great for a 450. Pulls my 45’ fifth wheel like a dream and with comfort.

I love my little Ford Fiesta. Leather seats. Good styling and sound. Neon lighting. Most important to me is dependability, and the Fiesta provides that. Excellent gas mileage.  Brand new tires. Brand new original stereo. Clean, rubber floor mats. 99k miles

I drove a used 2013 Ford Fiesta for about five years. The car was great mechanically and got awesome gas mileage. The one problem was the transmission which is well known and the car would often "shudder" while shifting. I got used to it but sometimes my passengers would comment on it as it definitely did not sound or feel good. Eventually I got a feel for when it would do it and I was able to accelerate or decelerate to avoid it. 

So if you want a cheap reliable car and don't mind the jerky transmission then this is a good buy.

Great car have one year now no problem at all Great handling 37 to a gallon fantastic handling plenty of room up front very comfortable seats the se has nice options inside looks great inside it is a great looking car best in its  class my 2014se has 10200 miles and still runs like new the back seat is a bit tight though plenty of trunk space  love my green phantom

Excellent driving little car, extremely fun, great handling, great shifting transmission, comfortable driver's seat.  I averaged 28.3 miles per gallon and everyday driving, which does not include much highway driving.  On the highway I've gotten anywhere from 32 to 36 miles per gallon.
Love my little green machine. My little green feista is at 173,000 and still gets 33mpg. I love everything about my car except the transmission. It shudders when you take off.

Bets vehicle I’ve owned. Great for families, and much more affordable than most SUV’s. Highly recommend!
This car is a pleasure to own and drive.5 years now snd no problems except maintenance. Tires brakes ect.

If you haven't driven a Ford Flex ever, you owe it to yourself to try it. I've had probably a dozen cars over the years, ranging from a Triumph TR7 and Toyota Supra, to Acura Integra before getting married and moving into more family-type vehicles. After a Jeep Grand Cherokee, a Ford Explorer (my fave until now), and a couple minivans, this Flex has been the clear winner. So much so that I just bought another newer one. It rides like an '85 Caddy I used to have, but feels much sportier, completely belying its 2.5 ton weight. Even steering is impressive; you can flip a u-turn almost anywhere without having to back up in the middle of it. Fit and finish really impressive, an amazing Sony 12-speaker sound system, bluetooth, navigation and I even have a fridge as the 2nd row console. Amazing car. Get one if you can!
Of the dozens of vehicles I have owned in 40+ years, this one is the Best!  I would not trade it, even though it is apparently worth more than I owe.

love the ride, the beach wagon look, the pick up, the roominess,  the third seat, all the extras, sun roof, view roofs, comfortable seats ...it's all good. also owned a 2012 Flex which i loved as well. so sad it was discontinued after 2019.

AWD  300 hp , tow capacity of 5000, seats seven comfortably, handles curves of mountain roads beautifully....GREAT BRAKES.   This car hauls  big loads, like a truck, but you feel like you are driving a nimble Volvo...not an SUV.    very dependable, no problems good visability/comfort.  about19 mpg doing 80mph on interstate

This is the first vehicle that I love as much today as the day I bought it. It is SO comfortable to drive; especially long distances. Plenty of room for the whole family and to buy groceries. Good gas mileage. Extremely safe and reliable. Can't say enough good things about this vehicle.

73k miles, transmission (or "clutch" to be more accurate) dies. $188 diagnostic fee later told it would cost almost $5000 to fix.  So believe all these other reviews saying the same thing.  We ended up selling ours for scrap because I wasn't about to pour $5k into it.  Oh, and it was also the most uncomfortable car I've ever owned and the controlled center panel for music and other functions was absolutely the worst.  A nightmare.  Ford may make other vehicles that are good but I'm totally soured on them.
I've owned this car now for nine years and it has been a hoot.  It still drives like a new car and with manuals dissapearing, I'm going to try and keep it as long as I can.

when my focus hit about 80,000 miles the transmission failed. and when i took it in the man at the dealership basically told me that he was surprised i didnt need a transmission sooner because of the car i had. Love my Focus got it a couple years ago at 60k miles, fun to drive, good mileage, everything was fine till couple months ago, transmission went out at 88k miles, now replaced, radiator went out, took a while to find due to it being a 3 cylinder engine, replaced, everything seemed fine. Now at 3 weeks later was at a red light and it would barely accelerate, Oil pressure light & low battery came on, but there was oil and battery was fine. Had it towed, we were thinking maybe the fuel pump, nope, transmission, nope, engine, nope, shop doesn't know what the issue is, could be electrical, don't know yet, Ford will have to take a look at it, now without a car again. If you want to get a Focus or any Ford just get a Toyota or Honda, and if you do make sure you know about cars.

I bought a 2015 in 2018 and I’ve had essentially no major problems with it. I bought it with 36k miles and today it has 126k. It needs some shocks and probably a whole suspension replacement but that is wear and tear for a car with this many miles on it. I live in Colorado and I have taken this thing everywhere. Throw some snow tries on it and it will go pretty much anywhere.

DO NOT and I mean absolutely DO NOT purchase this car. Purchased a 2018 with 61K miles and 3 months later I had MAJOR mechanical issues! NOT worth the stress, mental break down, being upset, money, or TIME on this car! SHAME ON YOU FORD!

MPG is OK, not amazing for a sedan, but I'm driving all on the highway, so I'm averaging around 31-33 MPG. I was very nervous about getting a Ford, but this car has surpassed my expectations by far. Highly recommend. I'll be sad when this car dies. Why Ford discontinued this car is beyond me, even though the demand for it is high.

Excellent condition. serviced often. garaged. It has all the modern electronics. clean.
