I love my Chrysler 300. Smooth ride, sporty, fun to drive, and feisty!!! When you hit the gas, it goes. Bonus sport mode adds to the fun. I am completely bummed that Chrysler has discontinued this model.

If you find a 300 with a hemi buy it.  The 300s will perform and handle with any vehicle out there.  The audio is harmon kardon with the beats speakers.  I have had newer Camaros and vettes. The 300 will not only stay with them but will deliver 24 to 27 mpg religiously. 363hp at roughly 1600 rpms.  Will embarrass it's brother the charger and challenger r/t's.  Most of all the best/advanced traction control systems on the market still today.  The v6 is strong, but the hemi will dance.

Without a doubt this Chrysler300 v6 engine is the best looking, the best driving, the most comfortable and with over 30mpg on the highway it's the most fuel efficient car I've ever owned in my 50+ years of driving. Jerry Bisson

No complaints here, only a grin from ear to ear. With the 5.7 litter and rear wheel drive, I get where I  want to go quickly. I get lots of compliments on the body style and the cabin space. The only thing I'd like different is to remove the traction control completely.

I have 3 children.......I also do multiple home projects and help friends move.... this van is amazing...it's beautiful inside and out, and when I need to work, this van turns into a full cargo van.... and it doesn't disappoint....I've always been a Ford girl..... absolutely didn't want a minivan... but this was the best choice I've ever made. You can flip down the back row and still sit 4 people...or half the back row...and sit 5 or even 6 because the back has a small side and a wide side that both flip down... the two seats in the middle fully go down into the vehicle when in cargo mode.... the van drives so smoothly.... it has sensors.... you can also turn off the door access in the back so children don't try to push buttons and open doors... I have weather tech custom mats which I suggest to anyone for this vehicle... they are tough, easy to clean and keep the van tidy... so if you have a ton of children to haul or a ton of landscaping rocks, (I've done both) this is the best vehicle for you...toss on some aftermarket rims and you will be even happier.... I'd love to try a newer model but right now my 2018 only has 35000 miles on it and I plan to keep it forever.
We purchased a 2020 Chrysler Voyager (used) and so far are very happy with our Family vehicle. This van has enough room plus lots of luggage room for road trips.

2020 S package pretty good looking.

Some issues already but covered under warranty.  Bought used 29k miles.  Batteries were dead.  Now brake making noise.  

Awesome travel van for wife, kid and dog super easy.

A great van mini or not. I've been a professional driver most of my working life. As such vans have had a significant amount of time in my experience. Driving Handicapped Accessible vans and busses have also been used. I drove the Pacifica in 2005 (was slated as an SUV but built like a station wagon) The Toyota Sienna too as well as the Dodge Magnum,caravan and Chrysler T&C.
All and all a lot of taxi work since 05 and in that time I drove mostly Dodges with bit of Toyota vans and I also have an 05 Odyssey.  So I think I am a qualified reviewer. The 2017 is in my opinion the best minivan I have Ever driven.  It's comfortable,  fast, ergonomic, handles like it's on rails and did I mention that it is Fast. Simply said it's the best I've ever driven up to this point in my life. I recommend the Pacifica to everyone that I know and some that I just overheard they're looking. Last and not the least is looks. The aerodynamics are beautifully seen in the ascetic of the van. It's beautiful and turns heads.
You won't be disappointed . Period...

This is a beautiful van inside and out.  It is quiet, rides smoothly and handles surprisingly well.  The caramel colored seats are heated and cooled.  Option package on the Pinnacle level includes everything.  Great car.
The ride is very comfortable and quiet. Many high end options that I wanted. Seat memory. Garage door opener. Heating steering g and seats. The stow and go is great for versatility.  Gear. Pets. Etc.

So, I bought this because I have solar panels that generate more electricity than my house consumes, wanted to dip my toes in the waters of electric vehicles and had employment contract and tax considerations that made this a surprisingly inexpensive choice for me. I have two big dogs that wouldn't fit into a Tesla. If you are interested in an upper end minivan, I think this is a good choice. Pretty much the only option I didn't get was the full length sunroof. The sound system is amazing. The video screens are essential kid distracters, if you haven't given up yet as a parent and just attached them to an ipad or phone. The DVD player is glitchy. 
I usually hate Chrysler products, but this was the only option that checked all the boxes, and in my situation if it sucked bad enough, I would just sell it and move on. 
That said, it hasn't broken down on me. About 70% of my driving is electric. The car uses about 3.5 Mw of electricity/year and gets about 31 mpg when the battery gets to it's minimum. You have no control on whether it will use electricity or gas and the car seamlessly flips back and forth. I installed a car charger in my garage to optimize charging (2 hrs vs 11). Over the five years and 75k miles since purchase the battery capacity has declined about 15%. The batteries are made by LG and mine was checked to confirm it (likely) won't catch on fire.  I bought a JEEP about the same time, and have had more issues with recalls on that than the Pacifica. 
Barring any severe breakdown, I anticipate this will be my daughters first driver in a few years. I was really hoping electric car quality, choices and prices would have improved by now, but will hang in there for a few more years.

Absolutely LOVE/ LOVED this vehicle until the hybrid part went out TWICE.. luckily it was under warranty, ended up trading it in to not deal with the problems or worry about the next “fix”.. but all the features & the ride is amazing for a big family! 

Pros- driving around town only having to get gas once a month or longer.
All the features for the kiddos & parents makes life easy! 

CONS- HYBRID. Loved it until issues started.. once it stated it problems just never stopped. 
& they have to keep it in the shop/ have a special working unit so it took FOREVER for each fix.

My wife and I said "We'd NEVER own a van". But here we are two kids down owning a mini van. I told her if I'm selling my pride to own a van it better be the nicest one around. We looked at the odyssey but being the techy person I am I was drawn to the hybrid system on it. I am pleasantly surprised by the get up and go it has. I like the surround view system.  It rides like your grandma's Cadillac and it's a van that looks half decent.
They refused to give a quote without having the pay off for my trade in they only need this number as mine is pd off to lower the trade value.

We have owned this car for 2 years and it has spent about as much time in the garage or parked as it has on the road.  When it drives, the car is great... when it drives.  We spent months waiting for the electric coolant heater, now we need a new transmission after a month of the car being parked from the crankshaft recall... and note... Chrysler does not offer rentals or loaners.  You're just making payments on a broken undeliverable vehicle.  I will never buy another mopare vehicle.

I watched this car for a few years before finally deciding to buy it. After one year went by, the check engine light went on. I took it into the dealer since it was under warranty and the electric coolant heater needed to be replaced. I waited 4 months for the part to arrive. I had to call at least a dozen times and even dealt with Chrysler headquarters for 1.5 months. I was so disappointed in the car. During those 4 months, the range plummeted. Before the check engine light went on, the estimated mileage was 510 to the tank. After the light went on, it registered at 410 per tank. The car would often kick over to the gas side even when the battery was fully charged. I miss my Honda Odyssey, which was good to me for 10 years. I gave this car a try, but once it's fixed, I'm trading it in.

Most days I don’t even use gas, but I love having a powerful V6 ready to go when needed.  It’s quick, quiet, smooth and so luxurious inside.  Most people are absolutely stunned when they get ride in my van by how nice it is, and how quiet. 

The tech features are amazing, and I always feel safe with my family.

Very quiet cabin with the noise-cancelling.
Never a smell in the car with the N99 cabin filter.
Super cheap to own with the electric range.

Excellent  vehicle 
We’ll maintained
Extended warranty. 
All scheduled maintenance done on a regular basis
Love this van. Handles great in city and on long road trips across country love it and would by another

I have 3 children.......I also do multiple home projects and help friends move.... this van is amazing...it's beautiful inside and out, and when I need to work, this van turns into a full cargo van.... and it doesn't disappoint....I've always been a Ford girl..... absolutely didn't want a minivan... but this was the best choice I've ever made. You can flip down the back row and still sit 4 people...or half the back row...and sit 5 or even 6 because the back has a small side and a wide side that both flip down... the two seats in the middle fully go down into the vehicle when in cargo mode.... the van drives so smoothly.... it has sensors.... you can also turn off the door access in the back so children don't try to push buttons and open doors... I have weather tech custom mats which I suggest to anyone for this vehicle... they are tough, easy to clean and keep the van tidy... so if you have a ton of children to haul or a ton of landscaping rocks, (I've done both) this is the best vehicle for you...toss on some aftermarket rims and you will be even happier.... I'd love to try a newer model but right now my 2018 only has 35000 miles on it and I plan to keep it forever.
We purchased a 2020 Chrysler Voyager (used) and so far are very happy with our Family vehicle. This van has enough room plus lots of luggage room for road trips.

2020 S package pretty good looking.

Some issues already but covered under warranty.  Bought used 29k miles.  Batteries were dead.  Now brake making noise.  

Awesome travel van for wife, kid and dog super easy.

A great van mini or not. I've been a professional driver most of my working life. As such vans have had a significant amount of time in my experience. Driving Handicapped Accessible vans and busses have also been used. I drove the Pacifica in 2005 (was slated as an SUV but built like a station wagon) The Toyota Sienna too as well as the Dodge Magnum,caravan and Chrysler T&C.
All and all a lot of taxi work since 05 and in that time I drove mostly Dodges with bit of Toyota vans and I also have an 05 Odyssey.  So I think I am a qualified reviewer. The 2017 is in my opinion the best minivan I have Ever driven.  It's comfortable,  fast, ergonomic, handles like it's on rails and did I mention that it is Fast. Simply said it's the best I've ever driven up to this point in my life. I recommend the Pacifica to everyone that I know and some that I just overheard they're looking. Last and not the least is looks. The aerodynamics are beautifully seen in the ascetic of the van. It's beautiful and turns heads.
You won't be disappointed . Period...

This is a beautiful van inside and out.  It is quiet, rides smoothly and handles surprisingly well.  The caramel colored seats are heated and cooled.  Option package on the Pinnacle level includes everything.  Great car.
The ride is very comfortable and quiet. Many high end options that I wanted. Seat memory. Garage door opener. Heating steering g and seats. The stow and go is great for versatility.  Gear. Pets. Etc.
I like it I love it. Pretty high mileage when I bought it, but I like it. Performance is good, as well as the quality of the interior.

I’m at about 200,000 miles now and still runs smooth and no issues aside having to fix an AC issue.  This is my 5th Acura and I’m keeping this one for as long as she runs which I hope is another 200,000 miles.
Had this car for a year now and love it! Handles perfectly on sharp corners and twists. Slow but fun.
Great car and fun to drive, especially with the Premium/A Spec packages and rare red leather/black suede “NSX” seats
Great Car!!  Drives real smooth.  Good Gas Mileage.  Dual Clutch is Great.  Would Recommend to anyone.

The ILX was rated as the most affordable luxury car. It's a slightly better Honda Civic. The brakes have a horrible screeching sound. Perhaps because the dealer did not put Acura brake pads on the car when I asked to have them replaced. The only mechanical issue I've had is a battery that died. This car is stylish and sleek but lack modern features ie blind spot sensing. The blue tooth is extremely difficult to connect. It was impossible for passengers to do so. It has decent power for a 4 cylinder. I got a lot of compliments on how good the car looks. However, in 2022 the technology inside the car does not match the appearance. The trunk is small. If the opening to the backseat area was larger that would make up for the lack of space. I upgraded to a 2018 TLX and that has everything the 2015 ILX is missing and more.
It is really clean and suitable for families. when i stepped in it seemed very comfortable and very calm sounding.

I bought my 2014 Acura ILX in 2016 with 40,000 miles on it.  This car is dependable, affordable, great styling. I've owned many cars new and used but this is a great car.  When I bought it the used car salesman wanted me to purchase a Lexus instead. He said as I was leaving in my new/used Acura "I'll see you in 2 years when you trade this thing in".  Well guess what it's been 6 years now and hands down this is the best car EVER and I won't be trading it in for years still.

Four months into the driving and configuring my wife's new MDX (SH-AWD Advanced)… So far so good!
Excellent finish and interior quality. The car feels solid and is very quiet inside. No rattles, no squeaks, the only abnormal sound I can hear is the jingling of the metal ring on the key fob laying in the door top pocket.
Driving mode is easy to switch using large knob in the center console, no need to stop and drill into the menu options like on new Lexus RX. Sport mode eliminates any feelings of insufficient engine power (at expense of the gas mileage, that's for sure), no jerking transmission then either. With about 4000 miles on it, transmission feels silky smooth.
The sound system is excellent! The infotainment system is fine - no finger smudges on the screen. BTW, the screen panel quality is way better than the one on new Lexus RX. High contrast, deep black, and no way to get sun glare anywhere near. Apple CarPlay, Android Auto – all work like a charm. Default Acura's navigation is actually not that far behind, giving the choice of seamlessly switching between at least 3 navigation systems at any time during the driving (Acura's, Apple/Google Maps, or Waze in my very modest setup).
Engine stop/start is annoying, but there is a way to control it with the brake pedal pressure – light pressure prevents engine from shutting down.
Not sure what those rich folks with $60k+ cars are complaining about gas mileage. It's not a city commuter's car. I'm seeing 27-28 mpg cruising on the highway. It doesn't require premium fuel, that's additional 20% fuel economy for you.
Driver assist features are all good and very usable. I only don't get why would ACC (adaptive cruise control) need to be that sensitive and require periodic "proof of presence", literally makes me shake the steering wheel a bit every several minutes. I hope Acura will relax this "rule" with the future software update, …please.
This is a very good luxury SUV.  We have had no issues with ours at all.  Fun to drive and it gets reasonable mileage.

Pros:
Good handling for a SUV with double wishbone.
Comfortable for long drives.
Generous features in general.

Cons:
One of the worst ever brakes I have ever seen in a vehicle. The brakes are super soft and cushy. It's an awful feel braking this vehicle. Service center dismissed that it's by design and there is nothing to repair.

Worst ever fuel mileage for. Acura has clearly scammed the buyers and it never reaches EPA estimates. On a normal suburb driving in California, the car yields just 12-14 mpg. In freeways, it can go unto 22 mpg. Forget this car as a commute car.

Touch Pad.

Very bad tires. I had to replace tires in 4 months of my vehicle purchase. The Alena tires are very bad.

lane keep assist and auto cruise are not that great. Auto steer will give off moment it sees a curvy road.

No rear AC vents. This was not a surprise given we know when got the vehicle but it's bad design.

Black piano plastics in interior and very uncomfortable seats in general.

Some of the interior geometry doesn't look good and it looks weird once you get used to it.
Car performs extremely well. Handles well in all road conditions. Fuel economy is what is expected for a premium SUV.

The car was rare and difficult to get - but the wait was worth it. All the comfort and tech features work as advertised, the style and the interior 3 rows of seats are great. You will not be disappointed if you can get your hands on one.

I leased a 2015 MDX traded that for a 2017 MDX (new grill) 2020 MDX and just used the "lease value" to get out of my contract 21 months earlier to lease the 2022 MDX.  I used the 'cash value' from Kelly Blue Book $44K dealer bought it out from Acura for $37.5K and sold it in the mid 40's. I got a great lease deal @ $555 month.   I'm happy because the new one is much better then the '20, the transmission had a click in it shfting from the lower gears, that went away eventually, but I didn't trust it.  The 2022 has a great Honda built 10 speed that gets after it and although it's the same sleepy 3.5 engine, it feels quicker.  The 22 is taller, longer, and wider and I noticed it right away.  It's suspension is like a cat, a lot different from the 'trucky- feel' in previous models.  Gas guzzler low 20's at best, that's okay because I use my Audi A8L more, it gets 30mpg on the highway with it's 3.0 335hp, and that is the truth!  I'm not paying 90K for a Q8, the Acura is good enough!

Aspec, SH-AWD: Engine is powerful enough to move the heavy SUV without problem
The transmission is doing well, especially after second gear; No gear changing feeling
Cabin is not on the quite or noisy side. So it is Okay
Interior material  quality is very good and looks decent. 
The gas milage is so so.
The tire grip esp. on snow is very good, and way better than what I expected. 
SH-AWD does its job very well esp. at high speed and curve.

I purchased A-spec package, overall the build quality is top notch... it has enough power to haul family around and no issues on highways.. I am impressed by the autopilot feature .... 

Still getting used to touchpad, I still miss touch screen touch... screen positioning is perfect for drive and there is a reason why acura is trying to perfect the touchpad. 
Alexa , Google, Siri and Acura voice works decently. 
Had issues with Acura link software , but now its works.

Old news SUVs with the V6 engine. Acura don't make these any more. So say good bye to your future resale value. Only an ignorant person would buy this thing right now for a higher price tag in this economy. These vehicles have no purpose. It's mainly for driving it around on pavement. It's not an off-road vehicle. It's just an overall priced junker in today's market. Newest vehicles 2024 are hybrid, to electric or a fuel mileage car. There's no more Acura MDX V6.

Purchased my first Acura, a 2017 MDX with 27K miles on it in the fall of 2020. I was excited to join the Acura family. First two years of ownership were flawless. About 6 weeks ago starting developing transmission issues. Metallic noise and complete loss of power for about 5 secs when passing. Two trips to the dealership and they could not replicate the issue. Finally captured the noise, tach and speedometer on video and sent to service advisor. Scheduled an appointment, but was two weeks out. Two days after scheduling the appointment, while exiting freeway I experienced the same issue only this time never regained power and transmission warning/errors light lit up. Had to be towed to the dealership. Received a call today that the transmission had catastrophic failure and would need to be replaced at 85,000 miles.  Luckily still under warranty. From what I've read this past week, seems like the 2017 MDX transmission has been HORRID. Not what I expected from the brand. Not likely to stay in the Acura family given this experience.

Mint condition runs very wellp no check engine lights runs very well very high maintenance very kept well and mint condition stereo sound now you just got to put something into so if you're it's like if you're selling it to me

The color is white diamond with saddle interior and wood trim. It has good rubber with lots of miles left on them. There are some scratches on the front bumper and fender. Nothing that is not repairable.

This is a very comfortable and versatile car. I love having 3rd-row seating, it is down 90% of the time for more trunk space, but on the special occasion here and there, this has been extremely useful to have. No issues since I have purchased this.
Great car no accidents no body damage always kept in garage. And we have maintenance records since we owned car in 2017

Nice locally owned well taken care of
Lady driven in town only
Nice inside and out
Great features
Leather seats
Looks like new.  Carefully maintained with only 53000 local and highway  miles. Clean and polished yearly

The best bang for your buck super car. Rare enough so you’re not one of the endless thousand corvettes out there. Probably the only super car you’re going to get 250,000 miles out of without major issues. Fast, fast and fast. Handles flawlessly. Great looks and sound.

This is a true supercar with (almost) no faults.  The striking profile tells you it is fast and that is not an illusion.  Handling is telepathic with the AWD making even the average enthusiast feel like Superman.  The car has 4 drive modes from "Sneaking Home" (AKA Quiet) to "Hauling the Mail" (AKA Track).  I have found the best all-around is Sport+.  The interior is quite comfortable for an exotic sports car and is a huge improvement over the older generation NSX.  Acceleration is instantaneous with the 3 electric motors completely hiding any turbo lag.  Visibility is also surprisingly good, making regular driving completely routine.  The only car currently on the market that is close to the bang for the buck of the NSX is the new C8 Corvette, but the NSX does everything better except the infotainment controls.   Combined with a 6-year warranty and traditional Honda reliability, I can't see a more well-rounded and exciting vehicle.  I an to keep mine until one or the other of us dies!

Sold the car due to this economy. This car drops value by age as well. Yes, low mileage should keep this car more valuable. It doesn't help!! Everything in this economy is just going downhill. All auto gasoline vehicles are taking a value drop big time. And as for this car, it was fun for awhile. It's out of date is the problem. The technology is just changing continuously. Like I said, I sold the car and washed my hands from it and moved on.

I love the NSX because of the attention is gets. It's sexy and sleek. Not the fastest supercar but definitely not the slowest! Not to many people have them which makes them rare and unique. It gets the best of both worlds on great gas mileage in EV mode and being able to hit 191 mph in track mode!
The NSX is great. Can't be beat and ultra reliable. Corvette is way too common, and just doesn't cut it. McClaren and Lambo both have too many issues, and too expensive to maintain.

The car is not as fun as I thought. I, traded it in for the new corvette. Definitely faster and more comfortable seats. The Acura was just not cutting it. Also, to many trips to the service department for glitches.
excellent
Man I love this Lil truck and its luxury.. Its sporty fast clean and new technology... And the colors of the interior are fly... Get one..

I drove a number of SUVs before buying the Advance model, including the NX and X3.  The combination of features and the driving experience of the Acura sold me, along with the reliability factor and reasonable cost for any repairs.

I tried to love this vehicle; however, the quality control ruined my experience. Throughout my ownership, the car had numerous annoyances like squeaky brakes, a horribly loud creaking noise when going over any speedbump, and an overall terrible MPG. 
On top of that, I had to reset the infotainment system about once a month due to unresponsiveness. 
The headaches and head scratches outweighed the pros; therefore, I decided to sell the car and purchase a Lexus.

If you plan on not using carplay or android auto, there aren’t any concerns to be made. I have on multiple occasions faced near crash experiences when fumbling with the barely functional touchpad. Come on Acura, touch screens are a bare minimum at this price level. If you care about the safety of yourself or your loved ones, look elsewhere.

I really like the vehicle in most ways with only a few issues -- no car is perfect. I could write a LOT about the many positives of the vehicle, so I'll just focus on my dislikes.

First, the turbo 4, while plenty powerful, drinks gas. This is a case where a larger engine would work less hard and likely deliver equal, if not better mileage. This is a heavy vehicle, and the 4-cyl is in boost most of the time; this kills mileage. I average approx 21mpg in mostly local driving and about 25 highway. There is no benefit to using a 4-cyl engine here. Plus, there is some slight turbo lag.

Speaking of lag, the Honda-built 10-speed is easily caught unprepared to act. When needing immediate downshifts under power, there is often a pronounced delay between a deep press on the pedal and forward movement. It's excessive. It's also noticeably jerky in slow speed downshifts. When cold, reverse usually takes at least several seconds to engage, with an odd delay even when warm. Normal shifts outside of these mentions are smooth.

I was expecting more from a luxury brand such as Acura.   

While the performance is stout and the creature comforts are plenty, some annoying things about my RDX are as follows:  Auto-braking - the absolute most annoying so called safety feature in new cars!   Technology has a LONG WAY to go before I'll be convinced the car can drive better than me...It's stood me on my head a few times and almost caused several rear end crashes when it slams on brakes for little or no reason (I've had it checked, this is a function as designed feature...go figure).   Engine auto-stop - have to disable each time; standard in upper level models...again, Acura, you can do better - Save a few drops of gas at the expense of excessive starter and battery wear...no thanks!  Remote Start without having to subscribe to an app...this may be the future, but it's an Acura fail. 

I love the car, just hate some of the 'luxury' features.

Fun to drive, esp. 25-55 mph.  Very quick and nimble.  MPG is nothing to write home about.  Our '20 mdx gets better mileage.  Comfortable for longer distances.  Infotainment needs plenty of getting used to, especially for less geeky folks.  Some functions can be quite distracting.  Build and quality is very nice and the feature set is totally maxed out with the Advance.  The whole package is much stiffer than previous iterations and if you get the advance package the adaptive dampers really come into their own if you really push the car, especially in cornering.  The sucker really flattens out and keeps all 4 tires well planted.  We'll buy another probably as we really need gas in Montana.  For winter driving I think this car is among the best on the planet, at least in it's price range.  Extremely stable, predictable and provides excellent inputs.

The styling, performance and comfort are key features of this Acura. We love using this car for long drives. The seats are very comfortable and highly adjustable. The advance package gives air conditioned seats which is hard to live without once you have it. Advanced package also has an adjustable suspension which is very noticeable. This car feels 'glued" to the road when driving. I feel very confident driving this car. Every part feels of high quality. Ok, so that's the good part. This is my 3rd Acura and I also worked for Acura for 3 years so I am familiar with Acura cars. The RDX and likely most new Acuras are not really drivers cars anymore. Which is very unfortunate. The RDX also does not have good gas mileage and uses premium fuel. Please don't let ppl convince you it does not.  Every piece of literature from Acura says use premium fuel. This is a high compression engine. Only premium will do. So keep that in mind. Over the RDX is an excellent choice.

I have a 2017 Acura RDX and it has been the best vehicle I have ever owned.  It has a the best vehicle I have ever owned.  Other than routine maintenance, it has been in for repairs one time.  It now has almost 90,000 miles.  When I start shopping for a new vehicle it will be another Acura RDX.

This is an incredible value!  Smooth ride, great acceleration and handling and extraordinarily reliable.  I do not dote on this car but with 110,000 miles on this vehicle it is still like new!  I have done routine maintenance and I have required no repairs outside of that.  Buy, buy, buy!
Great condition one owner low mileage Parked in a garage in a gated community mostly driven locally for small errands

Like other Honda's and Acura's that I've had over decades, this 2017 Acura RDX is supremely reliable. All you have to do is regular maintenance and you have a super reliable vehicle. That's number 1 in my book. Down time with a car is Really Bad and a waste of time and can be worse than that. It handles well, in sport mode it's quite quick, it's stable, good sound system, comfortable, storage is good, etc. The only thing I can say, and I'll take this from my wife, it's not very stylish. It's kind of boring looking compared to some more sporty looking SUV's. So, it depends what you want. If you want a very high quality SUV at a reasonable price, and are not too concerned with a really sporty look, the Acura RDX, is a great choice.

Bought 7/17 as a certified car with 16k miles. This SUV has been trouble free except for a tech bulletin fix for front brake replacement at 23k miles; warranteed. With the acoustic glass and extra insulation of the Advance Package, this SUV is quiet and smooth. My only complaint is with the adaptive cruise control, it seems far too sensitive. (I don't think i would like it on any car.)
Gas mileage has been consistent at 20 in town, high as 29 freeway. I have 2 steep hills to climb from my home and this SUV has been perfect in the snow without chains or snow tires. I replaced original Michelin's with Continental tires and they are much better.
the most reliable car  I have ever purchased, over 4 years and no issues, except a battery, comfort and enjoyability.

This car still has Pre owned certified miles and 14 months left until 1/1 23 and 10,000 Miles  Warrenty 
And power Tran Warrenty after that.

I have been told every time I brought my car in for some service or cleaning that my car is a great car and those cars hold their value.  I know two people who told me if I sold it on my own I would get $4-5k more than the blue book value.  Carfax value is higher than blue book also.

This car rides great! I never had any issues and never been in an accident, just a few minor scratches on exterior.  I've been told my car looks great.  I'll probably look to get another one by the time the year is out or another SUV that holds it's value like the RDX.

Replaced my 10 year old Toyota Avalon (165,000 miles) with this 2016 Acura RLX with Advance Package which included all the bells and whistles Acura made.  Bought new from dealer who priced it very low to sell (as did another dealer) plus doubled their Avalon trade-in offer after seeing it.  Still think highly of this RLX after 7 years of owning it.  Very quiet, roomy, comfortable yet firm ride, large trunk,  310hp has plenty of power/torque for a 4000 lb. car yet still averages 31-34 mpg on highway trips.  Have had no significant mechanical repairs.  Is a step up from the Avalon but maybe not in the Lexus/Mercedes/BMW class its original list price indicated.  Would consider buying a newer updated model but Acura discontinued the RLX in 2020 due to low sales and market shifting to SUVs.  Drawbacks for me are  the two small dashboard touch screens (can barely be seen through polarized sunglasses) and navigation system which was outdated when car was new.  Also the wider, lower profile 'sport' tires get louder as they age but higher profile (softer and quieter) are not made for this vehicle.  Still, very satisfied with it but may have to step up to higher priced makes/models when it's time to replace it.

Driving the 2014 Acura RLX is an invitation to a journey of luxury, comfort, and tranquility. This car stands as a paragon in the automobile industry, encapsulating high-class aesthetics and superior engineering, all while maintaining an ambiance of serene elegance that sets it apart from its contemporaries.
No issues at all. We need to sell to purchase an SUV.  We love this car and have had no issues at all. This is our third Acura RL.

One of best cars I owned.smooth ride when driving regularly.. but pretty fast when driving in sport mode and using the paddle shifters whit dual clutch.. for its size it handles its pretty dam good ..

It's stylish, roomy , comfortable, dependable, great in the snow. Great passing speed,has navation,serious xm radio. And many more bells / wissells, it holds the road, and curves at high speeds. Back seats fold down, to put long objects in the cab.

When I bought it in Sept 2020, I knew the technology was dated compared to other models, and what I traded in for it (2019 RDX Advance), but I have no regrets as far as that goes. The ride is superb. The acoustic glass does the job. The interior is very quiet, even compared to the latest offerings from Acura. Only down side, is when you turn on sport mode, and hoof it down the road, it doesn't sip the gas, it slurps it down quick. But in Sport Mode, when you floor it, it plants you firmly in your seat. Those 377 ponies are running! WOW!
Best bang for the buck at the time. Fuel mileage in hybrid mode is good. Highest I got for highway on a trip I took was 33mpg. It probably could've gone higher, but I was doing 75 the whole way. In city driving, I get around 22-23mpg with the start stop engine feature.
It's very comfortable as well. I really hope Acura comes up with a replacement for it in the near future. I've been comparing it to 2023 models out there, from Acura and others, and from info available here on Kelly, I'm surprised to learn that even after 3 years of being out of production, it still surpasses the newer cars in many ways.
If you're fortunate enough to find a used one that was kept well and with low mileage, get it, you won't be disappointed.
I very much like this car exept for its suspensions which rough for a luxury sedan. The standard equipments cover everything you dearmed of!
Incredibly comfortable, but also plenty of power when you need or want it. Handles way better than the weight would suggest, plus it basically drives itself on the highway. All for under $30k
A dream to drive, tight steering, hugs the hoad, luxurious cabin, great mileage hybrid.

Just park an RLX Hybrid SH next to any competing Lexus  or BMW to make a fair comparison. This vehicle is Accord / Honda's top of the line and surely deserves all accolades. It's a sleeper but beautiful and dependable.

First let me say this is my 5th Acura. I started with the TSX then TL then 3 TLX and I have to say the 2023 TLX A Spec is my worst choice. Exterior this car screams speed and style but interior and powerplant are a HUGE disappointment. My 2020 TLX A Spec had a strong responsive throaty 6 cyl engine. The 2023 has a turbocharged 4cyl! If I had done my research, with this change alone  I would have found a different car. The 4cyl is peppy and responsive but sounds like a whiny 4cyl. Surprisingly it gets terrible gas mileage even when its on economy mode ave 21-22 city and maybe if you're lucky 26-28 hwy! My 2020 got 26-27 city and low 30's hwy not economy mode. The interior where do I start. Wireless charge pad works at best a trickle charge rate and its location is terrible. Apple car play requires your phone to be plugged into a USB to work, no bluetooth connection, a HUGE mistake especially if you're paying 45-50K for the vehicle. The finger pad control is at times non responsive and the material Acura used for the entire dash including the odd "mushroom head" dash above the steering wheel (you just have to see it) smudges and smears dust very easily making it hard to keep clean.
I will say the safety features are amazing. The cabin road noise is much louder than my 2020 TLX.
Overall I am disappointed with the changes Acura made since the 2020, I'm not at all impressed.

This is my 5th Acura, my second tlx!  I traded my 2019 tlx a spec for this 2024 tlx a spec.  Loved my 2019 but this car drives and handles so much better and the power is great! The A spec comes with almost everything you want. The ride is nice ,power is great, and the fuel economy isn’t bad my first 2000 miles avg 26 mpg. A very beautiful luxury & sports looking car. I’ve gotten so many compliments on it already.  No complains at this time!
Dollar for dollar, the best value in a luxury performance sedan.  I would not hesitate to buy another.
I'm a multi purchaser of Acura Honda vehicles and I've never been unsatisfied with any purchase they have awesome reliability great resale value and they suit my needs

Traded our RDX for the A-spec in black. The paint is amazing and really sparkles in the sunlight when it brings out all the different spec colors in the paint. Handles amazing, 85 feels like 40mph and is very comfortable. Seats have great heat in the winter even up the small of your back, the cooled seats in the summer makes the leather so much nicer. The interior lighting looks fantastic and the flat bottom steering wheel is much more comfortable and easy to control. Car has a lot of power and handling is amazing.
I love my TLX,  it’s beautiful inside out, very stylish, comfortable and reliable.  I bought the advance pack and I love the audio system.  Great value overall

I drove the top of line Advance TLX and it was very comfy and comfortable. It had features like heated/ventilated seats, heated steering wheel, Apple CarPlay, BSM and Lane departure warning 

I would recommend this car
I seen almost all the reviews on YouTube some mix feelings and some good reviews this car is too much car for the money

Ordered the car new. Never had any problems with it. Loaded with every feature. Sound system is the best and so quite you hear no road noise at all. The sh-awd grips the corners like a Indy car. The Advance model is the only TLX with fog lights unless you get the A-spec model. I wanted Lunar Silver and they don't make that color in a A-spec. I also have 360 camera and heated steering wheel and seats.
It’s exactly what I expected.  The drives great, handles great and very comfortable.  I’ve had zero mechanical issues.
Very dependable, very good on gas The only grip I have is the front seats are not very comfortable for long rides.

Bought my Acura in 2020 and drove it for 3 years with little to no issues. Took it for an oil change recently and two separate leaks were discovered. Not happy about having to pay over $1500 for this, when my car is really only at 55,000 miles. Was planning on buying an RDX as my next car, but after having issues fairly early on, will not be purchasing another Acura sadly.

I purchased this certified pre-owned with 32k miles. V6 with SH-AWD. SO fun to drive. I mean, the handling, power, etc is fantastic and made my hour + work commute a joy. That's where the positive ends.  Good fuel mileage and have seen 30+ mpg on highway drives. 

Hood shakes at highway speeds. Entire dash lights up like an xmas tree and dealer can't figure out why. Developed a horrible miss at 67k miles with no codes so dealer can't fix. Tech in the car is far behind every other manufacturer and the audio system is horrendous without ELS. 

The vehicle could have been great. Add some luxury touches at least to get on par with Subaru. Fix the gremlins, and the car would have been a keeper.
The v6 has power to spare and rides very quietly. The infotainment with 2 screens is awkward and sometimes slow to respond. Overall nice styling and very pleasant to drive.

There is not much to say about the car apart from feeling it as very reliable. The Tech package is all I need to drive comfortable and safely. I would have given it a 5 star for quality too if the interior would have been a bit more carefully crafted. It is however a 4.5 in my books.

The ride is still very comfortable for a sporty car. This is my 3rd Acura and likely I will not switch brands soon.

Let me start off by saying I have an Acura Bias.  I traded in my 2005 Acura TL W/ 6 Speed Manual Transmission (226,000 miles) when I purchased my 2020 TLX V6 W/Tech Package.  This car is considerably heavier than the TL, but that is not a bad thing.  It's a joy to drive - I have the transmission default set to SPORT, so it responds to my throttle inputs in a way that always puts a smile on my face.  The car (Majestic Black Pearl) looks good too especially with the window tint I put on it - I always get compliments on it.  Technology has come a long way from my 2005 TL, but I love all the new advanced safety features (LKAS, Collision Mitigation Braking, Adaptive Cruise Control etc).  I wasn't even aware that the car had All Wheel Steering - I just thought that the turning radius had improved significantly from the TL.  The seating position is low - that is a question of preference in my opinion, but I love it.  When I partake in "spirited" driving the seating position inspires confidence.  My wife has an MDX with SH AWD, but the high seating position of the SUV saps my confidence even though it has never hinted at rollover.  Give me the LOW any day.  The gas mileage seems to be worse than on the TL - possibly because my right foot makes constant use of the horsepower increase.  There is an inflation system for a flat tire, but no spare.  If you have a nail in the sidewall you are out of luck.  Time will tell if this is a bad thing, but you do gain extra storage area in the trunk via a hidden space beneath the regular area - my jumper cables are kept there now.  The car is  quiet at speed and very stable.  Rear passenger area is less than ideal, but my kids are grown.  If my family of 4 goes out and about we take our Accord or the MDX.  All in all this is a very fine automobile that I anticipate getting several hundred thousand miles of driving enjoyment from it.  I did purchase an extended warranty (9 years/150,000 miles), so if any of the electronic wizardry goes out I should be covered.  I enjoy the android auto connectivity, but sometimes at start up the music will cut off occasionally.  This stops after a few minutes, though.
I have had sports cars in the past and this SUV handles like one.  The E Pace is nimble and quick.I tested the larger F Pace and it was clunky and much less responsive.

Much of my review of my 2019 Jaguar E Pace P 300 R-Dynamic SE will be subjective and my opinion, but that is what most reviews are. I drove a lot of compact/subcompact SUVs before deciding on the E Pace. I have owned many vehicles in the past from domestic to imports and base to luxury. I like a vehicle that rides and handles well, is quiet, has good build quality and feels solid. 

I was looking for a smaller SUV but one that was well equipped – vented/heated seats, HUD, upgraded seats, good audio system, etc. I test drove Audi Q3 and Q5, Acura RDX, MB GLC, Buick Envision, Volvo XC 40, Volvo XC 60, Hyundai Santa Fe Calligraphy, Cadillac XT4, and the Lexus NX 300 F Sport, and of course the Jaguar E Pace – the lesser horse power P250 as well as the P300. After driving the E Pace, I really liked it. I went back to the local dealership to drive different E Pace models 4 times. This car is a blast to drive. I did not find the HP difference between the P250 and P300 to be that significant, but it is notable. I decided the E Pace was the best option for me but not the ones available at the local dealership. I was looking to buy used and again, had specific ‘wants’ in an E Pace. I found the 2019 that I bought that was a Spec build for the original owner, beautiful white exterior with the black exterior trim package, mars red leather interior with 18 way vented/heated seats, HUD, upgraded sound system, and 20” wheels. I say all of this because there is a huge difference between a base or stripped-down E Pace and one that has nice options – but that is no different than most cars. Prior to making my decision to buy the E Pace, I had read several on line reviews (including ‘expert’ reviews) and watched many YouTube videos regarding the E Pace. Many of reviews when comparing the E Pace to the competition (and I drove most of the competition) were indifferent at best and negative at worst towards the E Pace. It seems that most of the issues, however slight with the E Pace were in the first year of production – 2018. In no way did I feel these negative connotations towards the E Pace. So bottom line, the following is my impression after driving my E Pace for the past week for approximately 700 miles.
1.	The vehicle is beautiful and elegant - exterior and interior
2.	The build quality is solid
3.	Excellent paint
4.	I refer to the interior as simple posh – fit and finish is very good, nice materials with very good leather seats
5.	The car is quick and handles well and wants to keep going faster
6.	The ride is ‘sporty’ – it’s not soft but not rigid
7.	The car is relatively quiet with little wind and road noise (I’m very picky about this)
8.	The upgraded Meridian sound system is very good
9.	The tech – acceptable and ok for me but if you demand the absolute best and quickest tech and that’s a deal killer, this may not be the car for you
10.	The front is fairly spacious, not so much in the back seats- adequate for adults for short trips
11.	There is only a fixed pano-roof option – if that’s a deal killer, move on
Do your research, drive lots of options many times, and make sure you are under factory or extended warranty!

After owning primarily Lexuses growing up and as an adult, after a long time with that, wanting a small suv - and something different - it came down to the XC40, Evoque or this.  Well, my dad who loves cars - I do not like driving but ive been back in Dallas for 7 years and in Dallas you must drive something great.   

The car is beautiful on the outside and I see people at times give it intriguing looks bc you dont see too many of these out there.  I got the gray with black leather interior - P250S model - with 1.5k miles CPO - right at height of Covid and got a terrific deal and the fact I have 98.5k, 5 full years (6 from the buy date the prior year) of bumper to bumper including new warranty - 4 years of maintenance/service...I wont disclose what I paid, but I came, saw, crunched numbers and drove home in two hours...two hours from ever being in one.  

The black interior...I thought it would be too much, but theres a cohesion and serenity to it when you step in.  Bc of the textures and shrewd use of other materials it all blends for a very peaceful feeling.  The others can be so busy.  I feel calm in my baby every time I step in and shut door.  I see SO MUCH about the plastic -- yeah yeah, honestly its fine.  it doesnt bother me.  Infotainment is fine too...id say less than 1% minor glitch but easily fixed.  

Sound:  what a freaking sound system.  its REALLY amazing...i have the meridian premium.  and the car is surprisingly quiet and serene.  Now, one big huge difference with Lexus -- yes, if the road is bad or bumpy you def feel it more as this is sportier or a pothole -- but i came from lexus and now its kinda just whatever.  the a/c is amazing...im huge on that.  German cars are terrible.  I didnt think this would be like Japanese but they got it perfect.  Cold on a 100 degree day in minutes.  or use the app to pre-cool it for you.  the app is great to make sure u locked your car if ur in ur apt 

Drive:  again, im not a big driver...but...this makes you want to speed.  this makes you want to do bad things...and it feels so good.  ugh.  but i only speed on the single or double lane express lanes and one time i hit 100 and was in disbelief bc u felt like it was 75.  it roars out the gate but yes, in parking garage going really slow it does do that strange jerk ive read, but its fine.  you feel empowered in this vehicle, like you're in one some secret that audi, merc, and bmw owners (sheep) havent picked up on. 

I LOVE the car.  I feel like myself:  a bit different than others, classy, fun, frisky and sep from the pack.  The warranty allowed me to try this bc of the massively bad rep Jag still has amongst mainstream luxe drivers and they need to work very hard to fix that.  So far, so good.

I live in urban dallas so mostly its quick drives and its not great on that, but highway in summer it did very well when i drove to austin and back.

City:  15 mpg
HWY:  30 mpg

We were in the market for an upgrade. Small non Japanese SUV. We looked at BMW, Benz, Audi and Volvo. And then we found the E-Pace. The interior is so beautifully designed. The exterior is stylish. A ton of high tech features. The package overall is the best. And you do not see it at every turn and intersection. If you are looking for a unique car, go for the E-Pace. Actually, we liked it over the bigger F-Pace
I love the style, fit and finish. The transmission is pitiful in this price range. Significant lag from 1100-1500 rpm.
One of the best cars that I have ever owned. No mechanical issues ever, nothing. Boston located - High demand - Buy one now of the 2019s.

We bought this F-Pace S to replace a Buick Encore that was fully loaded. The Jaguar is very quick and fun to drive. Handling around corners is tight and it feels steady at higher speeds…it sits on the road! Lots of cargo space if you need it and the interior is stylish and comfortable. My only complaint is that the power lift gate didn’t come standard in this model. Would more than likely look into buying a F-Pace SVR to replace this one.

I purchased my 2020 Jaguar FPace SVR 3
Us ago and am in love with this vehicle! I had a Jaguar FPace S model before and loved that vehicle too! The performance of this vehicle is incredible as it Clocks 0-60 in 3.7 sec. It is a blast to drive and handles like a sports car  if I get rid of this vehicle it will be for another SVR.

We love the car .  rides good with no problems.  Just thinking about getting a new  one.
This is our third Jaguar and we  tend to purchase another one if we sell ours

I have owned my 2021 SVR for almost 2 years. The growl of the engine is like no other car. Getting pinned to the seat as you put the pedal down 0-60 in 4 seconds in an SUV?!! It's also a value vehicle, Range Rover SVR's the bigger brother is $30-50k higher in price. I drive my family to Tahoe in snow, rain and hot weather, and she runs like a warrior with the supercharged V8 (550 bhp). No maintenance issues, but one advice to the Special Vehicle Operations team who builds these, please give her some more breaking power. :)

After 5 years of ownership of the Jaguar FPace S fully loaded, all I can say is wow. Not one issue in all of this time and it performs beautifully. The build quality has proven to be exceptional and enduring. The car still looks as new and that is not because of any specific reason other than monthly hand washing and garaged. Well done Jaguar for finally getting it so very right.
Great drive and power but not so good accessories. Seats are high and entry is low. Be careful not to bump your head when getting in and out.

I have owned BMWs in the past but by far, I appreciate the consistency, power and style of the jaguar F pace. I am always impressed by this vehicle. I bought my first one when it came out and I’ve had three since. In fact, one of those was my wife when she discovered how much I enjoyed my vehicle! Spacious, consistent power and a great look! An SUV that’s actually fun to drive.
This car is my favorite. V8 power with a supercharger and exotic exuast note. This might be the perfect combo for this type of car. Rare and beautiful body lines.

Pros:

First off, great look any year. This car is officially a classic. They may never make another F-Type in our lifetime.

has a great sound system. 

The computer system is awesome very modern even in/on older models. 

Gives a luxury feel with sports dynamics.

Great safety features should you find yourself in a pinch, I.E. traction control (with automatic weather sensors to adjust to temperature variations).

Automatic climate control for topless rides.

Cons:

Not meant for long drives unless you have a cushion.

Maintenance can be a hassle because not many drive this particular car.

Anything outside of those two cons, they're probably just bashing Jaguar.

This car is the most fun I have ever had in a sports car. Don't let anyone fool you. This car is a bullet. The interior is quite luxurious with leather stitching. I was quite surprised how quiet the car can be in non-beast mode. As production ends this year I will cherish this classic beauty.

I love this car. A Corvette is a little quicker, if you want to roll with boomers in denim shorts, high white socks, new balance shoes, and phone clips on the belt. A Porsche Cayman is (only slightly) precise in corners, but Porsches (though iconic) are common. No one sees a Cayman and remembers it or reacts to it. The F-type is rare, gets the looks and comments, and nothing sounds as good. Not by a mile. If you're a sensory driver (looks, sound, feel) this is your car. It's sure as heck mine.
One of the best sports car I ever had! Rides excellent and with the different suspension is a delight to drive in the city and hi ways.selling it because family has grown, more than two!

I’ve owned Corvettes, Pontiacs GTs, Hot Rod Trucks, etc. BUT NONE OF THESE PAST Automobiles come even close to the driving experience I have with My 2017 F Type Jaguar R  Series Convertible. I Love this car. It’s Dynamic Exhaust sound, It’s Power, it’s  Glued to the Road suspension, You have to physically drive this car to appreciate its Performance and Thrilling Experience………….Nuff Said.
Same similarities between this and a supra. Close to the same horsepower. This car feels a bit outdated. Jaguar cars don't hold there value well. I, decided to trade it in for something else.

Beautiful car, especially on the interior. All the finer appointments that make a Jaguar a luxury ride. Very solid handling, more acceleration than you need, single pedal driving mode is truly the future of automobiles. Battery gives respectable range at 60F (~230 miles) and above but is down to ~160 miles on a full charge in the winter (20F or lower). Perfect car around town, seats 4 very comfortably, 5 with a child and can hold 2 golf bags with the back seat up (much more with seats down). Zero mechanical issues through 4 years. Will keep until JLR comes up with a successor with more range.
Car looks good . comfort good. Rear view bad. In shop about 5 months for the several months we own it. Already bought a new car to replace it. Not a Jag. Never again

I actually look forward to driving now! The experience of driving it is night and day from my gas cars...and I pass gas stations laughing lol. Many sports gas cars try to race me, and they are surprised when I leave them in the dust (kinda cheating because it's electric). But it drives like a sports car, and the acceleration will literally take your breath away, as all my friends say in the passenger seat. I absolutely love this car! It's a luxury electric vehicle, because Jaguar is a luxury performance company. This is a Tesla competitor for sure

Car has been flawless after a year and a half. Great power and handling. Comfortable and quiet. Beautiful styling inside and out. Car can be raised to travel through 19” of water.  Range has never been an issue, even on long trips. I need a comfort break before the car does. I looked at Tesla but their lack of Apple Car Play, rear cross traffic alert, and Sirius made them a non-starter.

Terrific sports car like handling in what arguably is not an SUV in my opinion. The IPACE is incredibly agile just like a Jaguar! Quick acceleration, taut ride and sleek cutting edge styling. The interior is beautiful and finished expertly as most British luxury cars are. I love the look and the drive! I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an EV!

As the owner of a 2019 HSE model I can enthusiastically say we this is a indulgent sportscar. The performance, agility and handling are remarkable. The level of detail that JLR designed into the I-Pace is fantastic. The car is made in Austria, and the build quality is excellent. The adjustable air suspension, AWD, torque vectoring, 400 hp, 875w sound system, leather interior, head-up display, multiple screens...it is the essence of luxury. We drove three of the leading electric competitors back-to-back-to-back on the same afternoon, try it out, you will understand why we chose the I-Pace. It is a great car.

Amazingly good car. Highly recommended. 
Fun to drive.

I purchased my HSE I-Pace 1 year ago it’s a great vehicle, fast comfortable and does not feel like driving behind an IPad. I am pleased to see that Jaguar increased build in AC charger to 11kw from 7kw for 2021 model year, they have also added a wireless phone charger. My biggest gripe is the ridiculously slow infotainment system takes 5 to 10 seconds to boot up when starting the car also it responds slowly. On a positive note my range was 234 miles when 100 percent charged following software update its now 266 miles.

I drive the XE R Dynamic AWS fully loaded with the 19" rims. 30k miles so far and 10k of them were on cross country road trips.  A. It's a head turner, very rare car that doesn't get shipped to the USA market anymore which is cool in a sea of German cars. B. The 16 way butter soft seats are comfortable even after an 8 hour road trip.  Driving modes actually create a significant difference in driving style.  ECO for highway cruising get's great gas mileage and makes it hard to speed (which is why I use it sometimes) Dynamic and sport modes; if you sneeze you're going 109 haha.  OOPS! It corners like it's on rails due to the rear suspension and staggered wheel set up.  The clear view rear view mirror option gives you a clear view of the entire freeway all 10 lanes.  I love BMW not nocking the brand, but this Jag handles the way the old school BMW's did before they admittedly became more Americanized. You feel connected to the road; the car is responsive and intuitive.  The Tech is great.  Beautiful clean lines, blend of leather and aluminum trip with white stitching.  The features you don't need disappear so there is no clutter.  Rear seat is not very roomie.  Not a great car if you always have rear seat passengers. I don't so it's perfect for me.

Total waist of time trying to keep up with the repairs. "Definitely expensive" these cars are just cheaply made, but overpriced parts. On my way to get out of this mess and get a newer affordable type of car.
Excellent overall. Not perfect, but no car is. You will stand out from the crowd…very unique compared to all the Audis and Beemers on the road. 18k miles so far and no issues at all!

Performance is great, mileage for me is about 23 street, 35.6 freeway and the car has plenty of pick up. Owned it for over two years so far and to be honest I have had one small coolant leak that is known by jaguar and they have a quick replacement part for it already. Interior is Comfortable for my grandma to be in but also nice enough to show off a bit! Great car for the price and good alternative from the typical bmw, Infiniti or audi.

This car is a head turner, its very sharp and feels expensive as if no costs were spared during the assembly of this vehicle. Its the perfect combination of luxury and sport,  the v6 3.0l supercharged awd makes this the perfect dad car. Backseats are limited in space and create an unenjoyable riding experience for passengers.

Before Covid interrupted our lives I drove this car 550 miles one way to visit friends in the next state. I've made this trip many times but never before arrived with no neck and shoulder pain. This car almost drives itself! Looks hot! Almost more power than I can handle (and I drove a 1967 GTO in the past). Interior is lush. Best warranty ever. Covid hit and I parked it in the garage. LUV this car! Can't wait to get behind the wheel again.
Very sporty and great acceleration.  There are a few more options I would have liked but I needed a car and this XE was the closest to what met my needs.

Great performance, fun to drive, holds the road. Beautiful lines. Performs  amazing from the diesel. Gas millage averages 50mpg .
Reliable, Maintenance free in 5 years, never a maintenance issue.

I drive a lot for work.  I do both city but mostly highway miles.  The only issue i have with my 2022 XF was the initial tires having lost 2 in the first 3 months.  I switch brands and while a major pothole took out a new tire i really glad i switched.
Car drives great, nice feel, sounds and comfort.  i have had many luxury cars before and i am very happy with the Jag.  I also considered a E450 and 540 both were hard to find.  i was luck as the Jag (2) came in the day i looked for it and I went to the dealer 2hrs away same day and 1 was already sold.      Would i get again Yes, without a hesitation.  MPG is just ok at about 25-26 (heavy foot) on premium gas.  if i had to find a negative the trunk opening is not as wide or high as my previous cars so that has been a pain a few times but there is plenty of room inside the trunk.
Better than German rivals. More kick and comfort. Doesn’t bottom out on speedy inclines and handles better than BMWs

This car has 60k warranty what’s not to like. It’s very smooth handling and very powerful. Make sure you use premium gas for engine life. The entertainment system is a little clunky. Not all vin get the free apple play upgrade so that’s the only complaint with this vehicle. The technology is lacking.

Initial thoughts:
For those looking for an alternative to German cars that will turn heads - look at this Jag. There are deals to be had for 2020 models. You will get unsolicited compliments on this car.

I have the XF S trim and everything is gorgeous in and around the car.  The S has a Supercharged V-6 engine (no turbo lag) and barrels down the road with authority. Buttery drive that still makes you feel the road.

Try to get the XF S now as there is no S option for 2021 - only 4 cylinders offered going forward for XF. 

The trunk is very deep and back seat has plenty of room.
I agree that the infotainment system is not as strong as my former BMW car but it is not as bad as some say. The touchscreen works well. The Meridian surround sound is primo.

A+ sports sedan.

Has been my favorite car in my life.  I have had almost every type of car in my 52 years.  This one is fantastic.  Lively engine and handling....really lively.  Good tech....maybe could be better here but still good.  Comfort is outstanding along with ride.  Sound system good.  Nav is decent.  Climate control is Excellent.  Styling is Steller!  Service was always really good too.
PERFORMACE LUXURY AND MORE BANG FOR BUNK COMPARED TO OTHER WAGONS

Fairly fast, pretty good handling, and a great ride from a very practical car.  A great highway cruiser.  Typical Jaguar seats are equal to those in Lexus' IS-350 which I find superior to those from Audi, BMW, Cadillac, and Toyota.  A big trunk.  Jaguar's rain/snow algorithm for traction control is by far the best of what is offered by Audi, BMW, Cadillac, Lexus, and Toyota.  Jaguar's In Control Touch 8.0 inch infotainment/navigation system is slow and has a very limited storage for favorite destinations.  The heads-up display is panned by most professional reviews; however, I find Jaguar's to be superior to BMW's and Cadillac's HUDs with their white symbols mainly because Jaguar uses amber & green which I find less distracting by day and night.

This is a very fun car to drive and being a station wagon of sort, very practical. 
The sound system is good but the infotainment interaction requires education, not so intuitive.  Once dialed, a pleasure to drive, seats are very customizable and sport like in support.  This isn't a cushy ride nor is the seating soft, more sport oriented.  The transmission shifts smoothly and the dynamic functions add fun turning the wagon into sporty driver.

Great car and would keep it but I need a SUV.
Has all the upgrades including front seat heat/cool/massage. 
Rear seat heat/cool upgrade.
Total trash cheaply made engine is shot the interior  is falling apart the suspension light is on the rear sagging  air compressor failed this is my 2nd jaguar I will never buy another one

Purchased a 2017 XJL CPO and fell in love with this car the minute I looked at it and sat behind the wheel.  It far out classes a Merc Audi BMW in style and the performance is excellent.  I get so many compliments regarding the Jag even from Merc owners it just oozes class. The car also drives like a dream and after 6 years it’s still solid like a rock. My only regret is that Jaguar has discontinued the XJ model because the plan was to buy another CPO XJ. Also Jaguar CPO is the best coverage on the luxury market bar none.

My 2012 xjl is beginning to fall apart. The interior quality is very cheaply made. Start/stop button broke. Cup holder sliding lid broke , passenger’s mirror also broke.. among other things.. this car only has 43k miles and it’s already falling apart. Stay away

I’ve had every make of passenger car made except for Rolls and stuff like that but this is the best highway car I’ve ever had. British sophisticated with burled wood had tan leather very well appointed.  Supercharged V6 is a beast. The XJL is about 5 inches longer than the XJ.  Smoother ride in the L. It’s like going from a 22 foot boat to a 24 foot boat. Sweet car.
Over the top luxury partnered with a powerful fun drive. One of only 300 cars made - it’s your chance to drive something special.
This car is comfortable, spacious, runs like a airplane. and very luxury,economy in gas when drive in highways.  Love my car owner for 3 years.

Smoothest and quietest ride there is.
It already in 2013 had advanced technology.  It has a super-charged V 6 with AWD and nice wide 22 inch tires.
This car is spotless in and out.  It is showroom quality.  No scratches, no marks on the great thick leather seats.
Heated steering, 4 seats, power drivers and passenger seats, seat massagers,
Meridian Stereo, All glass top, engine is clean and runs like new.  A great car which is gorgeous throughout - just like new!  Black metallic, new fit tech mats, new trunk mat, new head lights, auto dimming, coffee heater in back,
Full controls for back seats, molded mud flaps.  No rust anywhere!  Prettiest car in the area.
This Boxster is in very good shape.  Available luggage rack; rubber mats for interior, frunk and trunk.

Having owned 2 - 911’s over many years, i never liked the boxster until the 2013 redesign. It was a huge improvement and what the car should have looked like from the start. The sculpted door sills made the car look bold and strong and a lot like the beloved Carerra GT. Bought a certified preowned 2014 S in black with the PDK. Would have preferred a manual but the PDK is sweet and precise. It blips perfectly when downshifting too so could be fun on the track. The car is solid, fast, beautiful and handles better than my 911’s and more like the ferraris i have owned. After all these years i still love driving this car and looking at it! Its still worth what i paid for it after 8 years of ownership which is a nice bonus.
Great car.  Traded my 992 for it and can't be happier.  Lovely 4.0 naturally aspirated engine that sounds incredible, great size for a sports car and looks amazing and somewhat exotic.

After just shifting from 1st gear to 2nd gear on the test drive, in my mind I was selling off my air cooled Porsches I had for a Gentian Blue Roadster.

Never thought I would go from air cooled to water cooled Porsches but it was a fluke that the car I found at the dealer had been sold twice with less than 765 miles on the car. 

Having driven a Porsche Targa, 210 hp, 5 Spd, with a 915 Gearbox and steel clutch cable for over 20 years, I sensed a new excitement with the 2020 Spyder 718 w/ 414 hp, 8k Red Line Engine, and a 6 Spd gear box. The car had to be mine, as as my mind went from rational thought to irrational thought in a millisecond of time.

The car rides very well over the prior design of Porsches of the 1980's with torsion bars front and rear verses the new coil over suspension of the Spyder 718. The manual gearing is fine as many reviews state its too tall. Who drives at the red line in every gear?

 Having owned prior manual gearbox Porsches, I know where to go to have gears 2-5 in the gearbox replaced at a later time after the first clutch job.

The car drives amazing like most other Porsche Spyder 718reviews have stated and this is probably my last Porsche that should need as I am retired. Some people get up early to go surfing, I get of Dark 30 when there are much fewer cars on the roads and drive the mountain roads with the car. Greatest car ever.

The car handles so well. Steering feels great. There is nothing like whipping around a corner in a Porsche. It's hard to describe but you have to try it.

Very comfortable to drive. You can tell they put effort into every minor detail.

The sound package plus is great. Bass is strong and miss and highs are clear. Way better than I expected after reading review online.

Haven't had a single issue. Happy I have the full tab interior since it's no longer offered.

The V6 is very responsive and the pdk is excellent. The growl is fun too. Don't think I would swap out for a new 4 cylinder. I will hold out til they redesign again.

After 8 years I have found only a few problems with the 981 Boxster.  With the top up rear view is almost impossible.  (get the rear camera or put the top down).  The door panels warp if living in any hot climate.  (the fix is $5000)  You'll think the window motor is failing but rather fighting friction.  The fuel door electric solenoid stopped working effectively in locked position.  Had the dealer simply remove the locking solenoid and revert to manual push-to-open.  The cabin air filters (2) need changing each 5K miles.   Battery change every 2 1/2 years.  (ask me why)  And be sure to have brake and clutch fluid flushed every two years.  (use dealer it's harder than you think to keep air out)

This car is top quality, fast,fun to drive, and on the road @ 80 to 85 mph 32 to 34 mpg. It doesn't feel big and bulky like a corvette. I have owned 4 corvetts in the past and this is my second Porsch. You have to drive one and you will see

I leased BMW convertibles for years And decided to purchase a car whose styling would endure forever.  The Boxster checks every box. Heated seats and steering wheel, blind spot detection, apple CarPlay, great handling and the timeless good looks of a roadster Porsche.  Great purchase.

The Porsche Cayman S offers uncompromised sports car handling, brisk acceleration, and excellent braking at no cost whatsoever to ride comfort.  This fine piece of machinery is beautiful inside and out, and is even remarkably spacious and comfortable for a mid-engine 2-seater.  When researching used Caymans of the 981 variety, I initially thought the prices were a bit steep; That is, until I drove one.  I've had mine for a year and find myself loving it more with every passing day.  I originally intended to own the car for a year or so, then move on to something else fun and exciting, but the idea of not owning this car is a dreadful thought!  Besides, if I was to have any other car that did everything as well as this one does, it would cost twice as much and likely start with the letters "Ferr...".

A wonderful handling vehicle especially with the X73 option, although that makes the ride very firm. The sound of the engine, power and quick shifting of the PDK are exceptional. The Cayman is one of the best handling sports cars made regardless of price. The downsides in my car with only 23,000 miles and always garaged except when driven are:  Headliner came loose from the roof and fell down on my head; the radio controls became sticky and the leather dash cover started peeling loose from its base. The latter is approximately a $10,000 repair. These three items are unacceptable in a $96,000 car.

Purchased the vehicle new and was a rough year and half breaking the vehicle in properly.  After breaking the car in and finally opening the 4.0 up, it was AMAZING. Hearing the motor scream up to 8,000 rpms and feeling all the feedback this car provides leaves me speechless.  The only other car that provides this type of feedback is a Lotus Exige, but that car lacks a lot of the creature comforts.  

I looked at some of the other reviews complaining about options being expensive.  Its a Porsche, and you don't need to go all out optioning the car.  Identify what options are must-haves for yourself and nothing else.  Also, know what car you are buying.  Mass produced cars will most likely depreciate.  GT cars hold their value very well and may appreciate even as vehicles move electric.

I wouldn't use this vehicle in bad weather, the Sport Cup 2 tires are great in sunny warm weather, but would have a second vehicle for inclement weather.  Otherwise, the car gets swirly.

Would I buy this GT4 again?  Yes, without hesitation

It would be difficult to say anything bad about this sports car without nitpicking.  The 981-series Cayman S is an excellent-performing two-seat, mid-engine, almost-exotic level sports car with an attractive, spacious, and comfortable cabin.

Many would also agree that is has drop-dead good looks from every angle, and no one can argue its incredible agility.  Porsches are often seen as older men's sports cars, and here is why:  Refinement rates 11 on a scale of 10, while putting up high-level, almost-exotic level specs.   How Porsche is able to combine this level of performance with excellent ride and cabin comfort in such a lightweight package is beyond my comprehension.  What you have here are all the makings of an exotic car at a more accessible price point, and with worldwide dealer support.  What's not to like!

Note:  I have been thru and loved Miatas, a 370Z Nismo, and am reluctantly letting go of my low-mileage S2000 tomorrow.  All will be distant memories the moment I slide back into the seat of my Cayman S.  What a car!

It is not in the top line of cars but it is still a Porsche! Any Porsche gives you the highest quality with the most luxurious features! Also if you get to hear that engine you will love it. 

Ts I own this car

Resale value is deprecating fast on these cars. I, personally wouldn't recommend this car. Gasoline vehicles are taking a value hit. This car was fun, it's the value that is hurting all these high end sports cars being gasoline.

In a world of 0-60 times and loud engines that don't always deliver, the Cayman has to be the best blend of performance, speed, handling, luxury, technology, and all around refinement in a true sports car that you would expect to cost way more. The second generation Cayman, the 981, takes the refinement, technology and balance to a new level.  And with the Cayman going to a turbocharged 4-cyl 718 in 2017, the 981 is probably the best normally aspirated 6 cylinder Cayman you can buy. It has lost all the gremlins of the 987 and not lost the beautiful 6 cylinder wail like the 718.

With the new styling and wider stance the 2014 offers the 3.4 liter flat 6 with 325 HP. Zero to 60 in 4.4 seconds, top speed is 175. Nothing in the Porsche lineup can handle the curves like the Cayman. With the same engine as the 911 with reduced HP you will find the Cayman will out preform the 911 on a closed course due to the mid engine. Why buy a 911 with limited rear seating when you can have the flat 6 less than a foot behind you roaring with the flat 6 asking you to jump on the gas……… This is the ultimate super car with great styling at a very cost effective price point.
This Boxster is in very good shape.  Available luggage rack; rubber mats for interior, frunk and trunk.

Its still worth what i paid for it after 8 years of ownership which is a nice bonus.
Great car.  Traded my 992 for it and can't be happier.  Lovely 4.0 naturally aspirated engine that sounds incredible, great size for a sports car and looks amazing and somewhat exotic.
