I leased BMW convertibles for years And decided to purchase a car whose styling would endure forever.  The Boxster checks every box. Heated seats and steering wheel, blind spot detection, apple CarPlay, great handling and the timeless good looks of a roadster Porsche.  Great purchase.

911 Carrera cabriolet is the best car I’ve ever driven. I have owned a BMW M3, M5, Audi S5, Mercedes 500, C 90, and Corvette ZR one. The technology and performance of this car beats all of them. The PDK transmission is astonishing. The thrust gap is almost imperceptible. 0 to 60 in 3.2 seconds with a top speed of over 185 mph in a turbo charged flat six that gets 20 miles per gallon on the interstate is just ridiculous! Combine that with a track worthy computer performance system that opens and closes the vents and spoilers to manage airflow over the car, the Bose stereo system that produces visceral bass with the top down, and the climate and comfort systems that are simply cutting edge…the car is simply unmatched! I’m sorry if you are unable to afford one, but if you are one of the lucky few, you understand.

Glued to the ground, impressive shifting and supreme handling. Nicely built and a great car. Shame on the ones giving it a bad review just because they cannot afford one and try to just make it look bad out of envy

Gotta love the fake reviews by people who will never own (or can't afford) a 911. I purchased my 911 Targa 4S back in 2021, and it's one of the most outstanding cars I've ever owned. The handling, power, etc., is unmatched by any other in the same category. It will definitely put a smile on your face. Mine is in racing yellow. What better color to have, right?

We all know a 911 S even with limited options is crazy expense. It's worth it - but just barely. My old 2019 Z-51 Vette (C7) is nearly as fast, handles nearly as well for nearly half the price. But it ain't a 911 which is the yardstick most pros and car fanatics use to judge other sports cars. There's a reason for that - all around excellent. Sublime handling, incredibly quick, fast, stylish and comfy. Lots of room, nice interior, but a bit too much plastic for a $138K sticker (including all the sports options, sunroof, custom paint etc).  Back seat good for dogs, luggage and groceries. Frunk isn't exceptionally useful.  PDK (eight speed) is indeed the slickest, quickest automatic I've even driven and light years better than my old 2011 C4S. Obviously, I like 911 enough to get another one. But it lost a star in the ratings for the savage price. I can't help feeling I got screwed.

Scrap metal junk cars. These cars are taking a fast dive off the cliff. Value is going down to the ground. These cars never lasted that long like a honda.  Time to go out and buy a golf cart. No more cars being produced

Gas vehicles, no more production being made. Forget this dam car, sold it and walked away. Everything is going electric is absolutely bs. This crazy America is sinking down all because of president Biden corruption

I, bought this car new and I have noticed auto value is going down. I'm actually going to go sale this right away. Very disappointed in Porsche for not being honest about auto value dropping. As for this car, it was fun at the time but no longer. Sorry for other owners as well.

The car is beautiful and of course garners attention. But, road noise from the tires is loud, so you have to crank the stereo to hear it.  Ride - my Polaris 4 wheel crew cab rides smoother in the woods than this car does on the road - unless you're on a new blacktop.  The trunk space holds plenty of groceries. Nobody can ride in the back seat - its reserved for our Terrier. Maybe a 6 year old child could fit.  The car at best is for 2 people. I thought it would be nice for a road trip - 400miles.  Nope. Our Panamera GTS and our Cayenne is far better in all areas.  Every guy needs a 911S and I got it out of my system - now its back to my more sensible ride that easily holds 4 adults and bags.

All I can say is Wow!  Long time Porsche owner and enthusiast. This car is awesome. 
Mine is a guards red with the PDK. I would rather have a 7 spd but none were available used.
I have owned the car a year and loved every minute.

Biggest problem is the engine already leaking oil. Transmission feels sloppy, and so does this car. I'm not a fan of Porsche 911, Carrera, 4S any of these car. They are junk!!! Plus KBB value is FULL OF BS LIES.
Very tight and a very strong and fast car. Reliable with good gas mileage. Last of the naturally aspirated engines. Buy if you can!!
Wonderful car! Outstanding driving experience! Well built! Comfortable! Great visibility! Overall a drivers car! The years of refinement really are evident!
Very comfy ride compared to higher up models!! It’s pretty quick. 0-60 in around 4 seconds. Amazing in corners.

I don't know what I would do without my 2016 911 C4S.  When I go away on vacation, I find myself wanting to get back home so I can take it out on the road.  I have owned many higher end sports cars (Ferrari F355 Spyder, BMW M5, Mercedes E63) and this car, is without a doubt, the most addictive vehicle I have ever owned.  Bottom line is, life is too short not to own one.  Well worth the price and an experience you will never forget.

Im a life long Corvette guy having lived through the muscle car scene and owned 12 Corvettes over the years (currently  own a 1966 427 4sp and  2016 ZO6 7sp ) . Ive always admired the 911’s from afar and alway wanted one. Recently picked up a CPO 2017 base Carerra lightly optioned with the PDK transmission. This car is as good a car as Ive ever driven. The fit and finish are what you expect from Porsche and the performance of this flat 6 twin turbo 3 liter is mind blowing. The car rides on rails and gives you feeling of control and stability. Its my daily driver and its automotive perfection.

The 2020 Porsche cayenne base is a good used car with a lot of value for the money it is good quality and the styling is nice along with the speed it’s not the fastest but it’s pretty fast for the base model

I’ve owned many high-end brands BMW, Peugeot, Maserati, and Mercedes. This cayenne is the finest fit and finished car by far. It has been extremely reliable, and regular maintenance is on a par with BMW and Mercedes, but it has been a great deal more reliable.

This is the second cayenne I’ve owned. I’ve owned high end cars most of my life. Porsche has the highest quality fit, finish an reliability of any car I’ve owned. The performance has spoiled me for any other car. Porsche has also honored warranties far beyond any other manufacturer I have ever owned (Ford, GM, BMW, Peugeot, Maserati, or Rover).

This car does not live up to the Porsche' brand.  Poor ride quality, very loud on the highway.  EXTREMELY difficult to navigate car options.  What takes me 4 clicks to accomplish something in the Cayenne takes me two clicks in a BMW.   On the road to adjust any setting is dangerous due to the poor user interface.  The voice assistant is useless as is the GPS system.  The GPS is inaccurate and gives instructions a second or two late.

I have owned the Cayenne, Twin-Turbo, loaded, for nearly three years now.  It is an absolute beast to drive.  Powertrain is over 550 HP, torque is literally insane, Burmeister stereo is fantastic, it is like riding on the back of a scalded cat.  Had to replace water pump first year, under warranty, nothing else.  Nothing.  Not as fun; road noise is higher than other cars (huge tires), technology is about three years behind Audi, tech is not as intuitive, not a fan of the new panels on the side of the shifter; glass panel is always dirty.  Not a day goes by that I don't look forward to driving it.  Have owned Ferrari, several 911's, AMG's and others.  My favorite: CTT.  Will be buying another one to get two year ago technology next year in 2023, the drive is worth it.

This is my 4th Cayenne. It handles curves better than my 2016 corvette.
For the price it should come with much more standard and safety equipment.The design is very mediocre . The base could use more HP than 335. Without the soft close option you it takes 2-3x 
to fully close the doors. Overall the superior driving experience compared to other SUV’s justify the purchase.

Had this to replace my 991.2 because of family reasons. It quite a reasonable daily driver, has nearly all the practicality of a mid-size SUV that can seat 4 people quite comfortably. But the real joy is how well it retains Porsche like driving characteristics for an SUV. It really feels like a car meant for the road, and drives way sportier than most cars! 

Throttle has minimal turbo lag, a little bit noticeable, but fairly even application of lower end torque in contrast to my prior SUV which had more noticeable lag. The steering is very Porsche, and perhaps the sharpest in the industry- move the wheel 2mm and it turns the wheels, no dead space. The ride is a bit firm, but creates a sporty feel. Brakes match the throttle- very responsive and impressively so when decelerating from high speeds. Wind noise absolutely minimal at freeway speeds. Extremely strong confidence with the AWD, steering, and nearly no body roll on windy mountain roads. 

No issues with reliability, have taken for all scheduled services. 

Highly satisfied wit this vehicle. However, for those who value roomy second row seats or large trunk space, may want to look at alternatives. If you value a vibrant driving experience, vehicle response, and primarily have 2-4 people to transport- this is a great option!

I purchased the new 2019 Cayenne new two years ago this month, and it has been amazing!  It is fun to drive, can haul just about anything I need, has been consistently reliable, and gets over 30mpg on the interstate. It is a very comfortable ride, and just a pleasure to own.

This SUV is one of the best buys in the price range. Highly reliable German engineering with lots of horses under the engine. This is the all terrain vehicle. Have over 130k miles and no signs of slowing down. Service regularly and it will run for 200k+. So much fun to drive and let's face it, it's a PORSCHE!

It's a bit like a racehorse. You look at it wrong and it breaks down. Compared to the 3 MDX's I owned, this was a greatly overrated, overpriced car option. A beautiful car when new, but as you add miles it becomes a very expensive and frustrating experience.

Flawless Driving , outstanding design, cruise control used give you more gas mileage.
Speed , maneuverability is quite amazing.
Overall

I was a skeptic after having had a brand new Ford since 2005. My last one being a 2021 Explorer ST. I figured what could it hurt to go drive one. I never have. Well, I was sold... started off with a used one for my first one. I will never buy anything but. It handled better than my other Fords in the WINTER and with no winter tires on. It has impressed me left and right. I have always owned the sport models or the fastest of that make. I believe I finally found my match. It is elegant but sporty. I love it!

The Cayenne from Porsche (Porsha) is the best moderately expensive SUV available. Bentley, Rover, Rolls, and Lamborghini all make SUV's that cost more, but then you're just showing off. 
I have driven the Cayenne at the "Tail of the Dragon" in NC -TN in the Smokey Mountains and I assure you the Cayenne can handle it. Big? yes Fast? yes Hangs on with most sports cars? Yes.
Also available with heated and cooled full leather seats, heated Steering wheel, Bluetooth, Navigation, proximity and lane departure alerts,  adjustable air suspension, hill hold, brake speed sensitive pre tensioning, etc. A really great performing, comfortable, fast, large sports car.

The Cayenne drives like a car, tows and hauls like a truck, goes off road like a Jeep, and performs like a sports car. Clearly the most versitile and dependable vehicle ever built by a sports / performance car company. The Cayenne is comfortable and enjoyable on long drives. and nimble and sure footed in the twisties. It easily accomadates 5 passengers, with heated and cooled rear seats that adjust front to back to insure ample foot and leg room. My Cayenne has the Sport Seats with adjustable side and lower seat bolsters to hold you in place for spirited driving, or more comfort for cruising. Adjustable air suspension goes from performance to comfort, and the Sport mode sharpens up all the cars responses. Truly a jack of all trades and a master of all roads.
CHEAP VW MATERIALS ON INTERIOR AND HAS THAT NOT EXCLUSIVE VW 'CHEAPNESS'....FAUX PORSCHE.
So far so good! Had the S for two weeks and so far so good-looks amazing.

If you like to drive and are ready for midsize suv, this is best option! I have a boxster s and love the tightness that a porsche is. The Macan is a true Porsche, its nimble, quick, and luxury all in one. I have the 3.0 twin turbo and its enough for me. Very quick.

I have had a 2018 Macan S for several years. It currently has 82000 miles on, I use this as my daily driver. Pros fun to drive, quick, reliable, Con maintenance cost, you can’t run down to jiffy lube to have the oil changed or NTB to have brakes put on it…it generally has to go back to Porsche and they are expensive, they do great work but still high. I have had two issue in the time I’ve had it,  1 transfer case, I couldn’t tell there was a problem, but the tech said their test showed it was bad and they replaced it at no cost. 2nd issue, the tech told me I had an oil leak and he said he replaced a bolt again at no charge. Great car great service no problem so far!
Best car in the snow. Safe great traction and downhill mode is a life saver. Solid safe with great acceleration.

It is in excellent condition, PRIMARILY DRIVEN ON HIGHWAYS. This Porsche includes $20,845 in OPTIONS: Mahogany Metallic paint, Leather Interior in Saddle Brown, Air Suspension including Porsche Active Suspension Management, Trailer Hitch without tow ball, Wheel Center Caps with colored Porsche Crest, Heated multifunction Sport Steering Wheel in Dark Walnut, Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus), Sunblind for rear side windows, Dark Walnut interior package, Roof Rails in black including Roof Transport System, Sport Design Side Mirrors, Park Assist (front and rear) with Surround View, Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus (PDLS), Adaptive Cruise Control including Porsche Active Safe (PAS), BURMESTER High End Surround Sound System, 19" Macan Design Wheels, Premium Package Plus, Comfort Lighting Package, Window trim in Black (High Gloss), Compass on Dashboard. STANDARD PORSCHE EQUIPMENT for the Macan Turbo: 3.6 liter twin turbo v6 with Sport and Sport , 400hp 406 lb ft torque, 7speed PDK, PASM, Sport Air Suspension with two levels, 18 way adaptive sport seats with memory package, LED daytime running lights, hands free bluetooth, PCM navigation module, am/fm radio with tuner and single disc mp3 compatible cd/dvd player, electrically adjustable

I love my Porsche Macan GTS very much. The performance is remarkable, and the quality and ride comfort are top notch! The quick shifting PDK is outstanding! I chose the sport exhaust, and I keep it turned on all the time, to hear the music emitted! I enjoy the reliability I’ve experienced!

2016 Macan S has 81,000 miles and never had a service issue.  Find myself, even after 7-yrs, totally feeling energized every time I get in it.  Averages 20 miles combined driving.  Service can be high but no more than Mercedes, BMW or Audi.  This car is  a daily driver and great on the highway when you just need to punch it.  Have never felt out of control or in danger in the car, very stable.    Annual waxing keeps it looking new

No SUV corners like my Porsche.  I've had BMWs, Infinitis and Mercedes.  All had their own qualities - but none handled like the Macan. And everything else has been solid, reliable - flawless apart from the size of the screen.
Power, performance, reliability, comfort, and Porsche good looks. What more could you want. Way better than my Benz or Jag.
I love this car! Color Cherry red w Tan interior is gorgeous. Driving this car truly has been a privilege taking it up to 130 mph, drove smooth & hugged the curves  making it easy to control.

I have really enjoyed driving the Panamera hybrid. So far no mechanical issues. Love that I can drive around town and never use gas. I pretty much only have to use gas when leaving town and love that I don’t ever have to stop to charge again if I don’t want to. Fun to drive and that extra HP boost from being hybrid sure makes it fun. More room that expected. 4 passengers very comfortable and can ride 5 if needed.

Love the ride, love the driving dynamics, love the fact that Panamera's AREN'T everywhere.  But, the infotainment system needs further development (numerous intermittent issues, satellite radio reception is terrible), especially integration with Apple CarPlay.  The car battery dies if car is left undriven more than a couple of weeks (dealer cannot solve it).  Great driver, but for $100K, I have higher expectations.
This car is perfect for all types of driving styles.   Handles amazing in all road and weather conditions.  No mechanical problems ever, super reliable car.   Never had to worry the car won't start.

Perfect condition inside and out. Best car I have ever owned. I like adaptive speed control, lane change assist, power steering assist and night vision witch identifies human images or deer image. This night vision has saved me from running down deer many times. Also identifies humans on the road.

This is my third Panamera, so I have experience with this car.  Excellent comfort, performance, safety, styling and mileage.  How does 54 mpg sound?  I custom ordered this vehicle and it has exceeded my expectations.  I think this car is the sleeper in the Porsche lineup.  Most people probably aren’t aware of this car and it’s capabilities.  560 horsepower, 3.2 seconds 0-60 mph.  Great fuel economy and No Range Anxiety!  This is the perfect vehicle for the sport enthusiast.

Perfect sedan for the guy who loves
Porsche but has a family and need additional space.it retains the Porsche
Lines but has a a luxury car line get many compliments on styling

I have owned my Panamera Executive S4 less than a month and the first thing I noticed is heads turning to see what it is, and several thumbs up on the way by.  
This car is fun, comfortable, and everything I hoped for in a premium Porsche.
Perfect sporty driver. Know your range and it’s fantastic. This is not your only vehicle. This is a cream puff kept polished and ready for luxury driving.

Had non-stop issues iwth Porsche Taycan. The air conditioner went out at 500 miles. The dealer put 150 miles on the vehicle when it went on for service. The charger doesn't work. Keys don't work. Constant warning lights.  Would not recomend.
Has it all - performance, style, handling, comfort, reliability, quiet, fit/finish, and did I mention performance?

Such an amazing sports car and no paid service required in over two years. I'm bringing it in for scheduled maintenance and recalls soon. The recalls are software updates and preventative measures. The scheduled maintenance is just inspections and fluid changes, with no engine issues to deal with and hardly any brake service since the Taycan uses mostly regenerative braking. I have a Taycan 4S and it performed amazingly at the track for a full day on two charges. I let all my friends and coworkers drive my Taycan and they giggle like schoolgirls when doing a launch control start or cornering at high speed. It also carries a surprising amount of stuff. I've had five adults in the car for short distances and it wasn't terrible. Getting infants in the back seat requires tilting the baby seat, which can be an issue if the baby is asleep. The cross tourismo and sport tourismo versions of the Taycan have larger rear access and this may not be an issue. I drive long distances, such as several trips a year over 800 miles, and have never had a significant issue.

I own a Tesla and yes they are great from a tech and charging infrastructure perspective but the Taycan is a Porsche. It drives like a Porsche handles like a Porsche and is simply solid. It just happens to be electric. The Tesla is a great car handles well is fast but it’s an EV first and a drivers car second.

Truly feels like a Porsche drive. Quick response great handling. Range is excellent. Dash looks like a real car not a big screen TV turned sideways. Functionality is great. Charge time is superb and quick. Would buy again
Non-stop issues with computer in car. Difficult to get appointments for repair and no loaners available. Dealership put 150 miles on vehicle when I took it in for service.
Best EV I could even have. Coming from Tesla I can, with certainty, say taycan is the perfect combination between looks, performance, comfort, and efficiency. Thank you Porsche!

it is the best car i've ever seen. it is hot. i want this car so badddd. it looks hot. i want it in pinkkkkkk.
I love this car but i can not describe it in 100 characters so i am gonna say a bunch of random stuff blah blah blah

I just bought this car, the HP and the way it handles is over the top. I can't go anywhere without crazy attention. It's an experience that I can't explain, feels like your in the cockpit of a fighter jet.

The sound, the look, the feeling and the attention this car gets is unsurpassed.  I haven't had a single problem except for a standard $560 dealer oil change and they don't even give me a loaner car but drive me home in a 10 year old Ford F-150 (with a lamborghini sticker on fender) and make me Uber back up to get car....and they call me complaining about my 3 star Yelp rating.

The car makes me excited and happy any time I get near it and drive it...Guaranteed pick me up.
It is an amazing car! Worth the money.

The horse power is amazing and exciting
the syling wonderful keep up the good work
lamborghini it amazing me on my test run
Take a test drive, get comfortable with the vehicle, and get ready for questions everywhere you take the car. Great drive and the braking power is seriously good.

I have taken this SUV on the highway numerous times and I can't be more proud of owning this SUV I am sure people call me crazy for adding all the miles on this thing but that's why you purchase it to drive it lol but yeah outside of maintenance cost, this thing is amazing.
great
Trash garbage

I have the Lusso Red top edition.  It’s my all time favorite car I’ve ever owned. My only negative is my husband’s a giant lol but that’s not the cars fault! 😝 he’ll still be a sport and get in (top down) on rare occasion. (6’6”) 😃 #lovemyroadster
So much fun! Top down on a sunny day… you just can’t beat it. The best of Italian styling combined with Japanese manufacturing.

The car is a blast to drive with the top down. Which can be done in less than 3 seconds up or down. The sport mode is perfect for tooling along city streets or accelerating up the freeway on ramp. Cruise work’s best most of the time.  As this car can certainly get out of its own way.  I am stopped often by car people asking what kind of car it is as it is beautiful with the red body and black racing stripe.

Puts a smile on my face whenever I drive it.  Owned since new, and never been back to the dealer for more than an oil change.  Quality is top notch.  Very fun to drive.  I'm 6'3" and I've driven this car on several long trips (multiple day journeys) and it's tight but very comfortable.

Like new , garage kept, fun to drive.
This is a great toy to have, it definitely is an eye catcher. Also, the paint is Bianco Perla Tri- Coat White metallic exterior paint with Black interior and many other extra comfort features.

Great performance and looks from a Mazda built, Fiat styled and turbo charged powered
true roadster. Marvelous ride around town!
As good or even better than its sibling Miata.

First, I must say I'm a Porsche Boxster fan, owned several, but they are getting way to expensive so I thought I shop around and I'm glad I did.  True, the Boxster is a powerful little car and the Spider cannot compete in that area, but besides that EVERYTHING else is AWESOME!  The Spider is more comfortable, the ride is smoother, the look is different and no one knows what you driving and driving it in manual mode gives me enough power.  Overall, I'm impressed and don't foresee me trading anytime soon.  Oh, and the price, WOW you get so much for you $$$$.

Purchased this car in April 2021. Had 29000 miles. I love this car! There are not many on the road and Fiat really hit it out of the park with this vehicle. Love the styling and the performance. It handles like a dream. It is a fun car to drive. At it's core it is a Mazda Miata with a Fiat turbo engine and the Fiat styling. Best of both worlds. I have never had a car that people really look at and give a thumbs up while driving. It pretty cool!

We have 91000 miles on our Fiat,  we have had very good service from this car.  Our only 
costs have been normal maintenance.  We bought this car new in 2013.

great runner, and loud. Always started right up. pretty quick. its not as manueravable as a Cooper. Coopers have a multi-link suspension. Fiats have front independent suspension and solid rear axle suspension. Not a track car. But very fun drive.
This is a roomy small vehicle with enough power and excitement to get the job done. it's a head turner at a great price... and the turbo? amazing... I love it

Bought this car 1 year ago. Since then I've spent over $9k on repairs and it just gave me a low engine oil pressure warning, meaning it needs a new engine. For the amount I've spent on this car, including what I'd need to spend to keep it running, I could have gotten a new one. Worst car ever.

Not a sports car by any stretch. Strapping a rocket to a garbage truck doesn't a space shuttle make. Just a slightly above average handling subcompact, that makes a lot of noise, and is very uncomfortable. Abarth means nothing here.

Great little thing for running about town.  Stores, School, etc.  Be advised if  you have Auto Trans and drive two footed.   With one foot on the brake and the other on the gas pedal It may go into a "Limp Mode shut down".  This is a Safety feature brought on by the "Toyota" runaway cars. It's in the owners manual.  To reset, limp to a safe spot and shut down engine and remove key for 5 seconds.  Restart and good to go.   Clean up you driving habits.
Okay, okay the color has a lot to do with it too. I got the "verde" that super cute soft green (I love this color so much that this is my 2nd one)! I get stopped at gas stations

I also own a Ram crew cab and a new Benz. Of all of my cars I own, the Fiat 500e is the most fun to drive especially those everyday trips to the office or shopping. I fold down the rear seat and the hatchback makes loading easy. It accelerate great; very quick and agile. The 500lb battery is located below the axles so it has the stability of a go cart. I used a regular 110volt outlet to charge at first. Now I have a 220v. The range is 80-90 miles. Rarely do I ever drive more than that in a day. Even if it is totally out, I will plug it in when I come home and in the morning it is fully charged. I have had zero problems with this car. The charger got crazy and Fiat let me buy whatever charger I wanted and then they reimbursed me for the full amount; very nice!

Purchased the car used 2 years ago from a private sale. This has been a really nice little car for commuting and around town driving. My commute was 22 miles each way, so on a full charge at 70 mph I would typically get to and fro from work with 30% battery left. The "Guess-O' meter" is useless but you can rely on the percentage of battery left. Around town and short trips I would average 84-90 miles at best. Use of the A/C or heater would typically reduce the range by approx 10 miles. Other than new tires and wipers the car has been faultless. Fun to drive with great pick up and easily charged on a level 2 charger. Traded it in for a bigger pack as my commute is now longer otherwise would have kept it. Would definitely have bought the new 500e if Fiat was still doing business in the States.

I live in San Francisco and thought this would be a fun and cost efficient car to have in the city. The range is a joke, it says 84 miles but it's more like 50 and you need to learn how to drive it in a specific way to extend the mileage or boost energy used to get that much out of it, it's a hassle and a gamble every time I try to drive further than 50 miles. It says it takes 4 hours or so to charge but that's only with the 240v charger which you have to get specially installed in your home or find one in public and it has taken around 5-6 every time I've had to fully charge it. I understood that there would be a bit of an exaggeration but am truly regretting buying this car and am trading it in asap.

Absolutely a wonderful little car. Extremely quick. Fun to drive. It really is best for local driving ,city use or round trip commuting of about 50 miles. 
This vehicle requires ZERO MAINTENANCE!, NO OIL, FUEL, FILTERS! 
The most affordable ev that is practical.  I have put this little car thru its paces i.e. snow,highway,dirt roads, hills and flatout top speed for miles (its limited to 88mph).  Never thought I'd like this car so much.

I got this car in March 2017 from a winning bid on Ebay for $5500, and I must say it's been one of the smartest purchases I've ever made.  Without virtually no maintenance nor gas, this car is the perfect candidate for a commuter and local driver.  In LA where the weather is more temperate I get about 80 miles in the winter and 110 miles in the warmer months.   I top off the charge at home and at work, not unlike charging up your phone whenever you get a chance.  I save easily $1500 a year driving this and it will easily pay for itself many times over.

I've been driving a 500e for my daily commute of 40 miles round trip for the last 18 months. It's fun to drive and surprisingly reliable. It gets the published ranges, but drops significantly when the temperature approaches 0 degrees Fahrenheit. If purchased for $10k or less, it's an extremely affordable way to get from A to B. A loan for $10k for 48 months at +/- $225 month, minus fuel savings of $125 month = $100 monthly expense compared to a car driven 1,000 miles per month at 20mpg. One down side is that the MN DMV uses the original MSRP for calculating annual license fees, which is really high compared to the KBB used average plus they add a $75 EV fee because you're not purchasing fuel and avoiding the state gas tax.
No any single problem with my fiat 500e since 2 years(God bless)

Nemo...our cute orange 500e gives me more joy than any other car we have ever owned. It is zippy, nearly no maintenance needed, really cute and plugs right into a regular outlet in the garage for charging. I was a little concerned about going all electric but I am a convert.

that dislike anything that's not from Japan, and call it "unreliable".  This FIAT 500L has been one of the best cars out of the 50_ that I've owned. Very roomy for a big guy, roomy back seat, versatile cargo area, fun to drive, peppy... I can't say wnough good things about this car. 

It's been everything I could have asked for. These cars are all over the roads in Europe - where there's very few Japanese cars in comparison. European style, attention to detail, practicality, etc. Look at the owners' ratings and reviews and you'll find the truth!

Transmission went out at 116,000, I bought it used at 75,000. Been having transmission issues since I bought it. Shop couldn't find the issue or replicate. Feel that Fiat knows this car has severe issues but rather place the burden on it's costomers. DO NOT BUY.
The motor went out at 70,000 miles and it was going to cost $9464 to replace!! Just had to sell for scrap. It was a cute, fun car while it lasted.

This car is so sporty and quick. It has proven to be tough and agile with an automatic that drives like a stick. Love it's pep and safety features.  It looks small on the outside but does have a lot of interior room for family, recreational gear etc. I've thoroughly enjoyed this car and get compliments frequently. I see more and more on the roads here but accessing service for some needs has been a challenge on an island (not O'ahu). For example, my key FOB is broken and I cannot get it fixed because I would have to ship the car to O'ahu for the computer chip work. Real bummer. But overall this car is FABulous!!

Many options found on much more expensive vehicles. 

Very sporty look and drive. 

Handles well in rain and snow.
Took a hard hit and interior was not damaged at all. All airbags deployed as needed. Does lack additional safety features…
Car is great just expensive for parts especially like if I’m getting an oil change I just wish the parts where easy to find like Honda or Toyota

I wasn’t sure what to expect when I purchased this vehicle 6 years ago, but it has been great. I’ve only had to take it into the shop for regular maintenance in that amount of time. Highly recommend if you’re looking for something dependable that won’t break the bank.

I bought my 500 X new and 11 it. Five years later, I still don’t see another car on the road that I would rather drive. My gas mileage is good, it is the perfect size and I don’t see a ton of others, so I feel special. It’s fast and sporty and perfect!

The hatchback area is small   It has a smooth ride. The Ford  dealership where it was purchased should have set things up on screen but I had to do most of it. Priced way too high. Am wanting to sell it. Have had almost 3 months
Great riding car.   I would purchase again.  Comfortable on road driving with plenty of pep.  We have had other Fiats in the family and this one goes down as the most fun on 4 wheels.
It’s peppy, comfortable and gets great mileage. I will buy an EV version when one is available. Just a perfect car for me and my family.

I purchased my 2016 Fiat 500X in 2019 with only 4000miles on it.  I thought I was the luckiest person in the world.  I purchased a vehicle with everything I wanted.  Leather seats -check. Side mirror- notification of on coming vehicles -check.  Rearview camera assist -check.  Sun roof- check.  Navigation, Call assist, plus many other extras.  Great car, right? WRONG!!!

I found out very quickly what a gas guzzler I purchased.  I have to fill up more often then a person breaths per day.  Then the real problems started.  Then light indicator for all of my lights (day, signal, bright, front, rear, park and interior lights) started cycling through saying that they were out.  At times they would be out and I'd change the bulb, just for them to go again and again and again.  I figured it was an electrical problem so I took it into a Fiat dealership.

They confirmed my suspicions and said, eventually it will affect your brakes and ability to drive.  I see this as a manufacturers problem and it should be recalled.  I asked if there was a recall on the electrical box or whatever the formal name of the problem is.  They said no, and sent me on my way.  They said the part to fix it hasn't been in and won't come in because it comes from China and China isn't sending parts at this time.

Between the $150 per week that I put in this gas guzzler and this whole electrical issue - this car is TRASH.  I'd rather have a basic car with NO frills - ABSOLUTELY NO FRILLS - then this money guzzling vehicle.  This car is a trap...don't fall for it's attractive looks.  Does LEMON mean anything to anyone?  If so, you know what to do...
I have the 500X Sporty and the car is everything I expected it to be and more.   Enjoyable to drive and it has plenty of options that are standard
This was the first new car I ever owned and loved it. Only regular oil changes, a battery, spark plugs and brakes once at 75000. A great reliable car.

This the one I Want. The joining and eventual separation of Bentley and Rolls-Royce followed a series of mergers and acquisitions, beginning with the 1931 purchase by Rolls-Royce of Bentley, then in receivership. In 1971, Rolls-Royce itself was forced into receivership and the UK government nationalised the company—splitting into two companies the aerospace division (Rolls-Royce Plc) and automotive (Rolls-Royce Motors Limited) divisions—the latter retaining the Bentley subdivision. Rolls-Royce Motors was subsequently sold to engineering conglomerate, Vickers and in 1998, Vickers sold Rolls-Royce to Volkswagen AG.
This is the best car I ever owned. It is a special addition - only a few made and available in the USA

The car is super and very nice
Great and reliable car really smooth  and fun to drive on highway and city. Great to go out with your dates.

Did my research and was impressed with the Lincoln Aviator Reserve.  The cabin was extremely comfortable, and well equipped.  However, I didn't drive it.  My significant other did and I was a passenger.  I knew it had the get up and go, since it was a twin turbo with a 6 cylinder.  What I'm not thrilled about it the noise in the cabin.  You can hear the shifting of each gear, and also the vehicle rides stiff.  I think I'm spoiled with my other SUV, which was the large model, instead of the scaled down Aviator.  I keep telling myself I'll get used to it, because I can't even imagine telling my partner, I would like to trade it in for something else. :(  Hopefully I'll get used to it.....
It is a beautiful SUV and I love the 3rd row seating.

From the beginning, had issues with electric windows, camera glitching or completely not working, parking lines disappearing, indoor dome lights coming on and not being able to turn off, wind shield wiper timing off or at times, going full throttle with barely any rain, loose connections, air conditioning not working, had to have entire info center replaced due to glitches, and there is something off about the hood. I've had several luxury suvs and this is the only car where the hood isn't tightly attached to the frame causing the hood to visibly shake when going over 75 mph. It is already not very aerodynamic due to front being bugger but wow, during windy days, I seriously pray as I drive hoping the hood doesn't just rip right off. 

Out of all the luxury cars I've owned and the dealerships I've used, Lincoln is far the worst due to lack of parts, service taking the longest of all dealerships I've dealt with, shortage of loaners, and bad quality repairs. Even the quick trip (whatever it is called) oil is bad. 

It's too bad it has so many issues because it's a beautiful, powerful and very comfortable.

The Aviator black label Grand touring hybrid is the best hidden secret in the SUV world. If you don't drive more then 20 miles to work this will save you a lot in gas. I am getting around 40-45 MPG which this vehicle. Best hybrid on the market for the size and power you get with this vehicle.

Bought it new starting having electronic problems at 12,000. Kept taking in for repair. Ford could not fix the problems and ended up buying the car back but charged me $10,000 for usage which I think was not right!!
This vehicle has beautiful interior and technical features. The one downside is the ongoing recalls (not safety related) requiring it to go in for service for software updates.

This thing is an absolute hunk of junk. The interface is literally nonfunctional and will probably make you crash and die if you try to get it to work. I would rather get around in a horse drawn carriage. A unicycle would be a more luxury experience.
Love this car. So much space for everything. So comfy to ride in. Rides nice, can’t hear anything outside when you’re inside. The perfect family car.

So, I thought it would have been a hoot to get the massaging seats, but inventory being what it is, I didn’t get them. But I got everything else I wanted. Mine’s a Reserve model with AWD. 3.0 twin turbo, not the battery assist model. Still breaking it in, the MPG is 19.5…not horrible, and it’s getting slightly better each ride. What I do like is the comfortable seats (even without the massaging feature) and the quiet ride. It reminds me of a rear wheel drive, full frame luxury vehicle from years ago. It absorbs rough roads great. The great interior and exterior styling is just icing on the cake. No issues requiring service.

UPDATE THIS CAR IS UNBELIEVABLE ITS ON OF THE BEST CARS EVER THAT LINCOLN EVER MADE IN A LONG TIME COMFORT THE RIDE IS AMAZING THE SEATS ARE THE BEST I OWNED MERCEDES S CLASS AND THIS CAR IS BETTER THAN THE MERCEDES AT HALF THE COST DRIVING THIS LINCOLN IS Believing
One of the best cars Lincoln has made comfortable great handling reliability is above if you want a great luxury car this is the one

One of the best cars Lincoln ever made comfortable great ride lots of power fit finish excellent and Lincoln stands behind the car even after the warranty ends shame they stopped making it they had a winner
This is the best Lincoln I have owned they did a exceptional job making this car ride comfortable reliable fit finish handling very impressed hopefully Lincoln Will bring this one back it’s a winner

Super nice, comfortable and stlyish car. Alot of compliments- i have always owned lincoln and believe they are some of the best cars on the road.. i wish they would bring this model back.. as i trade every 2 years
Can’t say a bad thing about the vehicle! The transmission makes the car fun to drive and gives excellent performance!

I have always driven a Lincoln and have been very pleased.  I purchased a 2017 Lincoln Continential  Reserve.  I have to say the comfort, speed, and ride are excellent.  However, this car does not represent the "Lincoln" status.  Maybe it is just mine, luck of the draw, I don't know.

So I have ~ 42,000 miles.  I am completely heart broken:

I replaced the door latches per recall from mfg.  So far I had to pay $ 840 to already replace one, and now another door lock has to be replaced.   

GPS does not work at all.  That went out under 40,000 miles.  I did not take it in right away because I am busy, and never thought it would cost $ 1,200 to repair.  I already spent about
$ 200 for the estimate.  

The radio is psycho.  Delayed, delayed, respone time when changing my preset channels.
Often will preset the station you are trying to change so you have two of the same.

Forget about Apple Play.  iPhone rejected. 

Recently paid $ ~ 450 for projector pump.

BEST FOR LAST:   CATALYTIC CONVERTER BLEW.

THANKS LINCOLN

I bought a 2023 Reserve AWD loaded model (Collection III).  Wow, Lincoln is building remarkable SUVs that seem to be under the radar, probably because the luxury crossover market includes several compelling options. The bottom line is that the Corsair can hold its own against all competitors.  Test drive a higher end trim and see what I mean.  The KBB review nails the vehicle dynamics -- not a sportster but ample acceleration and actually enjoyable to drive. The engine and 8 speed auto seem to work together seamlessly. The large touchscreen introduced for 2023 is impressive and the Revel sound system is fantastic. In addition, the Corsair looks amazing inside and outside.  An outstanding American competitor that is backed by an excellent warranty. Plus, Lincoln is offering very good incentives on the 2023 models left on dealer lots.

I LOVE my Lincoln Corsair Grand Touring (hybrid).  I got 41 mpg and I only charged it at night at home.  When I traveled, or went to work an hour away, I never charged it.  I had it for 8 months and then someone T boned me and totaled my car. The 911 people at the scene were so impressed with how well the corsair protected me.  They see all kinds of cars and accident scenes, but 3 of the 9 emergency personnel came over to talk to me about my car.  All air bags went off.  I am getting another corsair just like my last one.  

So comfortable, sporty, great safety features, and my passengers love the Massagers in the front seats.

This vehicle has been nothing but a headache for me since the day I purchased it.  There are problem after problem causing the vehicle to be in the repair shop just about every month. The car has many problems with the electrical and electronic system. If you want to drive a lemon, purchase this one and you will see.  Don't waste your money on this SUV.  I think a Hyundia will be a much better buy.

I love my 2022 Grand Touring Cosair !
This is my third Lincoln.  I love the Lincoln Brand . My first Lincoln was a MKX , second one was a Nautilus , and now the Grand Touring .
Absolutely no regrets buying this car. 
It fits me like a glove .
I mean literally. So comfortable , not to big , not to small , but just right 🤗surrounded in luxury . Inside and out very sexy ! Love the quietness in the cabin , even on the freeway . I just want to hang out in my car all day listening to my music.  It’s a pleasure to drive . 
This is the absolute best choice for my life style.   I usually stay in my towns area, so almost never exceed the 28 miles of EV.  Simple to charge .  I haven’t had to use any gas , but did try to run it on engine to see how that felt. 
It’s crazy not going to the gas station in the entire month that I owned it . Love coming home and plugging in . Makes me smile every time 😀 
I love getting comments about it . People always comment as we walk up to the car, then when they get in , they cannot believe how spacious it is , back seats are super comfortable and the head and leg room is great for men . 
Simply can’t say enough about this car .

I've own several Cadillacs last one I bought new 2007 SRX. I loved everything about this SUV. Best interior and leather. The Red Carpet Metallic paint is beautiful. Not one issue with driving and extremely comfortable.

This is a Ford Escape’s classier version. Very comfortable seats, great stereo, responsive and fast engine. I get 27.3 MPG with mostly highway driving. 
The collision avoidance is annoying because it reacts if the car in front of you turns off the road, but overall, it works well. I’d gladly buy this car again!

My last car was a Lincoln MKZ. We absolutely loved it and the car never had an issue. As our needs changed, we went for an SUV this time.  We were so happy 
with our Lincoln, we purchased the Corsair. This car has had more issues and all we hear from Lincoln is that the issues can not be recreated. The MKZ had a great GPS- somehow the Corsair does not. It is so frustrating to use and sometimes the GPS just goes “crazy”   Also, the hatchback refuses to open or close at times. Neither the interior release, nor the key nor the outside release work. We are counting the days till this lease is up. No more Lincoln’s for us.

Car is good, beautiful easy to drive lovely to ride in. The only thing I see wrong with this car is the screen is only 8 inches and it needs to be 10 inches. Pretty color I just found one I like better and was interested in knowing what my resale value would be for this car.

I contacted the service department at dealership about concerns about my vehicle I call Mr.Neil about a oil change for past week I never got return calls cause past month sense I took my car for service my car haven’t been driven the same  the time I made a review they don’t reach out about my vehicle anymore

Very nice vehicle, runs well, city and highway miles, frequent oil changes and tire rotations .  Never been in accidents.  Overall the vehicle has been good to me but I would like to sell because it cost to much for me to send overseas.
Only con is auto shut down after 30 minutes. Drives well , has low road noise. Gets good mileage on highway travel. Auto drivers seat in park makes exit / enter easy

Our 2019 Lincoln MKC is the most comfortable and easy to drive car.  It's great looking too.
We're so happy with it.  Can't think of a better car.

After 5 years and 70,000 miles, the hundreds of features that work remotely, automatically and manually have worked perfectly and never have failed even once.  The 2.0 Ecoboost engine is just fabulous.

Not very comfortable. I found it to be small, hard ride and lots of road noise. I’m very disappointed in the mileage. Not what I expected. I never owned an AWD before so I notice a big difference in ride and performance. Not what I expected in a Lincoln since I have had Lincoln’s since 1988. I feel Lincoln has cut a lot of corners and built a very cheaply made auto. Next time I’ll go bigger

There are many things I love about my Lincoln MKC - it's stylish and comfortable, and fun to drive.  But when simple mechanical issues arise, like a dead battery, it is quite a headache to fix. The battery is a slide-in, and the Auto Club cannot help with changing the battery because it involves removing parts of the engine in order to get to the battery. What would be a quick and easy fix for a Ford is a challenge with this car. The one thing that still delights me is the "welcome mat" lighting that projects at the driver's door when you approach the car with your key fob at nighttime. But that's not enough to get past the frustrations of ownership.

I love the color and the light leather interior. When you open door at night, lights up ground before opening door.
Fun to change interior color of lighting.
It’s been a wonderful car. We don’t need two cars anymore.
Very disappointed in gas mileage, upside is it runs on 87, but tank size requires constant gas station stops

We have had the car since 2016, it is my wife's daily driver and our trip car. It is her 2nd one. I love the ride and quietness when we are travelling. She regularly gets 19+ mpg around town, 21+ on the interstate and when I am driving cross country23-25 mpg w/ac on. It does have an aftermarket tuner which was worth approx. 2 mpg on 89 Octane. 

It seems that we have had to have some of the front suspension bushing replace right around 87000 miles on both of her MKT's, which was covered under the warranty on both. Only other repair was the replacement of the steering column, the power adjust quit functioning at the same mileage. Other than those to items, regular maintenance is all it has needed. 

Great car

Am over 60 years old and have owned only new cars.  My 2020 Lincoln MKZ now has 40K miles and never been in the shop for repairs!  Its the car that gets the most "wow" comments from my passengers ever!  Love Love this car If you can find one get it.

The 2018 MKZ Select is a sleeper for the price.  Super comfortable.  Good quality interior.  Hybrid gets 40 MPG if you pay attention.  Good stereo sound.  Perfect for long trips.  One of the best cars I have ever owned.
Good reliable car have had one for years. Dependable with many features I have enjoyed. Have had one for many years sad they stopped production of them. Good performance decent gas mileage.

Although kbb editors try their best to make this car seem, jejune, dont be misguided.  Tho you wont see it on their website for that bias reason, the V6 model of this car is one of the fastest, most powerful sedans made.  Period.  The 3.7L engine is a monster, the tuning is unreal in sport mode, continously damped ride while on the go, handling is incredible for a FWD vessel.  Interior wraps you with amenities and safety components, as well as lane assist, 360 blind spot, self parking, etc.  And with a quick and easy upgrade to the sync3 system and LTE telematics youre connnected to your car anywhere in the world from your smartphone.  Go drive for yourself and report back to kbb about how they are lacking integrity when it comes to their staff, maybe theyll get some real editors in place to give legit information when consumers are dependent on their honesty, or the lack there of as of today.

I own a 2014 Lincoln MKZ. I bought it in 2017 with 22,000 miles. I have driven it on long trips and gotten 40mpg. Regular oil changes & replaced the small battery once. It always starts and runs quietly, which is nice on trips.

I am second owner of 2020 Black Label Long version. After 6 month of ownership, I’m satisfied with everything this vehicle has to offer. I was looking to get Escalade but they were priced very unreasonable so I went for Lincoln. I had no issues so far and family feet perfectly for long trips. I like front seats with heat and massage option, it is very comfortable for me. The only dislike is suspension, I wish it was more smooth and more comfortable. Technology is definitely behind Cadillac or German rivals, but that is why price is not as high.

Very nice car but leaves you scratching your head at some of the ways they threw cheap accessories in to the car. Cup holders are non-existent for being a car that's obviously designed to ferry around kids. We drove a Yukon prior to this and I think there were three cup holders to every one person in it, this one you're lucky to have one cup holder and the middle row barely has access to them since they're on the floor. 

Gas mileage is atrocious but who cares, you drive a Navigator right? Wrong, you might as well reserve your own pump as much time as you'll be spending there.

Incredible vehicle. Comfortable, spacious, smooth and well-appointed. Performs well (mainly mountain driving) for its size. Love it. After several Land Cruisers and MB SUVs, I am happy to have found Lincoln.
Love this SUV! Most comfortable seats and ride we have ever had in a vehicle and this is number 10 and the last one was a Lexus GS 460 suv.

Bought a reserve and it's the whole package!  No problems total luxury and tons of room.  If u are buying the base model you aren't a true lincon fan or deserve a lincoln.  Car does everything but drives its self.

To start off, this vehicle is a wonderful choice if you are looking for these things:
- Adequate space for a family of 5 or more
- A comfortable experience tailored for long trips
- And a small but powerful engine
But for the grand price of $100,000, it lacks features that seem minor but are necessary. Starting off with inside the cabin.
For a 2018, the center console would suffice. But for a 2022, with competitors like the Escalade and GLS, it just feels outdated. The screen just sticks out the dash and the climate/stereo controls look straight out of 2010. However, the full leather dash and wood in front and next to you is unlike anything other. The Revel audio system is very nice, substantially better than Escalade's AKG system. Lincoln's SYNC 4 infotainment system also isn't that bad. Responsive enough and easy to navigate. During the summer days it can get kind of sluggish in the heat, and sometimes freezes up for a couple seconds. The seats are great. The 30-way adjustment is a little gimmicky, as 6 of those ways are just lumbar support, but the leg support and bucket adjustability tailors directly to both the driver and passenger. Moving on to the second row, it's spacious and comfortable. Not as comfortable and adjustable as the first row, but it's very good for a second row. I would say that the captains chairs with the center console is worth the upgrade. The heated, ventilated, and massaging second row makes you feel like an executive inside a Maybach, but the screen is rather tiny. There is also an ABUNDANCE of gloss black plastic around the screen, we've had the vehicle for less than a year and it's already scratched up. The third row is just a third row. It's just as spacious as the second row being able to fit full-sized adults comfortably. It also has buttons to recline just a bit, but besides that there's not much to add. You also may not want to recline, as even for being such a big vehicle, it lacks some cargo space.
Moving on from the interior, the engine itself is very powerful. A 3.5L ecoboost turbo-charged to a whopping 440 horsepower. It also sounds pretty good on the outside while maintaining silence on the inside. The steering is light and very sharp for such a big vehicle, and the suspension swallows any sharp bumps on the road. The body styling itself is not much different from the 2018, 2019, 2020, and 2021. Besides the changes to the rear with new taillights, it's identical to the prior years. In my opinion, the Navigator is more elegant looking than the competitors, with the Escalade looking aggressive and the GLS looking ugly (in my opinion.) Another thing to add is to NOT buy this car new. Bought it not even a year ago for just over $100,000. Now it's lost almost $20,000 dollars in value.
TLDR;
Pros - Comfortable. Spacious seating. Powerful engine. Satisfactory luxury in both first and second rows.
Cons - Somewhat outdated. Abundance of gloss plastic on the optioned second-row center console. Lack of cargo space. Depreciates a lot despite being practically brand new.
This sound system best seating best massage best of all get the black label you'll never be disappointed blows away all the other competition.

This Car is just as fast as my 69 GTO. but more fun to drive and more comfortable.
2 litre four cylinder turbo and all wheel drive.  could not get stuck in the winter snow up here.  This car has given me no problems other than normal maintenance.  Tires Oil changes and brakes. Original brakes made it to 90K at which time the rear rotors were shot. Front rotors still OK. the car gets about 32 to 35 on the highway and about 25 around town. the autostart feature is annoying at times. but is easily defeated. MY wife and I share the car and the seats and mirrors automatically adjust depending on whose Key fob is closest to drivers seat. Best newer car I have ever owned

I have owned a lot of fast cars including Corvettes over the last 50 years. In my younger years we used to race and build engines for drag racing.This is the first car I’ve ever had that I did not want to make it go faster. If you stick your foot in it hang on.

This car never disappoints. It’s chassis is the best I have ever experienced. Most  so called “high end sports cars” can’t compete in the corners and straight line. It always amuses me to see a bewildered M or AMG owner’s look after the car demonstrates its superiority. The power is awesome and not even the OEM Michelin Pilot SS’s can always handle it. Carbon fiber package a must!  I really can’t understand why someone who is really a true performance care enthusiast would buy one of these other overpriced imports other than for the status. If you are buying those for the name than you don’t know performance/value. The value is just incomparable. Best in class!
Performance, comfort, style are all excellent! Better than BMW M3
The ATS-V has the performance of a Corvette with the comfort of a Cadillac.  I have had this car 3 years and it continues to bring me joy.

This car is the finest machine I know of for less than 80K$. It does what I expect it to do without any surprises or disappointments. The tire/road noise comes through. I changed tire brands and the noise was reduced 40%. Tire ware is related to how the vehicle is driven. The back seat entrance and exit is extremely cumbersome. Ye deal with it on the rare occasions it is necessary. 'Safety' straps for the front do not disengage for ready access to the rear seat as they should/could - not user friendly as the rest of the car seems to be! The rear seat and foot room is only slightly larger than the 2 door Mercedes which isn't much. To get the most out of the CUE I had to really read the book. The CUE tries to offer too much! I have always owned performance and luxurious cars and this is truly a good one. I am pretty old and speaking from experience.

I have driven performance automobiles for most of my 43 years of driving.  This one offers the best overall balance
of comfort, handling, braking and acceleration.  I have installed high flow air filters in the stock air box and what a difference it made.  This car will literally fly.
I have the 8 speed auto after owning manuals for the last 10 years, this is the only way to go for maximum acceleration.  Puts a grin on my face every time I drive it.  Only way to buy one of these is used, depreciation is horrific the first 2 years so bought a low mileage 2016.

Great seats, comfortable interior, have no problem working CUE, strong AC, love the adjustable driving mode setting on the fly.  Dont know what more you could ask for, if you need more room move up to the V sport.  Tried that one as well but the center console takes up too much of the room between the seats but it has a bigger back seat and trunk.  The engineers that designed this car were car guys.

Get in, be quiet, and hold on!!! This is Vehicle nirvana! From the first moment the V six fires, and the exhaust cackles you know this is gonna be fun. The Recaro seats are set, the wheel adjusted, mode set to Track, mash the go button and you are propelled instantly forward!  My 97 Viper GTS has 450hp and 490 lbs of torque and this car has the same exhilarating acceleration dynamics. The eight speed transmission shifts crisply. Nice accurate feed back from the steering wheel. The interior is well appointed, cut and sew I think Cadillac calls it. Ergonomics are very good, everything is where it needs to be to enhance the driving experience. I especially like the the head light dance when the vehicle is started. CUE is the only low note in an other wise well directed symphony of Engineering excellence. I really have no adjectives that fully express my thoughts and experience with this car except, "AWESOME"! Cadillac really did a fine job engineering this World Class Sports Sedan/Coupe!

You're gonna want to set in the seat, height can be an issue especially if you're looking for a sunroof. If you're comfortable with the room give the back a good look, because I'd you're 6' or more there's  NOT much room in the rear other than perhaps 2 baby seats. This 4 series blackwing is so perfect, great design, great lines, and other than the little trim piece on the front seats it's harder for anyone that's never heard of a blackwing until all they can see is your tail lights. Case in point I made a GT Mustang owner wet his/her/them/they just a few days ago, so yea I stand on the title Beautiful and the Beast. Also I get alot of looks and positive comments just on the color alone. Now I had a 23 corvette on order for 30 months and as soon as I took delivery of this blackwing I went straight to stingray Chevrolet and changed my color, now they've changed the name one is Rapid Blue, the other is Electric Blue 💙 but side by side they're the same and still I get the positive comments in both, they also share red calipers and red seat belts.
Great car 4 door Porsche 911, handles like a race car, rides like a luxury car , beautiful to look at

The car looks great! But falls way short in every other way! Performance, and comfort is seriously lacking! Absolutely no room for a passenger in the back seat! There is a strong smell of glue or plastic that air fresheners can’t mask.. the engine is loud, it doesn’t sound like a premium luxury vehicle!  Wish I never bought this car!
This car is a great pro former!! It accelerates with much vigor. Braking is excellent. Interior needs work however
It is my baby.  Before this vehicle, a car was a car.  I enjoy everything it offers.  Peppy, stylish, luxurious & smooth.
I have the Luxery model. Now I want the V! This is the most addictive car I have ever driven. The corners at 45, the strong acceleration.... My tag should state CASKET!
great  gas mileage , easy to drive , a lot of gauges for information purposes, however wish the CT4  had a spare tire despite it self sealing tires . Otherwise excellent  vehicle

I've owned my 2021 CT4 for 2 months and get compliments on it wherever I go. Beautiful body design, sharp two tone interior, fun to drive. I have the Luxury AWD with the sun/sound package and winter package... and my only disappointment is the seats aren't leather and there is no accent lighting in the interior. These should be basic to Cadillac who is known for luxury, and for a $40,000 vehicle...the next model up has this for $6,000 more...but Toyota and Honda give you leather seats and interior lighting for less than $30,000. I basically love the car, but Cadillac, i feel you cheaped out on the seats and interior atmosphere

1. comfort is superb.  lots of room, and great seats.  good legroom in rear.  love the open pore wood and leather
2. utility is OK - trunk a bit small but enough for the 2 of us.  fold down rear seats make it easier to load larger items.
3. Drive is more than enough for me - and probably for most people.  4 cyl turbo provides power when needed and is miserly on gas.  suspension a bit soft, but a welcome improvement from overly harsh CTS this car replaces.  Overall good handling. 
4. value for money cannot be beat.  much less expensive than most other makes - I don't feel like I paid a premium for the logo.  
5. reliability.  Bought in Aug 2022.  No issues in first 9 months. Cadillac service is great - dealer picks up the car and returns it.  
6. Sound system is magnificent.  Best ever!!
7. cons: a) I like my car paint to be close to the colour of dried slush.  not available on this model.  
b) I would like more adjustments available re suspension.
c) trunk size
d) massage seats not available on 4cyl.  also could not option the sedona leather.  (Do massages require more power)
8.  Final comment - FWIW:  I read lots of car reviews.  Most, IMHO are written by wannabe race drivers and folks who have unrealistic expectations.  On a value-for-money scale this car cannot be beat in the lux segment.
It has more power than i thought it would have and I have gooten as high as 36 mpg with my AWD CT5 Luxury.  Rides nice, handles well, love it so far with 21000 miles

I own a 2020 ct5 sport, I would recommend this car. The first thing that turbo charged 4 cylinder engine has more than enough power to move this car. Performance shift mode that automatically engages when need for fast acceleration. Comfort 5 out of 5 driver and passenger seat are equipped with lumbar massage and extended seat. Comfort driver floorboard for legs and feet to be comfortable while driving. Car is equipped with a Bose performance audio system which is mind blowing and pleasure to the ears. I have had the car out in the snow once to test the snow mode and it's wonderful car gears lower which prevents sliding around and combined with awd handling is great. Sport mode on clear roads performs great high speed curving and handling is a 10 out of 10. Very reliable dependable car its a joy to own and drive.
This CT5 V is incredible.  The engine preforms and sounds great!  Very luxurious, with the platinum pkg.

I have a Premium Luxury with the V6 Engine.  My last car was a CT4 with a 2.0.  

The V6 is GREAT.  My car has most options, but oddly no sunroof.  I guess this helps out with the headroom in the back.  i have seen complaints about the trunk space, it's not a problem in the least.

A MUST is the Bose sound system.  Cadillac's "premium" sound system is not good enough.  I waited for the V6 to come on the lot, they had 4 of them.  It looks particularly good in White and Black.

I would buy it again.

This car has a great ride and driving  feel. Premium components. Amazing ride. 
Would buy again and again.

I ordered this vehicle in Oct of 2021 and took delivery April 2022 due to the chip shortage. Let me just say it was worth the wait! I absolutely love this Cadillac! I have the bigger engine 3.0 V-6 and there’s plenty of power and the ride is excellent. Very smooth and handles very well in traffic. Premium Luxury gave me all the options I could want including a 15 speaker Bose system. If you’re in the market for an awesome luxury car look no further! The CT5 has everything you’d want!

I've been riding in my mom's Cadillac's since the late 80's.  It's 2022 and she still has her 2001!  I never ever thought about owning a Cadillac. My most recent ownership included two BMW 750Li's and my last car was a Mercedes CLS550.  While these cars had more horsepower, I don't feel "punked" in this caddy!  I have the CT5 Sport with several added packages including tech, lighting, Brembo (red) v performance brakes and more. The styling is amazing inside and out.  It's very roomy which I enjoy as my CLS550 had a tight cabin especially in the rear. This CT5 is fun to drive and consistently turns heads everywhere I go.  Cadillac hit it out of the park with this one!

The styling is superb. The handling is amazing. The 3.0TT engine holds up against any luxury vehicle. The technology that this car has outperforms most 2024 model cars.
My ONLY negative is the transmission has what cadi owners call a "shutter", when cold. The trans will hesitate, then engages. It only happens occasionally when it is cold. It is more annoying and embarrassing.

I purchased a 2020 cadillac ct6 premium luxury with 30k miles on it with certified warranty I am in love with this car I've done alot of research on this vehicle and it just does not disappoint in any aspect of the car I probably pain 3k over what I should but it was well worth it by far everything is easy and the super cruise is excellent. No complaints from me here buy one you'll see...

I LOVE DRIVING THIS CARE-PEOPLE STOP AND ASK ME ABOUT THE CAR--THEY LOVE ITS LOOKS--WHEN I TELL THEM ITS NOT MADE ANYMORE -THEY ARE AMAZED. I HAVE THE 2019 TWIN TURBO WITH 404 HORSEPOWER AND HOPE THIS CARE WILL LAST AS I HAVE ONLY 20000 MILES ON HER.
Best car I ever owned . Now with 90,000 miles and never a problem . The 30 miles per gallon ( highway ) isn’t to shabby either . 😊😊😊

1. The car has the following features: NiteVision (Infra-red), Heads-up-display, 4 wheel steering, magnetic ride control, AWD, and every safety feature you can imagine (including a direct-camera rear view mirror, all kinds of crash and pedestrian avoidance warnings and actions, birds-eye view and even a camera with a flash card so you can record what is going on around your vehicle ..possibly to use for proof that you did not do something improper??)
2.) The car looks great, is big, comfortable and shows high quality in workmanship.
3.) It has plenty of power (0-60 in <6 seconds) for safe entry/merge onto highways, passing etc.  Definitely at the top of cars I have owned as a highway "star" (as good as my BMW 740 iL, etc.)
4.) My dealer picks the car up for service and drops off a loaner (no charge) and then brings the car back when service is complete.  Eazy-peazy.
NOW, the reason I mentioned "older driver" in the title is that the Heads-Up-Display, Infra-Red Night Vision (great for Seattle's hills and curves at night), tight turning radius and better curve-hugging from the 4-wheel steering, AWD for our wet/rainy roads, as well as all of the safety-net features help compensate for the slightest decline in reaction rates, less acute night vision etc.

I was also fortunate to NOT get one of the CT6's (and I do know they exist as I have been a regular on the GM and Cadillac message boards) with a herky-jerky transmission.  My hunch is that an issue as several have described like that would be infuriating.  However, when I was looking for a new car to replace my trusty Bimmer, this was the ONLY car that had the combination of all of the features I noted in my first point.  Normally I buy new cars every 3 years, but I do not see any car out there that I would consider an upgrade in any way, shape or form from what I already have, a pearl White CT6 (and it has built-in TV screens on the seat headrests so my grandkids can watch DVDs while we take trips!!) Can't get much better than that!
THE CAR IS AWESOME CLICKS ALL BOXES EXCEPT THE 20' WHEELS. NEEDS  18' WITH SIDEWALL.ALREADY BENT A WHEEL. NEEDS BIGGER TIRE LOW PROFILE ADD NOTHING AND MAKE BUMPS WORSE EVEN WITH AMAZING RIDE.

Love the car. Best sedan ever for me. Smooth ride, quiet, good mileage, and lots of leg room in front and back seats. Don't know why Cadillac dropped this premium car. My car is the Platinum version and has many amenities, including front and back message, rear seat adjustment, rear and front video, and blu-ray DVD player. Articulated turn is quite nice. Also, I like the adaptive cruise, although super cruise is vastly superior. The bird's eye and obstacle avoidance feature is most attractive in tight places or just backing up. Many other features makes this car a luxury in every sense of the word. Unfortunately, Cadillac does not have a comparable replacement sedan for this exceptional car.

I LOVE THIS CAR AS WELL AS OTHERS WHO HAVE COME UP TO ME AND SAY THEY LOVE THE LOOKS. THEY THEN ASK ME ALL ABOUT THE CAR AND SOME WANT TO GET ONE. I HAVE ALWAYS HAD SPORTS CARS BUT THIS IS GREAT AS A FAMILY CAR AND WITH OVER 400HP IT IS A WOLF IN SHEEPS CLOTHING AS I CAN GET OFF THE LINE AND DO 0 TO 60 IN UNDER 5 SECONDS. I HIGHLY  RECOMMEND THIS CAR AND I NAMED IT CHRISTINE AFTER THE MOVIE
