The power is linear and smooth, the ride is firm but compliant. Steering is a bit vague on center but overall very, very nice.  I honestly love this car! The exhaust modes Modify with the driving mode you pick. Rear leg room is great as is passenger comfort. You can cruise all day and not get fatigued. I just wish Cadillac didn’t stop production of this car. They finally get something right and then cancel it.

Very comfortable, roomy, fun to drive delight. Oh yes, screamingly quick,AWD, all wheel steering makes it park like a mid size. Great sound system. On a trip got 26 MPG, can cruise all day. The 550HP hand built engine sounds great. As nice as S class, but priced like an E class. If you can find one, buy it.

Too many gadgets.  Too many settings.  Have to turn off engine stopping at red lights every time you start the car.  Stupid idea.  Way too much money.  So far I have little things wrong, nothing major.  Hard to get this car.

Owning a Cadillac was my dream. I bought this car used with 24,000 miles. Beautiful to look at. I had 2 main issues. First, the transmission. It was jerking speeding up and slowing down. I researched and apparently their is a class action lawsuit over this 8 speed transmission. Second,  I had the 4 cylinder and was getting 11 mpg!  I admit that was mostly in town, but that's really not good and I babied it. I lost all confidence and traded it in for something new. I no longer dream of having a Cadillac.

This is one of the best handling sedans there is.  The magnetic ride control is awesome.  The interior is really nicely equipped with plenty of "automatic" controls.  There are three drawbacks to this car.  One is that the brakes tend to warp; the paint chips easily; and the other is the Pirelli run-flats.  The latter tires are hard as rock and if you hit a pothole, chances are the tires will pop.  I've gone through 3 tires in almost 1.5 years.  Finally went and replaced all four with Continental DWS6.  And the brakes have a tendency to warp.  Decided to go with aftermarket (slotted, drilled rotors with ceramic pads) and that solved the warping.  Once again, a great handling car, with terrific balance, AWD, and let's not forget the absolutely fabulous Bose sound system.

There’s one thing I don’t like about the car that I have to use premium gas. Other than that the car is amazing. The ride is fantastic. The stereo system is amazing. The look is fabulous. There are too many things I can say about this vehicle. That is so amazing you’ll have to drive it to believe it
it is a used care that looks new and has plenty of power.  Roomy and nice interior.  excellent on long trips.
A lot of compliments.  A lot of people would like to own it. Very few issues to be 2014 module year.

This car was bought new on special order.  I paid cash for the car.  This car has been garaged since it was new.  I have it detailed every couple of weeks.  This has been a great car, requiring little mintainence.  I assume because of the low mileage (25,806).   It has special chrome wheels which I added shortly after purchase.  In my opinion the chrome wheels makes it a very sporty car.  This only thing it is lacking is a sunroff.  This was intentional because the way they install sunroofs these days, allows the sun to still come through the top fabric even though it is closed.  I love this car and my only reason I'm thinking to maybe sell it or trade it in is to buy a new car for the upgrades in technology.

I was 71when I bought this car and, as such, needed a car with protection features as well as ride, performance and handling.  It has the forward collision alert that is unmistakably activated when you're too close to the car in front of you; but, that is not all. It handles remarkably well and corners precisely.  It's fast also.  A Cady, a rep told me that his friend remarked that this car was faster than his Camaro!  Now, all of that said, it only has 26,750 miles on the OD and the only thing that I have done to this car w/r to upkeep is change the oil, add 2 new front tires and a new battery which, by the way, is located in the trunk to keep it cool so that the heat from the engine doesn't degrade it faster.  (Someone at GM was thinking!)  I have compared this ride with a G70 and G80 and it rides better w/r to road noise and comfort.  On acceleration, it will give the G80 a run for its money!  With the Premium Luxury Edition, there's plenty to like on the inside.   Would recommend this to anyone, not just the elderly, seeking the qualities just mentioned above.

I have owned a Fully loaded 2011 CTS V6, a 2015 CTS 2.0 Turbo and currently own a Premium RWD Luxury 2019 CTS 2.0 Turbo. I have absolutely loved driving these cars over the last decade.  The sporty handling, tightness of the suspension and fantastic acceleration make it a very fun car to drive. I do love most everything about the body style other than the rear design ends up with a few blind spots and the interior is pretty tight for anyone over 5'9".
Unfortunately this will be my last Cadi for a long while. The current line up leaves me wanting much more. They all look like Chevys with a Cadi badge placed on them. I don't want an Implala, I want a Cadillac.

After owning a 92 Allante, a 2005 Deville, 2011 CTS, 2015 CTS and my 2019 CTS I will be moving on to another brand. Hope someone at Cadillac sees this.

4 door Z06 sedans.

Outstand power, ride, room ,comfort.


4 door?  What else can you ask for?


Most people never get rid of these, and those who do regret doing so.

ULTIMATE DRIVING MACHINE
comfort, speed, 28mpg hwy. owned since 2016
an outstanding performer for sure

Extremely comfortable for daily driving. An absolute terror when you want it to be. Car is extremely powerful and not for an average person. It can easily get away from you if you turn of all the safety features. If you don't, the car is very smart and can correct your mistakes.
this car is awesome , chris who writes 10 reviews does not even own one , he was driving a 2005 gto ,, ctsv is not your dads car , it has all the power and looks to boot

I've owned Corvette, Viper and the CTSV, 2019. I love this car, it flows so well in traffic and power is effortless.  0-100 so fast, with no effort, daily driving is a pleasure, change to sport mode and the shocks stiffen up, throttle response is modified. It's truly a fun beast of a car to drive, and the front end styling is awesome.  Rear shocks replaced under warranty, that's it.  Driven daily.

Folks, when you read these I bought this 2016 CTS Vsport Premium in June of 2019 with 32,000 miles, and as of this writing (June10 2022) I the miles are up to about 46,500.  
Also, the Vsport was $20,000 cheaper. This car is pure joy to drive! Though not as powerful and well known as the V, the 420HP Turbo V6, with 430 lb-ft of torque, is more than my level of driving skills can manage, and it has almost all of the other features of the V.  As a premium model, all the comfort features are there too.  The chassis is the same as the V, with all the aluminum in the same places, the electronic limited slip differential, 8 speed auto/manual tranny, plus all of the driving and traction and ride controls, that can be turned off.  I did that once and floored it, causing instant wheel spin at 45-50 mph, with the resulting fishtailing. I guess the car was scared,  because a message popped up on the display saying in essence, "Don't do that above 30 MPH because it is too dangerous!". I had to laugh but.  This car is a joy to drive in any setting road or track, but I never have to use all of its power, because only a slight goose of the throttle brings on an immediate downshift and off you go like a shot.

There is not a vehicle on the market that will give the power and versatility for under $100k. The performance is similar to that of 2 seater sports cars. But it’s a 4 door sedan. With 640hp and massive braking system i have not found a car more fun to drive. I laugh at my friends who spend on $300k Ferrari or Lamborghini. This car has similar performance for a fraction of the price and a fraction of the maintenance.

Soon these car's will be heading to the junkyard as cash for clunkers. LOL.. Bad gas mileage. To many things go wrong with these car's. Transmission is not good. Resale value is terrible. Walk away from these car's.

I own a 2023 Escalade , runs great handles well , but rear windshield in tailgate RATTLES so bad , and gm have not been able to fix it , I’ve own Denali's and have had no issue with them , but Escalade, a few issues like front bumper sensors so sensitive and have made very sudden stops, I will trade it in soon as new denalis are available .

Its hit or miss on this vehicle, we have been having issues with the check engine light coming on since we bought it. Have taken it to two dealers including the one we bought it from and they cant figure it out. We are filing a claim with GM to buy this thing back.

I absolutely love my Escalade. I am sold and my next automobile purchase will be a new Escalade .The only thing that I do not like about it is that on my 2021 model I do not have Blindspot alerts, which I find kind of strange, but that is the only thing that I do not like over the whole vehicle.

The newly re-designed Cadillac Escalade is solid in performance and reliability. This beautiful SUV has surpassed all expectations. Technologically advanced, available features make operating the vehicle fun and easy. We have had no issues with our vehicle, and enjoy driving it at every opportunity. The rear seat entertainment center is a lot of fun, and back seat passengers can send details and directions to the driver as needed. We receive a lot of compliments. Highly recommend!
Perfect car to pass on.  Drives like a dream and has no issues.  No scratches/dents/or other discrepancies.  I am not selling real estate so looking to downsize.
this can basically trash the lincoln navigator just because of it's tech. this truly is cadilac from the future.
Most important for the 2021 Escalade its a Diesel Engine, its amazing for this huge car . In the city economy 20-21 highway 26-27

Beautiful head turning Suv but alot of things are just poorly put together: rear subwoofer grill rattles and does not fit right, headliner was not clipped in all the way. Dash trim pieces not mounted enough, easily popped out. Rear seat pocket panels fall off when pullin out things from pockets. Super cruise is lousy and wonders from side to side when in lane. Diesel is economic but a little loud, gas motor has worse fuel efficiency then previous body style escalade with same v8

We bought the SUV for luggage capacity mostly, in addition to the luxury ride. It ran good for a long, but around 135k miles started a clanking noise underneath. We thought it was loose exhaust or something. But soon realized it was at a certain speed and rpm. Which meant a certain gear. Cadillac dealership confirmed it. So had it replaced. Since then, all good again.
The main thing I feel it should have had better, is the backing camera. It's just bad. Especially at certain sun angles. My $100 dash cam (with a second rear camera) has better video quality. 
Also want to mention, the mag ride is just okay. I think it may have improved in the newer models, but this earlier implementation is average. Highway travel is good, but on bumpy gravel road, it's brutal. 
Would I buy another Escalade. For sure! This is already my second. Owned a 2005 ESV before. Totaled it in 2011.

We still have our 2015 with 128,000 in 2023. Knock on wood no issues whatsoever other than the gel cracking in the Nav screen when it got to -10 degrees last winter. We purchased an aftermarket gel free replacement. This is a vehicle my husband and myself love equally. He loves the engine and the fact that it can do everything his pickup can do: we can tow our boat, our atv, etc. It drives smooth and has plenty of room for him and our kids who are all around 6 foot 3. Love the safety and convenience features and the premium sound. Will be looking into trading for the newer model soon as we’ve been so impressed with this one.

There is no better more recognizableLarge SUV on the market. Smooth shifting transmission at all speeds with plenty of power. Well designed  Inside and out. Climate control a letter to overcomplicated with rare controls. Would not get 22" wheels due to hard ride.

Our 2015 Escalade Premium has been a dream to own!  Literally, gas, oil changes, brakes, and tires, is what we've done with it over the last 6 years that we've owned it.  We currently (Dec 1, 2022) have 72,000 miles on it.
Excellent vehicle with great technology, ride, power, and room. Gets 20  mpg on flat roads. Have had no significant issues

My previous vehicle was an Aston Martin, both vehicles are beautifully made and are tops at doing what they do.  Both a pleasure to own.  Treat them well and service on schedule and they are worry free.  I keep my vehicles for 10 to 12 years.
Awesome vehicle.. great ride very well balance. Handle great. Great for a vacation trip . Very comfortable seating
Very nice would love to have this car and take it on trips and vacations with my family and friends!

Dedication to Innovation! Don't let the dealership not deliver on it's obligations. Just remember this, Cadillac through General Motors, stands behind the vehicles and various products they make. The dealerships are only concerned with their bottom line. Be prepared to shop for best overall vehicle pricing & service specials.

4000 trouble free miles on our 2024 Lyriq Sport.  September build date and we have not been back to the dealership for any issues.  There is a learning curve but once you figure everything out, its a blast to drive.  Great fit and finish, smooth turbine like drive.  We installed the Ultium ChargeUp Level 2 charger and it's great;  no more stopping at gas stations.  Come home, plug in and you are ready for another 300 miles of easy driving.  The Ultium battery platform is going to be used on other GM and Honda cars, plus Cadillac has a generous warranty for confidence driving.

Great Car and an accurate review in my opinion.  Initial models had some new production glitches but ours has been trouble free with 4,000 miles in 4 months- we’ve not been back to the dealership.  Ours was built in Sept 2023. The Ultium battery platform is being used in other GM and Honda products,  it will only get better as they continue to fine tune its capabilities.
There is a learning curve that could sometimes be confused with the car not operating properly.   Highly recommend that you take the credit and install a level 2 charger at home.  It’s great to not go to dirty gas stations anymore - pull in, plug in and the next day you have another 300+ miles of seamless, turbine like driving.

I have had my vehicle 5 months now, 3000 miles and never an issue or concerns.  Ride is comfortable of course, the power of car is incredible and you must pay attention to your acceleration as the speed increases quickly. 
One pedal driving is my preferred way to travel - love it.  The super cruise is fun and you have no option but to pay attention, it is amazing the car will change lanes and keep safe distances far better than a person.  I still like to have control of my vehicle but use a way to experience the car and driving on a whole different and what the future will look like.
I have zero complaints - no worry as I have installed a level 2 charger, which I turn power off when not in use so no worries on an electrical fire.  It charges fast and convenient.
Love it!!
Very impressed with the beauty inside and out! The amazing power is incredible! I love never going to gas stations!

The car has standout exterior beauty and a high tech interior that may be a bit challenging to some. It is exceedingly quiet and the dual motor version is very responsive. The primary problems we experienced were generally related to the software and infotainment system which I regard as symptomatic of a new car still in its infancy. We also had problems with the radio reception which were cured with replacement parts. The only continuing disappointment we have involves the wireless phone charger: GM confirmed that it does not work with IPhone 14 and higher IOS versions. Keep in mind that GM has announced that they will no longer support Apple CarPlay and Android Play in Lyriq 2025 and later model years.

The Lyriq is a beautiful vehicle that would be perfect in every way if it were safe or reliable. In our opinion, it is neither. Our Lyriq has the driver assist package, arrived to us with parts missing, and started having major failures (battery fault, trunk door stopped working, etc.) within 1000 miles of driving it. In the four months we have owned the car, it has spent over 30 days in service. 

The Lyriq's driver assist software is not reliable, and regularly fails or is out of service. Our Lyriq's adaptive cruise control and emergency collision avoidance have had two major failures that almost caused a crash each time they failed (NHSTA Safety Issue ID 11547432). After each failure, we took our Lyriq to be serviced, those failures were verified by Cadillac (in other words, we didn't make them up), and we were assured after each failure that our vehicle was safe. That has been false every time. After having our vehicle throw itself in park while we were driving because of a glitch, we are terrified of this happening again. 

When we purchased our vehicle, we were told that all of our software would be updating over the air. This is not true. Per the service technician at Michael Stead Cadillac in Walnut Creek, California, the Lyriq is not capable of over the air software updates for anything beyond the infotainment system, and all major updates that affect the safety and functionality of the car must be done by a dealership. These updates can take days to weeks to address, and impact major systems in the vehicle, including, but not limited to, emergency calling, emergency braking, and the driver assist system. Those features are unable to function without those updates, and the updates occur on almost a weekly basis. Our vehicle is essentially unusable. It would be our recommendation you do not purchase this car.
31000 miles bought new  great car need to trade for larger car garage kept. Cleaned reg. No children

This Cadillac looks very nice and sporty. The ride is comfortable and the interior is very nice, even though there is a little more road noise than I thought it would have when driving it. The transmission is the main turn off when it comes to this particular model. When moving at 10-20 miles per hour the car jerks and the transmission clunks when gears change. I have taken it in to get checked and the result is that there is nothing wrong with it.

There are so many disappointments with this car. The brakes are not nearly powerful enough. The suspension is way too soft and floaty which significantly effects performance in a negative way. There is a lot of torque steer from the front wheels when accelerating in 2wd mode. At about 26,000 miles, the entire computer system shut down leaving the car un-driveable. At 30,000 miles, the condenser for the air conditioning system seaized and filled theh entire system with shrapnel.

I can't wait to get rid if this car.
If the looks and options don't get you the handling will! 9 speed transmission shifts like butter, you never feel it! By far the best SUV out there!

Looks great! Nice interior. Short wheel base makes for a rough ride on bumpy roads. Serious blind spots on both sides of front windshield. Typical of design engineers who never road in one...smile.  Engine has plenty of power. Leather seats very comfortable.  Good vehicle for one or two people.

Before I sat in this car for the first time I thought it would be cramped inside but it's very spacious, I'm very tall and found a comfortable driving position right away.  There's lots of space inside and the interior in general feels premium, visibility is quite good and the upholstery is impressive.  Fit and finish is pretty good, this car isn't just an uplevel Chevrolet, it genuinely feels premium.  I have the base stereo but it still rocks.  Passengers have remarked on how nice it is inside, especially with the panoramic sunroof.  Cargo room is good.  I wouldn't say this car is fun to drive, it's perfectly adequate getting from point A to point B.  The turbo four cylinder is pretty responsive.  Overall I'm very pleased with this car.

No regrets!  Handles great!  Looks phenominal.  Better fuel mileage than I thought.  Very smooth quiet ride.  Excellent sound system and every other tech gadget you can get in a 2022!
A real keeper.

Smitty was my salesperson. He was sp helpful. The dealer was great. Findlay Cadillac is great to work with.

My QUE system went out at 13 months. The dealership paid for the repair.

I have had my XT5 3 years and love it! Sharp looking and a smooth ride! Zero mechanical issues. Maintenance costs very reasonable. Gas mileage has been excellent! 24-38 mpg. Purchased used with 36,000 miles. Initially used to commute 100 miles daily round trip but retired 10 months later. We live in a rural area with black top roads that do not get thoroughly snow plowed in the winter. AWD has never let me down! Plan to purchase another later model in the future!
This is a nice vehicle for anyone who likes luxury but doesn't want to spend a fortune. There is plenty of room for my son in his carseat in the second row.
This car has been reliable and safe for my family. I would recommend this car to other people in need of a spacious SUV in this category.

I really like the independent suspension and how smooth and quiet my 2018 XT5 Luxury rides. Long trips don't seem as long anymore because it's so enjoyable to drive. The rear view camera with bumper side views are so helpful when backing out of parking. The rear view mirrors with traffic indicators and lane change warning add confidence during freeway driving. Our ultra sized sunroof has been a pleasant surprise. We have been more than pleased with our XT5.
XT5 SPORT—Perfect for highway and city driving with a variety of driving modes and plenty of luxury features.

Stylish, drives well, strong reliable V6 engine, takes regular gas and good safely features. The crossover should come standard with rear view mirror camera due to poor visibility and rear collisions reported check Carfax report. The cabin is not as isolated as it should be for a luxury vehicle due to no skid or splash guard to protect engine and reduce road noise. I also noticed underneath the dashboard it could be better insulated. Finally the floor mats appear to small and cheap.

I'VE COMPLETED TWO SEARCHES TO FIND MY CAR'S VALUE AND ALL I KEEP GETTING IS OFFERS AND TRADE INS.  I'VE COMPLETED THE SEARCH STEP BY STEP AND STILL HAVE NO CAR VALUE.  PLEASE STOP ALL OF THE BS AND JUST GIVE THE CUSTOMER INITIALLY WHAT THEY'VE ASKED FOR.

1GYKNFRS5KZ140247. This car has been totaled due to an accident. But we had many issues with it and it was purchased brand new with 76 miles on it. Windows would all be open when we would come out in the morning. none of the airbags opened when I was struck by another SUV and totaled the car. adaptive cruise control automatically would turn off while driving on the hwy. think twice about spending this money on a Cadillac. beautiful car but safety features do not work. Onstar didn't report the crash. If it wan't for my Apple Watch no one would have been alerted. very disappointing  being as we paid for premium OnStar services when I pressed the sos button nothing happened no advisor came on to assist. non of the safety features worked on this Cadillac. very expensive for what your buying .

I've owned my 2022 xt6 premium luxury for 1 1/2 years now. The pluses out weigh the minuses. No vehicle is prefect, after a few minor adjustments my xt6 has been excellent. I will start with some negatives the interior could diffinately be more plush for this price, armrest and center console feel cheap. The dashboard is simple and lacks any imagination a two yr old could have designed it, but these are things I knew about prior to purchase. The pluses,after having owned bmws and lexuses not having to use premium gas is a big plus, my oil changes and maintenance in general are alot cheaper. To me this is one of if the best looking midsize luxury suvs on the market. I have also owned cadillac s before and expect to get 200,000 + miles without any major problems. Yes I am happy with my purchase and will be open and honest with my future reviews as well.

I have owned or driven many car brands over the 48 years of driving experience i have. After researching many vehicles I purchased a 2022 cadillac premium luxury xt6 in April of 2022. Love the exterior styling, however the interior leaves a lot to be desired. Seems as though no imagination was used at all, compared to other suvs in this class. Which i was aware of, but with that being the only negative i bought it anyway. Quick list of some poistives, vehicle uses regular gas instead of permium (a dollar difference at some stations) which all of the foreign vehicles use - maintenance is much cheaper- has a better warranty than the others except for kia and hyundai. Has i said in the beginning i have driven many  vehicles and they all have faults. The Cadillac brand is just has reliable has any brand made in my opinion. After owning my xt6 for 9 months now I have no complaints at all.

I am in my 70s and have loved cars my entire adult life. I own 4 now, an Audi A5, a Mercedes converible, a Genesis and my XT6. Love them all. None have more than 50k on the odometer. If I didn't love them I am lucky enough that I could go buy what I like. The XT6 is the first car I choose when I want to go for a long drive, or a short hop to the store. I take several 2,000 mile trips each year, and in this vehicle. Comfort and performace that was unknown in a vehicle in this price range a decade ago. Certainly for an additional $10-15K you could get better, but not that much better! Just one note: I installed Michelin CrossClimate tires at 19k miles and there was a significant reduction of road noise and a vast improvement of ride comfort.

Drives like a dream! Looks great!! BUT There are three sets of every kind of button. Some make absolutely no sense at all.  NOT INTUITIVE!  We drove it every day for a month all around the country and still don’t like/ feel comfortable with the inside buttons and screens. We had the book out to try to understand but they don’t make sense.   It is extremely irritating and DANGEROUS because you have to stop looking at the road just to find which hidden, barely marked button you have to push, swipe, click, push, not on the writing, but above or below , or or some other screen just to do one simple thing.  Someone got carried away trying to be different! They succeeded.

I took it on a lease for three years. It has the best features, protections and comfort over all the cars I have had in the passed. This one is a KEEPER.  Classy and ageless with the right care. So much fun to drive great Visibility, love the camera view 360 degree. Luxury XT6 has it all.

We have had several Cadillacs over the span of 40 years along with a few foreign  cars and domestics that were just not Cadillacs.  Included in the Cadillacs was an Escalade and an XTS all wheel drive sedan.  The XT-6 handles and drives like a dream and is the most comfortable  one yet.  Our son's family, (including our only grandson who is 3) lives in North Carolina which is roughly 500 miles away. We have made multiple trips with the XT-6 and being in our early 70's, we thoroughly enjoy the adaptive cruise control and lane departure warnings and assist.  The seats are very comfortable and we enjoy the Apple Car play function which pairs nicely with our iPhones.  We opted for the Platinum package which we enjoy.  All in all a great car to own!

I have owned numerous Cadillacs.
Was excited for the xt6 but am terribly disappointed in its poor handling in weather conditions. If you plan on using this vehicle in any type of snow conditions, beware, the AWD is terrible, tires are not made for snow and must be changed. Have been stuck numerous times in snow, vehicle slides on road at first sign of ice or snow, even when in AWD. Additionally, gear shift completely fell apart for no apparent reason. On the plus side, car is comfortable, drives well, plush interior, quiet and spacious.
Love my Cadillac! This vehicle far exceeds my expectations. It’s comfortable, dependable, and very luxurious. The Cadillac XT6 is the best luxury suv for the family.

Great car but I totally dislike the dashboard's CUE control center. Not easy to navigate and whenever I want to touch a command on the face of the screen, invariably, the car hits a bump and my finger will contact the wrong command icon or function I want.
Love my Cadillac. Looks beautiful, smooth and comfortable riding vehicle. Very luxurious. I have no complaints.
Great ride. Excellent power. Massive trunk. Super comfortable. Excellent gas mileage. I’ve owned this for 3 years and it’s a joy.
You get what you pay for it a Cadillac that smoke most more expensive cars like BMW Benz.. leaves them in dust powders them.
Boulevard cruiser for someone who like a roomy car with a great ride. Stylish looking with all the safety features and self parking to boot.
Car looks and runs as good as when it was new.No accident history.Only 45000k miles. Exterior and interior are ln excellent condition.
Hes wonderful. I wouldnt trade him. Might look for a 2019 with moon roof.  Or maybe the design will stay Cadillac.

My dear wife chose this car over seven years ago since it has a huge back seat that can hold three child seats.  We had three young grandchildren at the time.  I have been the primary driver since that time and found the car very serviceable.  The overall mpg has been 24.3 though lower lately for some reason.  With that many miles, you can imagine we have taken a number of driving vacations as well as commuting some miles for groceries and trips to our son's house about 35 miles away.  It's real comfortable for the driver and good in the winter with heated steering wheel and seat (also heated for right side seat).  The CUE system failed at about 100K miles but was replaced on warranty, thankfully.  Not real excited about the CUE system since it was designed in the pre-GPS era so no availability of screen directions.  Onstar is handy for verbal directions but requires a subscription.  Trunk is huge and rear seats fold down for large cargo area.  Have had a number of troublesome repairs since 100K miles that have been expensive.
Great vehicle has all the bells and whistles. V6 motor, 6.7 naviaghation, big low sun roof. Low mileage. .

Such a comfortable vehicle to drive in any conditions!  My 2019 Jeep Cherokee is reliable, feels luxurious, yet rugged enough to take on any weather or road condition that I have endured here in Northern MN

Better have the money to put a transmission in it and all new suspension/ cv axles all the way around at 100k, cheap trim/ cheap electronics/ cheap interior….I could go on and on, pray you never have to work on it because Chrysler made this monstrosity impossible without the proper diag tools/ specialized tooling.
Good reliable, new engine, battery, brakes.  Body us in good condition,  fabric seats it is automatic,  a small 4 cycilner, all power, good stereo.

This is the second Cherokee I've owned, this one is the Limited. It has everything on it, moon roof, heated seats & wheel, self parking etc. This one has the 3.2L and runs great with mileage in the twenties. At 30K no issues. I planned to buy a '24 but Jeep decided to quit production.
I not own this car but I dont like Jeep so very nice good condition just one light 4WD unlocked. I want sell

Jeeps are literally the worst cars ever made. The transmissions in these vehicles are absolute garbage. I drove my car for literally 1 month before the check engine light came on. They had to replace the thermostat, then the coolant hoses exploded. Then they had to replace the front differential and finally they had to replace the PTU on the car. I had the car for 4 and a half months and only drove the car for 6 weeks. The rest of the time it was in the shop. I had to trade in the car while being underwater on the loan because the Jeep was THAT bad and unsafe to drive. These Jeeps are legit UNSAFE for anybody to drive.

I like the 2.0 Turbo engine. Has plenty of pep and torque to get around.
The Jeep is solid, no rattles or squeaks.
Although I have no intention of doing the off-road in those occasions when I have driven in snow and even mud it has performed very well.
Since I mostly only drive in town now the mileage is usually 24-36 mpg.
What keeps it from a five is the touch screen which controls the radio/entertainment. It will reboot at random times, and sometimes more than twice.

This is one of the worst vehicles I have ever driven. Sure it looks decent and the interior looks nice but the seats are uncomfortable and that's just the start of the rolling garbage can this thing is. The throttle response is trash, good luck pulling into traffic as it will respond 2 seconds later and it's either all or nothing on the power. The transmission is slower than molasses and gets confused when it comes to down shifting. The ride quality is meh, tons of body roll through a corner. The steering is about as vauge as it gets, just keep turning the wheel, it will eventually go the way you want. 
It is shocking that someone greenlit this abomination and even more shocking that anyone has spent their money on them. Just stay away, your better off getting a 1992 Geo Metro that is missing a wheel, it's still a better car.

NEVER AGAIN JEEP
Where to even start is insane... Battery failed after 6 months. Drinks gas like a drunken sailor. 400 bucks per month for a complete mess

Purchased my car brand new and the amount of issues this car has is unbelievable.  My car cuts off. The battery constantly fails.  I have taken it to the dealership. I have called the Jeep company.  I had a mechanic and he said, "I'm sick of these cars. I'm not even going to waste your money. Get a new car".   I would not recommend.  They tried to make it compact, computerized and cute but this car is a mess and Jeep oughts to be sued for the vast amount of issues that people are having with this same car.
The Jeep compass sport is not reliable . Constantly issues with oil, if you turn the car with shut off, electrical issues, guzzle gas.

Would not recommend. Bought new. Had it three years (only 33k on it).  Tranny shifts hard, especially the colder it gets outside. Battery went dead after 2 1/2 years. First year was getting about 300 miles on a full tank. By year 3 I was getting about 190 miles on a full tank. Would never by a Compass again. Traded it for a 2020 RAV 4  Adventure. AVOID THE COMPASS
So I've had my 2021 jeep compass for 2 years  and it's been at dealership 7 rides lately and they can't figure out what's wrong

I, took this vehicle on a test drive. It's a 21 Jeep compass trail hawk 4 cylinder. It didn't have any neat things like a moon roof, heated seats, power lift tail gate, etc.. It already had 42k mileage on it. The asking price was crazy high!! As for this vehicle on the test drive, it's way under powered. Felt rough, kinda loud inside. The engine has annoying ticking sound. This jeep had a tough time going up a hill. Apparently that's how these jeeps sound. I, did not purchase this vehicle. I, walked away.. Lesson learned today, if you do like the trail hawk make sure you get the V6 with the upgrades.

I ended up with my Jeep Compass after I totaled my CR-V by hitting a deer on the freeway. There was nothing on the lot, and I liked the look of the compass. I had nothing but issues from the time I bought it. 

It drives like a truck, "it's a jeep thing" ok... It's not smooth whatsoever, it's loud, and mine had an issue with shifting gears that was never fixed after 4 visits to the dealership. It would jerk so bad, randomly, when shifting gears, to the point my dad was concerned to drive it when it was icy/snowy, in fear it would send itself into something/someone. My next issue was with the backup camera... It went out.. TWICE. My auto start/stop stopped working all together, which is fine because sometimes when I would stop at a light/stop sign... it wouldn't restart when I took my foot off the gas. My last complaint is with the gas tank... almost everytime I filled my tank I would have to hold the pump at 1/4 of the way squeezed because it would act full if I let it pump itself or even if I squeezed the pump half way. I would have to turn the pump UPSIDE DOWN to actually pump gas. Also, this thing is small. No storage space whatsoever.

The pros? I guess it's aesthetically pleasing. I was rearended on the freeway and it didn't leave a mark. 

I have been trying to get rid of this since I bought it 2 years ago... today I get to say goodbye. I'm going back to Honda and never buying a Jeep again.

junk car not running well with less than 5000 miles. Engine problems, bad transmission also definitely occur every time but the American Jeep and Ram cars no longer work. They only look good but otherwise they are garbage. Paying so much for a car that doesn't run doesn't make sense.

The quintessential Jeep truck (JT). Looks incredible, and so much fun to drive! I added a sunrider (soft) top which makes the open air experience quick and easy. Removing the doors adds another layer to this unique vehicle, not to mention the added convenience of a pickup bed for those trips to Home Depot or Lowes. Be forewarned - this vehicle drives like a Jeep due to the solid front axel, but that's what give it charm and makes it's off road prowess possible. Can't wait for the next snowstorm here in New England. Not to mention - strangers actually wave at you on the road (Jeep Wave) and leave bath toys (ducking!) on your vehicle when it's parked! Love my JT!!

I also own a jeep liberty diesel 2005. I had turbo problems with my Liberty but it is still going with a 145,000 Miles.  I am so much happier with the Gladiator Diesel. I wear a suit to the office and don't mind driving my Jeep Gladiator. I get tons of compliments on it and have had no problems other than a windshield replacement, not Jeeps fault but a rock from the Highway.  I have 20,000 miles on my gladiator and absolutely love it. Oil Changes between 7500 to 10.000 Miles. DEF fluid I fill about every 3500 - 4,000 miles. Cold start isn't a problem like it was and is with my Liberty. The Engine is responsive and quick. I have taken several long trips and have averaged 29-30 MPG traveling between 75-80 Miles per hour on the highway. Diesel prices vary but often Premium gas is more expensive. Diesel does save Fossil fuels and is so much better than Electric Vehicles. Especially in Rural areas. I do get a popping and a hop in the steering on slow sharp turns when in 4H. 4L works great and have had no problems when my traction control doesn't pull me out of muddy situations when in 2H.  I prefer Diesel because better gas mileage prolongs fossil fuels. I prefer my Dodge Ram for quiet highway rides but for a midsize truck my Gladiator combines the best of everything that I need. A pickup Truck, an Offroad beast, and a four door vehicle for when I have a car full. The back seat has plenty of room.

Owned 3 brand new wranglers, and use them on highway 🛣️ from Minnesota to Rocky Mountains 🏔️ the last 10 years. Work in mountains 8 to 11x a year in Colorado. Hence, I use em! 2022 loaded gladiator ruby! Absolute beast-I sleep in it at trailheads - I’m 6’2 210 and it’s bliss. I’ve pulled 8 trucks out the last 2 years - who can’t make the climbs -the only negative is wind 💨 handling in ruby -you gotta hang on in the passes and highways. It can almost every thing my wranglers could do BUT way more comfortable with fox shocks and killer wild peaks -been Toyo open country snob for ever. The storage is epic-

31k miles of trouble free driving, averaging 25 mpg. The diesel has gobs of power, smokes all midsize trucks, and a lot of full size trucks as well. Can’t beat cruising PCH with the top off, along with having the capability to do some serious off-roading.
Handles great, so fun! Drove from WA to NM and back with no problems, very comfortable! Very pleasantly surprised.
I've owned jeeps for many years. I've owed this fir 4 years and never had any problems with it . Love its a jeep and truck plenty of room tow is great .

The gladiator is our 8th jeep brand.  We have had 7 2 door wranglers and this was my 1st gladiator.  My husband has a wrangler and a ford F150 truck.  I have a CRV and the gladiator. We enjoyed the wranglers and I wasn't happy driving his truck.  It was to big for me and so I got the gladiator.  I really liked it, It was smaller in size for me.  Sadly I'm short and trying to climb into it finally bothered my back so I had to give it up.  I'm 71 this year.  If only they had this 15 yrs ago.
By no means are jeep comfortable but they are alot of fun to drive.  I never got stuck in snow or sand.  It went through water during a rain storm and had no problems.  You can park the 2door wranglers anywhere you want.
This is my 4th Grand Cherokee and they have been great.  The 4xe is very luxurious and fun to drive, no issue so far.

Previously, I leased a 2020 Grand Cherokee Limited and had no issues. I have a 3 mile commute to work so I put less than 10k miles per year on my car. Turned my 2020 Jeep in with 20k miles. Was very happy with Jeep and the dealership so I decided to try the Jeep 2024 Grand Cherokee 4xe

I’ve been driving the 2024 hybrid Jeep for one month now and I encountered, on three separate occasions, a very long delay when the electric battery and combustion engine are communicating. During this delay there is no acceleration. One occasion, I was driving my daughters to school and the delay occurred when trying to drive onto a two lane highway. I was not able to accelerate (felt like we were stuck in neutral) An 18 wheel tractor trailer almost hit us from behind…within inches. Horrible experience. Still losing sleep over this experience. 

I brought the Jeep back to the dealership and they said that this is the characteristics of a hybrid car.  There is nothing that they can do unless Stellantis rolls out a software update or recall to fix this problem. Now I have this car for another 3 years and have no trust in it! 

On a separate note, I am a very safe driver. I read the owners manual and I am also paying  attention to the hints from the Jeep app. I.e. accelerate and decelerate slowly, consistent speed, etc. but this issue continued to occur for a second and third time.

The Interior and electronics on the Grand Cherokee Summit Reserve are on par with the best that other luxury brands offer.  The leather and real wood trim are refined, and the heads-up display is clear, sharp, and bright.  However, the 4xe system does NOT work and is totally unreliable.  We have had the vehicle in the shop multiple times, with the latest appointment taking three days.  The dealer technicians worked with the engineers, and even after numerous software updates and component replacements, they couldn't get the vehicle to charge or even clear the check engine light.  If you want a $86K luxury hybrid EV that can't take or hold a charge, then this is the vehicle for you.

I've had mine for 10k miles now and it has been hiccup free. 0 issues or concerns regarding quality and reliability. It doesn't receive a 5 star review cause it prices itself out of the market many of the times. Perhaps its competitors aren't as driven by attention to detail but for the average consumer it mainly comes down to pricing.

I purchased this car in a Summit trim. I am stoked with my purchase and everything that it offers: Dual-pane sun roof, massage seats, passenger dashboard screen, truck's lifting ability, 21" wheels, top-grade sound system, hybrid capacity, rear view camera screen, and more.
Too many noises, and funny smells. It does not seem like a new car. Loose tons of value as you drive off the lot!

These vehicles were clearly not ready for production. Tons of recalls and they still can't fix them properly. Market value is plummeting because of it. Beyond that the hybrid system in general is garbage And extremely inefficient. Ford made a better system 10 years ago when the technology was new. Stellantis needs to buy these back.. unacceptable.

The vehicle will crank over and not start on random occasions. This has been happening since week 1 and it’s spent over a month at 3 separate dealers and they can’t find out what’s going on with it. Jeep wave and customer retention have been no help and absolutely rude. Do not buy. Going on 1 year of “new car ownership” nightmare.

Just told me my car went up in valve yet I lost over two grand in there estimate????
You guys are full of it!
Excellent shape. Selling car unable to drive due to health concerns   Color red leather interior new tires

Bought it used/30K in 2021. Fantastic shape. Put a $2000 Ceramic Coating/looks like Showroom shine! Test Drive showed butter smooth Transmission/still flawless and Super-Powerful Engine/almost too much power in Sport Mode!! So Perfect, I bought it a few hours after the Test Drive where I really worked it hard in everyway. Past 2 1/2 years has been a Dream car. Drive it on Mountain Tops and so much Fun on the Beach! Handles wonderful on the normal road. Interior Design is elegant and soooo comfortable with all the dash controls layout. AC/Heating is fantastic.  Its a true 10 on scale of 10! This 2018 is the 25th year Sterling Anniversary Edition so it came with a $4,000 luxury upgrade package/front tow hooks and other upgrades the Overland has, a huge Double Sunroof etc.... If you can find it, rare (25th Anniversary Edition) buy it, you will totally Love it. They made this model a "Showcase" of the best of Jeep features. Powerful/Sleek and Sexy/Smooth Ride/Ultra-Reliable. My Girlfriend can't even handle the TurboCharge of the SPORT MODE. Its like a Jet Airplane. Up to 120 in a blink of an eye. Makes passing cars on the Freeway a breeze. Only takes 1-2 seconds, just remember to slow down afterwards. I only use Sport Jet Airplane Mode 1% of the time. Normal Mode is already Super Powerful. Drive safe. I usually just put it on Cruise Control at 70MPH, kick-back and enjoy the smooth perfect ride. Jeep hit a Homerun with the 2018 Jeep Grand Cherokee Sterling 25th Anniversary Edition!!
I've driven jeeps for almost 20 years, and the Grand Cherokee is my absolute favorite.  Perfect size, handles so well, and very comfortable.
very good experience. the ride is comfortable on and off road. it is a capable vehicle that maintains its rugged appearance while being handsome -
be prepared to replace all your tires at 22000 miles and rear rotors/brakes. Plus a major blind spot at the front pillar/side view mirror. Watch for pedestrians because you cant see them!

4 motors & about a dozen CEL during its 132k miles. Motors are 20k+ new. Jeep won't honor warranties and can't diagnose anything on this correctly. It's a beautiful truck and the adaptive cruise control is very advanced for a 2015, but having it sit in the shop for 9 months for a motor is just stupid. Buy something else. It's also had an active recall with no solution for almost 2 years now. Stellantis doesn't care. I'll never buy another Jeep, Dodge, RAM, Chrysler, Alfa Romeo, Fiat, or Maserati.

It's giving me pricing on 6cyl instead of 8hemi 
On a 2011 jeep Cherokee limited edition Hemi.
Please help me out here
This is my 4th Grand Cherokee and they have been great.  The 4xe is very luxurious and fun to drive, no issue so far.

Jeep wave and customer retention have been no help and absolutely rude. Do not buy. Going on 1 year of “new car ownership” nightmare.

Quiet, spacious,  and comfortable. It feels like a jeep in every way possible. 
14k miles and still strong. I don't mind the shift knob. The only flaw I have found is the front warning detectors won't stop you, they just warn you. Love the half leather half swade. Would recommend this car.

I had this jeep for 13 months, no issues so far. I drove it from Indiana to Orlando twice with the family, it was very confortable and enjoyed driving it. I love the exterior and interior. Very confortable drive and it's grear driving it on the snow.

Only 9,000 miles!
like new!
have to sell because it's too high for my 88 year old Mom!
Garaged.. sun roof.. no dings

If I could give this vehicle a zero, I would!! Nothing but problems with it, very poorly made. My vehicle started overheating and had to take it to TWO different dealerships, 3 separate visits, for them to finally figure out the issue. Or so they said!! They had to replace the engine at 35,000 miles. I honestly don’t think they knew what was causing the issue, and just replaced the engine and wished for the best. Very cheaply made inside as well, all the plastic scratches so easily on the entertainment console. Will never buy another Jeep!

Whatever you do, DO NOT!!! buy this car. I have had nothing but problems with this vehicle as soon as hit 6,000 miles. It had to be towed after only 8 months of ownership because the shifter broke with less than 10,000 miles on it. I had it serviced a total of 4 times now and they never give me a rental "because one is not available" so then I am left making a $700 car payment while trying to find a way to get to and from work for them to come back and say "they couldn't find anything wrong".

I have never regretted a major purchase more and hopefully never will. This Jeep was a terrible ride when it ran which was rare. The car was plagued by electrical and fuel pump issues that Jeep could never figure out. I've sold this car and will never buy a Jeep again; the only thing worse than this specific model was the way I was treated by Jeep. Stay away.

I have had an issue with my screen locking up.  I can still change channels, but the screen locks onto an old channel and does not change.  I have been dealing with jeep for not 14 days, not 14 weeks, but for over 14 MONTHS and it is still not fixed!!  They seem clueless as to their ability to fix it.

Lots of space, very comfortable. I have had it for over a year and a half now and have e put about 7,000 miles on it. We have not had any issue with it other than a few recalls. My one complaint is that there are no ceiling vents for passengers. Instead they are on the side which doesn't work well for my rear facing child. The gas mileage also is not great, very comparable to that of a large pickup.

Today in Tulsa, Oklahoma, took a 24 Wagoneer (17K Miles) in for warranty work, told I have two (2) cylinders misfiring. This is the largest Jeep dealer in the State and there are no service loaners currently to be had, the service writer said that the good news is that "Wagoneer' owners get bumped to the top of the service loaner waiting list, Currently I am #13 on the list. What does that tell you?

We love our 2023 GWII! While it has had a few minor issues, they’ve been fixed by a software update and a new battery. Nothing you would expect from any high end, high tech car these days. Aside from that, it’s been the most comfortable ride for day to day and long trips we’ve ever had. The new Hurricane HO engine is fast and not something you’d expect in a vehicle this large. It’s fun to drive!
Drive beautifully but the various technology systems did not operate as designed. Unfortunately, I will purchase another brand owned by Stellantis, FCA.

Don't even bother buying this unreliable machine, technology wise, horrible, safety wise, good, software wise, worse than my 10 year old car. Problem after problem. Gap issues, speaker issues, loose screws. I paid 124k for this and the resell value is already at 80k. I knew gas was gonna be horrible so I should have saw that coming but gas is not good with this car.
It’s noticeably silent in the cabin and the ride is fantastic. I had a different luxury suv prior to this one and the jeep is noticeably better.
Super comfy, quite and handles well. Traded from a different suv which we also really liked and no regrets.

I am amazed at how comfortable and beautiful this vehicle is. It is very large, but doesn't feel like that when being driven. The interior is high quality.  Everything is easily accessible.  Lots of space for family and luggage.  I would put this vehicle up against any high end luxury vehicle

I purchased a brand name 2022 Grand Wagoneer series III several months ago.  Luxary pearl white and fabulous.  I have owned several other luxury SUVs over the years and this one is by far the most comfortable!  Tons of room in every row, the placement of equipment/ controls and OMG the sound of that motor when you crank it up… WOW!  It gets me every time.  The wilted seats and design is top notice.  Not only that, I like that I don’t see them everywhere on the streets. Why buy something like everybody else has then you can stand out from the crowd in something as luxurious as this vehicle!  It has surpassed my expectations and been great.   The price tag wasn’t my favorite, but I’ve been pleasantly pleased.   The steer wheel is one of my favorite parts, too. Design and comfort.  Jeep nailed it.

Nothing personal, but thing is a pile of junk. Oil burner, terrible gas mileage. Rear room, forget it. This SUV just lives up to it's name, junkyard vehicle's. That's all these things are worth. They also have the worst resale value reputation. Your trade in value is completely gone compared to what you paid for this suv.

I had two choices on a pre-owed dealership lot. I drove both. This made more sense to me with my family than the Chrysler. I did not know about all of the issues surrounding the 2016 Latitude!
If I had, I would have run away from this thing! I have had it three years almost four, and so far I have replaced a cooling fan, radiator, oil sensor, entire computer, grounding cable, multiple bulb replacements every couple of months(!). Oil changes need to be done every 3000 miles or this vehicle will just shut off due to excessive oil consumption even after the new sensor! Needless to say it is very dangerous.  Lots of electrical issues.  I bought this car with a sticker price of $15,000, in 2020 and yes it had close to 100,000 miles on it already but I  put in almost $4000 worth of work and still owe about $6500 and trade in value is a joke on these things.  Do not waste your hard earned money! I'm getting out of it as soon as financially possible.
sucks gas. great in the snow. MAJOR AND TONS OF BLIND SPOTS. seats suck they dont raise high enough without hurting the back of your legs. with the 9 speed that i have its  fun

First off, let me start by saying this. During the epidemic in 2020, I decided to change cars from having an old, trusty, dependable sedan. I've always been a lifelong Jeep brand fan and I landed with a 2017 Trailhawk for a great deal from a dealership. The car was loaded with every possible option for the model year and I've enjoyed my ownership most of the time. For a 4-Cylinder the car gets decent fuel economy and can handle every aspect of weather. However, I've had a couple of repeated issues pertaining to the MYSKY power sunroof. So please don't get one with this feature. Multiple times the front sunroof has been stuck open and will not close without bringing it to a dealership. In my opinion there should be been some kind of recall/notice for this because it was Poor design by FCA for sure. I've also had to replace speakers which have been notorious for weak sound quality and cheap parts. Being in New England this car will get anywhere safely as long as you understand it does not have a lot peppyness or spunk to it. Still a solid vehicle and you can feel the spirit anywhere.

This thing is not a jeep, it's a pile of scrap metal. These engines are oil burner, and they are not reliable. Give it some time, you will realize this as well. Your trade in value is terrible too. Doesn't hold, because these jeeps are for fools who buy them. I, traded in mine and never ever again would I buy this thing. Bad reputation vehicles, walk away.

Well, what a terrible mistake buying this jeep. Lesson learned, don't buy this jeep. Value depreciation is apparently known for jeeps. There just full of problems. Oil burner, service dept is expensive. Bad fuel mileage. That's why there's so many of these suvs for sale. People are ditching them for many reasons. Probably the same reason I'm getting out of mine. This jeep renegade trail hawk sucks!!

Our series II is Great driving, smooth, powerful. I’ve had 0 issues in 2 years. I rent a lot of nice cars and this one is the best for comfort and driving. I would ignore reviews of people who won’t take their car in for a free service. We have been well taken care of and I haven’t paid a dime for service so far. It’s been wonderful to own

It's huge, loaded with tech, and supremely comfortable. Everything is well put together and very luxurious without sacrificing utility. No issues whatsoever... Some complaints might be from customers who aren't tech savvy and are not expecting all the bells and whistles. Glad to see there are still auto makers willing to make a true go anywhere car that is brawny with a body on frame 4x4 configuration. And it doesn't look goofy like some other brands.

- 8 Visits to the dealership with a break failure that was about to cause my family and me our lives.

- Crysler engineering team can not fix any of the problems, and the client service is the worst I have ever encountered  

- we ended up selling the cars due to their low quality and reliability. We sold one with 30K miles and the other with 20K miles

I just bought a very expensive  Car Jeep Grand Wagoner   while i was  picking you   i saw a dent on  the car  i was very easy as they said they will fix  it.    i called today to get it fixed 
they want to wait for 4 or 5 hours  to have it fixed and pickup they don't want to give me a rental
 
Please don't buy any car from them

We bought the Series 3 Wagoneer in February 2022.  It’s been in and out of dealers serving for numerous electronics issues.  I expected it would need software updates as it’s a first year vehicle.  I didn’t expect glitching infotainment unit, seat heat malfunctions, memory seat malfunctions, dead battery issues, poor ac and heat quality in the rear, fluid leaks, and overall poor customer service from Wagoneer.  Love the looks, ride quality, power, towing and comfort.  In 9 months of ownership it’s been at the dealer for more than 30 days non consecutively. This was my first and last Jeep.  The broken tech isn’t new technology, just poor quality that the company can’t get right.

From day one the safety options work sometimes. They are on and off. I feel jeep/FCA put this vehicle into production before all the bugs were fixed. 
For the cost of this vehicle you would think it would be better.
Been at dealer going on three times for these safety option not working properly.

Wagoneer Series I 4x4 with Convenience Package and front passenger display.  Absolutely stunning in white (sea salt) interior. It the new family favorite. Too many features to count on this base model. The 3rd row seat is where the real magic, it has the largest window of any vehicle in its class and is just as spacious and comfortable as the 2nd row seats. If you need to carry 6 or more people this has to be on the top of your list if you value 3rd row comfort. I personally love the way it looks on the outside, very unique and standout. Everything in the SUV is thoughtfully engineered. Fuel economy is inline with the EPA, getting 17 mpg in combined driving. The 5.7L Hemi with the eTorque system is great. The cabin is whisper quiet. The base speakers are mediocre. Highly recommend it. We tested all three rows during our test drives and this one was the most comfortable in all 3 rows,

Car has stalled multiple times while driving. All warning lights go on, loss of power steering, power brakes. Car just literally dies on the road. I brought it into dealer, they gave me a software update and sent me on my way. Two weeks later it stalled again going 70 mph on the highway, absolute miracle I was able to swerve across two lanes onto the shoulder, where I slammed on the brakes taking me about 30 yards to come to a stop.  Car has been at dealer for a week and I have no confidence they can fix this.

I really wanted to love this car and yes it looks good but I’ve had so many issues on my 2021 Jeep Wrangler 4XE. Just be prepared to have your car in the shop all the time and know that most dealerships only have one certified mechanic to work on these. Always insist on getting a rental car if they’re going to have the car overnight and make sure they Uber you if you need to get around if they’re having your car for the day. And let’s not forget the ongoing recall..,

I have always been a fan of the Jeep Wrangler; I am currently driving my 5th Jeep; I love the versatility of the Jeep - I love its ability to travel deep into the back country and back out again.
Today's Wrangler has the ability to commute in city or country with ample power to tow a trailer and negotiate hills, the new JL comes with a top that is truly easy to open up on warm days.
The Jeep wrangler is a vehicle that possesses timeless beauty, it never ages.
The weakness of the Wrangler is its lack of practicality - I prefer the 2 door because it is goat-like when off-roading but there is very little space for groceries or lumber and bulky items. the cure is to own a light duty trailer, which I do.

I love being in EV mode around town and having sway bar disconnects and locking differentials on the trail. My MPG is incalculable because I have access to a free charger at work but no range anxiety of a full EV. Just fill up at any gas station and I'm good for another 320 miles. My favorite feature is the 1 touch sky top. This is my fourth Jeep and I'll never go back to a hard or soft top.

Over the years, I drove many different cars, BMW 5 series, Audi A4, A6 and A7, Tesla model Y, and even Toyota. My jeep wrangler Willys 4xe is the most fun car I have ever had.  While you should not really compare a non-off-road car with an off-road one, I’d say this jeep exceeded all my expectations. The 20 miles electric range is good enough for daily use. Love the look of the car.

I got a 2022 jeep wrangler Willy’s sport 6 speed manual 2D. It drives great for a jeep and I have taken it on long trips and it does great. I haven’t put a lift on it or bigger tires but I do think it’s a little under geared. I will probably invest into some lower gears in the near future.

I have a 2021 Rubicon 4xe (Billet Silver) and I love it. I have an electric step and also Clearlidz Freedom top on the way. I get more people approaching me about this vehicles looks than I did my 2017 Mustang GT  California Special. And that car won its class on a car show. 

This ride smooth. After installed the roof headliners is as quiet as can be. It has a ton of torque.  The seats are not comfortable for this amount of money. Had to have the battery cooler module replaced but that been it. Nothing else. And they gave me a rental. Better have! Steering wheel is too loose. Maybe I was used to my mustang. Its my 4th jeep and by far the best.

See title above. That adequately sums up the general consensus and overall correct evaluation of this majestic unicorn of a vessel of overland transportation. If you do not agree then i suggest some self reflection and deep thoughts concentrating on where and why you may have strayed from truth and salvation.
6th Jeep and 3rd Wrangler. Love it. Smoother than my Audi Q5. Never expected a vehicle this capable to be so smooth.

Love our little red Wrangler X, 6 speed manual. Ordered it in 2007 and keep it in the garage at our vacation home in the mountains. The first  thing we do when we drive up is connect the battery and take it for a ride. Only 16,500 miles on the odometer. I'm toying with the idea of lifting it and putting fat tires and a winch on, but another part me wants to keep it stock. It's such a fun car!

Doors leak water constantly. I tried replacing with updated front door seals and adjusting doors in but same issues. Door panels rattle non stop center console creaks and rattles when you rest your arm on it.
Oil filter housing cracks are common. I wouldn’t buy again.
Just a comfortable awesome ride! I'm more of a sports car person or I should say used to be till I got in this and drove. I love it.

Had my Jeep for 3 years blown head gasket warped heads and now timing belt needs to be changed out!!! After almost 10k repairs including new 35” tires it’s time to say good bye!! Wouldn’t recommend unless you enjoy Just Emptying Every Pocket!!! Jeep meaning

This is an amazing Jeep. Loaded out to the max. Full leather seats, disconnect sway bar, locking front and rear differentials, awesome stereo system. Both hard and soft tops. this Jeep goes great in the snow and mud, yet is very comfortable to drive everyday on the road.

I love my Jeep sahara 2014 4 door wrangler!!  100%buyer satisfaction   I purchased this Jeep used last summer paid $30000 in cash but it has been worth every penny!  I had so much fun this summer with my doors off and top down. It feels so free and easy to accomplish. Thought I’d be satisfied but now I am over the moon!!  Jeep is my new all around best vehicle!
We love it but it has had a electrical problem every year one so server that it has stranded us on the side of the road. We have never taken it off the black top road.

rides like a jeep, of course. runs very well. reliable and looks very nice. mpg is 18+ (my wife drives this more often than I) hinges are being replaced in a couple weeks, they are just beginning to rust.
