Bought this vehicle used with 54k miles.
75k miles: A/C compressor $1400
85k miles: transmission coupler $1100
88k miles: driver side power seat switch $60 DIY
95k miles: front tie rod $1000
100k miles: blown engine due to the dreaded burning oil issue. My wife was religious about oil changes every 3k miles. Repair estimate $16,000. 
Took the car to an auction house. I’ll never buy another Hyundai again.

We bought this Ultimate brand new in 2016. We have loved it every day since. The 360 degree camera, the blindspot detection and alarms that go off when someone/something is behind you are worth every penny. The 360 camera is hard to find in other cars.
We love having the extra 3rd row and when my daughter was younger it was a treat to be able to bring more friends to more places. Everyone loves the panoramic moonroof. Heated seats front row and even second row passengers, and a heated steering wheel. Ventilated seats in warm weather, we feel pampered. 
I would buy this car again, no question. We have had to go in for a couple of recalls but the dealership made it easy and I don't know of a car out there that doesn't have that at some point.

Purchased my 2024 Sonata in February. Looking at all of the sedan currently on the market for 2024, the Sonata was hands down the best looking for the price. Unless you're willing to shell out $40,000+ for an Audi or BMW, the Sonata takes the cake for being the best affordable sedan on the market. It out classes the Honda Accord with its interior design. As well as the Toyota Camry. I love this car and it drives just as good as it looks. The outer design is a big upgrade from the 2023 sonata's fish-mouth grill design. The Sonata drives great and is a quiet ride. Hands down the best car purchase you can make.
This car has had no problems since I bought it 2 years ago. None. It now has 90K miles on it and drives just as good as it did at 20k.
Nice design, good tech and luxury ride quality. Good for long trips and carrying family around. I highly recommend the 2024 Hyundai sonata
Great car turbo, wheels, new tires, sport, black,  heated seats. No accidents ruins Great.  Just serviced

I loved my 2022 Sonata until it was on the back of a towtruck in need of a repair at 28K miles. One of the fuel injectors broke and wouldn't close and now needs to be replaced. The warranty is covering the repair and I was lucky enough to get a loaner from Hyundai which is also covered. But there's a national parts shortage now which means they can't get the new fuel injector, and I could be out of a car for months (it's been 3 weeks already and nothing). Of course, the payments are due like clockwork every month and there's just "nothing they can do." I pay and pay and pay, and at 28K miles, my beloved car is already undriveable and no longer in my possession.

I've read that in addition to experiencing supply chain issues, the auto industry is making lesser quality cars now than in just the previous several years, which is what I suspect has happened to me. At my dealership, there are 7 more cars waiting on new fuel injectors that at the moment do not exist. Why has this happened to so many? They probably put cheap ones in to begin with but charged mega bucks for the cars anyway cause they are entitled to our money no matter what they sell us in return. 

People have found Hyundais dependable for some time now, but those days may be over - beware. I loved my Sonata but am seriously wondering what I am going to be in for over its lifespan if this has already happened. And I am very angry at Hyundai. The warranty covered it all but I want my car back and shouldn't have car problems on a car this new! I would consider a Toyota if you're looking for a new car to deliver you from car problems. I don't know if they've gotten worse as well, but they have such a good reputation for dependability and may be a better bet.  

As with most things these days, many cars seem to have gotten worse over time rather than better. I would love to say the Hyundai has been great but it now sits in a parking lot undriveable at 28K miles while I continue slaving away on the payments.
2.5T engine mated to an 8-speed DCT makes for a fun daily driver. Equipped with all the driver aids and a panoramic sunroof.
Very sporty car runs smooth I am currently leasing this car .  Want to lease another one when my lease is up.very teliable
Handles great more technology then more expensive cars. Quick for a four cylinders. Quiet! Tons of safety features. There’s also auto drive (hands off steering).

We bought it brand new in 2015.

It was good and trouble free for the first few years.

Regular services performed at the dealership.

Lots of recalls needed along the way.

There was always hesitation when accelerating from a stop. Never had it looked at, thinking it was normal.

Front left coil spring rusted through and broke at about 65,000 miles.
Fuel door release stopped working about the same time.

First transmission replaced at 78,000 miles under warranty. 

Hybrid relay failed at 124,000 miles ($1700 to repair).

Second transmission having issues at 125,000 miles.

This car is a big gamble. If you know anything about Hyundai's in general, you know what I mean. Car gets amazing MPG at 37-38 mpg on the highway. Also very comfortable and it had a lot of tech features for a base model. I commuted 120 miles a day for work and did all routine maintenance on this car. Never missed an oil change, tire rotation, etc. Car's engine blew at 103K miles. Rod connector bearing failed and destroyed the engine. Very common problem with these Hyundai's. A recall for this exact problem was put out for Hyundai's, but my specific model was not part of the recall.. Somehow.. I shelled out 6500 for a new engine and immediately got rid of it. I later learned that it's considered a miracle if these cars make it past 150K miles on the OG engine..

Due to recent car thefts across the country, car insurance companies have taken a huge hit and are now passing it on to owners by charging outrageous rates or denying coverage at all simply because it’s a Hyundai. Loved the car but not going to pay $2500/yr for insurance. Also, taking a chance it could be stolen every time I park somewhere.

5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️I bought my 2015 Hyundai Sonata used, 5 years ago for $7,999 when it had 78,000+ miles on it. It now has 98,000+ miles on it. During the 5 years, I put new tires on it 13 months ago and new brakes today (Jan. 2024), no repairs, only maintenance - oil changes, new wiper blades.  Not as comfy to sit in as my Buick was
 (I am a plus size senior), but absolutely the best used car I have ever owned.  Drives 90 mph smoothly - but only when no law enforcement officers are in the vicinity.  Love my Sonata.

I bought this car "used" with 200 miles and it had only been driven by the dealer. That's only important because it means that despite the fact that the engine needs to be replaced at about 70k miles it is out of warranty and Hyundai does not stand behind its product. I loved this car in the beginning. I have always done all of the recommended maintenance and repairs. Took it in for all of the numerous recalls over the years and now am faced with deciding if I just scrap the thing as a loss at 70k miles. The car itself drives well when it works although my husband feels the break can be overly sensitive. It has plenty of space inside and is comfortable to drive and ride in. Just can't expect it to last long.
Significant damage dur to being hit by a truck. Prior to the accident the vehicle was considered above average in condition.

I was looking for a replacement car due to a car accident that I was involved in, when looking for cars I stumbled upon the 2016 Hyundai Sonata SE and started doing extensive research on it and everything just added up! So far after a couple of weeks of owning it I can for sure recommend this car if you need a daily driver!

I know there has been a lot of hype about the engines. All I can say is I must be lucky. My 1st. was a 2010. 24k miles before hit a deer at 70mph at night. Insurance totaled. Got 2012 new. Kept it and traded after over 99800 miles. 3rd was a 2016. Only needed the dealer twice for minor problems. Both times it was computer related. Engine warm light. Was fixed after they rebooted. Quick fixes both times. No charge for troubles. Only paid for tires, brakes, oil changes, Weather Shield floor & trunk mats. In winter my. At was lightly struck in a parking. Just caught left rear bumper. Just hard enough to warrant the whole tear bumper and partial rear fenders had to be replaced. Wow. All one piece with sensors. Sensors requiring tuning. One more thing. Insurance replaced the wind shield after a stone hit it and cracked it. Another required sensor tuning for electronic sensor on windshield. Never took one in for real engine troubles. 220,000+ miles and 3 Sonata Limiteds. I have been very satisfied with the Hyundai's I've owned.

Fuel economy is very good. My current average is 45+ mpg. My decision to buy this car is completely logical in terms of price-benefit. As I used it, I realized that I made the right decision. It is unreasonable to expect super comfortable seats or high interior material quality for the money you pay. I'll see how durable it is in the long run.

we have purchased 4 hyundai vehicles and this hyundai sonata hybrid has given us the most trouble by far. this car has fiberboard panels on the underside and while entering a business our car rubbed the bottom and caused one of the panels to pull loose as they are held on by cheap clips. took the car to a hyundai center for repair and was told that this is a common problem and hyundai will not warranty this item. cost to repair / replace 1 piece of the panel is approximately $550.00. the car does get good fuel mileage. the panels being pressed fiberboard will come loose.
I got T boned by a big SUV. All the airbags deployed and I escaped without any injuries at all. I am shocked I survived without any injuries. Hyundai Sonata saved my life. I highly recommend it.

I love this car but it broke down on me. A little over a year old. The engine light came on. I needed a new converter and it damaged the spark plug. It took over a week to get parts with no loaner car. The chrome on the inside dash reflects into your eyes. The cloth seats show dirt. The mileage is amazing 63 mpg the other day. My car still hesitates at times. Not sure if I might have a defective car. We shall see.

This is how cars should be lots of safety features very nice styling and great MPG! I get 50 MPG and it isn't a econo-box
kind of car! It has power to spare and the safety features really work this car has saved me from several accidents when other cars cut me off! Great value!

We live in California. We flew to Michigan to get this car. It was absolutely worth the flight and the amazing road trip home. We drove 2,183 miles on less then 4 tanks of gas. The dealer bought us the first full tank. The tank holds 13.2 gallons. We averaged 53.9 MPG. We bought 3 tanks and still had over 200 miles left when we got home. The limited has a solar roof and comes with ALL the bells and whistles of new technology. The heated and air conditioned seats are so powerful! The car drives so quietly and so smoothly. We bought it for MSRP and paid an extra $1,450 to get the 100,000 mile/10 year Bumper to Bumper Warranty. Did you just read that?...let me repeat...10 year/100,000 mile Bumper to Bumper Warranty! HOLY INSANE!  This car come with 3 months Sirius XM, 3 years free Service. 3 years free Navigation! Bluelink connects your car to your cell phone. This car is so hard to find because it's SO BEYOND, BEYOND! If you can find one, I highly recommend!

I have had over 35 new cars over my 50 plus years.  Lot of cars from Lincolns Marks to Hemi Cuda.   I have been part owner of two dealerships.  I know a bit about cars.  This Sonata hybrid limited is an amazing car, as an engineer I am really impressed by the tech of the powertrain and also the interior is high end and well laid out .  I drive fast and found this car can pass well on the pike at 80 plus.  Pulling into traffic is no problem, it's quick.  The handling is amazing and equally precise to a new Accord.   Less important people love the look of the car. This 2022 Sonata  Hybrid Limited is a great car.  So far, without trying, this car is averaging 49mpg.  I would recommend this car to family, it's a great car.

I have the blu hybrid.   Pretty much a base model.   Comfort and quality is satisfactory.  Interior room is more than adequate for my 6:3 , 250 lbs.  One of the few mid size cars where I don't have put the seat all the way back, and I still have plenty of headroom.   The mpg is outstanding!  Today with temps in the mid 70s I average 59.1 mpg in city stop and go driving.  I have been averaging about 52 mpg in mixed  highway (70 mph+) and city  (15-45 mph) driving through the winter.  This is hard to beat with the current gas prices.

I bought this new in 2016 and have had 7 years now.  No problems.  The car is solid, meaning that if feels strong and built to be durable.  It is comfortable, economical, reliable, has room for large adults in the back.  It's quick when I need it also.  On one tank where I babied it to see the best mileage I could get. I drove 836.5 miles on one tank of gas  (17.1672 gallons) for a total mileage number of 48.71mpg.  I average 44 to 45mpg with normal driving which is great for a large car.  I get a lot of comments that it's nice looking car. It also noticed that it turns sharper than any car I have ever had.

I've owned this car coming up on 5 years now. Larger than you would think. Inside is roomy and the trunk is huge. Drives great and is very smooth in ECO mode and if you put it into sport mode it is quick to respond and fast. Will keep up with anyone.  Very sexy design, ours is black and it's gorgeous. There's been zero issues with this car minus a couple recalls. We went in, they switched the parts just in case and it took less than two hours.  One flat tire, which was my fault, I bought cheaper ones then ran over a razor blade.  It gave a great warning after only dropping 3psi too fast, then kept the screen up so I could see exactly how fast it was losing air.  Literally 3 minutes from the warning to flatter than flat. It allowed me to realize what was happening first, and pull over safely before it was fully deflated.  One con I have is that sometimes, when you need to gas quickly, to avoid a stupid driver or you anticipated wrong pulling out, it will stall a bit at first which is the LAST thing you want in that moment. This happened only in ECO mode, probably twice now.  I've heard this is somewhat common in electric cars.  Overall this is an amazing car and I'd buy it again.
Gas mileage up to 46 miles per gallon on the highway.   I was impressed because when I heard from Hyundai that it was only like 41 mpg.   Smooth riding car and classy looking.
I want a car like this. Hybrid for fun and economic and not too expensive. I want to know how much does it cast?

Roomy and.loadednwith every option. 
car was.titled  originally to the.Super Bowl .own a.little piece of sports trivia

I posted back in 2019. It's getting close to the end of 2021 and this car has been a daily driver. I use it for work, and for long distance road trips. I have had zero problems. My wife asked me today what I would change, and I told her my next car will be AWD. This is a heavy sedan due to the hybrid battery, etc, and slick roads are not its friend. Otherwise, it is comfortable, roomy, and going strong.

The vehicle has been great until this year.  The hybrid motor has died twice.  Second time, I pulled over, stopped and started the engine.  Both gas and hybrid came back on but check engine light was on.

Dealer is still looking at it.  They have been super, giving us free loaners.
But the hybrid issue is very disappointing.  That's the only reason we would not recommend it.
Car has a lot of nice features and looks good - but this car is TERRIBLE in the snow... we had 2 Sonata's before this and both drove great.  The Hybrid SUCKS

I was lucky to find one available in WA as it was not solid new here.  Outstanding vehicle, I have the limited so all the bells and whistles are installed.  Overall the all electric range has been a pretty consistent 30 miles which gets me to and from work without electrical use at all.  Handles well and is a nice long drive when needed.

If you are looking to recover your cost of gas this car is for you. In 5 years I definitely recovered my cost. Some months I only filled up once. Do I live within 30 miles of my employer yes, barely, 28 miles. Often times I would drive back on "gas" and end up using electric for most of the drive. (Not much acceleration). 

However.... My engine went and had to be replaced. I was 12k under 100k. So it was covered. Definitely keep all receipts and service documents you will need it. It did take 3 months for my engine to come in. They only covered 2 of my payments... kinda... still haven't received my money yet.  Like i said it is complicated.

As the title suggests you can imagine what I am about to write. If your looking for an unbiased mire liberally approached review of this vehicle scroll down. You won’t get that here.
I have not a single thing.. ok maybe one thing.. bad to say about my sonata. I could go on for days telling you everything I love about it but I will spare you the time. This car is honestly the greatest investment I’ve made. Especially as gas prices are so high these days I can’t imagine life without it. I get around 1200 miles per tank of gas and visit the pump about ever month and a half. Not to mention the reliability has been great as well. Of course with a mileage of around 56k (unless you drive a dodge) you should expect nothing less than zero maintenance issues. 
Like I said, I could go on but just know this car is worth every penny to me and I hope it would be for you as well.
Lastly, as others have said the only thing it lacks is trunk space. If you can handle that it will be worth your while. I promise.

Very quiet and comfortable as a commuter or for long trips across the state. Lots of nice features in my Limited Edition including adaptive cruise control. That allows you to set your cruise control speed but the car will slow down if the traffic in front of you does.  Heated and cooled seats are very nice. The Blind spot detection will warn you in different ways before you change lanes into someone. The dash layout is very clean and classy looking. Performance is very good when you take it out of the Econ mode. You can even shift manually if you want to keep it in a lower gear for a bit more torque. Great mileage especially if you charge it at home and have a reasonable commute. I get 600 miles on the 12 gallon tank frequently.

If are looking for a Camry size car that is a plug-in hybrid then this is the car for you.  Supremely quiet and comfortable and a joy to drive.  Plus you get 27 miles on the batteries alone which is (at Denver electric rates) less than half the cost of gasoline.  And if your trip is longer than 27 miles then it automatically goes into hybrid mode and will get 38-40 mpg on the highway. Great car!!!
The only issue is cargo space other wise love it

(1) It broke down on the highway about 3 weeks ago 90 miles from home and is still in the shop for a hybrid system failure. They said there was another one their for the same/similar problem. At least it is under warranty and they are paying for the rental car. (2)  Prior to that it was in Hyundai Service 11-13 times for the check engine light on. Hyundai service could not figure it out repeatedly, but reset the light. They tried to blame me several times, saying there must be something wrong with my home charger, which was professionally installed for about 1500 and another 150 to have it checked by another electrician. My impression is that this is their first plug-in hybrid and have not worked out the bugs.
State: CVRB $1,500 Tax credit:$ 4,919 Car pool sticker.

Ive racked 130 miles on this SEL.
Keep it maintained and far away from the dealership .. you’ll be golden!

We had a 22 limited for a few months and 5k mes..impressed with handling cargo space and tech....tho would gave preferred a cvt(transmission)overall automatic not bad ..want two improvements one major..economy one minor enlarged cup holders..

Most of our driving is local, so we use ev driving mostly. Car is quiet and power on electric is fine.  Really like the driver options- smart, sport, eco, hev, auto.  These options allow driver to select for best response.  Home charging takes time and planning.

On long trips the car becomes a hybrid and is ok with 30-35 mpg.  If most of your driving is long distance, there are more efficient hybrids to consider including the Tucson hybrid.  

Warranty is tops and complimentary service has worked out fine with no issues.

The design of the headlight placement has the cut-off for low beams at a dangerously low level. At a slight incline 20 feet is pitch black and this vehicle is a hazard to drive at night.  The dealer has no fix for this and it is a known issue. If your safety is a concern I strongly advise looking elsewhere.

Great drive , many tech features.
Very nice interior and terrific warranty.
Also is a good value for the money, other more expensive cars do not have the features of the Hyundai Tucson Limited.

My 2020 Tucson had an eyeglass holder. This does not. It also had 2 side speakers in addition to the main. This just has one speaker in the front. 
Other than that, I love this car.

This is my fifth Hyundai vehicle. I have not had one issue other than the wiper blades don’t clean the glass very well. I am a firm believer in Hyundai vehicles and their warranties. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy one.

Great mid size Suv comfortable ride for 5 grown ups.
Great car for Uber, it has everything you need and will get you 5 star ratings, Specially if you drive passengers from Airports,  plenty luggage room and leg room It avgs 32mpg highway not to bad in city driving 25mpg.
I change oil at 7500 miles range
I drove it 4100 miles in 8 months
My previous  car was a 2020 Rav4 XLE without a navigation System and noisy engine not as good as my 2023 Hyundai  Tucson.
I love this car so much, I got a monthly  canton car wash subscription to keep it clean everyday

I have the base model Tucson (SE). Though basic I absolutely love it! Has good safety features like lane assist and is very comfortable. Lots of room in the back for groceries or a shopping spree. Very quiet ride as well, I hardly notice any road noise. It is also very fuel efficient. Perfect car!

It's a month that I have a 2018 Tucson. Very comfortable front seats. Good smooth ride with good traction. It has a good gas mileage. Now the headlights are terrible! With position, low beams and fog lights on you can barely see more than 10 ft away. The fog lights are not independent and shuts off when highbeams are actuated. If you're a person smaller in stature the sun visors are useless.

I drove a 2006 Tucson for 17 years, NO issues. 
This car is not a good car. Very disappointed in The 2017 Tucson.  I spent every penny I had thinking I was buying a great car.  This is a nightmare. I will never buy a Hyundai again. Selling this one as fast as I can. It hasbeen easy, a LOT of people know this car is crao. I wish I had known!

If you want to replace your engine every 4 years, this is the car for you. All windows have issues. Dear windows which were practically never used, rolled down due to a piece of plastic breaking. $700 per window for replacement.
I love my Hyundai Tucson. This is my third Hyundai and I’ve loved all of them. I’ve had a Santa Fe a Sonata and now this Tucson. Good cars.
Nice car runs good just want a new vehicle. Looking for a bigger suv that can handle my work load and have plenty of space.

We had to get it into the shop four times and the dealership will cover the engine but it's a ridiculous situation. This car has had so many problems for just being owned only 2 years and being practically new.

I purchased a 2021 Tucson , one of the safety features i like are the anti collision sensor as well of the 7 air bag on the interior, unfortunately i was in a accident which results in a total loss, believe it or not non of the airbags was deployed and the anti collision sensor in a medium sensitivity was not working as well.
I would not recommend the brand  at all.
After inspection by Hyundai ingeniers they said that everything works normal lol even with the physical and obvious results.
Please think twice before to decide to buy those brand.
Also check the recalls that they have are a lot , and some of them related with safety features.

Ive racked 130 miles on this SEL.
Keep it maintained and far away from the dealership .. you’ll be golden!

The Veloster N with the Performance Package is an absurdly entertaining little pocket rocket that packs decent practicality and a wildly entertaining driving experience into an affordable and unique package.

Exterior styling follows the existing Veloster formula but with the details turned to 11.  The profile is much the same as the first generation car, with chunky squat bulldog proportions, while the huge spoiler, low profile tires, aero fences and touches like the Lamborghini like taillights and triangular CHMSL announcing the car's sporting mission. 

The interior is a bit dour and dark, but has pops of the N signature light blue color to elevate it.  The plastics are hard l, but like the rest of the interior are very functional and wear well.

The real raison d'etre for the car is in the drive.  Being able to adjust the suspension, throttle response, traction/stability aids and exhaust means you can take the car from mild commuter to a wild snorting and popping track or autocross star with a few presses of the steering wheel-mounted buttons.  On the track or otherwise being driven hard, the car encourages you to push harder and faster and nothing holds you back save for the limits of your own bravery - the car is communicative and 'alive' and can carry an absurd amount of speed through turns and is steerable with the throttle.  If you dial all of that stuff back, it's just a comfortable commuter.

Reliability for me over the last four years has been excellent, with no problems save for some peeling clearcoat on the wheels (a known issue resolved for free by the dealer).

Beyond that, the Veloster N has been an easy car to live with.  Comfortable seating for the people up front and room for two in back for short trips combine with the practical hatchback form factor to make it reasonably usable day to day and perfectly suitable as your only car (that also happens to be track-ready right off the lot).

Everyone should own a car like this at one point in their lives - it's the sort of machine that makes you a lifelong car enthusiast even if you weren't before while being good enough at the other stuff to use as a daily driver.

Could benefit from a little more top end power, more front camber and a little less body roll. 
Is less idiot proof than the accord of same year but is also more fun.
Ride quality isn't as bad as they say.
Anti lag is awesome and isn't too loud  
Great ctr competitor for 10k less.

It’s the sportiest most fashionable small car with best gas mileage I have ever owned. It’s first in its class. Runs excellent we have never had a problem out of ours. A deer hit the first one I had and went back and bought another one just like it.
The car only has a cloth interior option but other than that it is 5 stars across the board. I have owned my veloster N for 2 years and its a racecar that has never even once had an issue.
BY far performance is impressive! Super fun to drive, recommend upgrading factory tires to improve traction. Suspension you feel everything in N mode but that's a given.
excellent handling, gives what it promises in adrenaline at the wheel in circuit racing!!! good value for money paid

if your looking for a sporty hatchback /coupe the Veloster is great car. it come in cheap then competitors and has similar performance/comfort and looks way better. The 3 door is an issue if you think of it as a car missing a door, but if you think of it as a two door with an extra door you'll be happy. Car probably not ideal if you have kids but for a young person its great

I live in a city and my Veloster has been the perfect Sunday errand runner.  Peppy, parkable, and practical.  It's as adept at handling weekend trips to costco as it is at carving up some back roads.  I love this car.
Love the economical and how compact this car is. Overall, it does a great job with fuel efficiency on highways as well as in town.

I got my Venue new during the middle of the pandemic, I paid $6k below MSRP. This is the first car I've ever owned myself and I can't say enough how much I love him. Great value, a healthy amount of safety

Had this treat for two years. Six speed manual transmission—which preserves brake pads and extends fuel economy (I get 40  miles per gallon) and makes it fun to drive—more responsive in acceleration and Highway punch. Reliable as heck. Roomy interior. Way more interior space than most cars of this class. Good in the snow. Base model has a tough interior, which I really wanted. Tough, black fabric and plastic that can take a beating. I am a musician and a hiker, so I didn’t want a tender vehicle. I wanted tough. Cargo? Lots. I load and transport all of our gig equipment with lots of room to spare. The knocks this car gets elsewhere are not true in my experience: the manual trans gives it pop and fuel economy; it rides smooth on the highway. Also, it’s a unique looking vehicle. Stands out. One last thing: Apple CarPlay comes standard, even in the base model. Huge bonus.

The Hyundai Venue is a small very dependable SUV, it lacks off the line pick up, but decent overall pick up to maintain higher highway speeds. This SUV is surprisingly quiet on the highway and far more comfortable that one may think. I'd get the SEL or Limited rather than the SE. The SEL and Limited come with 17 inch wheels and don't look cheap.

Electronics and navigation systems are easy  to use and it is an overall a very easy car to drive. It's not the most stylish vehicle on the road, but Hyundai is doing a facelift in 2023 that will give it a few more looks.

I own a SEL and I easily get 40 mpg on the highway for the 121 hp engine. So you don't need a ton of power to get where you need to go.

This little SUV is alot more comfortable than it looks. It does lack a little power from a stand still, and not a bad thing, people drive too fast anyway, but it does very well on the highway, local or long distance. Gas mileage on mine is 35/40, nothing to be ashamed of. I have a SEL. The seats are very comfortable and the cargo space is adequate. The price is very reasonable as well.

I bought this car in Feb 2022 (Approx. $25000 out the door Price) and this is a very good car for this amount of money, especially with a bunch of features with good engine performance. Till now I did not feel any kind of trouble. Easy to park in a small place and very good Mileage in the city as well as on the highway. I love this compact SUV.
Super gas mileage, good power, exceptional safety features. Best compact SUV on the market. Great value for money.

I drove a 2008 Hyundai Tucson until this year when, after retiring and no longer commuting, I bought my Hyundai Venue Denim. I wanted a zippy little car with all the safety bells and whistles. My Venue Denim is the only one I found that has all I needed as standard equipment. All the others (Toyota, Honda, Subaru, Nissan, etc.) required upgrades of many expensive packages, easily turning a $22,000 base price into a $35,000 car.
Aside from price, the Venue Denim is an attractive little car, resembling the much more expensive and far less reliable Mini Cooper or Fiat 500. While all other subcompacts are either black, white, gray, silver or obnoxious with mostly black interior, the Denim is a sophisticated navy blue with a denim-colored interior, making the car look much more expensive than it is.
The Venue is zippy in city driving, easy to park, gentle on gas and adequate on the freeway. All in all I'm more than pleased.

Lucid air is definitely the king of electric vehicles. No other car compares. Performance is top notch, interior design and quality is absolutely impeccable. Interior made of Peruvian wool and lamb leather. Let’s talk about storage too! Trunk and trunk have two levels. We fit as many things into the Lucid as into our Suburban. Drives comfortably like a Mercedes. Racing performance like with Porsche. Rear leg room sits very tall people comfortably while having tall people sit in front too. Absolutely worth the buck. And please don’t compare it to Tesla. Tesla can only be compared with a prius
Wow no words to describe this. After the Teslas and many Mercedes in my life there is no going backwards. It’s Lucid moving forward.

I bought my 3 year old " pure " in the summer of 2021.Got a good price on line from a dealer out side the tiny cars range so I bought it sight unseen delivered on a truck. Fingers crossed. Every thing worked on my ride around the block and still does. Three winters, last particularly frigid and no problems starting, running or charging as usual.  It still has a pair or years guarantee  on the electrical components so while I'm nosing around for my next ride, my funny looking little MB is treating me like I knew what I was doing all along.

Great cars for a retired couple who mainly use them for driving short runs. In eco mode on city streets with no heater or A/C in use display shows a 100 +/- mile range. On the freeway with A/C or heat expect half of that. We live in Phoenix so no worries about cold batteries. 5  stars for drivers that fit into what it can do.

The 2018 Electric Smart for Two has plenty of zip, a good range for around town and charges easily overnight on a 110 volt circuit.  We charge it every other night, it's only driven back and forth to work and for local errands.  Parking is easy, due to its size and maneuverability.  Acceleration is brisk when needed and the Smart for Two holds its own on the freeway.
I love this car. when I travel with this car I enjoy driving this car. And It's true that Honda Accords are renowned for their durability and reliability.
A lot of room, great mpg, and love the new look! The interior is nice with a spacious trunk. Ive only had it for a few weeks but so far its been great. Hondas have always been reliable for me.

The EX model gives you more & the extra cost is worth it. Front drivers seat has 10 way power seats which are better than the manual on the LX. Overall I like it better than the hybrid. Both have issues for the long haul, & predicted costs to repair is something they both share. Ride on the EX is smooth ,pickup is adequate.  Fuel economy is par as stated on the sticker  but I am getting better than stated so that's a +. Seats are pretty comfortable & the rear offers a LOT of legroom & headroom.  Visibility in front is very good. Extra features in the EX are nice.  Lane assist, blind spot monitoring, heated seats ,come in handy on occasion. Trunk lid opens up fully with remote or push button on key fob. Rear doors open very wide so entry & exit is pretty good.  Same for front doors. Ground clearance is decent so not too difficult getting in & out. For me, going up to the hybrid just wasn't worth the added cost & not that many added features. The EX was the "sweet spot" for me. Time will tell how it holds up, as Honda has always been reliable even though some say its reputation is slipping.  But, that's what is offered today so we have to go with that. Gone are the days past when less $ gets you more. But overall,  the accord EX is checking most of the box's I require for my use.

This is the most reliable car I've ever owned! I've only had it for 2 years but in that time, I've had zero issues. It is quiet and has great gas mileage. I take my friends and family in it all the time and they rave about the big room in the back and how clean it is!

I have 2021 accord 2.0 is reliable and runs great. 3 years and 48,000 miles later auto dimming headlights don't work, auto start don't work, alarm doesn't arm when locked doesn't work, Honda sensing doesn't work. When it comes to Honda tech this car is a lemon!

2018 accord sport, multiple lights on, dealership doesn't know what is the issue,  last report said, cylinder misfires...
Sensors acting weird multiple times.

I got this vehicle at the beginning of this year January of 2023 and I can honestly say now I'm glad I made the decision to receive this vehicle. It's reliable and cheap to maintain and give you the right power and drive to give you just the right amount of happiness you can receive from a drive. I would say with this Accord you can look forward to have it for a while with keeping up to maintenance and everything up to date. The econ mode also saves you gas, along with the 1.5L ,I-Vtec turbocharged engine, giving that push if needed. (This is even the LX base model, with less features) imagine the 2.0L sport version.

Honda has always built reliable vehicles and mine is no exception. Nothing has gone wrong with the vehicle yet. It has a-lot of features to make your long & short trips easier, plenty of space for a family of 5 to get around safely. I’ve owned numerous Hondas in my lifetime and they’re great. This Sport model is built in the USA, Like my Honda! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
CHEAP HORRIBLE CAR. DEALER WAS HORRIBLE. SORRY I BOUGHT IT. LACKS BASIC FEATURES, HARD TO SELL. I BOUGHT IT USED. NO WARRANTY FROM THE DEALER.
Car is awesome, only thing is the 19" wheels I could do without. Other than that I'm 6'00" tall an don't have a problem comfort wise

I purchased this car new. The only problem that i had was with the low profile tires. In the first 3 years ,i had to replace 3 tires and two rims. The potholes in my area were horrible. The car hit a pothole, destroyed the tires. I would recommend the larger of the 4 cylinder turbo. It replaced the 6 cylinder that I hade in my previous accord. The only other problem with the car is the that it is very low,and is  hard to get in and out
I love this car. when I travel with this car I enjoy driving this car. And It's true that Honda Accords are renowned for their durability and reliability.
A lot of room, great mpg, and love the new look! The interior is nice with a spacious trunk. Ive only had it for a few weeks but so far its been great. Hondas have always been reliable for me.

The EX model gives you more & the extra cost is worth it. Front drivers seat has 10 way power seats which are better than the manual on the LX. Overall I like it better than the hybrid. Both have issues for the long haul, & predicted costs to repair is something they both share. Ride on the EX is smooth ,pickup is adequate.  Fuel economy is par as stated on the sticker  but I am getting better than stated so that's a +. Seats are pretty comfortable & the rear offers a LOT of legroom & headroom.  Visibility in front is very good. Extra features in the EX are nice.  Lane assist, blind spot monitoring, heated seats ,come in handy on occasion. Trunk lid opens up fully with remote or push button on key fob. Rear doors open very wide so entry & exit is pretty good.  Same for front doors. Ground clearance is decent so not too difficult getting in & out. For me, going up to the hybrid just wasn't worth the added cost & not that many added features. The EX was the "sweet spot" for me. Time will tell how it holds up, as Honda has always been reliable even though some say its reputation is slipping.  But, that's what is offered today so we have to go with that. Gone are the days past when less $ gets you more. But overall,  the accord EX is checking most of the box's I require for my use.

We bought our Accord Hybrid new in 2019 after owning a Camry Hybrid for 10 years. The Accord drive and handles great in summer and winter but do not expect to get anywhere near 48 MPG in cold weather. Warm weather driving in town you will get 48 MPG+ but will be lucky to get 36 MPG on the highway. Winter driving if you get 40 in town and 30 on the highway you will be lucky. We now have 50,000 on our Accord and have averaged less than 37 combined year round MPG. That's 20% less than promoted from Honda. Our old Camry hybrid always got the factory estimated mpg summer and winter and we drove for 10 years. If you are in the market for a Hybrid sedan buy a Camry!

This car drove nice and was one of my favorites. However, the MPG was no where near the rated 50 MPG advertised. My average MPG was 34.5. I did not get to drive this car past 31200 miles when the head gasket failed between cylinders 3 and 4 to coolant. Fortunately, I had 5 months left on the power train warranty and Honda will cover the repair (6000 to repair was the quote without warranty). I have since sold it back to the dealer I bought it from because I can not trust that I may need to replace the head gasket again later. Maybe I just got a bad one? You have been warned.

Excellent car overall, consistently good in quality, performance and efficincy.
Car is very comfortable in space the interior is nice and includes good technology.

Very spacious car for passengers. Rides very smoothly. A cut above in terms of quality when compared to other brands. Currently at 40,000 trouble-free miles.

A huge convenience factor is that one tank can get you to about 600 miles. Sometimes I barely fill up for gas every 4 weeks. absolutely spacious car. Just note that it does sit low, so it's basically the opposite of what you'd experience in an SUV (ingress/egress is harder, no hauling large bulky objects.
No spare tire. You will have to buy one.   The car handles very well and tracks straight down the road.
Great features, one of the best car I’ve own. Drives very smooth. The engine don’t make much noise. Also a gas saver

This is my first Honda, ever. What originally attracted me to this car was it's looks. With the larger wheels that come standard with the touring packing, there simply is not a better looking, 4 door sedan in the price point I paid in my viewpoint. Next I was attracted to how quiet the car is. As there is little to no noise at all when driving at lower speeds when it is using mostly battery power. And when you accelerate in it, the noise is still fairly quiet. And yes, the gas milage is great as well. I gave it less than 5 stars for it comfort because it is  a small bit of a challenge to enter into the driver's seat. But once you get used to holding onto the steering wheel as you drop yourself into the seat, it's not that bad. And I fully expect not to ever be disappointed with its 
reliability. If I could give it more stars, I would.

A great commuter car. I've owned much nicer cars in the past, but this is great for getting me to work and back. And while it is compact, the hatchback style is very useful and flexible.

I have the 1.5T Touring, last car owned 2007 Honda Accord EXL V6. First of all the dynamics. The car drives very well given the tiny 1.5L engine, which would be better suited for Europe than the US. I drove the Accord too but the engine is too small for the larger Accord. It has a CVT, which is generally awful but Honda was able to make it one of the best CVTs on the market, it will never act like an automatic but it is responsive and in sport mode very engaging. CVTs generate a lot of heat when driven hard so unsure, how durable it will be. The handling is very good and the car plays nice when thrown around the corners. Infotainment and digital gauge display looks nice for the class, leather seats are decent but don't expect anything fancy given the price . 
Downsides: small displacement turbo will not live very long, so forget the legendary Honda reliability but if you buy new, I would say with proper maintenance it should be trouble free for about 100k miles. The fuel consumption is disappointing, it only is within the factory parameters if you drive in econ mode and under 75mph on the highway with no accelerations. If you want to drive dynamically or have "fun", you would be better off with a used car with a V6 engine, which will not have this kind of variability. The leather seats have no lumbar support!!!! Really, and the passenger seat has no height adjustment? The person who came up with this should be fired along with the supervisor who approved it - and this is the top version of the Civic, really?

- The hatchback has a leak in the trunk area that is close to the electric compartments.
- There's a lot of cabin noise. There's a lot of sounds but especially the rattling in the dash area and on both passengers and drivers. Cheaper plastic
- Honda doesn't offer satellite radio for this trim despite the price 
- Overall quality control has declined immensely


*It's super fun to drive
*Went on a road trip and lane assist with cruise control was such a game changer
*They brought back dials for the AC which is nice
*Driver's dashboard has a simple yet appealing image
*Lots of trunk space


Overall, I regret this car tremendously and won't be buying a Honda vehicle in the future.

If you need a car that can get you from a to b while saving you a decent amount of gas this is their car. Other than some weird safety systems nonsense it has not given me a single issue after 4000 miles.

My review is for the civic sport specifically. I was just shocked how bad a brand new car can be. The ride quality is very harsh. I live in Illinois where roads are bad but I still have my other vehicles that obsorb the imperfections much better. The car also has very little if not no sound deadening. When your at highway speeds it is very loud. Making it difficult to have a conversation with someone. The sound system is pretty mediocre, very dry and not much bass. The infotainment display on the radio again not very good. Any cell phone made in the last 5 years has a better resolution screen. Finally the drive train, It is very slow, it may be because of the cvt transmission. But the engine feels very underpowered. Again in highway situations, you will have a hard time getting up speed and forget about passing someone just stay in the right lane because that's this is where this car belongs. The only pro I could find is that it gets decent gas mileage.

Great looking car. Attracts attention everywhere. Easy to drive at normal speeds or fast. Very comfortable ride. Solid steering feel. Great brakes. Quick enough, but nothing corners like a Type R.

Not a car for the faint of heart or someone who just wants practical & comfortable. But if you want a performance car you can take to the race track on the weekend, drive to work on Monday and the warehouse store in the evening, the CTR is by far the best car on the market in a decade. For the driving experience & performance, this car ranks in the top 5 or 10 year after year according to multiple motorsports journals for good reason. It is just so much fun to drive hard, and it's not a lot of work or hard to drive this car to the edge.
For those who don't want to stand out, this car is not for them, it's styling can be very polarizing. But if you don't care what others think of the styling of your car, or care more about performance and Honda reliability, then you won't care that folks take notice of you everywhere you go. You'll earn respect on the track from cars two, three and more times expensive.

Some cars are fun to drive. Some are practical. Some are comfortable. No other car I know of comes close to nailing all three. World class braking, handling, steering, grip? Check. Great engine? Check. Seats that hold you in place but don't beat you up? Check. More storage than some crossovers/SUV's? Yes. Good mileage, low insurance, low repair costs, reliability and legroom for adults in the rear? Yes. 'One car to rule them all, one car to sass them, one car to bring them all, and on the Nordschlieff pass them.'

If your looking for an all around blast to drive, this car is it! It is surprisingly powerful, handles extremely well, and when you want to dial it back and need to take a road trip with the family, it becomes an incredibly comfortable, practical car that is still an absolute joy to drive casually. I haven’t seen another car that is both a really good sports car and a really good daily driver that does as good as this one.

I bought one of the first Claritys in the Denver market in 2018. It was shipped directly from Japan. The car is comfortable, roomy and has all the updated tech (audio, visual and safety). I get compliments from passengers all the time. The gas mileage is superior and the electric battery capacity is enough to get you around town a few days a week!

I am very pleased with this car.  In the summer here in Wisconsin I am getting @60 miles per charge.  In the winter, over 40 miles per charge.  With gas, @43 mpg. 
I seldom buy gas and have no range anxiety.  The sport mode has plenty of power but usually use eco mode.  The trunk has lots of space, and a roomy interior for a smaller car.  I use CarPlay almost all the time for music and navigation.  Rather sporty looking too.  With the $7500 tax credit it was a great purchase.

great, comfortable car
always charged at home, so i paid just for electricity during the price gouging going on during the last couple of years

A Clarity Plug-in Hybrid is unlike most other cars.  It is really an all electric car that carries along a gasoline engine and generator to keep the battery charged.  It's transmission has only one gear besides neutral and park.  It gives you the best of both worlds, the all electric car world and the plane old gasoline car.  It has the longest electric range of any plug-in hybrid.  You can drive around town, do your shopping and errands, go to the theater and to dinner and never use even a teaspoon of gasoline.  This is just like an all electric car.  Yet you can also drive cross country on gasoline getting 40 to 45 miles per gallon and never have to even think about finding a charging station, just like any gasoline car.
Besides all this it has many advanced systems like adaptive cruise control, lane keeping and a built in Garmin GPS.

Great EV powerful car! I regularly get 45-47 miles per charge. Additional gas tank is small so not much $ to fill up during this gas price hike. Very comfortable, safe, good navigation system and alter system.

As a car, it’s perfect. I’ve owned Hondas since 1974, over 20 different ones. My current garage has the Clarity, a 2003 S2000, and a 2007 Accord, EX-L with 270,000 miles!
ALL are great cars.

The exterior looks sleek, and the interior is gorgeous. i have the Touring model, and the beautiful leather interior is smooth, warm, and surprisingly spacious. i've never had a car that felt so roomie. The center console is a joy to use, and the integrated CarPlay screen is awesome.

It's great that the back seats fold down to make more room to store stuff, though i wish the hole to the trunk was larger, but i only needed that once when trying to move a larger furniture item.

The acceleration is very good, and you can clearly tell when you're on electric vs gas, and unless you're putting the pedal to the metal, you'll be on electric the whole time. i saw some other electric hybrids that turned on the gas motor to run the AC and heating system. i'm happy to say that this doesn't, it's all electric until you've run out of battery, then seamlessly switches to gas. My normal commute of 15 miles or so means i'm always on battery, and haven't had to use gas at all in my normal day.

Honestly, i've had a lot of cars in my life, but this is the first car i've ever had that i actually look forward to driving every single day.

I’m having continued problems with the air conditioner under warranty and now out of warranty. It keeps leaking Freon. Already replaced condenser once but another air conditioning problem. Dealer said repair about $2,000.  Called Honda and they reduced the price to $630.  I think I’ll sell it now.

Also wanted Apple Carplay, Heated Seats, Electric adjustable seats, Romote start and Keyless Entry.  Best Car I Have Owned!!!
