I have decided that this will be the first and final General Motors (GM) product that I will purchase. The air conditioning failed at 60,000 miles due to a problem with the condenser. At 65,000 miles, I had to replace the transmission because it was causing very rough shifts between gears 1-2 and 2-3. Unfortunately, at 120,000 miles, the transmission is once again exhibiting the same issue it had before it was replaced. Additionally, I was unlucky enough to have a truck that experiences paint peeling on nearly every body panel. This is especially prominent in large sections near the windows and rear doors. Needless to say, I will not be making this mistake again.

My base model truck has been going strong since I bought it new.  It has had zero mechanical issues in that time and only one minor issue otherwise when a speaker connection worked loose and caused a buzzing in my music.  I would buy this truck again and again.  Now it is paid off and has cheap insurance, no payment, and no issues.  Everyone should be so lucky to drive a nice looking truck that they own outright.

Purchased this SLT Texas Edition new. No troubles with the 8 speed or the 5.3L. I had to replace the battery and changed out all four o2 sensors. Everything works. It gets 21MPG on Texas freeways 80+mph. Runs very smooth. I decided to do 2WD instead of 4x4. Off road, the Eaton rear locker works great. Its lighter than the 4x4 and handles a little better on the HI ways. If you live in the snow, get the 4WD. I only service at the dealer and keep in the garage. Mint shape. 

I wish it had a larger tank for the long road trips.

I have had my 2014 with only one problem the AC went out from a leak it’s fixed. Than of coarse tires brakes. 9 years old 141100 miles still no rust knock on wood running strong of coarse I have always changed my oil and used premium Mobile One.

The truck has a ton of options which you pay for. The 6.2L V8 engine is a gas guzzler. The 8 speed transmission is terrible. Clunky shifting, jumping on take off and in low gear. instrument panel lights are already burning out. It should probably be traded in to be honest.

2018 Quicksilver Met In colour Sierra for Sale. One owner- bought straight from the Dealer, well maintained, includes rims to fit winter tires. 10 month old summer Michelin tires. Economical 4 wheel drive reliable transportation. One year remaining on some extended warranty items. Has a remote starter. Newly detailed.
Front Driver door replaced because my neighbour backed into it while it was parked on the street. Doesn’t affect the integrity of the vehicle.

Solid and dependable, I still love this truck!  Absolutely zero issues.  Whether it's load after a home improvement run, pulling the camper into the mountains or across the country, or shifted into 4-wheeldrive...it does its job with excellence.

I bought this as my retirement vehicle. Couldn’t ask for a better truck. Lots of power, reliable, and plenty of room are some of the traits I love the most. I haven’t had to do anything except for routine oil changes/maintenance and topping off the DEF every 3rd fill up of diesel. Getting about 23 mpg which is great for such a BEAST of a truck.

This is a wonderful truck. I admit that this is my first big truck, but it sure is a nice truck. I purchased this vehicle with a specific goal of towing a camping trailer. This truck can tow up to 16,400 pounds with a fifth wheel, and I believe pretty close to that with the hitch. This is the 6.6 L gasoline engine. It might not get the best gas mileage I’ve ever had, but considering I’m towing a 14,000 pound trailer it does really well! It can tow the trailer down the interstate at 70 miles an hour no problem at all.  All in all it is a fun truck to drive and really looks cool!

Great truck, loved it until the DEF tank heater malfunctioned and shut down the truck.  Now sitting waiting for the replacement tank for over 10 weeks.  Turns out every HD truck 2020 and 2021 has the same problem and all will need this replacement that is being produced at a snail's pace by GM.  Per the dealership, last count, over 9000 trucks like mine are idle waiting for this part.  $65000 waste of money and terrible service by GMC (not the local dealership).
This truck is expensive but you get what Gypsy for!  I wished they would make the 10 speed Allison transmission standard on all Denali pickups!  Gas mileage is a bit low but overall,  love this truck

Infotainment system is unreliable and does something different every time I start the truck. I have been back to the dealer 6 times for repairs to the parking sensors. Two weeks ago the DEF tank heater shorted out and the dealer cant get parts. I can get the part if I want to pay 750.00 for something covered under warranty but GM won't release them to the dealer for warranty work. 
When passing a car on a hill the wheels spun a bit which caused the traction control and hill start assist to come on at the same time. Left drivers mirror won't fold in like the right one does. Radio tells me it needs an update but fails when it try's to download it. All for this and 72000.00 price tag. I can't wait to get rid of it.
This one of the most solid vehicles that I have ever driven! The 401 hp engine is more than enough power and the transmission is smooth!  Highly recommend this truck!

Traded in a 2017 Super Duty on a 2021 Denali 2500 HD.  What a great upgrade GM did to these trucks in 2020 as the cabin size of the Crew Cab is now equal to the Ford Super Duty.  Plus you get the 10 speed transmission which provides super smooth shifts.  The two best traits of the GMC HD are the smooth ride due to the independent front suspension an the fuel mileage of the Duramax 6.6L diesel.  The ride vs a solid front axle is night and day specially if you’re not towing all of the time and IMO, the fuel mileage is about 10% better on the 6.6L Duramax vs the 6.7L PowerStroke.

Like new condition!
Seat covers
3 side steps each side 
Premium wheels 
A sharp,  MUST SEE truck. Hard to find, too!

I have a 2016 Sierra SLT, it’s an extremely capable, reliable, and comfortable truck. Rides much better than my father-in-laws F250. Also in my experience the Duramax gets great mpg for such a big truck. I average 16 mpg mixed driving and have even gotten close to 25 mpg consistently going 60 mph. Currently have 39,000 trouble free miles on it and am planning on keeping it for many more years! I will say with the generation of these trucks that use the CP4 injection pump, make sure you always fuel up at high traffic stations and use a good additive in your fuel. The CP4 has zero tolerance for water contamination in the fuel. Still have 36,000 miles of my extended warranty and am planning on switching to a CP3 injection pump after the warranty expires. That’s about the only weak link on these trucks!
أحتاج إلى هذه السيارة، أريد 15000 كم how are you please quickly replacement gddhhdGmcgfs do khgfddfjfdddnn

My 2019 GMC Denali has astonishing torque and power, even while pulling my camper in and around Colorado, including over passes. Nothing short of awe-inspiring!

 Owner: TM
Absolutely no scratches.  Been extremely well cared for.  Used o pull  41 ft 5rh wheel camper. A real beautiful truck!
I was looking for a place to find a fair quote for my vehicle and on the recommendation of a friend I found you. All the evaluation software seems perfect to me. Thanks a lot.
Kelley blue book is great. I recommend it to everyone. It gave me that answer I wanted. And now I feel comfortable.

The truck is perfect in and out. Low mileage, and has been garaged throughout since new.  It has all the equipment needed for towing except the hitch.  All the maintenance records are with the sales dealer.  No accidents.   Looks new!!!!  Always washed and cleaned in and out.  Non smoking truck.  Waxed 2 x a year and detailed.  There is nothing that would need to be done.
Have a good esthetic  and look aggressive,the front is very good and look like old and modern. :^|.

Pulling a conventional 10,000 lb trailer over mountain passes is a whole new experience. Staying at the speed limit up long steep grades did not change the engine temperature. I feathered the accelerator up the mountain. The new 10 speed transmission is so smooth you cant feel it changing gears. This is my second GMC Denali Duramax, first being a 2016. I debated trading in for over a year, and am so happy I made the trade. Trailers always exceed by far the tongue weight posted on them, and in my case it came in at 1450 lbs. That exceeded my trucks posted maximum. The 2020 dually posts a 2,000 lb tongue weight, so now I can front load the trailer, and that reduces sway. If you can afford it, and have a heavy trailer, buy the truck!
The truck doesn’t have a sun roof which it was suppose to have

I have 107k miles on it now. Traveled the whole western USA pulling my 43' fifth wheel and its unstoppable. Just set the cruise control and turn on the exhaust brake and I breeze up and down hills. The steering wheel commands are all I need. I had one issue with the #4 injector went bad. Tech said the wiring lead shorted out. Lots of labor to fix it and it was just outside the warranty period. Cost $2500. I use it everyday for work now. I do notice the shift points can be off for a little while if I go from high elevation down to low. Computer catches up though. The truck gets a lot of compliments for its looks. Overall I'd buy it again.
It’s been an awesome truck tons of power to pull my camper no mechanical problems whatsoever
A rock-solid truck. Great tow rig. Tow a 5th wheel toy hauler, 16K lbs and it tows perfectly.

The truck pulls and prefers well when it's not in the shop. I've had oil leaks, boost leaks, a few recalls and had the entire power steering system go out (the gear box and pump) oh and now the transmission is slipping. This truck has been a nightmare and I'll never buy another GM vehicle.

Very strong truck, it's the work truck package and rides a pretty rough which is understandable considering its a 3500.  It is the best 4 wheel drive pickup I've ever owned.  I use it for working in the Oil/Gas Fields of northwestern New Mexico and have yet to have any problems with it.  I've had Fords in the past and while the engines in them are ok, the transmissions don't hold up for oilfield use, while I've never had an issue with the GM transmissions.

Worse truck I ever purchased.  The truck has a 6.0 V8 but even with that, it has no power under load.  The vehicle gets an average 8 MPG on a good day driving downhill.  If you tow with it, you'll be lucky to get 5 MPG.   It does look good and the tech options in it aren't bad and neither was the 4x4 but as mentioned that will also kill you MPG.  Don't buy it if you're cost conscious.  The cost of it versus it's MPG and abilities makes it a loser.  If you're just considering looks, then it's a nice looking truck.

Ive owned a few other trucks prior to this 2016 Denali Dually Duramax. Dodge was horrible for quality and service. I traded in my 2008 Silverado Crew 6.0 gas for this Duramax and had not one issue with that Silverado. The only thing thus far is the stereo can be a little glitchy and sometimes the steering wheel buttons dont work, but after talking with the dealer they did say theyve had some issues with it and theyll reprogram it when I go in for my first service. Not worried about it at all, GM has been great in the past about fixing issues unlike Dodge and sometimes Ford. The other issue to keep this truck from getting a 10 rating across the board is the vibration from the pedal. Seems like this should be an easy fix for GM engineers. Id also like the option of having 4.10 gears. In hilly regions it helps to not have to push the pedal and let off as you drive so much with these 3.73 gears. Since this truck has the Gooseneck / 5th wheel hitch factory installed, Id like to have the camera to see the hitch since we hook the gooseneck up several times per week and it gets to be a real pain getting in and out trying to line up the ball you cant see. Lastly, I really wished theyd give us some real AT or off road type tires. These ATs they give as an option are really more like radials for on road. Im a farmer and will be using this truck in the fields and these are not a good off road tire. Id opt for a Reaper except towing my tractors and hay from one field to the farm would be too much for a 1/2 ton truck, so I opted for this 3500 but now need to spend additional money on better tires. Overall Id recommend this truck to others without a doubt.

I love this truck.  I had 1 warranty issue at 5k miles.  The steering gear failed - this was not the first truck that had this problem at my dealer.  Dealer had the truck for 6 days waiting for new part.  Only other con is 70k sticker price.  Duramax/Allison combo is amazing.  Lots of engine/trans braking features.  Just great for towing.  I pull a 6,000 lb. snowmobile trailer.  Plug in the cruise at 70 - RPMs lock in, trans never shifts on highway grades.  Truck is super quiet and comfortable.  Love the crew cab and long box - room for your crew/gear. It is a bull!  Id buy it again without a doubt.

One of the first things I did was test drive the AT4 with my wife in front seat, my 6' son and the 6' 6" 300lb+ salesman in the backseat. Although my wife and I are 5'10" I asked my backseat passengers if the were comfortable after we adjusted our seats. They both said yes but I was skeptical so I asked my son to let me sit in the backseat next to our giant salesman.  I was surprised that it was comfortable.  So I got back in to drive and used the driver memory feature that adjust drivers seating to my specific levels. Nice feature. I got on the road and got to a red light. When it turned green I jumped on it and was surprised by the smooth acceleration and got up to 60mph in about 8 seconds. I drove it home after the purchase and never felt like it didn't respond to acceleration getting into the fast lane.  I cruised home at 75mph which about as fast as I drive on freeways and it felt solid. I know it's new and only has 47 miles on this 4 1.5 turbo but so far so good. My only concern is I'm not sold on the audio yet streaming my favorite tunes but it might just need some adjustment to trebl and bass which is a minor thing in my world. The looks of the exterior of summit white with black alloy wheels makes it pop. I'll put the AT4 up to any other compact SUV style, comfort and performance for the price. Suggested retail was $34000 I paid $28000 with dealer discounts. I'm very satisfied with the overall experience.
Comfortable. economical. Roomy. My third terrane. Great safety features. I don’t haul a lot of stuff.
9 speed transmissions have Issues. 7” infotainment console have Issues. Good Brakes. Nice Audio Speakers. Very sensitive to cold weather. Avoid unless warranty’d.

I had the 2019 GMC TERRAIN SLT. Obviously I fell in love with it because of the stylish look and how smoothly it drove. In December of 2022 I had my first accident. With the amount of force it took to rip every single thing off underneath mycar and the impact, the collision center  was shocked the air bags did not deploy. Fast forward 3 months of getting it fixed, it was 14k in damages. May of 2023 a driver was not paying attention and completely totaled it out. Everywhere where there was an air bag popped open but the air bags did NOT deploy instead caused my car to fill with smoke. However the accident was  so bad my kid's airbags in their carseats did their job. This is a GMC issue they fail to put a recall on. I QUICKLY fell out of love with my car. It failed to do its job to protect me and my kid's. I will NEVER buy a terrain EVER AGAIN!
I love everything about my Terrain! Best car I have owned! The gas mileage is perfect especially with the prices these days.
Ride is good.  Gas mileage is good. Took time to get used to the shift buttons. Also like that it has a button to turn off the stop start function.
The car is uncomfortable and low power and to much outside noise sits a little low then I figured so if I had to buy again I would not
Above average comfortable and excellent quick speed with turbo engine. Do not like wind noise. Love body style, just thinking of updating to newer car.

Vehicle had a defect from the factory. Every time it rained water would run down the inside of the dash and into the floor. The water covered the wiring and passenger side fuse panel. After three attempts at my local service center the leak was stopped. Now the vehicle is having electrical issues. The yukon has been at the shop a total of 70 days. GM’s solution to the problem was to send a field service engineer to work on it for another 15days. I have been a diehard GM customer since I was 14 years old. To say the least, this is very disappointing. Obviously, this isn’t the case with all GM vehicles. I just wish GM would make it right!

I bought a 21 Yukon XL, SLT with the premium package (captain chairs, tvs, leather) in January of 21 before the chip shortage.  I only drive it once a week (I have a work car) and on family road trips. At 1 year old and 3k miles, it died in a drive thru.. fuel regulator.. and had to be towed (fun fact you can't put them in neutral since the transmission is all electronic). On to June 25, 2023... The radio had to be replaced because it wouldn't download an update and it could just stop working at any point, also disabling the wifi (one week before our two week road trip). July 14th 2023, driving home on the last day of our two week road trip... the engine (we believe) breaks a lifter 100 miles from home and we have to get it towed, find a hotel, then work out two rental cars (family of 5 with two weeks worth of luggage) to get home.  I was never a GM fan, but my wife was raised on them. I will be getting rid of this garbage as soon as I get it back... from the second major failure, with only 11k miles on it.

i bought a brand new 2022 gmc yukon slt in november 2021 . i decided to go with a new truck to avoid dealing with previous owner miss taking care and stuff . after 1 year the truck start to experience problem . 2 times battery will completely drain and it wont turn on . now we have a similar situation but now the battery is full and suv would not turn on. it cranks but its not turning on. i have a sierra 2014 not even that truck has gave me so much problems as this new suv. worst decision i made .

Let’s be real here, all SUVs are pricey these days, even cheaper know cars like Kia’s. Then it gets more expensive with full-size SUVs, and desirable ones like the GM brand. My Yukon wasn’t cheap by any means, but I knew that going in. It is huge, comfortable, and has all the features that I could need and want. The gas mileage is just horrible, as expected, but I knew I wasn’t buying a Prius here. My biggest complaint is with GM, they nickel and dime you to death with ridiculous add-on subscription based services. Even the My GM app costs $15/month, absurd, and this service used to be free!

Have owned Escalades before, the Denali is as good and $25,000 less expensive 
Highly Recommend the Denali

5th Tahoe/Suuburban/Yukon over 23 years. They just keep getting better. I have the Ultimate Denali with Air Ride and it's an amazing SUV. I'd forgo the rear entertainment, as it's a bit clunky and kids prefer tablets anyway. I'd obviously prefer it in the <$70k range, but paying $80k+ was the price in mid-2021 (before dealerships stated tacking on market adjustments of $5k).
It drives smoother than any of my other trucks, and it is a very big truck. I only need 3 seats, but I carry a lot of weights and workout equipment.

Bought brand new, 6 miles on it when I picked it up from the dealer. Overall interior impressions right away was this was nice, and that is still true today. 

However....when I was leaving the dealer, several things went wrong on a 6 mile vehicle. 
1- my sales advisor was walking me through all the features and was demoing the sun shade on the pano roof...it went all the way back and got stuck. brand new car, sunshade broke. ok not a big deal, dealer tried to see if it was software related, nope, actuator broke needed to order. ok not a  big deal. 

2 - Pulling the suv to the front of the dealership getting ready to leave, air suspension malfunction, suv was stuck in its highest setting. would not got down at all. again dealer ran diagnostic, not software related, needed to really investigate. i didnt have time to deal with that, bought it out of state, needed to get home, dealer assured me it was fine to drive as is. (it was). local dealer dealt with that issue. 

3  - leaving the dealer driving home, check engine light came on 30 miles into the drive home! called the dealer, they assumed it was related to the suspension but couldn't be sure. got home, had to schedule a full warranty repair on a vehicle with 6 miles on it...…literally bought it and had to take it back to the dealer. they kept it for 2 weeks

issues were all eventually resolved, suspension was related to check engine light, a pin was loose in the wiring harness that caused both issues, and the sunroof was fixed after 2 bad actuators. GMs quality control was honestly really disappointing on a 85K suv. since the repairs though, 0 issues and it runs great. 24K miles later my only complaint now is gas mileage  but that was totally expected.
Smooth ride in absolute luxury! Great power, amazingly comfortable for short and long trips. Lots of room, great heated and cooled seats. Best vehicle we've ever owned!

This is apparently a common issue with all I've read about this car. 

Vehicle has completely fallen apart starting at about 100,000 miles. First the starter, then the electronics modules, then the transmission, and now I have a cylinder misfire. This has all happened within the past 10,000 miles (currently at 111,500). 

I have good friend mechanics, but even at the good friend price, it's racked up a total of about $7,000 in repairs in that 10,000 mile span. Prior to that, had zero complaints. Guess you need to ditch it before you hit the magic number...
Looks nice that's about it... Transmission went out at 105,000 cost $7500, ac compressor went out right after $1500  then heated after that $1000 money pit!!

Hwy gas mileage is  good, not so much in the city.  We drive it from the Midwest to Florida every spring break and it does the job. Lots of room for the kids and can pull our boat. We've thrown a Bule on the top and I have a bike hitch for the front too.  We've had some issues with losing refrigerant and it rides like a truck, not a small SUV. The space and luxury style compartment make for this to be a great rode trip vehicle.
The last couple of months I’ve had a lot of engine issues other than that it’s the perfect vehicle for me. Especially with kids

Since I am on this car I have had only two minor issues, both repaired under warranty. It is a great riding vehicle, and we use it for extended trips.  Gas mileage isn't the best, but given its size and capability it doesn't surprise me. The 5.3 engine is more than adequate, with great acceleration, and isn't noisy. If I had anything I would complain about, would be that when second and third row seats are folded down it slants towards the back of the vehicle just slightly. This causes things to roll to the rear of the vehicle. Something I see they corrected on the newer generation.

I have owned this vehicle and have not abused it in any way.  The milage is true and just like a new used from dealerships.   I have only 14,600 miles or less.  It drives excellent and all items work.  I have always taken to dealership for service and oil changes.

Allows us to travel anywhere and we like not be tied down with a camper. This is what we want but it’s different for others. We also have a bike rack so we can go anywhere. The size allows room for people to tailgate with. Great vehicle for traveling.

Vehicle had a defect from the factory. Every time it rained water would run down the inside of the dash and into the floor. The water covered the wiring and passenger side fuse panel. After three attempts at my local service center the leak was stopped. Now the vehicle is having electrical issues. The yukon has been at the shop a total of 70 days. GM’s solution to the problem was to send a field service engineer to work on it for another 15days. I have been a diehard GM customer since I was 14 years old. To say the least, this is very disappointing. Obviously, this isn’t the case with all GM vehicles. I just wish GM would make it right!

July 14th 2023, driving home on the last day of our two week road trip... the engine (we believe) breaks a lifter 100 miles from home and we have to get it towed, find a hotel, then work out two rental cars (family of 5 with two weeks worth of luggage) to get home. Allows us to travel anywhere and we like not be tied down with a camper. This is what we want but it’s different for others. We also have a bike rack so we can go anywhere. The size allows room for people to tailgate with. Great vehicle for traveling.
This is a BMW that can be afforded by most and very fun and inexpensive to drive.   I don’t miss gas pumps, gas prices or waiting in line.

Like the styling or not, the quality is BMW.  My i3 REX is 10 years old, has 54K miles, looks new in and out, and has never required a repair or maintenance.  The electric "fuel costs" is 1/10 of what
the cost of driving my 2019 X5.  The car is only charged at home.  Coming in on the REX with the battery fully depleted, requires about 2.5 hours to charge a 220V, overnight at 110V.

I’ve owned 34 cars up to this point, across a wide spectrum ranging from muscle cars to sports cars, including Honda S2K, ‘67 Cuda AAR, BMW 335i. The i3 is one of the most fun vehicles to drive and most practical, making it the Best Value vehicle I’ve ever owned. We acquired it used with 18K miles and it has exceeded expectations in every category. It’s a Keeper! If you find one and it fits your lifestyle and vehicle requirements BUY IT!

Great car for the urban driver. I use it to go anywhere around town which is 98% of my driving. It's a pleasure to drive and never get tired of driving it. I got the REX (Range Extender) and never used the feature  except when the car does a maintenance check on the generator motor which charges the batteries while you drive. I get a range of about 100 miles on a charge and I normally never drive over 35 miles. The REX shows I get an additional 60 to 80 miles depending on my driving use. City uses less while highway driving uses more electricity. I bought it used in 2021 for 18K (great deal by constantly checking used cars ove a 2 month period). I found this one at a Mercedes-Benz dealership which was a trade in.

My "toe in the water" with an EV and a great choice.
This is the REx version, so range anxiety is reduced
Bought used so someone else took the heavy depreciation.
Styling is out-there and I love it. Interior is spacious, comfortable and almost silent.
Acceleration is amazing and handling surprisingly predictable and forgiving at the limit, considering the laughably skinny tires.
Steering is a little too quick, but you get used to it, but can make is a little jittery at freeway speeds, especially with a cross-wind (tall skinny car)

I absolutely love my i3. I have had a lot of cars over the years and this is my favorite. So much fun to drive. It is very fast off the line. My daily commute is 18 miles so a single charge gets me to work and back with no problem. I have a charger in my garage so I just plug it in at night and it's ready to go in the morning. 

I'm also about 400lbs and this car is the only one that fits me out of the entire BMW line. I know you think it's a small car but the design works for big guys.

I purchased the i3 for around short trips,  it is just a joy to drive it. I charge with the 110 volt level 1 charger and it takes 12 hours to get a complete charge which is not a problem for me.  Saving me loads of money not filling my x5 every week for $70.

Definitely love-it or hate-it styling!  Quirky looks add to its character.
Very well built with a surprisingly spacious interior. Seats are thin but comfortable. Dash is clean and modern.  
Performance is outstanding with good handling and decent braking ability.
Constantly getting "thumbs up" from other drivers and I can see why.

Only negative is the dated screen in front of the driver. The center screen is far better and customizable to show what you need and when.

Good range and no range anxiety with the range extender (though haven't needed it in my 1st 3 months)
Car is definitely a head turner! Great on gas, great style. This car for its price is definitely worth it.
Great car to drive u will love it drive anywhere u like with the push of a button it’s value is high and stays high

What can I say, this car is spectacular.  I got it in 2019 and fell in love instantly.  The look, the feel, the way it sticks to the ground at high speeds in curves is unreal.  This car is an engineering marvel.  The car gets 30-35 mpg on average so you can easily have it as a daily driver if you don’t mind putting miles on it.  The only con is that you can only get about 10 miles on the electric charge in full electric mode.  You can either charge it w the charger that’s included, or while driving it via the battery regenerating feature.  If you’re considering buying this car, do it.  I will be buying the roadster as soon as I can find a great deal!
No complaints! Just enjoy the experience of one of the best rides and head turners. Life is too short not to enjoy..
The car is a beauty and an engineering marvel. Stunning looks and great performance - it will become a classic
Nice . I don't know whyy I have to write a review to check the price of a car value on kbb but ill ramble
Excellent condition-
Good

Quick, handles well. 
Average if 27kwhr per 100 is the best we get. 
No massage passenger seat but in drivers seat that's weird.
Sun roof doesn't open and too far back unless you're in the back. 
Boot is very small

This is a hands-down drivers car. I bought brand new, ordered from BMW and picked up in Germany at the BMW Welt facility with 0 miles. I have loved every mile driven. I would give 5 stars in all categories but I what I noticed and also a complaint is the comfort section. BMW M made this car a little too stiff whether intended or not. Even DINAN suggests puting in some softer suspension. On bumpier roads it tends to jump around a little. Other than that, best performance car I have ever driven. Do yourself a favor and stick with the 6-speed manual.

The M2 is a serious sport or track machine, close to M3 or M4 performance, but for tens of thousands less!  And it feels like a smaller car as well! Amazing car for ripping along on the highway, but perfectly comfortable for getting the groceries (and it has plenty of room for them, too)!
The highly engineered M2 Competition has extraordinary handling, power, and ride. The steering is like being on rails. Very little lateral sway. Perfectly weighted, fantastic power. Great brakes.

I got my BMW M2 brand new with some mods installed by the dealer since the day one! This review is gonna reflect what a new buyer experienced.


Let's start with issues which you all want to hear about. I had really bad luck with the idrive system and that crashed completely and end up with a full replacement. Then the ambient temperature sensor went crazy and so AC stopped working properly. Then after 3 repairs then they end up replacing the computer box once again. Then both of my tail lights got water leak and then both got replaced!

What a little electronic and quality issue nightmares. But to be honest it was a simple fix and replacement but the dealership took forever to figure those out.

Then let's talk about handling and driving. I had many many cars in my history of driving as I had a company which allows me to rent car monthly! So I got free car to try basically nonstop. Like M3, Z4, Miata, Mustang, Corvette, Camero SS, Hellcat etc... So I had tried the full capability of this car in a track, and as a normal driver I will say this is a sweet spot of very high performance handling car with livable daily. Brakes are ok. (I had a M4 with ceramic brakes before M2, but M4 brakes are hard to live with daily as it is completely overkills). So with M4 that I felt I always living in the edge to M2, it feels like a completely different car with much more smaller easier to control car. Fun enough M2 is nowhere lightweight but definitely got its own character to it.

Sound wise it is just addictive. My M4 was like super loud however and wakes up the entire neighbour! But M2 just got the right sound to keep it going without those farting bangs. 

Car reviewers gave very high score to this car. However, I actually agree to many of them! Not just an ads afterall.

If you know how to drive a car w 500+ hp rear wheel drive , I can comfortably say this beast is one of the best performance cars out there on the road, fast, quick , constant acceleration up to 180mph without slipping on performance, handles great, sexy looks, comfortable and intimidates everything else around. If I have to complain, there would be only one issue , that is the brakes. Upgrade to a high performance brake pads from its original m3. thats all really, what a fun ride! Highly recommend the BMW Performance race school if you wanna up your game.

An amazing sports car and a daily driver, I can't get enough of.
No regrets, just good times. Buy it and don't look back!

The brakes are good but sometimes! From the beginning I complained about the brakes and bmw said it’s normal. It keeps happening random and almost crashed because of it so I took it back with a video of the issue then bmw said it doesn’t have a fix for it. The other day in the rain it was acting up causing me to crash so be careful buying m3 m4 because my friends having same issues with his m4 been happening since 6k miles

Styling: Wolf in sheep’s clothing...only car buffs recognize it, but if left stock is classy enough that valet will park it in front of a 5 star hotel. Performance: The COMP PKG is a blast to drive! Lots of torque and power that will land you in jail in Sport+ mode. Comfort: Absolutely a daily driver and good enough for the track on weekends. If you do that, I suggest replacing brake pads with aftermarket racing pads. Overall: Best performance car for the price!

I have had mine for 2 years and only put 5K miles on it.  It runs and looks as new.  I put a race chip in it - don't know if it gives me the full boost the manufacturer claims.  But this car is fun, fast and handles well.   The interior is very nicely done and the seats are cool.  It has great pick-up in all ranges and speeds.  It is very confident doing 90 in a 40 mph zone.  The ride is a bit harsh over bumpy pavement like we have here in DC, but it feels very sporty.  It's hard to justify a porsche when you can have all this for so much less.  I have had nearly a dozen BMws and this is my favorite so far for having sick fun.
cant say how much I like it, it went so fast!!!
Great tech, parks itself, very comfortable, perfect amount of power but can modded to increase performance easily
2021 BMW M4 is simply amazing. Performance, design, technology, is top notch! Highly recommended. Holds value very good 👍🏻

The power and performance versus cost are an insane value.
It's easy to modify and increase performance as well.

Worst cars in history. These cars don't hold there value. They are nice at first, but you go to trade it in have fun with that. Value Dropping Fast! These cars are just overly priced and not as reliable as other competitors. Here's my review, BMWs Sucks!! End of story for them, and good bye to there gasoline engines.

I can tell you now, I've had a 2015 and then a 2018 M4 Competition.  I have moved to an electric BMW I4 but that 2018 M4 is my favorite all time car.  I never had any issues.  It looks and sounds good. The handling is perfect, especially in sport mode which I drive most of the time.  I had mine tuned and it went from 444 to 549 HP for $800.  Wow, did that M4 fly.

I miss the car very much.  The M4 as a used car is a great deal. Have fun.
I have owned many M's but this one is truly special. Not too big , not too small and perfect amount of H.P. Very reliable and looks much better than the new buck teeth model :)

My 2019 M4 has already 58,230 miles on it! I have not had any electrical or any other mechanical issues, just the normal oil change and break check ups. I replaced my tires but other than that, it has no issues! I just love it! Too bad that rocks and things on the road give small scratches, chips or dents. but overall all the electronics and the powerful engine can’t be beat.
Simply a beast! I have the Competition package on mine, there is nothing else you need. Excellence acceleration and braking. I love the way she handle. Really the ultimate driving machine.

BMW has one of the worst resale value vehicles. These car's also have to many things wrong. My car has been in the service department for electrical issues, to engine problems. Not a good car, I wouldn't recommend it. Not for that price tag!!

The end of bmw m5 and all other BMW's gasoline vehicle's. Say hello to your new electric cars, suvs, trucks. Bmw never holds there value reputation any ways. One of the top worst resale value reputation vehicles in history. You think you are cool because you drive a bmw?? Well, your not..lol.. Side by side, a toyota camry vs bmw.. Only one will win in the long run. That's easy it's a toyota!!!
Best Bimmer  I’ve owned and I’ve owned plenty. Styling , performance, handling are over the top. Tanzanite blue is beautiful.

Incredible speed and handling, incredible sound from the exhaust, but also has incredible comfort modes that chang the ride from one or the fast race car in the world, to an incredibly comfortable luxury sedan. Best car I’ve ever had, and that’s after I had 3 Teslas in a row, including a Plaid. 

The M5 attracts attention of car enthusiasts. I had zero compliments with my Teslas over an 8 year period. After just 8 months with my M5, I’ve had over a dozens compliments.

The only downside to owning this car is that I cannot ever see myself owning another automobile that I will like better than this one.  I am Dad in a family of Five and this car regularly pulls duty as a family sedan, believe it or not.    You literally get to have your exotic sports car and family sedan in one.
If it wasn’t the best experience than idk what can be better than driving away with my dream car and the experience by us is yet to get even better
Never really  drive it great paint no scratches  no dent  nothing been replaced  everything original  minmal interior  wear (driver seat everything  works

This is the most fun I've had behind the wheel of a full size 4 door passenger car.  It's head-snapping quick, handles like a race car and has all the comfort features expected from a BMW.  Please keep on making these angry V8 beasts that rumble through the neighborhood to show that there's no substitute for horsepower and those silent electric rides are just a pedestrian accident waiting to happen.  Raw exhaust noise on tap here.

This is the second m6 convertable I have owned. I absolutely love it! I have a bad back and these seats are HEAVEN to sit in. The only downfall is this car LOVES to go FAST! A real head turner and a love to drive!! Don't test drive it unless you have the $$ to buy it because you will fall in love.

This is the kind of car that can be summed up in one word...excellent. From the thickly bolstered steering wheel, to the superior B&O sound, to the large trunk, to the exceptional seats this car is excellent. You'll read/hear "this is not a sports car", I'm a previous 2013 Audi RS5 and BMW M3 (E46) owner it's at least as much a sports car as they are. I'm also a previous BMW 3/5/and especially 7 series owner, not to mention Mercedes, Lincoln, etc. it's more luxurious than any of them to say the least. The ability to transform this car from all out beast to docile touring machine with the push of a button is phenomenal. Can you put two adults in the rear seats? Yes, will they want to take a cross country trip back there? No. However the same can be said of many luxury sedans. Reviews point to the weight of this car as if it's something bad. Is this car heavy? Yes. I personally prefer the weighted feeling of the car; the fact that it is endowed with technology that totally defeats the weightiness and allows you the to take windy roads like you're on rails is again...excellent. While this is easily one of the best looking cars I've ever seen, one can only really appreciate it from the driver's seat. If you're considering this car, you owe it to yourself to test drive it. Let me warn you before you do though, there's a very good chance that you'll be going to the bank shortly thereafter.
Engineered to perfection.  Incredible engine and gearbox.  A great family car without compromising on speed or quality.

I recently purchased a 2024 BMW M35i SUV and I am absolutely thrilled with my decision. The sleek and sporty design of this vehicle is a head-turner on the road. The performance is exceptional, with a powerful engine that provides a thrilling driving experience.

Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my 2024 BMW M35i. It combines style, performance, and luxury in a way that few other vehicles can match. I would highly recommend this SUV to anyone in the market for a high-end and exhilarating driving experience.

Love my 2019 BMW X1. This subcompact SUV has many positive attributes:
1. It has proven to be very reliable. I have had no trouble at all other than routine maintenance. Note it does require premium fuel and synthetic oil.
2. It drives like a BMW. For an SUV, it handles extremely well around corners with little to no body roll which makes it fun to drive while inspiring confidence. The AWD system works beautifully and has gotten me safely through heavy snowstorms.
3. The interior is classy with a nice balance upscale materials and utility. I have the sport seats which are nicely bolstered and heated. For a subcompact SUV, the cargo space is ample and comes with a hidden compartment which is a nice detail. 
4. The main detractor to balance out this review are audible road noise at highways speeds - this is partly due to the run flat tires it comes standard with. All in all, I highly recommend the X1. It's a great value for what you get, especially if you buy one slightly used to take advantage of some initial depreciation.
Superior sound system, smooth drive, carplay, panoramic moonroof and changeable interior lights. With the light when you open the door showing X1 on the ground. Which is neat.

THIS IS THE BEST CAR I'VE EVER OWNED!  AND I'VE OWNED A LOT OF CARS.  I'M 72 YEARS OLD.  I'VE DRIVEN MERCEDEZ, INFINITI'S, AND LEXUS.  THIS CAR CAN TURN ON A DIME, GETS, GREAT GAS MILEAGE, AND AS MY FAMILY SAYS, "DRIVES LIKE A DREAM",

Very zippy, especially in Sport mode. I don’t even know what to do with that kind of power.
In Eco mode I can get 37-38mpg on highway which I am happy about.
The seats are the cheapest ones BMW makes (I believe). They are not the best but firm and comfortable for small people, for the most part.
I don’t love the instrument cluster. The most accessible section is where the most useless controls are located (radio presets and CD slot that’s covered up by plastic). 
The cup holder location is also terrible. I have to reach to get my drink and it’s very hard to get the drink out of the cup holder without banging it against the instrument cluster. 
I think a full size spare tire should come with the vehicle even though it’s equipped with run flat tires.

At 17k I had to replace my front brakes. The service manager admitted it’s a design flaw with the X1 & they see it all the time.

23k & was just told now my rear brakes have to be replaced. The answer for this one? “The X1 is pretty heavy”.

For reference, brakes shouldn’t need to be replaced prior to 25-30k with the average being between 30-50k for most cars.

This car is great if you live in an area that doesn’t have the best roads and weather, but you don’t want to be driving around in a giant tank. Also haven't had any major issues at all. As long as you aren’t off roading daily or something, this cars performance could last a lifetime! Always get compliments on it. Also mine is a pretty base model and it’s great.

This car with m package makes it a fun to drive car, yet it’s a small suv.. totally reminds me of my E36 M3 characteristics, you. Feel the steering and control the car, not other way around… plus more traction from Xdrive. Totally recommend it especially young at heart lady drivers, who like to smile behind the wheel and seat comfy and tight, yet the car ownership is extremely affordable and so far it has been super reliable.
Heated seats and steering wheel, new tires, maintained to perfection. Black exterior, beige faux leather interior ( washable!),
I've had the X2 m35i for going on 4 years, it's been reliable, sporty with great handling. Small little quirk thats not so good is the visibility but other then that its a great car.

The X2 is impressive for 4 door SUV.  Driving at highway speed is very quiet. The smooth delivery of torque is easy to deal with when merging onto the highway or passing. No need to floor the gas pedal to pass with a 2.0 L turbo. Handling is as you expect from a BMW, but in the X2 is not harsh. The hideaway trunk allows us to carry your dog in the rear (lift it up, then anchor it), ~6 inches deep allows for extra headroom.  The infotainment system screen is large and touch-enabled.

Great small sporting and spunky SUV. Beautiful , sporty aerodynamic design with  spunky 4 cylinders, 2.0 , twin turbo engine that will make you to fell happy! Perfect exterior  and interior  design. With the panoramic moonroof you will have real fun!

The people writing reviews must be paid by BMW to write the terrific reviews they have i have nothing but problems with this BMW X2!! Constant problems having to take it in to the shop.  Traded it in and got myself a Toyota Venza Hybrid…Side note ITS WAAAAAAY better save yourself some money and get a honda or Toyota

With so many different models, i just could not take my eyes off the X2, the styling is unlike any other models BMW makes. It was love at 1st sight, I took it for a test drive and within 1st 2 minutes I had my mind made up, meat and potatoes on the road, effortless passing of ANY car on the road.
• Style: Perfect blend of sexy & classic & sporty that only BMW can do.
• Performance: Easy acceleration, effortless passing and even in uphill conditions due to the powerful engine, AWD with 19" tires grips the road, sharp and composed at the same time.
• Technology: Apple WIRELESS CarPlay sync perfectly with my iPhone 12 ProMax, best in class BMW infotainment responsive 8.8" touch screen. 
• Convenience: Motion sensing auto back liftgate, auto sensing door locks & push button engine.

Those that prefers class & performance will be satisfied completely as it is peppy and smooth yet composed with a very refined style unlike most suv/crossover, this drives more like a sportscar!

This is for the 2022 BMW x28 with AWD

this was my 6th BMW..slowly getting smaller)
It is super responsive and reliable like all my previous BMWS..no storage in the back but to be expected..the back seat is non existent but I don't have more that 1 passenger so ok for me..

Not only is there limited visibility it’s backup camera is almost useless. The drivers seat has moderate motion for improving the visibility too. Finally I have never had a car which required more service. Don’t buy this. My lease is up in October and it will be the happiest day of my life when I drop this on the doorstep of BMW.

Holds all the cargo you need, especially with both rear seats folded down.  Performance is sharp, especially in Sport mode.  The navigation system is better than the one in my Jaguar.  
Audio system works seamlessly with Sirius and with Bluetooth devices.  Also, BMW has a nice smartphone app with lots of functionality.

The liftgate gasket design is wrong! If you check the car's roof, the roof bar's gaskets go directly under the liftgate gasket's! A couple of years later, rainwater goes under the liftgate gaskets and inside the backside: all stereos, main battery on the back. The car goes toasted! I had a 2018 X3 M40i. It was just 24K miles. The car messed up in 2023 summer. I just checked the problem dealer service asking $300.00 just the inspection fee + all problem cover needs $5,000.00. The best way; 1- Do not purchase X3. 2- if you bought, definitely every two years, change the gasket of the liftgate. (Note- I checked the X5 models, and they do not have this bad design.)

The only thing I am just disappointed  about in regards to this car is that they discontinued making it after the 2021 model (to roll out a new electric/plug-in model to replace it instead). I will miss it after it’s time to retire this one.
Absolute quality and workmanship.   Tremendous power and options unheard of an unthought of my other car manufactures.   Truly the best vehicle I have ever owned.

Smooth ride and responsive steering which can be adjusted to your liking.
3 Driving modes and surprisingly good fuel economy - 2.0T plenty of power for 
passing even when going uphill ...
I'm bias since my last car was a 2007 but this car is perfect. All the features I would expect and the design is sleek.

SUV that drives like coupe
Superiors handling
Exhaust sounds amazing
Very powerful and engaging throttle feel
Interior is very detailed and having nice materials

Best car I have ever owned!  Great value for the money. Comfort and stylish vehicle by BMW. Mileage mid 20’s around town with 4 cinder/ twin turbines. Long distance trip averaging over 32 with premium gas.
This car is a great car for both tooling around the city or traveling with the family. It handles well, is comfortable, and is roomy.

Mine is British Racing Green with a cognac interior. Goes 0-60 in 4 sec. and it gets very good gas mileage with its mild hybrid and 48 volt system. Owned it a little over a year and have not had a single problem. It took over 6 months to get it, but it was worth the wait. I would definitely buy it again.

Traded X3 xDrive30i in for a Sportier version of the SUV.  Definitely way more sportier with 473hp.  The 21i wheels make the car look more aggressive.  With spirited driving and a pretty good commute on highway to work I am getting 20.7 mpg, better than what is was rated at.  But I got 30 mpg in the Turbo 4 on the other X3 so both exceeded expectations.  The M seats are more comfortable by a little over the 30i.  Having programmable M buttons on the steering wheel were a great idea!  A stiffer ride than the x30i but that was expected and is not uncomfortable by any means.  The X3 has many versions to pick from so depending on what you want it is a great vehicle.

Cannot stress enough how fast the X3 M really is. The engine is a dream and you really can't beat the performance and space the X3 platform brings. That being said, the ride quality is legitimately unbearable. Despite having 3 different suspension settings, the difference between 'comfort' and 'sport plus' is not even noticeable. If you live in a cold climate or a city where road maintenance is not a priority, this car will destroy you in a matter of days. 

For the life of me I cannot fathom how BMW let this car go out of the factory with ride quality like this. I understand it's an M car, but who is really bringing an SUV to the track? If the X3 M had the suspension setup of a X3 M40i that would be a game changer.
This SUV is amazing! It’s fast and fun to drive. Really enjoying it. Good job BMW

Just picked up the X3 M40i. I can't imagine being more pleased with a car. I have owned my share of other BMWs, MBs, and Audis. Most could be classified as "very good" but this vehicle stands out far above the rest. Great performance (the higher level Ms aren't worth the extra $), outstanding handling, amazing interior! Everytime I get behind the wheel and hit the button and listen to that engine come to life, I just smile. Drive it once....you won't be happy with anything else!

I have owned BMWs for over 20 years, owned 325, 328, 228AWD and driven a 525 for a few weeks when my 325 was being repaired, of all these, this X4 is the best!  I plan on upgrading in a few months to the M version, I am retired and figure this be my last car before going to the big Autobahn in the sky, might as well leave this world in a zoom-zoom car considering my first was also zoom-zoom car I created from a 1972 Ford Maverick Grabber edition with 5.0L engine.

This is a fantastic performance SUV! It is powerful, precise, and has aggressive styling. I wouldn't recommend it to someone who is a fan of regular long trips as sports seats can be a bit uncomfortable but it's perfectly fine as a daily driver.

I had an X3, which was great, and now have the X4 M40i and once you get used to the shape, rear blind spot and difference in cargo so space, you see the X4 offers a quick, sporty alternative to the more traditional family vehicle which is the X3. Both drive more like sedans than typical SUVs except you ride higher and have more forward visibility. The M40i is recommended, it’s plain fast. Mine has everything except live cockpit which is fine with me. Leather, premium package, driving assistance, etc. A very fun all around car. If you plan on having taller adult rear passengers and/or routinely have lots of cargo, consider the X3 or X5. If you are somewhere between more space than a sedan and won’t mind a sloping rear, try the X4. Haters will comment it’s ugly but I say unique. There are plenty of cars in the BMW lineup and something for everyone. Speed, handling, SUV type height and more room than the average sedan, you have found your solution.

Great car in its class.  I came from 2017 Macan GTS, and that was a fun car.  But for the pricing, the power, tech, and comfort, the X4M40i is simply unbeatable.  As others have stated, all around great car/CUV for the price-range.  Absolutely love it as a daily driver.

The BMW X4 is a true diamond. It is very practical with its huge carrying capacity, fantastic pickup and maneuverability, 33 MPG, near silent cabin, top-end options and superb comfort. Worth more than the X3 in every way. Has great mechanical reliability. Free 3 year maintenance is unmatched by competing vehicles. BMW service has been perfect. Nothing has failed. Far superior to competing Mercedes, Audi, Lexus and Infiniti models. It is a 10/10.

I bought my BMW X4 xDrive30i in February, easily the best car ive owned.
The handling is incredible, it makes you feel that pre-excitement when youre about to get behind the steering wheel. Definitely makes every trip a fun experience.
It has a slightly stiffer ride when compared to the more family-friendly X3, wich has a more soft ride.
The interior quality is stunning, you can feel the expensive materials all over the cabin, soft surfaces, leather, metal.
I havent has any issues with cargo space, since i rarely have someone with me, besides my GF.

Another fun part is the reactions you get on the street, you notice the heads turning almost everywhere you go, it takes some time to get used to it.
Overall a great vehicle, definitely would recommend to at least do a test drivr and experience it for yourself!

Strong handling and tightness on the road. Quick off a standing stop. Excellent safety features, M quality braking, surround cameras, and speedometer on lower windshield. Comfortable ride inside, with intuitive features such as automatic heating of steering wheel when cold, etc. This is my third BMW and best all around, most fun vehicle I have owned.

I got the X4 M40i for about a week. It is amazing to drive.  The comfort mode is nice - a well balance between eco and sport. But the sport/sport+ is another level of fun and excitement. I love the voice control, driver assist, and even parking assist.  The value you can get from this car is far better vs. Macan, after taking into account of the features/options and price. BMW hits a home run in this performance suv.
Love this car! It's stylish, reliable, great fuel conservation and very spacious inside. I often times look outside in my driveway and simply marvel at the beautifully concepted vehicle I own.

Have yet to have any work except for routine maintenance done on this vehicle! All hwy miles due to traveling for work as a nurse. Roomy, classy, sporty and luxury all in one. Also, there is only 1 other like it in Colorado and I believe it’s white. The uniqueness is the color of the interior which is COGNAC
The car has been great to me to 52,000 miles. No complaints at all or any major mechanical issues!!..

I have had a BMW sedan before. The X4 surprised the heck out of me. Ride was comfortable and felt tight in a good way. Seats are comfortable. And space is better than reviews claimed. I was looking for a vehicle that was more than a sedan and less than a full size SUV. It is perfect. I like it better than the Audi A3. And was able to adjust quickly to the entertainment,audio system. Great vehicle for those looking to step down from the Typical SUV.

I came into this car after owning an X3 that I absolutely love. I loved that one so much that I kept it instead of trading it in. The X4 exceeds all my wishes AND expectations in a car. I prefer it to my X3. First of all, if you have a need for speed and quick acceleration, there is no engine like a BMW engine. Range Rover. Mercedes and Audi are all slugs in comparison. This one Doesn’t even require premium gas!!!!!!  Very comfortable and quiet ride. The cabin is much quieter than the X3. The ride is super smooth— even on rough terrain. That might be owing to the super premium tires. I love the tires which reinflate when I drive over a nail. They are costly to replace but that is the most expensive maintenance costs so far. The oil changes run about $100 but who can complain if that is the only regular maintenance? Trunk closes with a push of a button. The only flaw I see is the
seats are a different material than my old X3,; they claim it is leather but it I must be a composite because it retains the summer heat. It can burn your hands to touch the steering wheel or seats after leaving in the sun. This X4 is a Princess and should be garaged anyway
Fit, finish and quality. Just great to drive .
Everything at your finger tips.

Love this car,  Have had it for about a month now.  I was afraid that it would be terrible on gas.  Im getting between 22 and 23 MPG.  

The suspension can be a little stiff at times.  This stiffness is what makes it handle well.

Its all BMW and I am happy with my purchase.

I have owned BMWs for over 20 years, owned 325, 328, 228AWD and driven a 525 for a few weeks when my 325 was being repaired, of all these, this X4 is the best!  I plan on upgrading in a few months to the M version, I am retired and figure this be my last car before going to the big Autobahn in the sky, might as well leave this world in a zoom-zoom car considering my first was also zoom-zoom car I created from a 1972 Ford Maverick Grabber edition with 5.0L engine.

This is a fantastic performance SUV! It is powerful, precise, and has aggressive styling. I wouldn't recommend it to someone who is a fan of regular long trips as sports seats can be a bit uncomfortable but it's perfectly fine as a daily driver.

I had an X3, which was great, and now have the X4 M40i and once you get used to the shape, rear blind spot and difference in cargo so space, you see the X4 offers a quick, sporty alternative to the more traditional family vehicle which is the X3. Both drive more like sedans than typical SUVs except you ride higher and have more forward visibility. The M40i is recommended, it’s plain fast. Mine has everything except live cockpit which is fine with me. Leather, premium package, driving assistance, etc. A very fun all around car. If you plan on having taller adult rear passengers and/or routinely have lots of cargo, consider the X3 or X5. If you are somewhere between more space than a sedan and won’t mind a sloping rear, try the X4. Haters will comment it’s ugly but I say unique. There are plenty of cars in the BMW lineup and something for everyone. Speed, handling, SUV type height and more room than the average sedan, you have found your solution.

Great car in its class.  I came from 2017 Macan GTS, and that was a fun car.  But for the pricing, the power, tech, and comfort, the X4M40i is simply unbeatable.  As others have stated, all around great car/CUV for the price-range.  Absolutely love it as a daily driver.

The BMW X4 is a true diamond. It is very practical with its huge carrying capacity, fantastic pickup and maneuverability, 33 MPG, near silent cabin, top-end options and superb comfort. Worth more than the X3 in every way. Has great mechanical reliability. Free 3 year maintenance is unmatched by competing vehicles. BMW service has been perfect. Nothing has failed. Far superior to competing Mercedes, Audi, Lexus and Infiniti models. It is a 10/10.

I bought my BMW X4 xDrive30i in February, easily the best car ive owned.
The handling is incredible, it makes you feel that pre-excitement when youre about to get behind the steering wheel. Definitely makes every trip a fun experience.
It has a slightly stiffer ride when compared to the more family-friendly X3, wich has a more soft ride.
The interior quality is stunning, you can feel the expensive materials all over the cabin, soft surfaces, leather, metal.
I havent has any issues with cargo space, since i rarely have someone with me, besides my GF.

Another fun part is the reactions you get on the street, you notice the heads turning almost everywhere you go, it takes some time to get used to it.
Overall a great vehicle, definitely would recommend to at least do a test drivr and experience it for yourself!

Strong handling and tightness on the road. Quick off a standing stop. Excellent safety features, M quality braking, surround cameras, and speedometer on lower windshield. Comfortable ride inside, with intuitive features such as automatic heating of steering wheel when cold, etc. This is my third BMW and best all around, most fun vehicle I have owned.

I got the X4 M40i for about a week. It is amazing to drive.  The comfort mode is nice - a well balance between eco and sport. But the sport/sport+ is another level of fun and excitement. I love the voice control, driver assist, and even parking assist.  The value you can get from this car is far better vs. Macan, after taking into account of the features/options and price. BMW hits a home run in this performance suv.

We now have over 18k miles on our 2022 X5.  We have the SDrive 4.0. It is a pleasure to drive with no mechanical or other problems at all. We recently took a long road trip driving over 700 miles one way, mostly highway miles. The BMW X5 averaged over 29 miles per gallon for the trip.  Around town we average 28.1 mpg. Very impressive fuel mileage.  The vehicle has great acceleration and handles great. It is a fun vehicle to drive.

This is my 4th BMW. The one was a 2013 BMW X5. I bought the 2022 after over 9 great years with the 2013 E70. So far the 2022 has been trouble free and has amazing fuel economy; it was also something of a relative bargain (I ordered it with several options for $70K) considering today's prices and the quality of the car.

Shortcomings with respect to the 2013 X5 (E70):
1. No Soft Close doors. In my view, this was a big mistake on BMW's part and resulted in my trying out an Audi Q7 but that was like driving an iPhone. I really liked the soft close doors on my 2013.
2. No direction indication in rear view mirror. Yes, this is redundant with the navigation system but it was a very quick check.
3. No rubber side strips. My 2013 had rubber side strips that helped when opening doors in tight places. This is a stupid cost saving measure.
4. Wider than the 2013. Makes reversing out of my garage at an angle tricky.
5. Steering feel inferior to the 2013; that was the last year they had hydraulic steering. The 2022's steering is precise but numb.

Improvements over the 2013:
1. Head-up display. Nice reminder of speed while keeping eyes on the road. 
2. Much quieter and hard to tell what speed one is travelling at (see point above).
3. Better ride, more absorbent, less bounce.
4. More power at high speeds. No difference around town.
5. Amazing gas mileage; 24.5 mpg so far (mostly Nor Cal freeway).
6. Blind Spot Monitor, an excellent safety feature.

Finally, I have to mention that for me the iDrive controlled by the knob on the console is a superb safety feature allowing me to use my phone, change radio stations, change car settings etc. without having to to take my eyes off the road. Once you get used to this touchscreen usage seems risky.

I have owned a few x5's and this one by far by passes all expectations. 
I am a proud owner and will continue to purchase the bmw brand in the future
This car has been in the shop more than on the road. Called BMW of North America about these issues and they didn’t care. Trading it in and moving on with different manufacture.
It’s a little mushy. I have the air suspension. Very luxurious. Mine was delivered just as the pandemic began. We haven’t traveled as much as we planned when we ordered it.

Had this for a year never had a single problem very powerfull and amazing. MPG is avreag at about 80-90mph i get 15-20mpg on the phev model and at 75-80 i get 25-28mpg i was expecting somewhere around 50mpg but still pretty good for heavy suv

Bought the X5 x-drive 4.0 vehicle new, less than 9,000 miles and has been in the BMW dealer repair shop for a total of 8 weeks.  We've picked it up twice only to have the same electrical issue occur the same day.  The vehicle check engine light comes on followed by a warning to immediately pull over and call road side assistance.  If you continue to drive it the shutdown process begins and eventually the vehicle shuts down and can't be restarted.  They have replaced the Power control module, the battery ($2,600 battery BTW) and the generator.  My X5 is not a hybrid, but I guess the generator is need to charge the second battery on-board.  It has now been 8 weeks in the shop and we still do not have the vehicle back.  I have attempted to work with BMW Customer Care Group to get the vehicle replaced, but they are unresponsive.  I'm told my case has been escalated, but they never call me and I have to try and reach them.  I never get past the initial rep and always end up leaving a v-mail with my case manager who never calls back.  Highly disappointed with BMW, both the vehicle and their customer care group.  Shocking really when you pay $80k for the "Ultimate Driving Machine".  If only I could actually drive it.

I love the look of the 2021 X5 and it is reliable. Just does not have the usual quality and attention to detail of the X5. Most women buy this for the size and safety. Tires are very poor quality and therefore lack safety. BMW has recalled many tires but it is their fault for cheapening such an essential piece of equipment. I lease this car.
I was told after a year of driving the car that it needed new tires. Had less than 12,000 miles on it.
very poor tire on such an expensive car and I should not be penalized for it. No soft close doors on a car that price is ridiculous. This used to be one of the best buys but not too sure now.

Bought a 2016 BMX X5 used with 35Kmiles.  This is my second X5.  Experience some ghost electronic issues for a while. After the vehicle passed 100k miles, it was in the shop frequently.  The air compressor pump that inflates the dynamic suspension failed ($2k), the heating/cooling system failed requiring a new system board, 6 months of trying to get the brake system to work with costs over $4k, (the BMW certified service dealership even had to call BMW engineering in Germany to get help with repairs. Apparently, there is a different procedure to fill break fluid after you put in a new brake cylinder).   

I decided to get a new vehicle, but they would only give me $2,500 for trade-in value. Guess the repair history follows the VIN among BMWs.

The ride is nice when it works ok.
Outstanding curb appeal. Lightning performance. Unmatched comfort and amenities. Bad fuel economy.  But who cares when you have 567hp at your disposal.

I had the 2015 BMW X35D Diesel version and the timing chain broke at 122,000 miles,  and ruined the engine. If it wasn't for this, I would rate this car 5 stars, great power, handling, surprisingly easy to work on,  and I miss having the car.

Best and most comfortable vehicle I’ve ever owned. I owned ALOT H2Hummer before this. 
It gets up and goes fast! Or nice in town ride. My large dog live the back seat.
Great vehicle, fully loaded, heads up display is a must - super comfortable, spacious, drives like a dream

The x5 50 is a performance
Lovers dream, with great luxury built inn. All wheel drive, head up display and more make this my all time favorite vehicle.
Quality Drive always, handling and steering.  Engine and transmission are flawless and has more power than you will ever need.

This is the 5th BMW I owned and it is by far the most reliable one. I have owned it over 3 years and never had issues with it. As big as this vehicle is this X5 has lots of get up and go and also gets up to 28 miles per gallon on the high way. Really fun car to drive and lots of options for the money.

We now have over 18k miles on our 2022 X5.  We have the SDrive 4.0. It is a pleasure to drive with no mechanical or other problems at all. We recently took a long road trip driving over 700 miles one way, mostly highway miles. The BMW X5 averaged over 29 miles per gallon for the trip.  Around town we average 28.1 mpg. Very impressive fuel mileage.  The vehicle has great acceleration and handles great. It is a fun vehicle to drive.

So far, I've been driving 2 years now and love the performance of handling and power.
Free maintenance is plus.

Best driving performance. I’ve been driving lots BMW’s models for over 25 years. The 2022 X6 is truly built well and offers luxury and sporty driving performance that I really enjoy driving. I highly recommend this car for people who just enjoy driving in general

It's been 3 years since I've had an X6 again as I had an X5 that I traded in.  X6 did not disappoint in style, quality of engineering/horsepower...it's a BMW.  The X5 made me feel like I was in a mommy car...my X6 has made me feel younger as ever with the head turns from other people.

Looking forward to 3 more years in my new X6 and will look to (hopefully) an electric X6!
All the car Ever wanted. Really a great machine that is fun to drive. BMW really took time to come up with a winner

My first BMW experience and I am enjoying it, I love the lines of this car but for a six-cylinder the gas mileage is fair, but not good. I would recommend it for excellent handling even with snow packed roads.

Love the car. Sleek, stylish, fast and in my case loaded with features. Despite the slanted roof back seats offer plenty of comfortable seating space and trunks nearly as big as in X5. No complaints on anything in my certified X6.
This car is a beast! It is very athletic and agile. A little rougher ride than my 7 series but I love driving this car.

Nice styling and type of vehicle that you don't see yourself coming or going. The workmanship with trim and fit is very good. The pricing of this X6 should reflect less plastics and rubber that has been used on the interior.

The engine is the 3.0 with twin turbo. Has the power that is more than enough when needed.

The rear trunk is a bit too high for a heavy lift from ground level. Don't understand why BMW couldn't come up with a better design.

Would I buy another X6, maybe. I think a X5 would be a better vehicle for my situation, but the X6 is more out of the box look than the mundane SUV'S you see on the road.

Bought my pre -certified 2017 X6 BMW Handles phenomenal...!!! Reviews were great!...Could not ask for a better BMW ... glad I got my X6 2017 like brand new ...German engineering is Fantastic.....!!! The Ultimate Driving Machine.....

I love the car. It is very sleek and stylish and is both masculine and feminine. However the navigation being on the window is convenient but is a distraction while driving. It feels like you have double vision when you're trying to read this navigation that's on the window in front of you and drive at the same time. You have to train your eye to ignore the navigation. The car has a lot of Technology on the interior and will take a bit of practice to utilize all the features. It took a few minutes just to changing gears to pull off. Controlling the cameras and radio is confusing.  Great for someone who is tech savvy. I felt like Inspector Gadget trying to control all of the features. The price was fair, affordable and well worth it. Much more comfortable to drive than the big bulky  x7 and the square, boxy, soccer mom x5.
Best car I've had. Adaptive cruise control is great!

This is my 2nd X6 previous was 2016. I tested the  Q8, Cayenne, Land Rover, and GLE. I chose the x6 over the others for the following reasons. First, I really like the coupe look on the SUV. The drive is excellent and truly responsive in the dynamic mode. I always felt like all four wheels were firmly planted during my test drive. The off set staggered wheels (20’s) look enormous at different angles, and the rims are sharp. No need for aftermarket. The comfort seats are very supportive and stylish. Ventilated and heated. The front row is pleanty wide and well designed with a great big infotainment and the HUD is top of the line. Q8 and Land Rover info’s leave unsightly fingerprints that are more noticeable because of their slanted positioning. The X6 back row is more than adequate in size. I am 6’ 235lbs. and had no issues in any of the three seat locations. By the way this car is really great for a family of four on vacations. Luggage fits surprisingly well even with the roofline and a full tank will get you about 448 miles! 
I had a hard time passing up the GLE Coupe AMG43 at $86,500 it’s 10 grand more than my purchase and I admit  the V8 turbo engine is sick, but I like the x6 dash and info better. If you can do without a 4 second track car and decide that the X6’s 0-60 at 6 sec is quick enough, you will be very happy while saving yourself about 10-15 grand!

So far, I've been driving 2 years now and love the performance of handling and power.
Free maintenance is plus.

Best driving performance. I’ve been driving lots BMW’s models for over 25 years. The 2022 X6 is truly built well and offers luxury and sporty driving performance that I really enjoy driving. I highly recommend this car for people who just enjoy driving in general
