The car rides great, but I've had multiple issues with everything from the transmission to the chassis.  Tip-- if you buy this car, get the extended warranty, you'll need it!  AND you can't rotate the tires because they're different sizes on the front and back, making them wear out about every 20K miles.  And guess who is the only place you can get these tires?  You guessed it, the BMW dealership!  Sure wish I would have kept my American made car!

I'm 58 insurance exec. I've had Jeeps, Suburbans, F150's I've rented Escalades and Yukons. Of all these SUV's and Trucks I'll have to say that my 2019 X7 M50i is the best ( and expensive) vehicle I've driven in North East Ohio to Florida. I shoot trap and most gun clubs are not on finished roads. So I've followed and been followed by every truck and SUV imaginable over these paths. Never had any problems even as I've raised the vehicles air suspension. But driving in heavy stop and go traffic, Snow covered and Icy roads, and worst of all Central and South Florida I-95 and I-75 crazy drivers. This vehicle performs. Power, ride, no road noise, great stereo, headsup display, adaptive cruise control with lane change assistance (my favorite, as it can drive itself, as long as your hands (knee or two fingers) are on the wheel. Also I get a complements often about the car and its interior.
this car is awsome. it is fast , it handles well, its intirior is very nice , etc... this car is an exellent all rounder.

The X7 has more leg room than my previous Audi Q7.  This 2022 has many more unique technical features.  Great ride with adjustable heights; the fit and finish is excellent.  The standard 22” performance tires are not suitable for winter driving, so I ordered a BMW snow tire and 21” black wheels for winter.

Like BMW claims, this vehicle is literally the ultimate driving machine. From when you first walk up to the car and open the door, you know you are in for a fun, fast, and safe drive. It’s an SUV that drives like a 3 series. You feel in control at every acceleration and every turn.  Upgrades like Dynamic handling, luxury seating, and cold weather will cost you for sure but it is worth every penny.  We are lucky to have found this vehicle and do not think we will ever switch again.

I made a big mistake when test driving the X7 by not noticing the loud and annoying brake noise when coming to a full stop. Ive had the pads replaced and the dealership has been cooperative but unable to have the problem resolved.  I would NOT have bought the vehicle if I had noticed during the test drive. BMW needs to find a solution to this problem as its unacceptable. Had a  parking valet tell me "not my business but you need to have those brakes looked at, that noise is not normal!".

In my 40 years of car ownership this model is my absolute favorite. It is a smooth as a7 series or Mercedes S class with the all the benefits of an SUV/SAV. It’s not cheap by any means you really get what you pay for with this flagship vehicle.

I got the factory built custom matte finish frozen black exterior xdrive 40i. I upgraded from a 2019 Volvo XC90. The drive quality is immensely better - on long road trips espl. The car is loaded with tech, which also is the downside. It takes some learning to navigate to the settings. I love my car so far..
I love the design and handling. It is fun to drive on any day. Convertible top operates quickly and seamlessly.

Beautiful cabin no wind blowing around you.
Great body design,joy to drive just travel ten thousand km across USA 
With two cary on bags and  one set of golf clubs ,can’t believe the amount of space in the trunk.. handles beautifuly.  Love it.
The car is really a piece of art that gets your heart rate beating and makes you feel great when driving.

These cars are very comfortable and easy to drive.   Pretty quick and when in sport mode they move and handle great.   Maintenance can be a little expensive but you only have to go in once a year or 10k miles.  Once you have a heads up display I think it will be hard to go back to anything that does not have it.

The Volvo product stands for safety and sustainability and this car represents it thoroughly. 9700 miles in 1 year trouble free aside from 1 recall to resolve a potential issue with electric motor torque failure. I did not experience any issues... I am on my 4th tank of fuel 91 octane or better since I utilize the plug in extended range for most of my driving. The car goes from mild to wild when I put the drivers setting into power mode. 455hp combined and 523 lb ft of torque. I know this next perk is a weird one but I love cleaning this cars exterior. Some cars when drying after an exterior wash bleed water from many nooks and crannies but this car is so tight it does not.
Fun to drive, fair to good highway mileage, good to avg. city mileage. I have experienced 0 problems in three years, 18000 miles.

I own a 2019 Volvo s60 T6 AWD Inscription. The Volvo dealer experience is very good, certainly better than most (I was treated much better than the Lexus and BMW dealers I have been to). Same goes for their service. I've had a couple small issues that were fully covered under warranty and the service team was great. 

As far the car itself, I would say it is excellent for someone looking for a luxurious car that is smooth and quiet but can also be really fun to drive if you're in the mood. The T6 gets 315hp from a turbocharger and supercharger, so the car isn't loud or sporty, but it is quick. I find myself speeding without even noticing because the cabin is so quiet and the acceleration is so smooth. 

I've always been a fan of Volvo's Swedish exterior styling, but I understand it's not everyone's cup of tea. As for the interior, I think it's pretty clear this is the most beautiful sedan on the market. This car is STUNNING on the inside. The seats are incredible (especially on the Inscription model with thigh seat extensions), and all the materials are very high quality and work together very well. Volvo's Inscription models all have the best interiors on the market, and that's a hill I will die on. I feel like I just melt into the seats. 

I would recommend this car to anyone who wants a luxurious experience but doesn't want to add another 3 series to the road. On the spectrum of luxury sedans, I would say this is cooler and more sporty than most Lexus models, but more refined and classy than BMWs and Mercedes. It falls very close to and Audi A4.

Beautiful fully loaded car with Polestar Technology to add a little fun to the ride on the highway.
Excellent styling, have 3 series and Audi’s Q3 and A4 easily the best seats and interior would definitely recommend and buy another one over the BMW and Audi

Very elegant sedan with sporty character.  Best seats I have ever tried for long trips.  The audio system (Harman Kardon) sounds great.

The performance is excellent for the type of car (0 - 60 in 5.3 seconds with the polestar engineering enhancement)

Reliability has been good.  Only problems are check engine light due to a vacuum hose and an abs sensor.  All covered under waranty.
Great car but expensive to maintain. Front suspension is also suspect and doesn’t deal well with rough roads.

Great car! It has 113,000 miles and has had no major trouble. It has a new timing belt and a new ac compressor, as well as LED headlights. The interior has been well-maintained and is in good condition.

I bought a Ice White 2014 Volvo S60 T6 Platinum new from the dealer in Jacksonville, FL and had it shipped to me in Wisconsin. End of year savings and I paid around $37,500 - an excellent discount to the sticker. The dealer had mine outfitted with the 19" Bor wheels and all-season P7 rubber. I made the mistake of spending $2,200 on 17" BBS wheels and Michelin snow tires from the Tire Rack. I say mistake only because the car handled Wisconsin winters just fine with the P7's. I put the BBS wheels on once and never again. Anyway, I loved the car. It handled great - stayed relatively flat in curves and it was as quick as I ever wanted with 300HP and 325lb torque. The inside was as roomy as the F150 Lariat I traded in on it. It looked little from the outside but the inside front was wide and roomy and a great place to sit for as long as need be. I will say the 19" low profile wheels made the ride a bit harsh on the lumpy Wisconsin roads by me but I got used to it - my wife not so much. Never had a single problem with it and when Volo says service is included they mean it - wiper blade refills included and my dealer had a free loaner policy. Kept it for 70,000 miles and since the free maintenance ended at 50k I just decided to get something newer - wish I'd kept it for another 20-30k miles. Great car!

many owners have defective engines with less than 90000 miles--- my previous volvos  were still in great working order with 360000 miles - 244 model -- 250000 miles - 245 model ---220000 miles  740 model..  Terrible volvo response ---- look up class action suit that volvo got out of.

This is my first Volvo and I have to say it is a work of art on wheels. Its captivating design, both its interior and exterior without screaming for attention, reflects Volvo's commitment to excellence. The driving experience is a delightful fusion of power and refinement, ensuring that each moment behind the wheel is a rewarding one. While the omission of a rear camera is regrettable, it doesn't overshadow the S60's many strengths. If you're seeking a sedan that offers a harmonious blend of beauty and performance, the S60 T5 Dynamic is an excellent choice that will leave you enthralled with its charm.

This car has had almost no issues since I bought it new. It’s survived city driving in the Washington DC area for a number of years, some long trips up to Canada, and local Dr out around Michigan in lots of weather conditions.

This model is the last of the 6-cylinder engines and operates in normal (good fuel economy) and sports modes (very very powerful) at the slide of the shifter left and right. Most of the time it’s comfortable and easy, but you can get past very quickly if you need to.

The functions and packages are good for this model. Easy in cold weather, including *remote start* for those cold (or hot) days you want to get the car to temperature before you get in, optionally with heated seats and steering wheel.

The handling is very precise and the stiffness of the steering wheel is a customizable setting.
Drives well.  Little to no issues. I drive this car daily and love it.  I think everyone should own this car.  There is no reason to ever buy another car. It is amazing.
Drives well. Very reliable burns oil around 80,000 miles. She is a dream to drive. Brakes stop when you need them, steering is tight

I have been an owner of many vehicles including multiple Mercedes. This car is a great value for the money. Tons of options and unparalleled safety. While most might say this completes with an S Class I would say that it is more of an E class size but with way more options. The app is excellent and the Bowers sound system is a must!
I have had two S90’s and love the features, ride and gas mileage. It has a very large and comfortable back seat. Have had zero issues. I highly recommend!
Great interior.  Great looks. Even great mileage for its size.  Not a sports car but an extremely comfortable place to spend long hours on the road.

This is the most dependable, comfortable and economical car I have ever owned.  Extreme comfort and performance for a sedan.  Cruises on the the highway with approximately 30mpg.  I feel very safe in this vehicle.

The vehicle is beautiful, great lines and design outside. Head lights turn head when pass by. The interior is simple, elegant, functional, advanced and luxurious. The seat are extremely comfortable, touch screen, 360° camera, assisting parking, safety cameras when driving that with assisting breaking and much more... drive test it, love it and buy it!

I purchased a 2020 Volvo V60 momentum (wanted the city weave interior) for my wife. Love everything about it except the T5 power and shifts.
I seen new S90 Rdesign T8 pop up and decided to test drive it. The electric moter takes out the poor shifts that I dont like in the T5- completly. I work 28 miles from home and uses about .3 to .5 gal. Per day round trip by also charging at work which is awesome given its power. I traded in my 2019 Eclass 450 that I owned 1 year. No complaints about it but they are EVERYWHERE. Rarely do i see an S90 specifically an R design T8. I get complimants everywhere. No one noticed the Eclass. Only complaint is the ride quality. I will likely keep it until the Polestar Precept comes out or a complete redesign of the s90. Love it!

This is my first Volvo and have to say that it has been one of the most dependable vehicles I have owned.  It is extremely comfortable and handles nicely.  The many safety features are astounding but that's what Volvo is all about.  It's not perfect but for as many cars I have owned and driven this is my favorite and I enjoy looking at it's beautiful styling and it's many features.  Perhaps there is better out there and I'm sure there are many but this car "rocks" and I cannot see any alternatives out there that would surpass this choice.  It's not a rocker but it has plenty of power for my needs and a great reason to own.

The overall pleasant experience with the S90 is somewhat spoiled by the not so premium 4 cylinder power plant.  While putting our an acceptable 250ish horsepower on premium fuel, the motor falls short of the smoothness and quietness of most of the European 4 cyl. competition.  It’s a shame, because the rest of the car is equal to anything I’ve driven in the segment.  The S90 is a big, comfortable touring sedan that can click off 30 plus MPG all day long.  The pleasant experience is only enhanced when the OEM Pirellis are replaced with smoother riding and quieter performance radial tires.  

The interior is beautiful and comfortable with Volvo’s well known safety features everywhere.  The exterior styling is fluid and graceful, generating many “I can’t believe it’s a Volvo” comments with those not current with the brand.  All-in-all, the Volvo S90 should certainly be on the shopping list for those looking at premium, near luxury full size Euro sedans.

My first Volvo and I am very pleased!
Good gas mileage, drives smooth and the safety features are great. 
I would recommend.

My 2019 Volvo V60 was a beautiful car, but had a vibration from 65-80mph from the very moment I purchased it at 13,000 miles. Both local Volvo dealerships were unable and unwilling to solve the issue. I tried different sets of wheels and tires, road force balanced to perfection. This issue is very common on the SPA platform. Check out Swede speed dot com and read about it yourself. Volvo Cars USA was of no help. My advice is avoid Volvo, they are not made the way they used to be and the service is awful and uncaring.

This vehicle has set a new standard for us. As first time Volvo owners, I don’t see us ever going back to US made cars. Better in every way. Only complaint is the center media console could be a little more intuitive and visually accessible. I hope they do better on their 2023+ models we will be ordering.

Where else do you get great comfort, exceptional style, fantastic hauling capacity combined with superb performance? The Volvo V60 Polestar. I get looks everyday form people admitting my ride with its gold calipers and seatbelts along with it amazing styling. I can haul a full-size treadmill in the rear and have plus don’t forget the Polestar performance and great fuel economy via Hybrid.
Awesome vehicle, reliable, good on gas, very comfortable, attractive styling, interior is beautiful. Plenty of pickup

Love the Volvo V60 Polestar long roof!
Excellent performance, handling and style!
Great gas mileage with many short trips where we don’t use any gas at all! Very comfortable seats and ride. Very rare car, we had to travel over 400 miles to get one.
Hardily recommend!

I love this Volvo V60 T5 . It’s fully appointed and the safety features are amazing. I’ve had it a year and drove 7000 miles, with no trouble. The cameras and sensors give me the feeling of being very safe in any driving situation. When pulling out of angle parking the camera view and warning system are a tremendous feature. The leather seats are heated and very comfortable. The sound system is killer. Gas mileage in city is not ideal but a very livable 26 MPG. I OWNED three used car dealerships in Pa. so I feel qualified to rated my Volvo at 4 1/2 stars. Thanks Volvo

Bulletproof motor in a small wagon delivering 325 ponies & nearly 360 ft.lbs. of gutsy torque from the legendary incline six cylinder engine to all four wheels making for an exhilarating driving impression (for a family station wagon) that will leave a smile on your face.  Slap on a pair of snow tires and you’ll find yourself maneuvering through a foot of snow better than your neighbors Subaru. Seats provide 600miles of comfort for the long hauls and gas mileage to me is irrelevant given anyone able to afford the sticker price.  Just be mindful about maintaining your Volvo by certified Volvo techs.  An oil change will run you a minimum $250. This car will have minor problems as all Volvo have their quirks, but they will save your life as their safety is second to none. I’ve seen Volvos well beyond the 300k mile mark.  I’d buy again after four years of ownership but I’m also a Volvo nerd having owned five.

I almost send to the shop to repair every a couple months . Burning oil , engine light on . Reduce engine performance sign on …, and the cylinder just need replace it for $9,200 and the car worth $5,000 . After I owed v60 I will never buy any Volvo again . Not reliable at all and resell value drops like Rock .
Very fun to drive - lots of pep.  Great handling.  My is eight years old and everybody think it's new.

We have now had our 2018 V60 Volvo Station Wagon for a year.  Volvo station wagons used to be plentiful and cool, however sales have been cannibalized by their SUVs.  Even the small SUVs, and we've driven those from half-a-dozen manufacturers, have a truck-like feel.  The V60 drives almost like a sports car.  It sits low to the ground, has comfortable leather seats, and has a 240HP engine that provides more than adequate power.  It does well in mountain twistys and on interstate in heavy traffic.  It goes exactly where you steer it with a degree of precision that no SUV we have driven can match.  Of course, it has room for lots of cargo, but most important, it is fun to drive.

Will not experience a smooth ride, offers a hard ride,, need to insert key in ignition to start, unable to pop the trunk at any distance at 100% performance ,  air conditioner maximum cooling is a “low”comparable to their competition.

With just over 100K miles on my Volvo V60 it has been a reliable and gas efficient vehicle. The most comfortable car I have ever owned and "knock on wood" has not left me stranded. Routine maintenance is all my V60 has ever needed. Have not experienced a high dollar repair cost as of yet. She is fun to drive and cheap to maintain.

Excellent gas mileage, averages 29 mpg highway at 70~75 mph.
Averages 23 mpg city driving.
Comfort  is an understatement. Sitting in this V60 cruising the highway for hours on end will put you to sleep if you are not careful.
Just turned 100K miles with "zero" mechanical issues.
Safety features are top notch.
I love my Volvo V60 and hope it lasts for the next 200K miles plus.

Bought certified used with low miles.  Has been a joy to drive and no issues.  One recall outstanding but Volvo has been very good at communication.  After driving a Jetta wagon for several years this was a step up in luxury for me and couldn’t be happier.  Very nice ride,  great gas mileage and comfortable for me.  Don’t need an suv as this wagon has the space I need.  OEM tires have been ok, but will need to be replaced this summer.  Certified warranty is long enough to see me to the 100k miles and expect to have smooth sailing on past that.

I have had this car for a year. A loaded luxury version. T6. Mileage is about 27-28 highway. Power is great from standstill and up to 60 or so. Passing power at 70 or so is weak. But, this 2.0 four cylinder makes 316hp and is certainly adequate. My other car is an S560 Mercedes so I am comparing to a high benchmark.
  The V90CC does so many things so well. With good winter tires it is a snow beast. The seats with massage, heat and cool are phenomenal. Excellent cargo capacity, rear seat legroom is way way better than the V60. 
  Pilot assist is wonderful. I drive through Boston traffic without ever touching brake or gas pedal, takes all the pucker moments out of traffic. I bought used with 19k miles. 
  A great car I will be keeping for a long time!

There really is not a lot on the market like this little beast. Smooth (with 19" wheels, 20's have thin tires and make for a harsher ride), refined and elegant. Interior is subjectively the best designed interior out there, very well put together. The designers did a fantastic job with this vehicle. The engine is no seat of the pants thrill (turbo 6 would have been better), but is smooth, and the transmission shifts very well, never searching for gears. The manual mode is not great, this car was made for leaving it in auto. This car is perfect for its intended purpose, cruising around, it is very relaxing to drive. It is wonderful on long road trips. It is a shame the regular V90 leaves our shores, it looks much better than its Cross Country sibling.

After 2 years and 16K miles of owning my 2020 V90 Inscription T6 AWD wagon, the car has been mechanically trouble free.  Only problem was a blind spot monitoring system issue that was easily addressed with a software update.  With its 4 cylinder/turbo/supercharged engine, on premium gas, 22-24 city mpg and 29-31 highway mpg.  Car's design turns heads. Numerous times, people have approached my car to marvel at it.  Superb for long-distance travel.  Volvo has somehow created seats that get more comfortable the longer one travels.  After numerous 5+ hour trips in New England, I can attest to its front seat comfort.  Rear storage space, while adequate, is a bit compromised by the severe slope of the rear hatch.

Really best car
It has almost every feature with good quality 
No need to suv 
Safety is perfect
Including everything you need

We've had several Volvo's over the years but got away from them for a bit.  Glad to be back!  The V60 Cross Country is very refreshing in the land of SUVs with it's distinctive styling and good looks.  Best seats in the industry, solid driving, good engine performance, and it is quiet.  Sensus control has a learning curve and isn't overly intuitive, but once you have it is pretty good.  Cockpit storage is lacking, but that's a minor complaint.  Biggest complaint is premium fuel.

I previously owned a Volvo station wagon (740). The previous body style was smaller making it easier to park and maneuver. My new 2021 Volvo V90 station wagon is large (195” long and 76” wide). I bought the 2021 Inscription T6 Cross-country V90, the MSRP was $65,000. For a large car this size I would normally expect a smoother ride, road imperfections are readily felt by driver and passenger. Due to the length of this car, it is not easily maneuvered making it harder to park. I would have expected the interior to be quieter and more insulated from the noise of the outside world and the road. The car is in between a sedan and a SUV (it is lower than a SUV making it easier to get into and out of, but higher than the comparable sedan making harder to to get into and out of than a sedan). For the price of the car, I would have expected softer, higher quality interior components (on the top of the doors, on top of the dash, on the console and the console covering, on the finish around the cargo area. Also, the leather seats for $65,000 should be made of a higher quality softer grain leather. For the price of this car the doors should have been covered in high grade leather and the dash as well). I have only had my car for 2 1/2 months and driven 800 miles.

Excellent long-distance touring car.  Extremely comfortable seats.  Driver assistance features (e.g., dynamic cruise control, lane keeping assist, blind spot monitoring, emergency stopping, etc.) on-par with the best.  The T6 model's turbo/supercharger system offers excellent and responsive engine performance.  Mileage, after 2000 miles of driving, corresponds with the window sticker's EPA estimates of 31 highway, while my city mpg is 24 versus EPA's 21, all with 91+ octane fuel (as required).  Interior and exterior material quality and fit-and-finish is excellent.  First 3 years of routine maintenance included, along with non-run-flat tires, which are typically longer lasting and less costly to replace, versus run-flat tires now found on the V90's competitor vehicles.  People have stopped to marvel at the car, take pictures and ask about it.  The V90 Inscription is rarer than a Ferrarri in the USA.  Would definitely buy this car again. 

With all this said, no car is perfect.  Its closest competitors (i.e., Benz E450 Estate Wagon and Audi A6 All-Road), offer V6 engines vs Volvo's 4 cylinder, with comparable or slightly better fuel mileage and more power.  It should be noted that the V90's competitors are priced far higher than the V90.  Lastly, the V90's 15 gallon fuel tank is fairly small, in comparison.

A very good daily performer.
Plenty of space , good quality interior shows no signs of use.
MPG 26-27 on average.
Gearbox is fine , manual shifting too slow.

I should have bought the T6 for the 4 wheel drive.
2 wheel drive is OK but not under heavy acceleration.

Safety overall  perfect.

I have owned SUV’s for many years now.  My wife and from the beginning of the Pandemic went to a one car family for economic reasons but now was the time for me to add another car.  I looked at many options including the Honda CRV, Toyota’s Rav 4 and more.  Once I saw this car, it was love at first sight.  The interior is very spacious, while being a smaller SUV, the cargo area is bigger than you think.  Even with the back seats up, you still have plenty of space for grocery’s or whatever else you need to put back there.  The standard options and safety of this car was a major reason why I wanted this vehicle. The power from zero to 60 is great and stronger than the cars I listed above.  The exterior look is very nice and I love the crystal white paint with beige leather interior.  It is such an easy car to drive and I knew the gas mileage prior to buying so anyone that complains on this didn’t do their homework.  With power comes lower mileage but I can live with that.  I love my new car!

Power get the polestar addition . The technology is first class the ability to use voice activation on the controls  set heat and cold use the system to increase fan speed . Use windshield wipers and set temperature . Heated seats and  steering wheel. super car great miles per gallon 27.5 around town .  Dry safe as well .
Great car, handles beautifully, very smooth ride, great excelaration. Amazing sound system , very comfortable seats and leg room in the back.

We drove a Mustang E and a VW 1d4 then the Volvo. We ordered it on the spot. This car is seriously fast and fun to drive. The range is a little low being the only downside. The Volvo dealership was great, no messing about, we were in and out in less than an hour. We’ve owned the car for a year now and no issues. It has some great features for storage etc. we got both fed and state rebate (9000) taken off the price at the dealer.

The car is fantastic. It is fun to drive. Easy to maneuver and park. Has a lot of room despite being their smallest SUV. I have not had any mechanical issues and it is very durable and high quality. It has maintained it value as well. Nicely appointed interior. I wish is has the change of lane alert is the only negative.

This car was a nightmare. When it worked, the comfort, styling and drive comfort were great. Unfortunately it was the most unreliable car I have ever owned. The car experienced a complete power failure five times and required flat bed towing to the dealership. 

Despite Volvo's promise of quick response towing, this was not the case. Since the car was frozen after each power failure, it had to be dragged to the tow truck and put on a flat bed. Only limited companies have such capacity and each tow took up to five hours to complete. 

Once at the dealership, they spent days after each failure to try to fix the problem. I was never given a loaner as they were all gone. And, Volvo corporate never contacted me to help improve the situation. 

After five complete power failures, Volvo repurchased the car under a Lemon Law provision. They never called, discussed, or tried to arbitrate any trade or other resolution. This is and was my worst experience with any automaker. 

If one looks at forums, this is not a unique experience. Although it may be rare, it is not so rare that there are no numerous reports of similar issues. Simply search for Volvo XC40 recharge, power failure. There is even a thread called, "dead as a doornail."

If you live in an area with many Volvo dealers, there may be a loaner, assistance or adequate service. However, if you are in an area with only one dealer, or the closest one is miles away, you will begrudge the decision to purchase this car which is clearly a work in progress.

This SUV is very impressive. Fast, capable and looks great.  A ton of fun to drive and extremely comfortable. I didn’t want a car that looked awkward because it was an EV, and this looks like a regular SUV. Handles great on curves and straight roads. The torque rocks. Like a rocket

Two days into my Volvo Recharge purchase and couldn’t be happier with my decision. Beware, this car is fast af! You can zip this thing right to 60 leaving everyone else in the dust and not even realize it. It zooms with extreme quickness and is quiet as a mouse. The ride is so smooth you’ll have to constantly look at your speedometer to catch yourself going way above the speed limit and come back down. One pedal driving is a trip if you aren’t used to it but is easy to pick up. I opted for the higher trim and am super happy with how intuitive this car is. 
Bravo!

Volvo cars have left me disappointed when it comes to reliability. Unfortunately, their service and customer care only add to the frustration and make you question your decision to buy a Volvo. Let me share my personal experience, and you can be the judge.

In mid-December, my 10-month-old XC60 Recharge unexpectedly shut down for no apparent reason. After reporting the issue, it took volvo roadside assistance a whopping 12 hours to arrive. Imagine being stuck in the middle of nowhere for that long. When they finally showed up, they attempted various fixes but to no avail. Ultimately, they had to tow my car to the service center where I initially purchased it.

To my dismay, the service center neglected my car for the first four days without even offering a loaner vehicle, despite my repeated requests. This was quite disheartening considering they had claimed to be a premium brand when I purchased the car. In reality, their service fell short and felt more like a budget option.

After spending over a week in the service center, I was finally asked to pick up my car. However, my happiness quickly turned into disappointment when the dashboard started showing errors within 10 minutes of driving. I had to return the car the very next day for further repairs.

As of my latest update on January 31, 2023, my car is still in service for the third time in the past 45 days. In fact, during the last 45 days, I have only had my car with me for a mere 3 days; the rest of the time, it has been at Palo Alto Volvo Service. 

There are lot many small problems, if i write here, it will become a 50 page book. Another day.

 If you visit Twitter and search for tweets about Volvocars, you'll find numerous similar experiences shared by others. It's disheartening to see a brand with such potential fall short in terms of reliability and customer support.

I have owned my XC60 Recharge for the past 7 months and find it to be a great- practical  vehicle.  

The car has solid pickup getting on and off expressways, is very comfortable to drive with more than adequate room for front row passenger and back seat riders.

The electric charge gets me approximately 45 miles per charge which is about how many miles I drive each day.  My only complaint is that the Recharge takes  6+/- hours overnight in our garage to charge which is a bit longer than I expected.

The car has performed as advertised.  I would
purchase a XC 60 Recharge again.
This fuel efficiency for 415-455 HP cannot be beat.  Better than Mercedes hands down and Jeep doesn't even come close!
Leading hybrid technology drivetrain, and far superior in reliability and fit and finish to Mercedes, Range Rover, Audi, etc.

I leased a 2022 XC60 with the B6 engine. I couldn’t wait for it to get here, but when it did, all I wanted to do is give it back. Extremely reliable and great driving experience.
Must test drive to appreciate Volvo superior quality  and craftsmanship.

If you are thinking about buying a Volvo, do it. Every added package is worth it, especially the bowers and Wilkins. I’ve had 4 benz, trash car, trash customer service. T5 is underpowered but the T6 R-Design w a polestar (my car whooped a Dodge Challenger. It’s a 3 ton car buy drives like a sports car. Trust me, just buy it yall.

Our XC90 Inscription has without question been a Real Performer since purchase.  No regrets whatsoever.  The Bluetooth is quirky more frequently than we care and can be outright annoying sometimes, when it does not respond according to your request.  The "cushioning" in the seats is Good, but could be "cushier" like our BMW seats, which simply melted around you like "buttah." Unfortunately, the 2nd row seats are not heated/cooled, which one would definitely expect for a car in this Class & Price level range... That is kinda irritating, but we've learned to accept it.  The Navigation system is NOT as accurate as one would think in this vehicle's Class & Price range. We recently learned this on a trip to the mountains of NC and rather than relying on our personal experience of driving the route, we knew was closest and best route, the Nav took us in an alternate route, which not only took us an extra 45 min. to arrive at the same destination, but took us through two-lane, winding road through the mountains, which we will never do again, when we know better. The styling is absolutely Great and people still think we're driving a "new car," which when complimented makes us feel downright Good! We purchased the "Wrap-Around Warranty" shortly after purchasing the car, which we believe was not only a Bargain, but extremely Wise investment considering all the truly electronics that came with the SUV.

I love everything about this car, especially the safety tech. But the cabin noise level is too high for this segment. I had my car checked by 2 different dealers and they both said this noise level is normal for XC90. I had MDX before that and it had much better noise isolation. Currently, my XC90 noise level is the same as my Prius so you can understand why I would rate this 3. 

Other than noise level this car is perfect for road trips as you can put auto pilot on and relax a bit. 

I will not buy it again just because of cabin noise

SUZI is a very safe car, travels well. 
We would like to know her value. 
Leather interior and all around speakers and air.

We needed an SUV capable of road trips with our 3 dogs (2 big and 1 mini), with room for an air mattress on a nonstop drive.  Problem solved.  This is my wife's car and she loves Volvos.  We still keep a 2007 Saab convertible for the summer, and it's the best car I ever owned, so we trust the Swedes to know a thing or two about winter driving.  Everything about the XC90 is amazing and I'm still learning the features, but this is one well-built and safe mother, not to mention comfy and cool.  Had to get the big HP and ball-cooler leather seats, but I let her pick the rest.  Now I get my Maserati back.  Did I mention we like European cars?  And the deal we got didn't hurt either.

Such a step up from our Lexus RX hybrid. This T8 plug-in hybrid is soooo cool! Lots of power when needed, but the all electric mode around town or for quick trips boosts mileage to surprising levels. The worst mileage we've seen from a full tank (mostly highway driving) was 34. The best was 71! And our insurance bill went way down! Some of the tech (and there's a LOT!) takes some practice to get comfortable with, but overall, we are in love with this vehicle. Highly recommend comparing it to others before making a final purchase decision.

The car is in excellent condition. Very reliable and compact as well as being iconic. If you are looking for really good car during Europe deployment that's it. The car is registered in US Registiration System and EU Spec. As far as i know, you can't take it to US in regular way. I don't have any negative aspect about the car. Flawless and enjoying. regards

On a 2018 mini jcw with only 20,000 miles I’m on my 6th tire replacement at approximately $300/tire. The run flat tires on the mini jcw are prone to severe damage under normal driving conditions. They do not handle even the smallest road potholes well. Left rear light fixture failed and costs $300 to replace. Too many rattles and poor fit and fittings.

All the bells and whistles from the full sun roof/moon roof, leather interior, entire selection of colors for interior lighting, backup camera, heated seats, headlights that auto adjust to level and corners as you drive the list goes on and on but good luck keeping the prissy thing moving. Known for the engine mounts deteriorating (they are just rubber pieces between the metal). Spring in the shifter column broke off and the car reads it as a transmission problem. It’s 5 years old, paid off and stopped moving today. It won’t crank but I can get to Minis diagnostic screen which tells me the only problem with the car currently is that I need to set the date/time.

I had the first year Clubman and loved it.  Moved toward more exotics and left Mini. This year a Clubman caught my eye. Stopped at dealership, found what I wanted and brought it in. So much fun to drive, plenty of power for me and it wants to run on the freeway. The car has many of the creature comforts that I've had on much more expensive cars.  Chesterfield brown leather with white piping and British racing green makes for a sharp car.
The car is nothing but continuous problems and Transmission shifts hard. Needs already a Transmission Rebuild!!! Beyond Expensive Repairs.

Great Car!! I love it! But there is a couple CONS that I want to point out.
1.) The car doesn't come with a spare tire.
2.) Tires that are sold with the car are run flats and are 40,000 Mile tires.
3.) The car is low to the ground so when you hit a pothole or a bump in the road you feel everything. The Mini Cooper Countryman is higher off the ground and has more head room. So I would recommend buying a countryman over a clubman.

I love my mini clubman. It’s a lot of fun to drive and the options for varying interior light colors makes it a custom experience. The mini emblem that shines from the mirror is an added bonus that never fails to impress people when they see it for the first time, it also is practical because it lights the floor by your feet so you can see if you dropped something or if there is a puddle next to your car if you are coming outside in the dark. The run flat tires are great because the roads are awful where I live so the threat of a flat is only a pothole away. Although I have had tire trouble in the past, I don’t think it is the fault of the vehicle as much as it is of the road conditions and poor luck. I have an automatic so you can switch from sport mode, to mini mode (I think that is the name), to green mode depending on what kind of driving mood you’re in or if you need to save on gas. It takes premium gas so it is a little more expensive but the mileage is better than my previous vehicles so it definitely goes further. The felted bottom keeps the engine and mechanical parts clean from road debris and general corrosion from salt etc. Even though it is a small car it is super spacious because the trunk has storage underneath and the seats fold down so you can transport larger objects. The trunk opens with 2 doors outward instead of upward which is another sporty/cool feature of this car. I love it.

I absolutely love my fully loaded 2018 Mini Cooper Clubman S.   I traded in my old 2017 Subaru Impreza Premium, and the difference could not be more stark between these two cars.   My new Mini is quick, has very nimble and responsive handling characters, and the interior refinements are similar to that of a 3 series BMW.  The Harman Kardon sound system with 8 speakers is brilliant and well worth the upgrade. I do appreciate the extra space when I go to the store or take others with me.   So far, my Mini has been very reliable, and I have no reservations recommending the 2018 Mini Clubman.
Just got a used 2014 convertible for my first Mini. I hope to have it for years to come.  It's so fun to drive especially on our curvy mountain roads.

The car truly is excellent. Ride is a tad bit firm as expected for such a well handling vehicle. It is greatly improved by the choice of tires. 

It is sporty without compromising on economy. I frequently get 33 mpg with the manual variant when driven responsibly. With a more heavy foot I average around 26mpg. 

It is truly a car like no other. And safe. I got in an accident with the car hitting another at 50mph and I've never felt so safe in a vehicle. All airbags deployed and the vehicle did a tremendous job making the impact feel as if it was not happening. 

I acquired exactly the same one!

I bought the Mini in November of 2022.  After a year of ownership, I have found the car to be everything I had expected and hoped for.  It is roomy and comfortable up front for two full grown adult humans and a blast to drive.  The automatic transmission is actually an automated manual transmission and I'll probably never bother with a standard transmission again.  The automatic is that good.  Cargo space is perfectly adequate for a second car and the hatchback is surprisingly useful if you fold down the rear seats.  The car seems to be very high quality and there have been zero issues over my year of ownership.  I get about 32 MPG, but much more if I drive sedately.  The headlights are fantastic.  The seat heaters and heated steering wheel are likewise fantastic.  The stereo is adequate, but not stellar.  The double moonroof is awesome and although the seats are manual adjustment, it's easy to find a comfortable position.  Legroom up front is spectacular.  I love the frameless window doors even if they do let a bit more road noise into the car.  The Mini feels well built and it certainly helps that they've been making refinements to this exact car since 2014.  I don't care for the lame lane departure warning.  It is intrusive, but you can switch it off.  The older iDrive infotainment is nice and I prefer it to a touchscreen.  The Mini/BMW navigation system is typically excellent.  Perfect second car.

It failed to give me the value of my car, stating it was unable to.  Mini will no longer be making my specific type of car (manual shift).  The fact that I have low miles on the car, which are ALL mostly high way miles, the car is black, on black with black rims; I'm positive I can get MORE for my car!

Excellent driving car. Iconic looks, inside and out. Great gas mileage, averaging 34 mpg.
Would have given it a 5 star rating, but the rear brakes had to be replaced at 22,000 miles. And rhe run-flat tires suck. I bought a spare kit and out real tires on it. It handles so much better.
Outstanding car.  So much fun to drive.  Handling is amazing. Very roomy for its size. Have had 4 large people inside with no issue.

My Mini makes me feel so young and it is such fun
I have people at stop lights telling me how darling she is I love my
Mini and will never trade her for anything else
Car is a lot of fun to drive , Speedy little car ,convertible top so easy to use, I enjoy driving it

2018 Mini Copper Countryman All 4 S

Problems prior to 60,000 miles:

Door Latches: All four door latches failed (at various intervals) requiring the doors to be tied down to the headrest until repaired. The passenger door latched failed twice. Service manager was unable to offer an explanation as to the cause.

Battery Replacement: No indication/warning light given that the battery was getting low… It just stopped functioning. Replacing the battery requires removing support bars and engine compartment panels. Somewhat time consuming compared to most cars. 

Engine Coolant: almost all of the engine coolant evaporated causing the car to overheat. No warning light that coolant was low. Car had been serviced by Mini of Bedford two weeks prior and had been consistently serviced by the dealership.

Decals: Decals around the headlights bubbled and needed to be replaced. 

Tires: Run flat fair weather tires needed to be replaced to allow for inclement/snow conditions.

Service/Technicians: There are very few shops that work on Mini Coopers and most are as expensive as the dealer.

Overall: The Mini Copper is not a reliable vehicle and owning one in North America is costly unless you have the time to perform the repairs yourself.

I love Minis, this is my third one and will definitely buy again. The Countryman is a very fun and car to drive. the interior is very stylish and luxurious. I've never had any mechanical issues with any of the Countryman's that I've owned. I could go on and on about how great of a vehicle they are, love them. Unfortunately there is one issue , I dislike all the black plastic trim on the exterior of the vehicle, it fades very fast, other than that I love Minis.

My wife and I have owned 3 regular Mini Coopers and now a 2022 Mini Countryman for myself (my bucket list car ;-) .  We also currently own a 2016 Mini Convertible.  I absolutely love the fact that you can design your own car online with very unique options, colors, etc..   My 2022 Mini Countryman Cooper S is roomy, sporty, classy, and unique all at the same time.  Currently leasing the vehicle but may decide to purchase at lease end for $26,000 in May of 2024.  I ordered my Mini Countryman fully loaded with all options except for the sport seats.  FWIW, I am 6'4" 250 lbs. and the car fits me fine and is very comfortable.  Again, avoid the sport seats if you have a broad back.
I have leased this car for 4 years and really love it.  It has leather seats heated.  Great amount of room in back, have been able to use it for everything.
Love the car, I have an interested buyer so I just want a resale value for my JCW Edition
I love this car. Makes me smile. Cute. Parks easily. A lot of pep. Well made. A ton of room with seats folded down. A little noisy on hwy because of run flat tires. Otherwise, perfect car.

I've enjoyed my Mini over the past few months until I had an issue with the auto lock.  While I was packing up the car after a hike my keys, phone and dog got locked in the car. I was on a rural road in 98 degree heat.  Luckily a trucker came by and was able to break the back window to get the dog out. I contacted Mini who asked that I bring it to my dealership which I did. They did not find an issue with the system and said that it may have been caused by interference from my cell phone. That was 4 weeks ago and I've still not heard back from BMW/Mini that they are addressing the issue.  I've made a safety complaint to the NHTSA and hopefully they will be able to get a response.  In the meantime I've had all auto locking features disabled. Overall very disappointed in my customer service experience.

As a car enthusiast and vintage road racer, our nicely equipped 2019 BRG with white roof Mini is a blast.  Even my long-suffering wife enjoys driving it.  It handles, rides, brakes, accelerates and sounds like a sports car from within.  We own the Countryman S ALL 4 with the underrated 189 BHP turbo 4 that pulls like a small V-8.  Great gas mileage in city/highway driving as well.  It's a car you can drive all day and still look forward driving it the next.
Just got a used 2014 convertible for my first Mini. I hope to have it for years to come.  It's so fun to drive especially on our curvy mountain roads.

It is truly a car like no other. And safe. I got in an accident with the car hitting another at 50mph and I've never felt so safe in a vehicle. All airbags deployed and the vehicle did a tremendous job making the impact feel as if it was not happening.

I have people at stop lights telling me how darling she is I love my
Mini and will never trade her for anything else
Car is a lot of fun to drive , Speedy little car ,convertible top so easy to use, I enjoy driving it

We love our Blazer RS, myself (husband) being disabled it's by far the best option of any vehicle on the market, both front seats are electric and heated, but the passenger seat will lower down so I can get myself in the car and then raise the seat to normal position and then when I go to get out I lower the seat and am able to get myself out of the car 
Not to mention the beautiful and comfortable leather interior and the exterior is a beautiful design that draws praise from strangers everywhere we go, performance is awesome with just the right amount of power with a smooth ride 
Rear of the car has plenty of room for my 4 wheel disability scooter can't say enough about this car

I purchased this vehicle with 400 miles on it so I considered it brand new. So far I have only put on 25,000 miles and have already put over $5000.00 into it. Thank goodness I also purchased an extended warranty. To just replace the battery cost $500.00 because the vehicle had to be towed. Then the power stearing failed and most recently a sensor of some sort. Extremely disappointing.

Purchased my 2020 3LT new in the beginning of 2020. First let me start by saying this is one of the best looking Suvs on the market inside and out. Mine came with leather seats, panoramic sunroof, 360 HD camera, tow package, bose speakers and the V6 engine. I have roughly 45k miles on it and so far the only thing wrong has been a radiator leak which was covered under warranty.  I do wish it got a bit better gas mileage as I average roughly 19 mpg. Long trips it will get up 25 plus mpg. 
As others have said the V6 is peppy and unless your in sport or 4wd your tires will spin because of the torque if accelerating quick from stop. 
Size wise I have 2 kids and both fit in the back seat fine. I can fit a wagon and stroller in the trunk at the same time so there is decent space in the Blazer. Overall I really love the blazer especially with the added features included.
Like new only has a couple of door dings on the drivers side door.  Has mostly in town mileage.  Well kept under car

No questions asked, best driving SUV in its class regardless of what people say. but my blazer has hands down the cheapest quality everything. The car dents when it goes over a tough bump. thats how cheap the metal is. Cant even enjoy the Bose speakers because of how poor the interiors quality is as well.

Bought new 2020 Blazer in Oct of 2019 . This car only has 22000 miles on it . We are retired and seniors so it doesn’t get driven often . Loved everything about it , until now The back up camera , the acceleration, the air conditioner, etc . Everything worked as it should . But this past week , while driving home compressor locked up , which caused drive belt to break . Car overheated. Should not be happening to a car with so few miles An expensive repair bill followed .
Very clean leather seats hot and cold seats heated steering wheel  moon roof all wheel drive color hot red black rims

I purchased the 22 Blazer RS FWD in December '21 and can't believe how much fun it is to drive. Plenty of power and handles nimbly.  Average fuel economy for me has been 19 mpg. I highly recommend this vehicle!

I bought this car 4 months ago and it runs like a charm. It's good for a big family, not too small, and cheap financially. I used to pay 400$ for gas a month before I got this car and the electricity bill has almost no difference since I bought this car. It's also pretty reliable with no issues so far and it's really fun to drive

This is my second electric car , both Chev. Best bang for buck, dirt cheap to drive . I charge at home and it costs me about 3 bucks to go 100 kilometres. Lots of room , I brought a stove home in the back of the EUV version.

This is the best EV for the price as a commuter car. It has one of the highest level 2 charge rate, although DC charging rate is low. Very comfortable interior, good regenerative braking, and affordable pricing. Love it.
just purchased a 22 EUV  Premier launch edition love this car much more comfortable styling better all around car than the previous 2020 I owned
I find that I get between 264 and 274 miles or range per charge, despite the EPA estimate of 247 miles per charge.

We purchased the Chevy Bolt EUV Premier with Super Cruise Option.   Love the size and inside is very roomy.  You have to sit on it to appreciate it.  Very well designed.   Have not put gas since August 10th when I purchased it!    
The 8 inch color instrument panel is excellent.  You hall the info you want and more.  The 10.2 inch display for the info system has more than you need to use.  
You can't go wrong with the Chevy Bolt EUV.  Regenerative braking rooks!   I see my distance go up when I am driving and using it. 
Battery issue well I have not seen it.  I am keeping my battery max charging to 90 percent and charging it daily so it does not get to low.  GM will do good by us.  They will replace out batteries and then I will have another 8 years /100000  of warranty on the new batteries.
I hope they don't discontinue this vehicle when the 2024 Equinox EV comes out.   For my wife
the Equinox is to big this is the perfect vehicle.  Easy to maneuver.    It may be electric but you drive the same way you always did.  
Great job GM on this great EUV!

This is the second Bolt having own a 2017 Bolt EV.   I traded it for the new EUV after driving it for 5 years 55K miles.  The new dash with the new infotainment system is great.  I think the price is a good value compared to other EV's with a 250 mile range.  I like the Super Cruse although i think that it still needs some refinements.   
Current battery problem are not that much of a concern but disappointing.   GM will need to do something to reward early buyers of this car.

I took delivery of my Summit white Launch Edition one week ago.  Here are my initial impressions:  

I am happy with: the build quality; the ride quality; the noise levels; the acceleration; the handling; the steering; the brakes; the blind spot detection; the adaptive cruise control; and the transmission selector.  I have issues with: the seats; the audio and navigation controls; the pairing of my phone with the car; super cruise; and charging (the car could not be charged with the charger that came with the car).  

If I could do it over again, I believe I would buy the Premium model without the Sun and Sound and Super Cruise packages.

I had test driven a few EVs before making the switch from a gas car and there was something about the Bolt that just captured me more than others. First, how it drives. The Bolt's driving characteristics are easy to learn, at least for me. Some other EVs drive different and they feel heavy. The Bolt somehow still feels nimble and small, which I prefer. I have a disdain for large cars and SUVs, personally. It still comfortably fits 4 adults over 6'. Myself being 6'6 this is one of the few cars where it is possible to have the seat too far back. The plus side of that is a friend who is 6'4 still had plenty of leg room behind me. Researching the car myself, I was concerned about the seats being uncomfortable but I have put nearly 4000 miles on it in the 3 months I have owned the car and have no complaints.

If you have a place to charge, owning an EV is a no brainer. My apartment has chargers that are reasonably priced, so I end up paying about 1/3 - 1/4 the cost per mile compared to my former gas car. The only downside is the slow charging at fast chargers. All Bolts are limited to 55 kW at DC chargers, which means most stops on long road trips are going to be 40 mins. Newer EVs charge much quicker (usually a minimum of 150 kW nowadays, almost 3x faster than the Bolt), but if you rarely road trip I personally would save the cash and buy a used Bolt. It is otherwise a fantastic little car that personally brings a huge grin to my face.

As far as quality overall, I will leave you with an anecdote from my grandmother the first time she sat in my Bolt with nearly 50k miles and closed the door: "This is a GM product? The door doesn't sound like tin can and the interior doesn't squeak!"

Ironically, I was always a snob you know I like V-8 engines Mustangs Corvette that type of a car and when my fiancé died, I inherited his Bolt and I thought I would just drive it for a while to save on gas because last year a gas is up to seven dollars a gallon.. I cannot believe how much I enjoy driving the car not just for the savings but just how fast he can go. You have to actually be careful and how it handles. Love it.

yes I would purchase another one but later model with electric seats. The interior is as my wife puts it sort of like an early Holiday interior, cheap. The seats are from hunger ( my back is not in the best condition so most vehicles hurt me), but that's about it. It's great around the area. The battery upgrade gives me approx 300 miles local. It can get out of its own way. I simply enjoy it. If we go on a trip and I know the hotel has a charging system I'll easily run 200 miles one way. A note, consider the short wheelbase. It's not a Cadi and a bit rough on some road surfaces. I am lucky too. The local dealer is pretty good.

The infrastructure needs to be expanded but we all know that. I have a Tesla adapter on order from the Chevy dealer. That should allow a bit more flexibility.  

I added an OE full size spare and tools for repair in the trunk.

Of course, I love my Chevy Bolt. It's an EV.  They are awesome.  And the Bolt is fine, but Chevy has reached the end of my patience.  Where is my replacement battery promised more than 2 years ago??!!!!  Tired of short range and wondering about it starting a fire.  Hey Chevy, stop blaming LG Chem and keep your word!!

GM decided to replace some batteries and not others so expect the car company to either support your purchase or not. 
It is a very small car. Even with DC fast charging it is painful to try to go over one charge on the road. You don't have enough time on earth left to try to go cross country unless you only go 200 miles a day and stay at hotel overnight.
They seem to cost more to insure than a gas car.
States are now putting on extra fees that may be more than a gas car.
You can only recharge it cheaply if you have overnight home charging at low prices. You generally have to buy or have installed a charger. Can be expensive. 
Blind spot lights can't be seen at night for the most part. Car behind you had bright LED's and they overpower the mini yellow icons. Should have been placed inside the car.
Charge port is plastic. Guess how long that stuff will last?
You basically can't work on it unless you know how to be safe around 400V HV. Heard MB is locking customers out of hood for that reason.
Almost no maintenance. You won't miss the gas station and laugh at their prices with folks in car.
Might not laugh at the rising electricity rates but everything seems to have doubled in price except my wages. 
Batteries go bad. The range of the Bolt will keep it a working city car for a long time hopefully unless it catches fire. Hoping for next gen batteries to fix that.
My skinny behind fits the seats and lets a 6'3" frame fit. 
It is quite. The OEM tires are about the only low rolling resistance tires you can use. They are expensive to replace and an EV can burn them up in a short time unless you are careful.

I got the basic Bolt, no frills.  Car payment is low, no upkeep expense, never a moment it didn't work, tremendous range (300 miles on a summer day).  No gas.  No oil.  Never stop at a gas station except to get a drink.  Great power, easy to drive--almost never touch the brake with one-pedal driving.  No unpleasant smell, no mess on the garage floor.  NOTHING ever needed attention--oh, I did get a tire rotation a few times.  They said there was a problem with the battery--but I never saw it--they gave me a new battery recently.  No hassle.

FIRST and foremost DON'T buy one that has not yet had the older battery replaced.  I expect it will be years (if ever) until the newest battery is replaced.  I will upgrade rating if the battery is ever replaced.  There are restrictions on where to park and charge if you dont have the battery replacement!!!!!!!

You wont get the estimated mileage unless you dont run the AC or heater.
Very spunky as it takes off quickly.
Its very quiet and nearly completely gets rid of most traffic and things around you.
Premium Bose speakers are excellent (if you listen to music from your cell phone)
Does not feel like its a very small car.
Traveling around the country is a total challenge due to charging times and finding charging compatible stations.
If you have a newer one like mine a 2021,  the battery is not yet replaced.  
The seats are like sitting on bricks. I didn't think it would be an issue but it is!!!
In spite of the issues I like this car.  With a new replacement battery and significantly more comfortable seats I would give it a 4.5 rating, I am considering going to an auto upholstery shop and get the front seats replaced its so uncomfortable.

I purchased my 2020 Bolt EV as a "used" car from my  local Chevy Dealership in February 2021.  I paid right at 30k but it had all the bells and whistles that i wanted and less than 1000 miles on the odometer. Yes,  I am waiting for the recall battery pack to be installed sometime in the next month.  My family are all about fossil fuel cars so i got my share of shade cast at Me and my car "Minerva".  That was until they had a ride...then it became the "well it is a good car, but when will it catch on fire?"  All i can do is shake my head, smile, and marvel at the stupidity.  Now almost 2 years later and I am getting comments about how i must like not having to pay high gas price.  Oh how the wheel does turn.  I believe Minerva is still one of the best purchases i have ever made.  She is quiet, comfortable and a blast to drive.  I use one pedal driving and rarely if ever have i had to touch the brakes.  Minerva has never left me on the side of the road and i can charge at both my home and office.  The replacement battery will come with a new 10 year 100k mi warranty and i look to hand down this car to my grandchildren when they are getting ready to drive.  GM has pulled some bonehead moves in the past, but this car is not one of them.  Chevrolet should be proud of the Bolt just like i am proud of Minerva.

Sure they quote you a value for your trade, but the dealer is not obligated and doesn't come close to the estimate value. As usual, once the dealership gets you in the door they'll attempt to fleece the customer. I think KBB gets paid by getting customers into the dealership because the dealer wants no part of giving you the price KBB says.

I got my oil changed and all of a sudden my camaro lost its speed. Why? I went to 4 mechanics and no one knows what im talking about. Check ingine light was cleared by one place. Frustrating.  I wanna trade it.

I've owned this beautiful car for over 5 years now and haven't regretted it a minute.  Styling is outstanding - especially with the RS appearance package.  The Garnet Red tint coat paint is just stunning.  Love the power of the mid-level V6 and that it only needs 87 octane gas.  Automatic transmission shifts super smoothly (even in Sport mode)  Very solid chassis with no flex or rattles.

The leather interior has held up well although I needed to have the interior door handles replaced (under warranty) )due to chipping "chrome" paint.   Overall, it has been quite reliable with no drivetrain issues.   As with any car, you should study the maintenance schedule and be financially prepared to follow it.
Enjoy driving this car , I got the convertible 2ss , only wish I can drive it more often. Only negative I can think of is the CarPlay tries to switch users to often.

I love my crush orange SS 1LE. Nothing like driving around in great weather rowing the gears in this beast. Never gets old and will never get old. Oh and the cracks pops and burgles. Oh my how they sound like a symphony to the ears, or terror to your enemies. Buy it now.
like to know more about this car so is there anyone that could help me figuring out all the details

The biggest issue I have with this Camaro SS is the shift skip elimination for the manual six-speed. How stupid, it makes you drive all weird and I almost crashed 9 times. I finally bought the plug-in at the top of the trany to stop that from engaging. Drives wat better and smoother now.  Did chevy not learn from the early 2000s how stupid that is? Otherwise great Camaro SS. The fog lights should have a separate turn-on button and should have been placed vertically with a slight outward angle at the bottom instead horizontally placed; it looks cooler that way. Oh yeah, on star sucks. Apple play should be wirelessly and there should be an upgrade for it. Camaro should be made in America too! It handles amazingly. Love the 1LE package and dual exhaust system! Oh, and it needs cup holders in the back with just a like 3-5 inches more room for length. But they can sacrifice that 3-5 inches for the back by taking up some trunk space.

Best Car I have ever owned. I have owned 15 plus cars in my life including a Dodge Viper SRT 10. This  6TH Gen Camaro SS is hands down the best chassis ever made. The alpha chassis controls like a god around corners and have supercharged mine pushing 700hp. Great control, looks and overall great ride. I have no issues looking around inside and feel very comfortable with the 6TH generation Camaro. Chevrolet hit it out of the park with this Camaro Generation.
The Chevrolet City Express helped us with consistent dependability for five years and will do the same for any new owner.

I love the vehicle. I use it  for business and personal duties.  Great gas mileage.  I really like all the doors for easy access. The only negative I can think of is that the passenger seat does not have an arm rest or overhead handle to assist with entry and exit.

I bought this truck new in March of 2019 and I love this truck.  It's small easy to get around 20 mpg city and 36 hwy. This diesel motor has tons of power and can tow 7000 lbs.  Just turned 40k miles and not one bit of troubles, not even a recall.  Lots of bells and whistles, premium Bose sound, touch screen display, spray in bedliner and heated steering wheel controls.  I've added a cab high canopy for secure hauling of things.
I can't say enough good things about this truck or Chevrolet in general.

I have the diesel z71. I'm very happy with it. I have the loaded interior. It feels a lot more luxury than Tacoma at the same finishout, in my opinion. I also love the power of the diesel engine. It's completely capable for everything I need in a remote Montana lifestyle without being too big or unwieldy. I get complements on it all the time.

Most comfortable midsize truck, long trips are no problem.  Handling and performance are top-notch.  The Bose sound system is awesome, quality sound, that is a huge plus.  Outperforms the Ford ranger and Toyota Tacoma. I would definitely recommend this truck.

Great ride. Great features. Powerful v6.Drives as smooth as a car. Alot of interior room. You can expect alot of compliments. I have z71 with good looking roll bar. Great off road. CONS- Info screen flickers sometimes ( but not often enough to b concerned ) Shakes at high speeds ( easily rectified)  OVERALL, GREAT TRUCK!

2017 Chevy Colorado, 31000 miles, gets 24 to 26 mph on highway, and 19 to 20 in the city.
It sets high, and you need to use running board to get in the vehicle. That is the only reason we plan on getting a new vehicle, my wife and i both have knee problems: therefore need something lower to ground to get into.
I purchased the vehicle when it had 10 miles on it, all the miles are local except the two time we went to Virginia to visit my sister.
All Maintenance has been performed by Stingray  or Absolute Auto Repair shop. I have records of all maintenance including the dates it was refueled, and total cost for everything.
It is a really great driving truck.
It has a soft bedcover on it, and it has a tow hitch installed.
Great truck! Bought new,now has 54000 with no trouble.  Plenty of power on the v6 LT trim . Would definitely recommend.

I have the LT model, which is middle of the road on features but has everything I need. Simple, clean appearance. V6 has plenty of power. Too bad they don't have a manual transmission as an option. Bed is plenty deep with tie downs where needed. Feels like a whole lot of truck compared to the S series I drove previously. I love it.
Chevy from the keys..I luv my colorado..next generation..my own 1st truck.. feel excited with the bow tied

After almost 3 years of ownership and 25,000 miles, this car is awesome!  If you can, add to the purchasing experience by doing a Museum Delivery.  It’s truly a great experience,  and then drive it home.  The fit and finish is great and no unexpected trips to the dealership.  Unlike many high performance sports cars I’ve only had to do the engine oil change and transmission service at reasonable rates.  The C8  is an excellent daily driver that gets decent mileage and has plenty of room for two people to take weekend road trips.  The hardtop convertible can’t be beat - the roof goes up and down at speeds up to 30mph and has room for luggage that doesn’t need to be shuffled around whether the roof is up or down.

I’ve owned my 2024 C8 HTC Z51 for about 6 months now. This car continues to excite me every time I drive it. The handling, attention, and acceleration are exceptional. I own more powerful cars, but the C8 is always my natural choice to drive when I just want to enjoy the day. You can’t go wrong with a C8.

I have owned several sports cars and the last corvette i owned was in 2007 and it was was a nice car but did not have the looks and quality of many imports. I bought this C8 in red mist metallic and Napa leather seats, i went more for the appearance and not the race track look. I am very impressed with the bappa leather, fit and finish. I’ve owned this car for 10 months and everyday and i do mean everyday some what says what a beautiful car, i drives well handles well, maybe only complaint would be  noise feed back on an asphalt highway with a lot of aggregate.

I'd rather drive a Porsche 911 BASE any day. Corvette is just having their moment due to the pandemic . All these corvette owners think they'll sell for a Million bucks. On a Real day a Used 2020 Corvette should be sitting at around 39K. Corvette Owners Please thank COVID for Price inflation lol. End of the day... It's just a Poorly Cheap made American Car.
Love everything about my C8. So much fun to drive! So grateful and appreciate the perfect amount of tech, comfort, and space to go with all the power. Love the mid engine too!

Worst resale value vehicles on the market. Trade in value has dropped beyond a point that you have two choices. Take a huge value loss, or just keep the car and have a value loss.  Both ways are indeed the same!! These cars are not holding up from the cost of purchase, to a year later ownership. Bad experience ever buying this junkyard car.
Power Style and Precision.  Best Corvette yet.  How did they do it?  Mid-Engine for a great price.  Last of the Mid Engine V8 options out there.  No need for turbos here.  Just pure linear V8 power.

Enjoy your gas hog car, because there's no more corvette gasoline engines. LOL :))) These cars will eventually become electric. This car is old news, past history. So theres been class action lawsuits filed but its about who can afford more attorney's.

This is an unbelievably great car. Had it for 18 months, and It’s now 5 years old with 25K miles.  Thrilling ride with Zero problems. Strangle my it’s a comfy road trip car in Touring mode with great gas mileage even with the supercharger.  I don’t like GM, but I’ll buy another gas-powered vette.  Love it!

I have owned my corvette for 5 years and it has been a wonderful car.  The performance, reliability, and versatility at this price point is hard to beat.  It still grabs a lot of attention and looks impressive for a model that debuted as a 2014 model.  There really is something for everyone with the options and models available.  You cannot go wrong with this car.

I've driven other older Vets and C7 is by far the best driver car. The handling and traction is not even comparable to the older models. The manual gear box is heavy but crisp and accurate. Not a seating in a traffic car (manual transmission) but the most fun on curvy and open roads.

The C7 corvette is a phenomenal performer, especially at its price point.  When you compare the performance numbers with it's competition, it's not even close. I have owned a C5, C6, and now a C7. Each iteration has been better than the next and they have always been wonderful performers and very reliable to own. I have owned other sports cars from many different manufactures, but keep coming back to the corvette. The sound, looks, reliability, low maintenance costs and accessibility from a price standpoint make this the best sports car experience for the money.
I've had this car for two months now.  I love it.  Extremely powerful, well built, and fun to drive.  Can wait for spring and summer to get here!

Terrible resale value. These cars are overpriced from the get go. CarMax offer was terrible but I took the money and ran. I, will will wait it out for something else. Due to this economy crisis, i feel lucky to get what I can.
Had mine for almost 2 years. No issues. Keep up on Maintenance and you will have a reliable vehicle.
Good driving, really good gas milage, enough room for 4 adults. Reliable. Popular car with good resale.

Took perfect care of my car but at 50k miles one of the pistons started misfiring. Needed a total engine replacement. Thank god my extended warranty covered it or I would have been out 7-8k. This vehicle is cheap for a reason. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money for a Toyota. There's a reason the Cruze has been discontinued and Chevy is getting out of the sedan game .

Great for gas mileage and it's a comfy car. 38K miles after buying it brand new and fully paid off we had to replace the entire engine. Traded it in after spending $6000+ for diagnostic tests/installing a new engine, don't want to own a Chevy again. I don't recommend.

Fantastic mpg, great handling, low maintenance.  Purchased car new after discounts it was a little over 24 grand.  Leather, moon roof, heated seats and wheel!  I am finally putting new brakes on it at 148,000 miles.  OEM tires lasted 61,000 miles I put on Michelin defenders and am replacing with defender IIs 86,000 miles later!  A great hwy car I get 50-55 mpg at 75-80 mph!  At 65 mph I am 60-65!  At 55 70-73 and the best was 81!  Amazing. In town my worst was 36 but usually mid 40s for mpg.  Only maintenance was when the dealer service my transmission at 75k miles I got a check engine light-it was the 02 sensor, weird right after servicing?  Dealer told me it happens.  Possible the tech bumped it?  Nope I was told, never went back to that store-I am sure the tech screwed it up.   I would definitely buy another, much cheaper than hybrids on hwy.  my cost to drive 100 miles is $7-7.50 at $4-4.20  a gallon.   My old gas Cruze coat around $12 for same distance at $3.30 a gallon.  Hybrids at 41mpg and $3.30 a gallon cost $8.05, yep about a dollar more on the hwy.  if you driver on hwy this is the car, 580-620 miles on a tank.  In twin driving I think a hybrid is better but close.  The new electric cars are better when you charge at .315 cents a minute.  The Tesla takes about 10-15 minutes to charge for a hundred miles. - so about $ 4-4.50 to go 100 miles WHEN it's warm out, you lose 40-50% ranger when below zero, yes I test drive a couple electric cars and best range was for Chev Bolt was 230 miles and 140 at -10 and colder.  They were 3-4k more expensive to buy also.  My sister's Tesla 3 was better at over 300 in warm weather but maybe 200 in cold.  But you can't get a gallon of electricity if you run out and they are over twice the price.

There you go, hope that helps!
