Best part, low miles and highway driven (high-speed) miles at 8,300 total.   That's less than 3,000 miles per year.   Garaged and covered at all times when parked.   Detailed professionally monthly.  All service records by Maserati.

I hope no one here has to go through this ! Just providing some info that I believe is relevant to owners and potential owners!

I purchased a 2014 Maserati Quattroporte with 29,154 miles on Sept 21, 2017 which was still under the manufactures warranty.
· On Sept 27 2017, I brought the car to the Maserati dealer due to a loud knocking sound in the engine that started Sept 25 2017
· The Maserati dealer was unable to locate the source of the noise and contacted Maserati of USA for further guidance
· Maserati USA requested the vehicle service records and stated the engine needed to be replaced since the noise could not be located
· Maserati USA approved a complete motor replacement under the manufactures warranty which covered the full cost of parts and labor on the vehicle with 29,479 miles
· The Maserati dealer disclosed a 1 year parts warranty on the engine and one year warranty on labor

On June 15th 2020, My newly manufactured engine provided by Maserati abruptly stalled while driving and forcing the car in Neutral. So towed to the dealer.
· The Maserati dealer contacted me on June 16th 2020, indicating that the Engine that was just swapped out a bit over 2 years ago and only been driven for 14,265 miles (Current odometer = 43,744) has seized and is need of another replacement
· The dealer advised that I will need to open a case with Maserati USA since the engine was already replaced once under warranty, but is no longer covered under the manufacture or extended parts warranty provided during the first replacement
· Service records were once again provided indicating the engine was serviced on 10/12/2018 with 36,492 miles (7,013 miles on new engine) and then again on 7/6/2019 with 39,750 miles (only 3,258 more miles = 10,271miles on new engine)
· Maserati USA is approving a second engine Swap at 43,744 miles on the car, but only 14,265 miles on the Brand New Engine and has committed to covering the cost of the new Engine, but Labor costs approximated to be $5,300 would be my responsibility

To summarize –

Maserati was unable to identify the source of the initial engine noise in Sept of 2017, which resulted in the first motor swap at 29,479 miles. The defective motor was replaced with a BRAND NEW (not refurbished or used) motor from the Maserati production line. After ONLY 14,744 miles of drive time on a BRAND NEW engine, it has now failed. Maserati is willing to provide a replacement motor at no cost which is being considered a “good will” (as if I somehow contributed to a failed engine at 14k) replacement and since the original parts warranty has expired, I ( the consumer) will need to cover the Labor cost. I am not however understanding how there can be 2 engines go bad, (the 2nd at only 14k) and there is no investigation into the cause. Can there be an underlying reason for the engine failure that was not found during the initial investigation in 2017? Does Maserati have a service assurance department that completes RTF repair analysis to find any manufacturing defects? Is the Mean time between failure (MTBF) numbers of the parts used in Maserati Engines not rated to sustain a Maserati engine for more than 14K miles and this is considered normal AFR (annual failure rates)?
As a manufacturer, I would expect these to be a concern and evaluate the root cause instead of considering a car engine failing at 14K miles BAU, and asking the consumer to pay for the labor costs to replace the engine. The bigger concern is, how can a consumer be asked to have any confidence in a car manufacture, and the safety and reliability of its product with 2 engine swaps. What assurances would be given that this will not happen in another 2 years’ time, out of warranty and considered out of pocket costs.

+ Update Feb 2021--- Had to get a lawyer to recover the money for the labor costs, and after months of back and forth with Maserati, they finally settled on reimbursing me the labor fees, but I still have no reassurances that their wont be a 3rd engine failure and also had to sign an agreement that waives my right to another lawsuit against Maserati. The sad reality is, I feel that selling this car is now my only option, but just making it someone else’s problem.

Finally bought a 2014 gts with 37k on it from second owner. Wow I should have got one a decade ago! The nicest best drivers car I have ever driven, and I've had about 40 cars. I actually love that fact that it has some Chrysler parts and is low tech. The repair and maint. Cost are much better than the 2013 end older. The car is very very very smooth and comfortable on the hwy.. I drove 1100 miles home with an average of 27.5mpg! Going 72 mph. The exclusivity is why you buy the car, the driving experience is way you will never buy a lesser car again. I already want an sq4 for my winter car next. The car is near 150k new, but I bought at 6 yrs old with 37k for $27000. And the 4 or maint. Was already done. First owner lost 100k in 3 yrs. Second lost 30k in 2.5 yrs. I expect to own 5 yrs and sell for 20k so my cost should be about 12k for 5 yrs with maint. That's cheaper than a Camry or accord. I will consider a cpo as I did this time, but wanted a gts and could not find a cpo for under 60k. The sq4 at 3 yrs old as a cpo with 30k in it is about 40k with 3 yrs unlimited miles warrant. That's hard to beat. And at 6 yrs old as worth about 22k so 6k a yr to own one with warrant is great. 
My advise, GET ONE!  Shop well. Get a well maintained one. Service records. Find one that was garaged, the windows will not be delaminated and the dash will not be cracked, both the most common flaws in found while hunting. City mph is bad 13-15 mpg. But who cares. Btw the easiest car to wash. The way the lines flow its so nice to wash it by hand. Even the 21" rim's are designed to be easy to clean.
Really a true driving experience!

The Maserati is a fun car to drive. The Ferrari engine and exhaust sound is unbelievable. Wonderful exterior and interior lines. This is a drivers car and not a car for techies. It's also the least expensive way to have a Ferrari engine.

This car is a great combination of luxury and power. Most enjoyable luxury sedan I have ever driven. Leave the radio off because the exhaust notes on this car are all you need to hear. Driving a Maserati is truly exclusive and fun.

Runs Great , 30.8 mile freeway on a 400 mile trip. going  65/75 mile hour.  Tires still in good shape with 40 thousand miles ware.  Ram replace engine because of recall oil consumption old engine ran Great and the New engine also runs Great with no oil consumption.  The only thing about this truck could be improved  is the GPS Tomtom. Sucks. works  but not user friendly.  Great pickup for a Van getting on and off the freeway. ride good, Heats good . I like the Van wish the bench seat could be remove for more room when hauling large items.  This Van smokes the Ford Transit.  Way better Van than the ford.

My 2018 Ram Promaster has a total of 45, 400 miles. I purchased it new.

Here are the issues I've had in 45, 000 miles:

-Engine had to be replaced
-NEW engine constantly clicks on "check engine" light. Dealership gave up trying to figure it out.
-A/C failed after approx. 6 hours of usage
-ALL rear door hinges FAILED and needed to be replaced
-Cargo lights FAILED.
-Running Lights work....Sometimes.
-Battery Failed
-Rear / Front suspension is WRECKED. I baby this vehicle and still am looking at a  $3,8000 repair bill.
-Rear "Barn Door" hinge is failing, AGAIN. That'll be another $400 approx. to fix.

Overall, this is JUNK. Money Pit. Waste of $25,000. 

Ram should be ashamed of themselves.

I bought the Promaster City because it has the most cargo room  of all the small vans and I wanted to save on fuel cost. 
But the repair cost has offset any fuel savings.
1. This Fiat engine uses a lot of oil. 
(Usually 2 quarts added between 5000 mile oil change)..
2.The engine has stalled out several times, several engine components 
have needed to be replaced. (Alternator, fuel pump, piston rings,
Blown head gasket, electric sensors). 
3.Now I am having to replace the long block assembly due to the engine having no compression. Only 83,000 on current engine. 
4.unless Ram gives you a better warranty than 30,000 miles, I would not buy this van.
Not a real comfortable ride for long distance travel. Wish had gotten with xtra seating. Has no side or rear windows.

Use a Promaster for plumbing. I have a lot of equipment in the back which will press up on the door. This triggers the “door open” sensor and makes it so the van can’t lock its doors. I don’t want to take certain jobs in fear of someone stealing equipment or the whole van. You’re not able to turn this off because of a department of transportation rule.  I don’t understand why you would design it like this. I can put regular locks on the cargo doors but the cab itself can’t lock which defeats the purpose of having the locks on the back. Incredibly frustrating.

This is my 3rd Promaster, averaging around 120,000 per year.
Good on gas for such a big vehicle average of 17.5mpg.  Rear view camera is a great option to have since I don't have rear windows or sliding door windows. Looking forward to my next one early in 2022

Interior flaws are blind spots with such huge mirrors and cup holders way to low to reach seats uncomfortable...dash info hard to read and I don't need to know mpg... like I said go with the ford transit

I have the base model supplied by my company and have driven it 2000 miles in 3 weeks. iPhone does not stay connected to hear the navigation audio or phone calls UConnect3 with no navigation no apple car play.

The cup holders are useless except to hold my phone, cups fit too tight and the power ports are between the two cup holders which are very low in the console. you'll need another solution if you like to have a drink handy while you drive.

The seats I have are manual and vinyl so because the A/C is not very effective the seats are a sweat conduit...only an issue because I have nowhere safe to put my water yet. The seats are will take some time to find a comfort spot, the lumbar support seems kind of high up fo me more like the lower to middle of my back.

The A/C blows cold only when accelerating, on a 95degree day it won't keep up with the heat radiated through the large windows. 

The blind spots although greatly reduced by the added convex mirrors are still a major hazard, avoid any angled intersection where traffic comes from the right, the windows, the pillar and the separation barrier allow no view of the intersection beyond straight across the road. Its worse than my old full sized Ford Van.

The cargo section is great if only the lights would stay on longer, the lights are very nice and its well lit for the first few seconds. 

Fuel economy is good when the van is lightly loaded, with about 1,000 lbs of tools and 190 lb driver my highway fuel economy in the urban areas runs about 22mpg with the AC running and average speed as indicated on the dash of 43 mph, so plan on filling every 300 miles or so.

If I had a choice this would not be my selection, at around 27,000 its not a great value for the money. A comfortable work vehicle for those who drive a lot is like a good pair of shoes. This is not that good pair of shoes.

I got polestar for its design. It is an elegant car with high quality audio system and driving experience. I am especially impressed by the safety features. Inherited from its Volvo sister, polestar just feels very safe to drive with many protective features. The seat belt will tighten up when it detects objects moving fast toward you. The drive is very quiet, smooth and relaxing. For people live in cities, service isn’t an issue.
This car is comfortable, well-made, versatile (thanks to fastback design), and an absolute joy to drive. Over 18k miles in and not an issue or complaint.

It drives like its on tracks, easy charge plus I charged at 150 KWHs and we charge at home and it is a 75 KWHs battery, always easy to add apps updates are easy to install, great google auto interaction plus Waze etc.

frunk is big, trunk has a lower level too. very strong interior and our white paint work has pearl in the paint.
We would buy a second Polestar 2 but I own a Rivian.

Pros: gorgeous design, comfortable interior, drives great for such a heavy car, good performance in the snow, range is over 280 miles when the weather is good, has been reliable for the 13 months I’ve owned it so far 

Cons: multiple interior rattles, Volvo service center either doesn’t know how to work on these cars or doesn’t want to, iPhone app is garbage and hasn’t improved in over a year that I have owned this car, Polestar more concerned with launching new models than adding support and features to the 2s that are on the road

I bought mine off a leasing company which saved me around $18,000 (car had 12k miles on it when I bought it). This is my second EV, and though it's not as efficient as the BOLT that I owned, it does have twice the power, so it's understandable. I have the Plus package with upgraded and ventilated seats. I looked at one with the cloth seats and the upgraded leather makes a big difference in these cars. 

I'm getting 200+ miles of mixed driving range in the winter (PA) with 90% max charging. Not great but more than I need for my daily use. I do all my charging at home. I have an ICE car I use for long trips. I should mention I have the dual motor too. This car is well planted in the corners despite its odd height. It may not be as fast as other EV's out there, but  400hp and 460lb torq is more than adequate. This is the fastest stopping 4-door anything that I've ridden in.

There are a few design choses I find odd, like the ride height. Polestar must be hearing about it though because they will start selling lower springs for it in 2023. It's not the prettiest car from the outside, but the open-pore wood, mood lighting, and Nappa leather inside looks great. I did drive one with the entry level grey seats and I did not like it, but to each their own. Only 1 easily accessible cupholder for the front reminds me of European cars of the past. The door panels have plenty of space for aluminum water bottles, so that makes up for it a bit. I rarely have more than a 1 water bottle with me, so it doesn't bother me. 

My biggest issue with this car is the input for media. There isn't any besides streaming or bluetooth. My Bolt had Andriod auto which made playing music stored on my phone more convenient as I could use the screen to navigate the media. If you use satilite radio, Spotify, or Youtube Music this won't be an issue for you as the car does have Android Automotive and you can stream without the use of a phone. The navigation works without a paired phone too, which is shockingly NOT a given these days. The car DOES have plenty of charge points with type-c connection and lots of digital storage so I surmise this issue could be solve with software. 

I have had no interaction with Polestar Services or Dealerships so can't give any opinions there.

In short, if you're looking to buy used, I think this is an excellent daily driver. Probably not a great long hauler. But if you're like most Americans, you have more than 1 car in your driveway anyways. The EV market is growing every year, but if you don't like SUV's your options are still very limited. This car provides solid build quality with an excellent interior (in higher trims) paired with fun and competent driving characteristics.

I love my Polestar but I can’t recommend this brand to anyone nor will I ever recommend parent company Volvo due to their poor parts support. My car has currently been sitting for 5 months waiting on back ordered parts. Wish I could lemon the car out but the window for that passed so now I’m stuck with an unusable car that I get to keep paying on.

This car is an absolute nightmare. It can barely make it past 120 miles on the highway or in the winter due to a faulty heat pump. And don't even get me started on the promised range of 270 miles that has never been achieved. Despite driving this car for 16,000 miles, it has been nothing but a constant source of frustration. I tried to sell it, but the Polestar dealers have been entirely unresponsive, ignoring my emails and phone calls. This is unacceptable customer service and a clear indication that they do not value their customers or stand behind their product.

This is the best car we have ever owned. Incredibly fun to drive, good for family of 5 (albeit tight with a car seat), very usable and reliable tech, 16000 miles plus over one year with absolutely no issues.  Pilot pack is great with adaptive cruise control, plus pack with panoramic roof makes interior of the cabin feel very roomy. Performance upgrade definitely worth it.
So good for family members and friends👭👬 guys if 3-1 rating then you hate the company 10000000/10 :)
the car were a masterpice but selled and it has got to be very good 10/10 this got to be trending ngl

The car looks great, infotainment system is great, 4matic is great, handling and comfortable level is great (seats are not very comfortable). However, this engine use 91 gas, but it is totally not worth it. I think they made a wrong product with the wrong direction. Good car, but bad value.

No matter what angle you view the A-Class sedan from, it manages to look simply stunning and has to be one of the best looking cars in its class (it's definitely better looking than the Audi A3 sedan). Exterior features include 18-inch alloy wheels, a panorama roof, and LED headlights. Optional extras include an AMG Line body styling kit with twin trapezoidal chrome tailpipes as well as a Night Package with gloss-black exterior accents. This car is a tech puppy with fuel touch screen pads and ambient lighting. 
Mercedes-Benz builds some of the best interiors in the German luxury-car market, and even cars at the lower end of its lineup benefit from some fine craftsmanship and design. Step inside the cabin of the 2022 A-Class sedan, and you'll be welcomed by a contemporary design that combines sleek looks with real ergonomics; not only does it look good, but everything falls to hand logically. The interior of the 2022 car features 12-way power-adjustable front seats with four-way power lumbar support and a memory system for each front seat. There's dual-zone climate control up front, and the 64-color LED ambient lighting adds a whole other level of ambiance to the cabin. The seven-inch touchscreen is neatly integrated into the top of the dashboard, and the space feels roomy enough for four to five passengers.

2021 A220, AMG line with night package and almost all the additional packages (media/sound system, driver assist, adaptive headlights)-basically everything BUT the AMG engine (I drive too many miles!). Although I listed a lot of CONS, I am glad MB is taking care of the issues and I would still recommend this car. A friend of mine bought the EXACT one only a few months after I bought mine and its been nothing but spectacular for her. Maybe I just got a bad one?
PRO: Cute car! I have the black and red interior--took a minute to get used to but as soon as I tinted the windows (all around) the "bright" in the red really decreased
PRO: AMAZING infotainment and cluster display!! I love all the options, the clarity, and the interior "comfort" it provides
PRO: Handling on turns is great. Way fun to drive.
PRO: Never had adaptive headlights before but I don't think I will EVER get another car without it!
PRO: All weather mats are molded perfectly to fit and stay in place. 
CON: At almost 6k mi, I noticed the brakes were "shaking". Sure enough, rotors warped but pads were within normal for wear. They were both replaced within warranty (per dealer, warranty is "no questions asked" if failed before 12k). Well, here I am just about 7k mi into the new set and the shaking returned. Not happy....they will replace under warranty again and "take a deeper dive" into why. I drive 15-18k/yr 95% freeway. No windy roads, no stop and go traffic, no I don't rest my foot on the brake either. My civic brakes lasted almost 60k before replacement so I can assure you its not "my driving habits".
CON: Passenger door speaker went out at about 5k mi--replaced under warranty
CON: Rear passenger door weatherstripping just decided it was going to fall off--replaced under warranty
CON: Leather seats--be careful! If you get anything on them at all, they are perforated and will go right through. Also, something leaked out of my lunch pail one day and it permanently stained the red part of the seat. I used leather cleaner and my rag was turning "pink" from the red leather--so I immediately stopped. MB said "sorry all we can do is replace--for $2500"--ya no thanks.
CON:  Ive only noticed it a couple of times but pushing the gas and it sorta "stutters" before going into gear--not sure if engine vs transmission but its something and completely random so MB can't "fix" what they cant see/hear/feel. Transmission can be heard a LOT of the time "clunking" into gear--I've been reading that this is common with this model
NEUTRAL: don't have a rock chip your windshield--spiders out almost instantly. $1500 to replace and have camera re-calibrated
NEUTRAL: Paint--not sure if its truly the miles I drive but EVERYTHING seems to "chip" the paint. Seems a bit weak to me....
NEUTRAL: Rides a bit rougher than I would expect for a MB on "comfort" drive--although its low to ground, has the low-pro run-flat Pirelli tires....
NEUTRAL: front seats will move all the way back into the back seat for tall drivers/front passengers, however, that means a back passenger can't sit behind tall drivers (minimal room)

My car was a disappointment. it's a sometimes car. Sometimes the doors lock/unlock via remote and sometimes they don't. The ride is so bad my Michelin tires are failing from the ruts in the road (losing air but no nails in them) and the Michelins are good tires. Driving is a constant avoidance of holes or you hear a cha-chunk. I brought this back to Mercedes and they shrugged and said, it's an 'A'. How can anyone love this car? I am getting a Tesla after my lease is up.
Good car. Very overpriced radio. Stay away from the $850. radio. Car is fine

No other car has this much tech without twice the price mercedes used what they put in there 100k plus s class in the entry and it works full touch screens not like other cars that have infotainment only and have reg speedos this car is truly out of the future not to mention first in its class augmented reality car is sporty kinda small but still comfy suspention is great u could really tell ur in a luxury car when u go over bumps and take corners compared to my 2004 g35 this handles great they really outdead themselevs on the cars chassis. the engine is good great low end torque and good enough passing power . car has alot of nice features but hate how mercedes makes u add all of them separately at a higher price , gas mpg is really good for a car that takes 91 . it is truly a good deal for steeping in the luxury market with mercedes only problem is this car has so much tech that if u plan to keep it forever it will get really expensive if somthing brakes like all mercedes they just dont hold there value like they used to decades ago .

I have a 2023 AMG C43. I purchased the vehicle July 2023, the car looks amazing! But I haven’t been able to enjoy it due to electrical and 12V battery issues with it since I bought it. Mercedes-Benz LLC won’t respond to my complaint. Been incidents where I try to turn it on and it wouldn’t, the vehicle even left me stranded on the road for hours, been to the service department for these issues over 10 times.
Really fun car to have and amazing interior, great entertainment screen plus real buttons to ease a few functions
If you get the right options this car is a killer. The other bad reviews was the ones that didn't know how to buy this car lol. Poor little things
This car has been a nightmare.  My upcoming service appointment will be the 4th since I purchased it new in the fall.

Glitchy infotainment, squishy brakes, lack of real buttons/switches. Seven years to bring out a brand new C300 and this is an underwhelming achievement. Took almost 12 months to get the car after placing the order. No prices available when order was placed and certain features were missing when the car finally arrived due to the ongoing never ending chip shortage. Car was manufactured in December 2021 but did not arrive at the dealer until July 2022. Wherever it sat around for 6 months is possibly the reason that none of the finicky touch screen controls work too well. Have no idea why the the first third of brake pedal travel does nothing. 2023 model (with no changes) arrived at my dealer 4 months after I got my 2022 car. Maybe the chips for the features I was supposed to get finally arrived. Adjusting anything while driving is pretty close to impossible and even the “Hey Mercedes” voice control is iffy at best. Lots of cheap plastic trim on the inside. Even the ambient lighting which is one of the best features loses points because of the horrendous reflection in the windshield at night.

I was super excited to get this car due to the looks and tech it has but that was very short lived. After a month of owning it there was a problem with my tire pressure reader, fit and finish issues (parts in my console sinking in), and engine issues. The engine issues were the most annoying as the car kept prompting me to pull over and restart the car and the check engine light has been on since, the car has now been in service for a couple of days and I won’t be getting it back for a couple more days and have been left without a loaner.. not what I was expecting with a new car.
Beautiful car, the restyling is well done. Compared to other vehicles at this pricepoint it offers amazing features and technology. Everything you'd expect from a MB

Fancy Sport car first hand owner driving to and fro between home and working place 25 miles daily.
Idled for 2 1/2 years since 2018

This is my 3rd Mercedes.   I've also owned several other brand of vehicles and this is my favorite.   
It's not as exspensive to maintain as people think.    
Well worth it and so nice to drive. 
This vehicle is best in a no snow or minimal snow area.  I have nothing bad to say about it.
Reliable, luxury, nice performance, good on gas. Totally recommend! Worth the price, no regrets. If you have chance, get one
Fun to drive, love the 4 Magic, save money on service y not taking it to dealership and instead a certified Mercedes mechanic/ service center.

I own C300 coupe.Bought it used with 19000 miles on it in 2019.After 40000 miles drivers seat ripped open at the seam and Mercedes wanted $1100 to repair it.Found another upholstery shop for $550. Car comes without a spare tire and uses run-flat tires that only lasted 20000 miles but was told they should last 50000.Disappointing ! Directly above the windshield and before the roof is a black strip that is discoloring from black to grey. Mercedes said it can only be fixed by replacing the WHOLE roof.I didn't even ask what that would cost.
Absolutely amazing quality at a great price. Mercedes Benz does not skimp on this car because it’s a C Class. Interior is brand the engine is feisty. Handles like a race car yet smooth and quiet.

I purchased this vehicle brand-new in August 1921 and this vehicle has definitely exceeded my expectation I truly enjoy this vehicle and I am certain that you will do the same . 

Compliments of this vehicle from inside out.   
This is by far one of the best performance Mercedes AMG vehicles or better yet sedan performance vehicle that I have ever ever experienced

The styling (with amg package) is fantastic. Gas mileage is surprisingly good, however the ride is a little rough, even in comfort mode. I do like the optional modes and you can really tell the difference in each.. OTA upgrades are also a nice plus.

Excellent styling, great performance, and MPG above 30. Great choices of Dynamic ride, from Economy, Comfort, Sport and Sport Plus. Paddle shifters  and quality interior. Only downside is a
hard ride....definitely  not an S Class, but a solid value for the dollar.

LOW MILEAGE .I HAVE OWNED THIS CAR.GARAGED. DELIGHT TO DRIVE THE CAR IN SUMMER WITH TOP DOWN. VERY RESPONSIVE AT HIGH SPEEDS. QUICK RESPONSIVE PICK UP. BEAUTIFUL INTERIOR. NO  ACCIDENT.TREATED LIKE A MISTRESS!!!!
Great performance. Handling is awesome, tight and nimble. Great look. Seats very supportive love the messaging seats. Highly recommend
High class car/Beautiful interior/A lot of technologies and features/Fun to drive/Excellent audit system

This car has been nothing, but a dream to own. Although it is a first model-year car with a brand-new body style, the 2017 E-Class seems to be well-refined inside and out. The turbo-four provides ample power to overtake most cars on the road without creating drama while doing so. The powertrain in smooth and gear shifts feel non-existent. The technology and safety are excellent even without the Driver's Assist Pkg. The standard equipment provides enough features to really add to the premium feel of the sedan. Overall, cabin materials and quality are top-notch, right out of an S-Class with very few complaints. Owners should just be wary that there are a few more rattles from the dash than one would like at this price point, the piano-black lacquer scratches easily, and there are PCV valve issues with the turbo-four. Otherwise, this is an all-around solid vehicle that beats out many of its other competitors.

Best safety if you get the safety oriented options.  Collision prevention features are among the best (only lacks intersection collision avoidance).  During crash features to prevent injury are the best by far, unless you go up one class (S or Audi A8).
This car is a pleasure to drive!!  Whenever I drive it, I am told how good my ride looks.  It is quiet, dependable and a pleasure to drive.

My 2021 E450 Cabriolet was purchased early January 2021 (7th car from dealership). 
1st month, defective 48v battery. Took 2 months to get replacement from Germany. 
Every 2 months or so since then, car has failed to start

An experience like no other driving this vehicle. The engineering is second to none and exceptional response. I feel grateful to be able to experience such a vehicle. Having said that, there are a few cosmetic issues that could be better made. For instance, the LED entry seal plate is coming unglued on both rear entry seal plates, and driver/passenger visor mirrors covers cheaply made. When you pay almost 200k for a vehicle you expect all aspects of a vehicle to be exceptional. Other than that it would not detour me from buying this car again.
It was not too good.
Bigger, wider, better handling, technology, look.

I've had every type of luxury car you can imagine. I've loved them all, but this is my favorite! It is incredibly solid feeling when you drive, comfortable, great road visibility, and "built to feel like it will last forever".

I drove the 2018 G550 and liked the car - even with all its faults - including the biggest fault. Don't go on the highway and don't turn too fast on slow curves.

Now I own the 2019, and it's a new world! Drive where you like, when you like - HOWEVER you like.

Not sure how MB got rid of the wandering, loose steering and lean - but they did. They didn't stop there, they added tech too! 

Don't like how the rear seats folds (leaving a big bump/ledge), or where the power window buttons are - but it's all good. At least I can take it anywhere, anytime.

Every thing in this vehicle is made to perfection! Still discovering new features even though I own the vehicle for last 6 months. Drives , sounds and feels great! Highly recommend if you can find a G63!!!

new features and design far exceed expectations.  I have owned three g class Mercedes vehicles and my 2019 is without question a much better vehicle.  powerful, beautiful interior and meaningful exterior changes.  Mercedes did an outstanding job with the new design and as an owner, I could not be more pleased.

Most reliable G. 2012 G550
Keep it forever classic design great car

Keeps great price as well

Love everything about it

Refined Beast. People know what they are and love them.  You will get noticed.  Fort Knox on wheels with amazing exhaust note and hauls butt for it's weight.
Historic, timeless and cool.  They will never go out of style and hold their value like crazy.  
Not for everyone though.  Some people just don't understand.
It’s a eye catching car. Especially in my matte black. Pretty loud 5.5 V8, 380 Horsepower (in mine) and it’s pretty quick. Not super fast but not slow at all! And it’s great at off-roading!

I started as a skeptic. What was all the fuss about? An overpriced mall crawler, I thought.  But, somehow I could not get the idea out of this truck my head. The reviews of many other high end 4x4s would have commentary like " it is no G Class" or " Not made to compete with the likes of the G glass"...........so I looked far and wide, found one, and drove it. it took only 5 minutes and It was over....bought it on the spot. 
I sat inside and was instantly hooked. The thing felt like a safe...shaped like one too. The interior was the perfect blend (for me) of utility and luxury. The engine was impressively powerful, and the exhaust note sounded amazing (it has side pipes for goodness sake). The car was 11 years old and felt more solid any new car that I ever owned. Some modern tech mixed with old school quality was the right kind of alchemy for me. No turning back. I am ruined for anything else. If you can find one in your price range, but it. Don't hesistate, You will not be sorry.

black and white package car is in excellent condition contact 917 623 7911

only serious buyers please

This truck is designed for comfort, performance and is the most capable vehicle I have ever owned.  It is fast, comfortable to drive and easy to park and navigate thru city streets when required.  While gas mileage is poor and requires premium fuel that is the price you pay for the comfort and performance.
I like to maintain my vehicles myself and it is possible to do this without any special tools.
Here in the North East of the US it is a harsh environment for all cars but Mercedes seem to not hold up well to the de-icing materials used on the roads.  This car is no different and started to rust along the running boards and under the rear window washer fluid dispenser after six years.  I recommend staying ahead of this with a good body shop and I have spent about $1,000 to treat these rust spots proactively. 

This is a great truck and fun to drive and own.  As an engineer I really appreciate the design of this vehicle and would recommend it to anyone to experience great engineering.

One tough and super reliable truck, with awesome performance, style and comfort!
Still a head turner, nothing shakes,rattles or dissaponts...

Speed demon with great sound as well!

I have a 2004 with 124000 miles. It is the best truck Ive ever owned. In the past I owned a range rover and an escalade. The style is timeless and classic, EVERYONE admires the look of this truck. The interior is spacious (high ceiling and huge trunk space). This truck resale vale is the highest you will find. It is a perfect family truck for vacation. It is also the perfect truck to style and be boss in. I purchased an extended warranty since the mileage was getting high, there have been small issues but nothing serious. I will trade this truck in a year but you better believe my next truck will be a Gwagon.

Most Americans are ignorant of the Mercedes V-Klasse and the type of van that it is. American "minivans" are cheap inflated overrated Station Wagons. They are far less van and more car. The Metris/Vito is a real mid sized van. Its design is an excellent cross of functionality and comfort. Its a VAN that has the capability to haul goods, along with trailers and more. It was not designed to carry children or to serve as a grocery machine. Its a VAN, not a station wagon. The Metris is well made and doesn't go overboard with the computerized junk. There are fewer bells and whistles (ie, things to break) and has more workhorse features, because its a VAN. Not a stationwagon.  If Americans actually traveled, they would know that the V-Klasse has been the backbone of Deutsch industry for a long time. Serving as Krankenwagens, delivery vans and more. 

Put the Metris against a Pacifica any day and see who leaves who in the dust. Power is in the torque. The Metris shares a family with the Sprinter and its little sister. Don't listen to uninformed American youtube idiots who call this the "worst mini van". Technically its not a minivan, its a VAN. Know this first before you base an opinion one a vehicle that's in a completely different class.

i have just wrote a review on the mistsubishi mirage and said ' this is the worst new car'.this van might tie it for the no 1 place. people argue that it's a cargo van converted to a passenger van so it will be like this. but then, better buy a minivan which is better in every single way. the 3rd row dosn't fold at all. there are many more bad things than just this.

The Mercedes Benz is the worst vehicle ever in the modern mini van.

The design seems like it was made back in Y2K 2000 year.
First the seats in the rear can't decline which is uncomfortable to passengers. 

Second why don't the windows in the back can't go down. Terrible situation if it hit in the car an passengers can't breath. Also not great for moving things sites like big tvs an stuff.

Last rear wheel drive in the wheel for a mini van is insane. Definitely selling car because poor quality in the snow.

I'm sorry Mercedes Benz need to get Mr. Magoo out the design office.

This could of been a top mini this style has been the same since 2018.

This has been a great vehicle for not leaving me stranded... solid power train, but the automation (sensors and power doors) leave a lot to be desired and will drain your wallet. I've replaced two actuators for the rear power doors, one locking mechanism for one of those doors, and a hood latch sensor that beeped every 5 seconds for two days until the part came in. That was all in the last 30k miles. For a 2017 vehicle, I'm shocked it didn't have Apple CarPlay; fortunately it did have Bluetooth. Never again, Mercedes... I'm going back to a Ford.

This car has a lot of space for people and in the trunk.
Gas mileage is much better than comparable minivans (22 mpg on highways).
The quality of components and finishing is very good. The style (inside and outside) is not super (it is more a van than a car).
Some extras: leatherette seats are stylish and easy to clean. Electric doors are super convenient.
Performance is nothing special.

If you are looking for a reliable cost effective cargo van that will easily fit into a standard garage-look no further.  I needed at least 8' of cargo floor length due to the size of boxes I regularly carry and every other van I looked at that would accommodate that length was too big for my garage.  I was also worried that the 4cyl engine would be underpowered and too loud and nothing could be further from the truth! This van has great acceleration and get's about 22 mpg in town and 25+ on the highway.  Quality is really good and service intervals are at very generous 15K intervals.  AC and heat is excellent and the Becker Navigation system is very intuitive and easy to use.  I love this van and plan to add a second one sometime this year.

Headliner had to be replaced several times because of creases and sagging.
Van started leaking gasoline on cold starts within a year.
Various electrical issued with tow hitch wiring
Transmission had a major issue 3 days after warranty ended...........

The ride quality has diminished since purchase, after towing a couple times now the entire vehicle has little rattles and squeaks here and there. Cruise control was promised but not included.

MB Service is terrible for someone who owns "Just 1 Metris" and not a fleet
I bought my van fully loaded and couldn't be happier !

This 2022 S Class replaced my 2017 S Class.  I am overwhelmed by the improvement between the two cars.  Everything is better.  The ride quality, the materials, the overall feel of quality, the audio system, the interior silence, even the fuel consumption.  My car is highly optioned, but the base car is also an excellent choice.  Once you own an S Class, the only other car you buy is another S Class.  This car is truly exceptional.

I'm a first time MB owner. The car has some outstanding features like rear axle steering, suspension that compensates for curves, interior comfort, etc. 

However, I have experienced several issues that shouldn't have happened.

First, in cold weather (I took delivery on Oct 31 in Michigan), the caliper pads adhere to the rotors. When one puts the car in reverse for the first time each day, there is a loud bang when the pads break loose from the rotors. If you take the emergency brake off when parking the night before, the problem doesn't present itself, but you shouldn't have to have a work around for something this simple. The dealer says the vehicle is operating as designed.

Second, also in cold weather, the initial light throttle 2-3 upshift is extended to the point that it doesn't occur until 4500 RPM in some cases unless you force a shift by letting up on the accelerator. After the transmission gets to operating temperature, the problem disappears (although the shifts aren't timed very well, engine flare is apparent during shifts regardless of temperature). I don't know, and the dealer can't tell me, if it's a MB built transmission or a ZF.  Again, the dealer tells me this is normal, it's not. I ran transmission plants for 20 years and never saw this issue. This is a design defect.

The sensors that warn the driver of obstacles may be on the edge of being too sensitive. In a few cases, a warning was issued when there was no apparent reason.

Besides these issues, the car is an outstanding vehicle. It's a joy to take trips in because of seat comfort, environmental control, and the semi-autonomous driving on expressways.
Fantastic shape. New tires everything perfect condition. Beautiful black car   Interior beige leather perfect condition
Quiet, smooth, solid feel and lovely to look at. Every time you enter, you will be impressed pleased and amazed.

I purchased my 2015 s550 preowned in 2019 with 51,000 miles. It was a one owner car. The car was just traded in for a new 2019 s550. The car was well taken careful with all the books and records. I have not spent any money except for a trunk release repair.
The only other money spent was for scheduled maintenance, which was not overly expensive. I have 88,000 miles on the car. I enjoy the ride, quietness, and driving comfort. I would highly recommend the s550 as a new or preowned car. Just do your homework and have your mechanic check it over.

I love my car it was originally $120.000 brand new! It still looks New! It’s a 2015 Silver exterior S550 Mercedes Benz with less than 25.000 miles on it. Black leather seats inside. Never been Smoked in, New run flat tires, and just been inspected! We call this Beautiful Car (The Silver Fox) if you are interested in purchasing it I’m am selling it for $60.000 if you want to see pictures I can send plenty pictures also! Hank you

Am the original owner and have handled this car carefully since day one. It does great on road trips, with better than expected gas mileage and a very smooth, controlled ride. 
My biggest complaint is the quality of the body/paint. The car is always garaged and always hand washed by me. The coating on the 'chrome' front grill began to peel off, requiring a new grill replacement. The clearcoat on the roof is failing and starting to chip away. No matter how you wash/wax it, it never seems to get to a high end finish.
Other complaint is that it does seem to go through brakes and tires fairly quick with run flat tires at about every 10k miles ('normal' per the dealer).

Amazing car with unbelievable technology, but too tedious with all the different computer levels and options to make adjustments for temp, seats, radio, etc. Example, can't make any changes while nav screen is on and then you still have to make multiple selections to get what you want to do.  Great handling and awesome acceleration and I get 32mpg on trips (checked several times), about 28 when I mix in the local driving. Smooth comfortable ride but I get a slight hum between 52 and 65 mph (not from tires) that they can't get rid of. Test drove same yr and modle with  a service rep and got the same hum.  Very annoying having to use an app for remote start - it fails to work most of the time for a variety of reasons. When it does work it takes at least 1-2 minutes to accomplish compared to 2 sec for any other car I've owned. Disappointed not a touchscreen.

Our Mercedes 2018 S560 is the best sedan we have ever owned. We are still driving it after 41000 miles. It is comfortable, quiet, gets 27 mpg on the road and about 16 around town. We could buy a new one but we are so satisfied with this one driving like a new one we don't see the need to do so. It listed sticker price was about $110,000 and compared to other similar   cars it has been worth what we paid for it.

I own this car and am the original owner. It's the best ride I've ever had, but the issues I've experienced cause me to give it a 3. The front grill rides so close to the ground you will end hitting the front on anything that's taller than a few inches. You cannot pull up into a parking place. You have to park a couple feet back to avoid the curb that most cars have the clearance to drive up to. I've had to replace the front chrome pieces several times. The key fob doesn't always work. I need to have a manual ignition option. There is no spare tire. It has "no flat" tires which is great if you're in a city; but if you're driving over 50 miles on the highway, you have no refuge. I need to have a spare just in case. The cost of maintenance is very high. The tires don't last 40k miles, they last about 20k. And when you need a brake pad change (which happened to me at about 26k miles) you have to replace the pads and the rotors. And those are not cheap. Just not worth the price.

Amazing car, with outrageous power and AWD, and the ride is incredible.  You are in complete isolation in this car, I've owned several Mercedes and this one is by far the finest.  We did have to put new brakes on her and it was pricey, but not surprising, as the brakes are very large.  When you have a lot of go, like this car, you need a lot of woooo, to get it stopped.

Couple months ago I purchased a 2014 Challenger Rallye Redline after renting a Challenger and really enjoying the experience. I have to say this might be the best purchase I ever made. The car runs like a dream and the beauty of the car is hard for anyone to deny. The car is a V6 but from the moment I start it up until the moment I've arrived at my destination it's pure bliss. Responsive, quick when you need it (and let's be honest, even when you don't) and I feel like I've turned my daily commute into a joy ride. I'll never buy another car that isn't a Challenger.

I've owned my silver Dodge Challenger SXT for 11 years, and just lost her due to an accident involving semi that destroyed 5 other cars, including mine.

When I bought the Challenger, I bought her new, and only put in the recommended mid-grade unleaded, did the oil changes and all other maintenance on time, and the only problems I ever had was a bad alternator, and I replaced the battery.  That's it, that's all.  That motor was absolutely bulletproof.  Up to the day of the accident, she drove like she was new.  The transmission needs to be properly checked and serviced, because Chryslers have notorious transmission problems, but mine shifted smoothly and with confidence all the time.  No issues in 11 years and almost 170,000 miles.

For those who claim it has poor mileage, you're a liar.  I was able to get 30-32 MPG on the freeway.  In the city, it's maybe 17-18, but the cylinder deactivation system shuts down two of the cylinders when you're at cruise, so it saves on gas.  

The trunk is truly massive, the front seats are comfortable, and at 6'7", I've never fit in a car better than this.  I will never again find a car that fits me as well as the Challenger.  This is a magnificent machine for those who take care of it.  Keep up with the maintenance and keep it clean, a Challenger will last you for 250,000 miles or more.  This car truly was trouble-free.
Super fun and exciting driving  experiences reliability and comfortably in a sports car a timeless classic  that is the American muscle car it's definitely not cheap to Own but worth the expense
rt automatic 8 speed, 347 hemi custom decals like new. sublime,oem super bird decals and emblens. custom exhaust,sounds great original parts saved.
Tires for this car tend to need replacing around 30k miles. Overall a fun car to drive! Biggest negative is my grown kids always want to drive it:)

The Writer here states that the ZL1 Camaro has over 100 hp more than the challenger and the Mustang 500 even more... Does the Writer know that the HELLCAT has over 700 Horsepower and the Demon has 1025 HP?? This is the "KING OF THE HILL!" .. The most horsepower ever in an American Street Legal car!!

Great Drivers car. Spacious, Great handling and plenty of power. It DOES NOT have the infamous Engine Mismanagement system. Because it's a manual it does not turn the engine from 8 cylinders to 4 Cylinders like the automatic transmission models. . The exhaust note is meaty yet reserved. The factory subwoofer and sound system has a very nice concert class sound.

Great fuel economy.  I realistically got 25mpg with a well rounded mix of city and highway miles.  The engine compartment is spotless. SPOTLESS.  My 2012 SXT has 200,000 miles and STILL running strong.  I’m in the market for another car and it’s one of those AWD versions of quite possibly the best automobile ever built.
Tell them what you got they will tell you what you can get they  are vary to the point not much playing around with a smile
I had soooo many problems with this car, so many recalls and a lot of mantaince problems and horrible on gas and engine, so many problems and don't buy this car at all.
Works really good has 2019 black rims air works great paint really good 2015 dodge charger. You won’t regret buying

Very reliable 5.7 plenty of power. Has been put under load many times and has many hours of idle time and it hasn't gave me any issues. A/C and heating system is probably one of the best out there. Have 9 cars and none of them come close. 

Cons: interior door panels start to lift due to the heat, panel next to the knee right on the center console starting to lift as well.
Every thing about this car is wonderful. Heated and cooled cup holders, automatic four wheel drive, beats radio, great performance. no problems.
Charger has carbon fiber stripes runs really well. The only problem I have with it is scratches on the bumper and a small tear as well small fixes that has nothing to do with the engine.
The3.6L is one great motor , love the body style, really easy to work on. Handles the road fantastic.

By far the best and most powerful stock vehicle I’ve ever owned. My problem is the Uconnect theft system sucks.  I’ve only had the vehicle for a month it had $49950 @ time of purchase for I thought a price $36000. 1 month later and now Kelly blue Ook says it’s valued at $30000. I’m very very unhappy with the blue book value. I forgot to mention the $7500 down payment… So I guess we can say I paid $43500…
Excellent car and great condition tires and rims 24 inches tall . Nothing wrong with vehicle.  Had only one owner
Have had a 2020 RT, now a 2023 GT Plus. Love both, will never drive anything else, the power, the space, the exterior and interior.
This car is roomy, comfortable on long trips—CT to Michigan, and ok on gas. I love it. I have two dogs.
What's my car worth 21 dodge durango citadel whith hemi and DVD package...................................................
Monster of a SUV but yet drives like a charger!! Great handling for its size!! very comfy ride! That V8 sound is awesome!!!!

Car looks very good cosmetically and clean with no external damage. Low mileage, needs new battery as car has been sitting for a while and battery has dead cell or cells so will not hold a charge . Tires are in good shape with like new tread. All glass is in good shape and all power windows work. No rips or tears in the seats.
I want $28,000 -  Like new and only 41,000 miles. Fully loaded 4x4, Black in great condition. Want Electric car.
Perfect for towing or everyday driving. Powerful, Good looks. All around a awesome vehicle. Smooth ride. Amazing sound. Perfect for taking the family on vacation.

LOVE THIS VAN!  I'm a homeowner and I'm always doing repairs, so I need a van to haul stuff.  The Dodge Caravan is just what I need.  With proper care and responsibility, it never needed serious repair until about 8 or so years into the running.  First van was a 1995 bought in 1996.  2nd one was a 2006 bought in 2007.  3rd one is a 2019 bought in 2022.  Not bad!

So many features were thought out for families with children!  Examples: Cargo nets on back of front seats; stow-n-go middle and back seats with different configurations possible, amazing air bag system (and I tested them all in a rear-end collision!), power lift tailgate; slots for tying rope around high stacks of luggage in the rear; adjustable roof cargo supports; etc.

I use the Caravan primarily for driving to and from work. But over the years I have also used it to haul everything from bags of top soil to lumber for a chicken coop. When the seats are folded down, I have 8' of cargo space! People are amazed at how much I can fit in the caravan. 

We stay on top of regualr mainenance, having a full tune up completed at 100,000 miles. She still runs great. 

The only issue that I have had is a button for heat to my feet gets stuck from time to time. And the center console cover has cracked from hot Texas summers. 

I do not know what I will drive if this ever bites the dust. Never thought I would own a mini van before this one. Now I am sold The ride is superior to many vehicles we have had over the years. Not a quiet as some, but smoother ride than most.

Very poor Brake design.  The stock Rotors are too Small for the size and weight of the 2008 Dodge Grand Caravan.  Went through 3 sets of Rotors in 3 years.  Finally had to go to Drilled and Slotted Rotors.  These are remarkably better.
I Purchased this Mini Van from a Company called Mobility Works. They sell Handicap Accessible Mini Vans.

I cannot tell you how much I love this van. It has everything I wanted and more. Drives smooth like a car. Sits me up higher where I can see more. The seats fold into the floor so I can haul most anything I want without having a truck and worrying about it getting wet or stolen. Back up camera was a bonus I didn’t expect but learned to really like it. I would but it all over again!

I bought a 2019 dgc with 68k miles 10 months ago. At 82k miles the transmission went out completely. It was replaced with a brand new zero mile Oem transmission. Less than 1 month later transmission went out again. This vehicle is not driven hard or abused. This vehicle has been a huge hassle for our family and Chrysler has not been pleasant to deal with. Bottom line is I will be trading this vehicle in soon and will most likely never own another modern Chrysler product. Very disappointed.

My Dodge caravan 2010 SE 
Has 305820 miles and it’s still running ,it has some cosmetics damages but the envíos amazing

I've had my 8-Ball Hornet GT with Cold Weather and Track Pack for almost a year now.  When I saw it and sat in it I imagined it was a TIE fighter on wheels.  I was not disappointed when I drove it.  The 268 hp is a leader in it's class.  No, you will not be dusting Camaros and Mustangs, that is what Charger and Challengers are for.  As mentioned I have the Track Pack, and it is very nimble and quick on curvy roads.  It is a more sophisticated and refined power than a typical Dodge.  You can definitely see and feel the European influence.  I know "True Mopar Guys" hate it, but this is a market segment Dodge needed to delve into and I think they did it very well.  My wife and son each drive a Jeep Compass, the Hornet is much more fun to drive.  I highly recommend it.

Wanted a CUV for its practicality.  I was coming out of a Mustang. I also wanted some performance.  I was intrigued by the Hornet for that reason.  I have also had a love for Alfa Romeo cars. The Hornet is based on the new Alfa Tonale. For all of those reasons, I was not a sheep & I checked it out for myself. I leaned toward the RT because of the incentives.  They totaled 10K.  That brought the car down to around 34K.  Much more manageable than the $44,620 sticker price. I am a car guy so I understand things outside of the shiny things that consumers are drawn towards. For example you get 4 Piston Brembro brake calipers & Koni shocks. Independent rear suspension. All season sport tires.  You get either the GY Eagle GT or the Michelin Sport all seasons.  You won't find them on a Hyundai or even the Toyota.  You definitely need to take the time to learn the car.  3 Drive modes.  Hybrid, E Save, & Electric.  I've been getting around 33 miles of all electric range on a fully charged battery.  The interior feels solid & refined.  Seats were a big things for me.  I will say that if you are a larger individual the bolsters might cut into your hips. (I am not, so no issue for me) Infotainment & standard safety features are amongst the best in class.  Small trunk & weird handle to close the hatch.  I love the exterior look.  The blacktop package adds to that look.  Blacked out badging along with blacked out mirror caps & trim.  My main concern  is overall reliability. I have had a few tech clichés with the security system & front end collision sensor.  Waiting on 4th quarter software update to hopefully fix some of the tech gremlins.  So far I am pleased with the vehicle. Check one out for yourself.
We had the oil housing replaced because it was plastic with a metal one and next thing I know the engine died right after

2019 Dodge Journey, was a fleet auto for a construction sales vehicle. Drove it from 3500 miles to 130,000 and never fully felt that the vehicle would perform @100%. More electric issues than drivetrain. Sync Bluetooth constantly was major issues, especially needing navigation daily. 3 starters, multiple batteries which is removed from the fender well compartment. Crazy to engineer it that way. Otherwise it took a beating and kept running. Positive is the AC, brakes and drivetrain never failed. Great gas mileage vehicle. 3.5 rating

I bought my Dodge Journey new in 2009, it during the cash for clunkers program.
It has 248,500 miles on it and still running strong.
I kept up with all maintenance schedules, oil changes, tune-ups and transmission services.
I did have to replace normal wear and tear items.
I also replaced some sensors and parts like starter and alternator.
I live in Ohio and it only has 2 small rusts spots on it.
I could not be happier with this vehicle.
Hopefully I it will make it many more years and miles.

I’ve had this vehicle for 8 years ! I’ve put a lot of repairs into the vehicle such as struts, brakes twice , ball joints , bearings and continued maintenance such as new tires ! Not happy with the Alloy wheels that seem to leak when it gets cold! 
However 3 years ago this vehicle started to Bubble around the 2 front door handles ! Now at this point their is a large round circle of rust on each door ! 
This vehicle only has 119,000 miles! 
I have see other vehicles of  the same make & model that are doing the same and are newer than mine  ! Is this possible a factor defect that not many have reported !?

I’ve had my 2014 for 1 1/2 years and it’s broken down more times than I can count the gas mileage was broken when I got it starter went out 3 weeks after I got it had to get it towed twice that day, throttle replaced valve cover gasket replaced and it’s still leaking oil, leaking antifreeze, brakes bad, emergency brake doesn’t work
This car was riddled with problems. First it was the power steering, then the front tie rod ends, then the transmission, the fuel system, and all the oil leaked out and blew up the motor.
nothing but trouble, in the shop for six weeks with no clear answer. NOW same thing with all lights are all on the dashboard.

Never had any issues! I drive it gently and I have loved having it for moving so much and doing real estate. While it’s not a race car, duh it’s a suv crossover family vehicle. It drives smooth, no mechanical issues! Ac did go out, but I honestly think it was from a finder binder a few years back that shook it up and it finally gave out! I’m very impressed with it! To me, it’s been good on gas, not excellent, but good! I have enjoyed all 100k miles with my Journey! Lots of fun beach trips and road trips. Treat your car good, it’ll be kind to you.

There are only 2 things I’d change on this great car. 1 - the two spoke steering wheel is ugly. Reminds me of my grandfathers tanks. 2 - at this price point the gauge cluster MUST be fully digital on the advanced package.
Highly recommend the vehicle.  I get so many compliments on the looks and very few people have the vehicle so it really stands out.

i spend more than $ 65000.00  and just find out  no wireless charging my phone

i spend more than $ 65000.00  and just find out  no wireless charging my phone

I recently purchased a Genesis G80, 2022. The styling separates it itself from the rest of the same looking sedans in the market. In addition to the superb styling it rides smoothly and handles well. I have owned it for three months and have not had any mechanical issues. Unlike the BMW 5  which I have owned in the past this vehicles back seat is spacious.
 The Genesis G 80 provides quality and comfort at a reasonable price.

This car is an unbelievable value.  I have a 3.5L Twin Turbo with AWD and the Prestige package (I highly recommend the Prestige package due to the Heads Up display and several other luxury options included).  The owners manual leaves a lot to be desired.  It is hard to find explanations of the numerous features.  For example, I have two buttons, cryptically labeled, on the overhead panel where the dome light and sunroof controls reside.  I cannot find the difference between the two buttons in the owners manual.  Both light the dome light but I cannot figure out why there are two buttons for the light.  That is just an example - the manual must have been translated from Korean, and poorly at that.  Ride is smooth as silk, with windows closed a boom box next to my car is silent, acceleration is remarkable for a car as heavy as this.  Gas mileage is terrible though.  Around town, I get 16 mpg with a light foot.  On the road, I get around 19 mpg.  Wondering if there is something wrong with my fuel delivery system.  Have not asked Genesis for valet pickup and drop-off of my car for service but based on comments in the G80 blog, dealers are reluctant to deliver on the promised service, not to mention they say loaner cars are not available.

First let me say this is my 3d G80 and the first of the new design. The new G 80 looks great but is a giant step backwards in terms of build quality. In an attempt to lighten up the car they have gone to a 4 cylinder engine and lots of cheap plastic parts. The car feels more like a AWD Sonata than my prior G80. Build is disappointing as many interior plastic parts don't fit together well,  the engine is power4ful but shakes and shudders like a tractor, gets worse gas mileage then my prior 3.8L G80 and the emergency braking system just plain doesn't work. The lane control feature is erratic and the car feels unsafe to drive when it is engaged. The worst part is that the factory support team is unable to properly support the vehicle due to the incompetence of ALL the dealer service teams and the manufacturer has refused to fix issues claiming everything is "normal". REALLY!!!!  They are doing this as a way to work around the lemon law in my state. This has a been a very stressful experience and I warn anyone considering purchasing a G80 that if it can happen to me as a 3d time loyal Genesis customer it can happen to you.

Wonderful  overall look. Interior is special, but leatherette in the low end car?
I went from a 3.8 six cylinder to a turbo 4. Maintains performance, improves gas mileage, but sounds like the 4 it is.

Interior feel and look is a step up which is immediately obvious. 
It is a bit more difficult to exit than my previous G80, but is spacious once inside.

Wonderful safety features and I look forward to my 5th Genesis.

Took delivery about a week and a half ago. This is my fourth genesis, 2012/2015/2018 g80 sport htrac, The new one 2021 g80,3.5 twin turbo v6,AWD,prestige. I think that the change is more revolutionary than evolutionary. This thing is a pleasure to drive. Highly recommend. Huge value for dollar spent. The issue is the dealerships. Genesis is a luxury car being sold in not so luxury environment.
Beautiful, comfortable, fast, good price, reliable, great service., excellent performance. I love it

Bought a '21 2.0T Elite package just off lease with 22,000 miles on it.
This is a fantastic Sports-Sedan. A good value new compared to the competition (BMW 3 Series, Audi A4, Mercedes C Class), it's an even better value CPO or lightly used. Since it doesn't have the brand cachet the German do, it's depreciated a bit more (don't expect that to continue).

Power and handling easily match or exceed the Germans, and maintenance costs will be significantly less in the long run. The only complain I hear is that the infotainment is straight out of a Hyundai/Kia from that year... so what? It has CarPlay and Android Auto, HD Radio and Satellite radio (if you really want to subscribe). The infotainment is simple and straightforward, unlike my wife's 2024 Kona with the massive touch screen that we can't even figure out how to navigate to the radio tuner on without looking for a tutorial on YouTube... There's something to be said for keeping things simple.

The seats are probably the most comfortable I've ever had in a car with the possible exception of my 1976 Chrysler Cordoba, which was like sitting on a well loved sofa.

The adaptive cruise control is a god-send in rush hour freeway traffic.

If you're in the market for a luxury sports-sedan, do yourself a favor and at least check it out.
Bought this car for my wife and we've owned lots of luxury cars in the past including Mercedes, Infinity, Lexus, and Audi. This is definitely among her favorites. A fantastic car for the money.

This has been my favorite vehicle so far. Very sporty but doesn't break the bank to buy it. Looks wise you would think that this vehicle would cost much more than it does. The 2022 Genesis G70 3.3T Sport Prestige package has all the bells and whistles. I am very satisfied with my purchase and it drives just as good as it did the very first day I bought it. I will definitely own many more Genesis in my future. Highly recommend this vehicle.

Good car, has an issue with transmission braking. 

Good car, has an issue with transmission braking. (Happy now character limit??)
well made, looks great, fast, gets good MPG- after 16K mikes we are very happy- just a great car- better than my Audi
As soon as you begin driving this car you feel as though you received more than what you paid for. Exceeded my expectations and is better in person than on paper.
